**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Lord’s Annotated Scripture of the Wondrous Divine Incantations of the Primordial Transmission of the Spirit-Soul of the Great Sage Perfected Warrior of the Mysterious Heaven*

### *The Supreme Lord’s Annotated Scripture of the Wondrous Divine Incantations of the Primordial Transmission of the Great Sage Perfected Warrior of the Mysterious Heaven, Scroll One*
**Compiled and Annotated by Chen You, Disciple of the Inner Teachings of Ascending the Mysteries, Fang Tianzipei of Li**

**"Supreme Lord" (Taishang):** *Tai* (Supreme) denotes reverence; *shang* (Lord) denotes exaltation. This refers to the Primordial Ancestor who established the Dao in the most ancient times—the **Supreme Lord of the Jade Clarity Sacred Realm, the Peerless Dharma King of the Primordial Beginning**; the **True Lord of the Upper Clarity Realm, the Healer-King of the Three Realms, the Numinous Treasure Emperor**; and the **Supreme Lord of the Grand Clarity Immortal Realm, the Guide of the Ten Directions, the Primordial Unity Emperor**. He is the ancestral *qi* of Heaven, Earth, and Humanity, emanating from the Three Clarities.

*The Huainanzi* states: *"The Dao of the Supreme Lord gives birth to the myriad things yet does not possess them; it completes the ten thousand forms yet does not govern them."* It further says: *"The Supreme Lord nurtures transformation; the next best establishes the Dharma."*

Thus, the rulers of successive dynasties have revered the Three Clarities, all honoring them with the title *Taishang*.

**"Expounds" (Shuo):** Means "to elucidate." The Supreme Lord’s teachings of the various scriptures and methods all serve as gradual steps toward the wondrous gate.

*Laozi* says: *"The Supreme Lord establishes virtue; the next best establishes merit."* This scripture was issued by the **Purple Tenuity Emperor of the Northern Culmen Palace**, in accordance with the Supreme Lord’s decree to establish merit—thus, it was expounded on this basis.

In the first kalpa of the **Dragon Han Eon**, corresponding to the first year of the **Eternal Longevity Era of the Great Luo Three Heavens**, on the **Upper Prime Day**, the **Primordial Beginning Emperor** ascended the **Eight Radiant Heavens of the Grand Empyrean** and expounded the **Numinous Treasure Scripture of the Dao for Salvation**, intending to guide the **Thirty-Six Heavenly Emperors and all True Lords**. Suddenly, the gates of Heaven shook open, revealing the lower realms below, where the **Third Kalpa of the Kaihuang Era** was drawing to a close, and malevolent *qi* surged violently.

According to *The Authentic Record of Master Dong*, the last ruler of the Xia, **King Zhou**, had lost the Dao through licentiousness, defying Heaven. This provoked the **Six Heavenly Demon Kings**, who harmed the people of the Nine Lands. The Primordial Beginning Emperor then commanded the **Supreme August Jade Emperor of the Golden Watchtower, the Heavenly Sovereign Who Opens the Heavens, Holds the Talisman, and Governs the Calendar in Unity with the True Dao**, to descend to the **Northern Culmen Province** and enforce the decree. In the yang realm, he aided **King Wu of Zhou** in overthrowing Zhou and pacifying the realm; in the yin realm, he dispatched the **Great Mysterious General** to subdue demons and separate humans from spirits. Within seven days, both endeavors succeeded, and the cosmos was purified.

**"Mysterious Heaven" (Xuantian):** *Xuan* (Mysterious) signifies the One; *tian* (Heaven) signifies the Empyrean. This refers to the **Purple Empyrean of the Great Mysterious Heaven in the Northern Quadrant**, transformed by the *qi* of the **Celestial One**. The **Mysterious Emperor** now presides over it, for in the fifty-seventh year of the **Yellow Emperor’s** reign in the lower realms, he ascended by celestial decree, and his palace was established in this realm. As the origin of the **Water Transformation**, it is the foremost of the **Nine Empyreans**.

The **Void of the One** transforms into the **Western-Southern Empyrean of the Primordial Simplicity**, called the **Second Radiance**.
The *qi* of **Pure Unity** transforms into the **Eastern Azure Empyrean of the Azure Primordial Heaven**, called the **Third Radiance**.
The *qi* of **Numinous Unity** transforms into the **Southeastern Verdant Empyrean of the Primordial Division**, called the **Fourth Radiance**.
The **Realm of the Void and Brahman** transforms into the **Fifth Radiance**, the **Jade Emperor’s Palace of the Supreme August Heaven of the Numinous Empyrean**.
The *qi* of **Ultimate Unity** transforms into the **Northwestern Jade Empyrean of the Primordial Mystery**, called the **Sixth Radiance**.
The *qi* of **Mysterious Unity** transforms into the **Western Jade Empyrean of the Grand Simplicity**, called the **Seventh Radiance**.
The **Supreme Void of the Great One** transforms into the **Northeastern Grand Empyrean of the Primordial Azure**, called the **Eighth Radiance**.
Below, it covers the **Southern Flaming Realm of the Mortal World**, where the **Primordial Beginning Emperor** descended to save the multitudes.
The *qi* of the **Primordial Brahman** transforms into the **Southern Crimson Empyrean of the Grand Cinnabar Heaven**, called the **Ninth Radiance**.

Thus, within the **Nine Empyreans**, the years of the **Five Kalpas** are recorded to mark the celestial epochs. The **Three Heavens of the Great Luo** maintain the reign titles.

At the age of fifteen, the **Mysterious Emperor** encountered the **Purple Primordial Lady**, who said: *"Your harmony with the Great Peace ensures your ascension."* His master later told him that after his ascension, he would serve as an **assistant minister in the Three Realms above** and a **Great Sage of the Ten Directions below**. After **2,500 years**, he indeed ascended in the **Gengyin Year of the Yellow Emperor**.

According to *The Outline of Imperial Lineages and Chronologies*, this corresponds to the **twenty-third year of King Zhou’s reign in the Jisi Year**, precisely **2,500 years** later. *The Comprehensive Mirror* records this as the year **King Wen received the Mandate**. In the **first year of King Wu’s reign (Jimao Year)**, it had been **ten years** since the **Purple Primordial Lady’s prophecy**.

The **Heavenly Conjunction of Kan and Li**—the **Mysterious Warrior of the Two Essences**—overthrew the **tyrannical Shang Zhou**, ushering in the **Zhou Wu era**.

**"Perfected Warrior" (Zhenwu):** *Zhen* (Perfected) means "upright"; *wu* (Warrior) means "divine." Originally titled **Mysterious Warrior**, this was changed to **Perfected Warrior** to avoid the taboo of the **Song Dynasty’s temple name**, reflecting his **stern discipline of non-killing in punitive expeditions**. The **Jade Emperor** sent him to guard the **North**, and during the **demon-subduing era of King Zhou’s fall**, he was commanded to **unbind his hair and go barefoot**, granted the **Black Banner of the Sacred Mound**, and **donned armor in person**. After his triumph, he **trampled the Tortoise and Serpent and returned to Heaven**, where he was hailed as **Marshal** and revered as the **Fortune God**.

On that day, the **Mysterious Emperor** looked up and sighed: *"Today, my master’s words have come true!"*

*The Authentic Record of Master Dong* states: In the **second year of the Jiayou Era (Dingyou Year) of the Song Emperor Renzong’s reign**, corresponding to the **third year of the True Transformation Era of the Great Luo Heaven**, on the **fifth day of the fifth month**, the **Three Clarity Lords** ascended the **Jade Palace Hall**. The **Marshal of the Nine Heavens** was ordered to open the celestial records, review the merits and transgressions of the **Ten Thousand Heavens**, and rectify the **Three Officials and Four Saints**. Since the **opening of the Great Void and the birth of the Divine One**, they had **protected Heaven, aided Earth, and nurtured all life**.

On the **first day of the first month of the fourth year**, the **Jade Flower Abbey** completed the engraving of the **Jade Register**. A decree was proclaimed to the **Three Officials and Four Saints**, summoning them to the **Seven-Treasure Jeweled Terrace** on the **Upper Prime Festival**.

During the era of the August Emperor’s perfection, the Supreme Jade Sovereign personally conducted the rites and decreed the investiture of the Dark Warrior, bestowing the title **Supreme Purple August Heavenly-Unity Perfected**, **Jade Void Preceptor and Minister of the Mysteries**, and **Supreme Emperor of the Dark Heaven**, while appointing him to the office of **Nine Heavens Investigator** and granting the subsidiary honorific to the **Tortoise and Serpent**.

This is the *Root Transmission*. "Root" signifies origin, and "transmission" signifies flow—it is the historical compilation edited by the **Golden Watchtower Daily Record Institute**. Moreover, each dynasty’s sovereign has observed its own rites, and by imperial decree of Emperor Huizong, this text was composed to extol the awe-inspiring responses of the Dark Emperor’s might. The **Heavenly Bureau of Celestial Investigation** meticulously recorded each event and memorialized them to the **Mystic Capital**, where they were inscribed into the **Golden Registers and Jade Chronicles**. Whenever the celestial mandate required merit assessment, the **Marshal of the Golden Watchtower**, **Divine Lord Han the Venerable**, along with **Perfected Han of the Life-Commanding Office**, **True Lord of Name-Fixing**, **Nine Heavens Investigator of Merit**, and **Nine Heavens Treasurer of Blessings**, all attested to the facts and jointly compiled this work, henceforth known as the *Root Transmission*.

Recently, another text, *The Veritable Record of the Dark Emperor*, descended from Heaven and was brought to the mortal realm. Through **Zhang Mingdao**, the chief of the **Purple Void Altar** in Xiangyang, it was shown to **Jiang Renyu** of the **Jade Hut** and printed for the world. How profound and unfathomable are the sagely and divine affairs of the Dark Emperor! The compilation was undertaken by **Dong Suhuang**, **Left Minister of the Supreme Perfected Western King**, **Director of the Celestial Mechanism of the Upper Clarity**, **Perfected Lord of Divine Response and Primordial Grace**, **Flying Rosy Radiance Perfected**, and **Middle Yellow Master**. **Zhang Ya**, **Jade Hall Academician of the Nine Heavens Registry**, **Water Bureau Transport Commissioner of the Lower Prime**, and **Inspector of Penal Affairs of the Nine Lands**, **Upper Immortal Yuan Sovereign**, served as its editor.

The postscript records: In the **thirteenth year of the Era of Transformation of the Supreme Great Luo Heaven of the Seventh Kalpa of Extended Peace**, corresponding to the **eleventh year of the Chunxi reign of Emperor Xiaozong of the Great Song**, during the **Middle Upper Prime of the Jiazi cycle**, on the **fifteenth day of the first month**, in the year **Jiachen**.

The **Two Perfected** appended their decree, saying: "Let all who read this purify their hearts and recite it kneeling."

**Divine Incantations**: "Divine" signifies illumination, and "incantation" signifies oath. The Supreme Sovereign established these as covenants of great trust and accord. According to the *Scripture of Subduing Demons*, they are "flying and concealed words"—the sighs of the **Dao’s bellows and keys**. When the divine hear them, they strike the true and summon the numinous, and none fail to arrive. Thus, one should align with the **Heavenly Stem and spread the Dipper**, or **stimulate the Earthly Branch and point the Big Dipper’s handle**, assisting the **Celestial Pass**. At the altar’s center, one knocks the teeth, offers incense, and pledges vows as the heart desires. Sincere recitation moves the **Great Sage Dark Emperor**, whose spiritual resonance spans the warp and weft of existence. Swift without haste, present without motion, all good responses yield great auspiciousness, fulfilling this ordained command.

**Wondrous Scripture**: "Wondrous" signifies attainment, and "scripture" signifies path. The *Essential Affairs of the Dark Emperor* states: "Heaven attains strength, Earth attains tranquility, and the people attain sustenance." Thus, the **Three Powers and the myriad beings** all rely on the **primordial qi of the One Dao** to revolve the **Great Potter’s Wheel**.

At that time, the **wondrous practice** arose from the sincerity of the multitude. The **Great Emperor radiated brilliance upon the Dao**, discoursing on the **method of nurturing the One**, unlocking the **mechanism of Grand Peace**, and pointing to the **timeliness of daily use**—all extensions of the Dark Emperor’s traversed path. Therefore, the **Dao in Heaven coalesces into primordial qi**, while on Earth it **latently governs primordial form**, and within humanity it **stirs primordial consciousness**. To **attain primordial consciousness** is to comprehend the profound mysteries of this scripture and practice them.

The present scripture states: The Dark Emperor descended and declared that in matters of **blessing and benefit**, he **protects people, augments longevity, and fulfills Heaven’s mandate**. Those whose **qi is upright and heart is pure**, whose **loyalty is complete and filial piety is exhaustive**, shall have their names inscribed on **jade tablets** and be **recommended for ascension to immortality**. It is fitting to **pour water, offer abundant incense, and bare one’s sincere emotions**.

The scripture says: "Bow in reverence and pray—no wish shall go unanswered."

At that time, **Immortal Zhang the Heavenly Master**, thrice encountered the descent and transformation of the **Supreme**. According to the *Scripture of the Southern Dipper*, he was bestowed a thousand scrolls of scriptures, all essentials of cultivation, to be transmitted to those of the Dao. These enabled **embodied deliverance**, ensuring **eternal existence through endless kalpas**. This scripture, too, was among those thousand scrolls.

Alas! This book carries the Dao, revealing the **Dark Heaven’s vast gate of expedient means**. The Dao lies in human practice, ascending to the **realm of the Supreme**, guiding one along the **path to immortality**. *Laozi* said: "A tree of arm-spanning girth grows from a tiny sprout; a nine-tiered terrace rises from mounds of earth; a journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step." And again: "Be as cautious at the end as at the beginning, and there will be no failure." *Mencius* said: "The Dao is like a great road—how could it be hard to know? The trouble lies in people not seeking it."

**At that time**—that is, "thus have I heard."

The compilation of such true records was overseen by the **Divine Scribe of the Celestial Archives Bureau**, an immortal official of the **Supreme Heavenly Editorial Court**, who edited and inscribed these treasured golden tablets. Thus, the phrase *"at that time"* serves to initiate the refined preface, concealing the subtle mechanism of composition within its opening words.

The **Purple Tenuity Great Emperor**, serving under the **Golden Gate of the Celestial Palace** as the **Purple Tenuity Decree Officer**, wields governance over the great affairs of the **Three Bureaus of Heaven, Earth, and Water**, presiding over the authority of life and death, destiny and command. His rank is titled: **Supreme Prime First Grade, Ninefold Qi-Bestowing Fortune-Granting Celestial Official of the Northern Culmen—Purple Tenuity Great Emperor**.

In the **Zhongyuan Festival of the Dragon Han Era’s first year**, when **Heaven inaugurated transformation and established the Five Kalpas to perpetuate destiny**, they were named: **Dragon Han, Crimson Brilliance, Supreme August, Extended Prosperity, and Inaugural August**. Once the Five Kalpas had run their course, the cycle recommenced. At that juncture, it was precisely the **first year of the fourth kalpa of Dragon Han**, coinciding with the **first year of Eternal Longevity in the Supreme Great Luo Heaven**, and corresponding below to the **jǐ-mǎo year of King Wu of Zhou’s reign—on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, the rén-shēn day**—a day of celestial assembly and textual review in the heavenly courts.

Within the **Supreme Clarity Realm, at the Northern Culmen Palace**, the **Central Heaven Northern Culmen Palace**, whose lintel bears the title: **Purple Tenuity Decree Office**.

Beneath the Golden Portal of the Supreme Clarity Realm, it governs the Office for Commanding the Myriad Spirits. Before the Hall of Purple Tenuity—this hall’s name being the Northern Culmen Chamber of the Golden Portal—its left and right bureaus exercise universal oversight. It is the courtyard where the Three Luminaries enact their transformations, the precinct where the opening and closing of yin and yang are regulated.

The *Treatise on Celestial Patterns* states: The Purple Tenuity Enclosure comprises fifteen stars—seven in the western array, eight in the eastern—situated north of the Northern Dipper. It is also called the seat of the Purple Tenuity Great Emperor. All the celestial officials and stellar lodges shine resplendently, so that those below on earth may behold them. Arrayed among the sagely beings of the heavens, the officials within and beyond the Purple Tenuity Enclosure—each with its designated overseer—number one hundred eighteen in rank, aggregating seven hundred eighty-two stars. All administer the governance of the celestial mechanism. As the most essential offices of the Three Realms, they comprise the Southern and Northern Dippers, the Eastern and Western Bureaus, the Five Stars of the Five Directions, the Six Palaces and Six Luminaries, the Twenty-Eight Lodges, and the Twelve Celestial Palaces—these six divisions akin to the six ministries and their attendant secretaries. The Flying Heavenly Divine Kings, wielding the authority of Surveillance Censors, supervise the boundless immortal hosts of the inner and outer courts, bearing the mandate to inspect the borders of the Eight Extremities.

All subordinate offices, in accordance with the statutes, on the Three Primordial Days, uniformly adhere to the decrees of the Northern Culmen Purple Tenuity Office, reviewing and recording the registers.

The Southern and Northern Dippers:
The Southern Dipper holds the registers of rank, emolument, and stipend; the Northern Dipper governs the ledgers of life, death, right, and wrong. According to the *Scripture of the Southern Dipper*: The Six Offices of the Southern Dipper and the Seven Governances of the Northern Dipper divide their duties to jointly administer the Three Powers, Six Harmonies, Eight Trigrams, and Nine Palaces, overseeing all officials and ranks within and beyond the realm. They are the central bureaus of the Purple Tenuity and Great Tenuity Enclosures. Above, they govern the twelve celestial divisions and the numinous spirits of heaven; below, they oversee the twelve terrestrial regions and the earthly deities—rulers of the Four Waterways, Five Peaks, Nine Provinces, Eight Extremities, famous mountains and great rivers, city gods and earth altars. In their ledgers and under their jurisdiction lie all peoples, all creatures, and the myriad things, without exception.

The honorific titles of the Six True Lords of the Southern Dipper are:
Heavenly Treasury Controller of Destiny, Upper Minister, True Lord Who Mirrors the State;
Heavenly Minister Recorder of Deeds, Upper Minister, True Lord Who Mirrors the Peaks;
Heavenly Beam Prolonger of Life, Protector of Destiny;
Heavenly Sameness Increaser of Years, Protector of Life;
Heavenly Pivot Deliverer from Calamity, Literary Glory, Refiner of Souls;
Heavenly Mechanism Supervisor of Life, Keeper of the Registers, Great Regulator.

The honorific titles of the Seven Stellar Lords of the Northern Dipper are:
Celestial Rotator, Greedy Wolf, Supreme Star Lord;
Earthly Mechanism, Great Gate, Primordial Star Lord;
Mechanism of Humanity, Emolument Keeper, True Star Lord;
Authority of Time, Literary Curve, Binding Star Lord;
Jade Balance, Health and Chastity, Principal Star Lord;
Opening Yang, Martial Curve, Recorder Star Lord;
Jade Radiance, Breaker of Armies, Pass Star Lord.

Each month, on the three seventh-day periods, the stellar lads of the Two Dippers descend to the human realm to review and admonish matters of life, death, transgression, and fortune.

The Eastern and Western Bureaus:
The Eastern Dipper records destinies, presiding over the Jade Numinous Jade Registers, evaluating the merits of human virtue and conduct, and governing the cultivation of good character. The Western Dipper records names, reviewing the multitudes of beings, executing the decrees of the Registers of Extinction and the Great Calculations of the Passes.

The *Scripture of the Eastern Dipper* states: By the mandate of the Eastern Dipper Emperor Lord, destinies are calculated and years prolonged; descending to the lower world, it delivers from the Three Paths, Five Sufferings, and Eight Difficulties, and can erase death to grant rebirth.

The *Scripture of the Western Dipper* states: The Supreme Clarity Great Perfected Emperor of the Primordial Mystery wields the handle of heaven, issuing commands of the Prisons of Might, subduing demons and restraining spirits, presiding over the execution of punishments within and beyond. It searches out and examines hidden and perverse forms; below, it records the deeds of humanity—good is invariably inscribed, evil invariably noted. Names and titles diverge, the limits of life and death ever revolve in cycles of eight hundred myriad millions, the roots of good and evil entwined like ropes, manifest and unhidden.

The honorific titles of the Five Stars of the Eastern Dipper are:
Azure Numinosity, True Lord Prolonger of Life;
Numinous Radiance, True Lord Protector of Destiny;
Opener of Heaven, Great Guardian, Assembler of Blessings;
Great Brilliance, Harmonizer of Yang, True Lord Preserver of Harmony;
Tail Extremity, Supreme Overseer.

The honorific titles of the Four Stars of the Western Dipper are:
White Standard Emperor Lord;
Lofty Primordial True Lord;
Curved Sovereign, Numinous True Lord;
General of Mighty Might.

The true offices of the Two Bureaus descend to the human realm, establishing their ordinances on the first, fifth, and ninth days of the month for the Eastern Dipper, and the seventh, ninth, and fifteenth days for the Western Dipper.

The Five Stars of the Five Directions:
They govern the five directions—gēng-xīn, jiǎ-yǐ, rén-guǐ, bǐng-dīng, wù-jǐ—corresponding to the Five Phases: metal, wood, water, fire, and earth, the stars of the Five Constants’ forms and qi.

The *Scripture of the Seven-Star Divine Incantation* states: Heaven and earth establish their positions, thereby instituting the Five Phases. They traverse the world, inspecting nations without the Way, observing inauspicious people. All within the bounds of their domains—creeping, crawling, and breathing beings—have their destinies tied to heaven.

The *Essential Compilation of the Primordial Scripture* states:
The Year Star of the East governs benevolence, engenders jiǎ-yǐ, transforms grasses and trees, administers the spring mandate, and oversees the myriad crawling and flying creatures born of transformation—twelve years to complete one celestial circuit.
The Great White Star of the West governs righteousness, engenders gēng-xīn, transforms metals and stones, administers the autumn mandate, and oversees the myriad horned and hornless creatures born of the womb—one year to complete one celestial circuit.
The Sparkling Deluder of the South governs propriety, engenders bǐng-dīng, transforms smoke and fire, administers the summer mandate, and oversees the myriad feathered and winged creatures born of the egg—two years to complete one celestial circuit.
The Chronographic Star of the North governs wisdom, engenders rén-guǐ, transforms water and springs, administers the winter mandate, and oversees the myriad shelled and scaleless creatures born of moisture—one year to complete one celestial circuit.
The Quelling Star of the Center governs trust, engenders wù-jǐ, transforms dust and earth, administers the four seasons, and oversees the myriad wise, foolish, and deluded humans endowed with spirit—twenty-nine years to complete one celestial circuit.

If a ruler can be reverent and temperate, sagely, respectful, pure, frugal, and yielding, then the August Ultimate is established.

Then naturally the Five Stars descend with auspicious omens, and their blessings extend throughout the realm.

*The Essential Hong Fan of All Under Heaven* states:
In demeanor, be reverent and solemn.
When Jupiter responds, it accords with wood’s bending and straightening, sending timely rains; words are heeded and compliant.
When Venus responds, it accords with metal’s malleability and transformation, sending timely sunshine; sight is clear and wise.
When Mars responds, it accords with fire’s blazing ascent, sending timely warmth; hearing is keen and plans astute.
When Mercury responds, it accords with water’s moistening descent, sending timely cold; thought is sagely and profound.
When Saturn responds, it accords with earth’s sowing and reaping, sending timely winds; thus is humanity.
When the ruler’s virtue aligns, the Five Fortunes are evenly distributed, extending to the myriad people.

Should the opposite occur, the stars will trespass and encroach, comets and baleful stars will clash and shatter, giving rise to warfare, floods, droughts, and displacement—calamities that bring ruin and death to the multitudes.

*The Book of Destiny* states:
The Five Stars traverse the celestial stations, exhibiting phases of direct motion, stationing, retrogradation, and concealment. When they illuminate men and women, determining the Four Pillars at birth, direct motion brings fortune while retrogradation brings misfortune.

As for the Six Palaces and the Six Luminaries—
they govern the Six Palaces of the Great Yang, Great Yin, Celestial One, Great One, Yellow Banner, and Leopard Tail, presiding over the six revolutions of day, night, darkness, brightness, wind, and rain. These are the Sun, Moon, Jupiter, Mercury, Mars, and Saturn.
The Six Luminaries proceed rightward through the celestial stations, conforming to the Purple Tenuity’s system of regulation, their movements varying in speed.

*The Scripture of Disaster Dispelling* states:
The sentient beings of the Desire Realm pursue only fleeting glory, neglecting the true Dao. They remain unaware that the Five Phases’ revolutions and the Eleven Luminaries’ illumination govern their fortune and misfortune.
When fire and earth station or conceal, when metal and wood trespass and encroach, when Rāhu and Ketu surge in opposition, when the Sun and Moon suffer eclipses—these bring about the relocation of prefectures and counties, the people’s disasters, floods, fires, locusts, and warfare, all arising therefrom.

*The Astronomical Treatise* states:
When a state lacks governance or misuses its power, it incurs the reprimand of the Sun and Moon. The six extremes manifest in the heavens as warnings to admonish and caution the ruler.
The Sun, sovereign of all yang, corresponds to the ruler and governs procreation, completing one celestial circuit each year. Should an eclipse occur, it warns the ruler: governance is flawed, the sovereign’s authority falters, the spirit’s resolve is benumbed and deluded, the altars of soil and grain grow feeble—thus the Sun’s eclipse punishes with enduring yin.
The Moon, sovereign of all yin, corresponds to the empress and great ministers, governing punishments. An eclipse admonishes treacherous ministers and disobedient children. Completing one celestial circuit each month, if words are not heeded and courage swells with recklessness, if the people’s extremity is sorrow, then the Moon’s eclipse punishes with enduring yang.

Jupiter, continuing Thursday, corresponds to the Five Fortunes and governs learning. Completing one celestial circuit every twenty-eight years, if one’s demeanor is irreverent, intent wild and reckless, and farming seasons are usurped, extremity turns to evil—wood’s icy desolation punishes with enduring rain.
Lunar Comet, continuing Mercury, corresponds to ancestral temples and governs sacrifices. Completing one circuit every nine years, if anger manifests as a comet with bristling head and trailing tail, if hearing is not keen and emotions are unrestrained and hasty, if heaven’s seasons are defied, extremity turns to poverty—water’s calamity punishes with enduring cold.
Rāhu, continuing Mars, corresponds to auxiliary duties and governs yang virtue. Completing one circuit every eighteen years, if it eclipses the Sun and Moon, if sight is unclear and the heart defies restraint, if laws are spurned, extremity turns to loathing—fiery disease punishes with bloodshed and enduring brilliance.
Ketu, continuing Saturn, corresponds to sowing and reaping and governs yin virtue. Completing one circuit every eighteen years, if anger causes mountains and rivers to collapse, if thought is intolerant and plans reckless, if parents are insulted, extremity turns to famine—punishing with enduring winds.

In an era of Great Peace, the Sun does not eclipse nor do the stars rebel, for virtue has reached its zenith.

For the men and women of the world, all take the Great Yang as the origin of their life palace, while the Great Yin determines their body palace. The Celestial One governs the Five Fortunes of humanity, the Great One oversees untimely deaths, Rāhu punishes men, and Ketu admonishes women. Within the Six Luminaries, the Sun and Moon distinctly divide day and night. Rāhu, Ketu, Comet, and Purple Tenuity—these dark luminaries transform people toward goodness, manifesting their light only when punishing the wicked.

The Twenty-Eight Constellations, resplendent in sound,
reside in the four directions, arrayed across the heavens, comprising three hundred sixty-five degrees and more. They are subordinate to the Seven Governors—the Sun, Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn—whose lodgings are called the Twenty-Eight Constellations. They regulate the years, months, dawns, and dusks, establishing the four directions and the seven luminaries.

Void and Pleiades assist the Sun Emperor’s governance;
Danger and Net assist the Moon Sovereign’s governance;
Wall and Triaster, Winnowing Basket and Chariot Roof assist Mercury’s governance;
House and Beak, Wings and Tail assist Mars’ governance;
Dipper and Straddler, Well and Horn assist Jupiter’s governance;
Ox and Bond, Ghost and Neck assist Venus’ governance;
Maid and Stomach, Willow and Chamber assist Saturn’s governance.

They perpetually cycle through the years, months, days, and hours to accomplish the year’s work. Descending through the sixty cyclical signs, they determine the natal stars of men and women. According to the solar terms, they divide the true influences, governing the twenty-four administrations and the affairs of the nether prisons.

Following *The Astronomical Treatise*, they oversee the Son of Heaven, the heir apparent, empresses, ancestral temples, civil and military officials, and the images of all things under heaven. All are entrusted as follows:

Dipper-Wood Literary Prosperity Star Lord governs rank and emolument, rectifying the Many Administrations at the Winter Solstice;
Ox-Metal Great Martial Star Lord governs sacrificial animals, rectifying the Flourishing Benefit Administration at the Lesser Cold;
Maid-Earth Celestial Beard Star Lord governs tailoring, rectifying the Sheltering Harmony Administration at the Greater Cold;
Void-Sun Celestial Task Star Lord governs tomb construction, rectifying the Gushing Spring Administration at the Beginning of Spring;

The Flying Celestial Divine Kings,
The Flying Celestial Divine Kings serve as the Chief Envoys of Merit and Transgression Inspection. They are known as the Eastern Hu Elder Lord, the Western Shi Elder Lord, the Southern Yue Elder Lord, the Northern Qiang Elder Lord, and the Central Cang Elder Lord. Stationed in the five directions, they preside as the ancestors of the myriad spirits, commanding an assembly of flying clerks, jade lads, jade maidens, and wondrously acting perfected ones—numbering twelve million four hundred thousand in total.

They roam and observe the Great Void, and on each of the Five La Days, they examine and assess the worldly, bestowing or withdrawing fortune and misfortune.

On the Heavenly La Day, the first day of the first month, the Eastern Hu Elder Lord gathers the assembly of elders at the Nine Qi Azure Dragon Gate to collectively deliberate and determine the duration of people’s spiritual qi, the timing of their prayers for descendants, and other matters, which are then reported to the Mysterious Ancestor.

On the Earthly La Day, the fifth day of the fifth month, the Southern Yue Elder Lord convenes the elders at the Three Qi Cinnabar Terrace Gate to assess the official ranks, blessings, and physiognomy of the worldly, as well as the prosperity or decline of their blood relations.

On the Moral La Day, the seventh day of the seventh month, the Western Shi Elder Lord gathers the elders at the Seven Qi Pale Spirit Gate to evaluate the robustness or frailty of people’s physiques, the success or failure of their studies and careers, and their reputations.

On the People’s Yearly La Day, the first day of the tenth month, the Northern Qiang Elder Lord assembles the elders at the Five Qi Pale Spirit Gate to determine changes in people’s stipends, fluctuations in their diets, the rise and fall of their official ranks, the length of their lifespans, and the severity of their illnesses.

On the Royal La Day, the La Day of the twelfth month—specifically the third *mo* day after the winter solstice— the Central Cang Elder Lord gathers the elders at the One Qi Wuji Gate to assess calamities, strange dreams, fortunes and misfortunes, the waxing and waning of "post-horses" in time, and the locations of life and death.

The Five Elders record the proceedings of the five assemblies and await the triennial Three Primordials festival to personally present them at the silent audience in the Purple Tenuity Imperial Court.

The Boundless Immortal Hosts,
The radiance of the sun, moon, and stars shines upon the mortal realm, traversing a distance of 356,971 *li* to reach the Eight Vast Territories. Beyond the Eight Knots, far removed from the Northern Culmen, lies the Boundless Realm. The ranks of the Boundless Immortal Offices vary.

According to the *Sutra of Causes and Conditions*, the Supreme Lord issued a decree commanding the Heavenly Thearchs to summon the Five Divine Kings of the Emperors. They dispatched the Nine Bureaus, Four Offices, Seven Star Lads, Ten Heavenly Generals, Eight Divine Lads, Wondrously Acting Perfected Ones, Celestial Immortals, Flying Immortals, Examiners of Scholars, and Examiners of Soldiers—altogether nine hundred million myriad beings—each assigned to their respective domains. Some manifest as clouds, some as rain, some as wind, some as dew, some as birds, some as beasts, some as great, some as small, some as short, some as tall, some as visible, some as hidden. In myriad transformations, they hold registers and wield brushes, ceaselessly investigating, searching, and scrutinizing day and night. They record merits and transgressions, and on the appointed days of the Three Primordials, return to their offices for review and verification.

They all approach the imperial throne, reverently paying homage to the august majesty. "They all approach" signifies that all attend the audience. At that time, the officials of the Six Departments of the Stellar Offices, along with the Divine Kings of Investigation, the Wondrously Acting Immortal Hosts, and the courtly assembly, present themselves before the imperial steps, each reverently holding their positions with solemn respect for the court’s authority.

At times, Jade Lads,
akin to the office of the Palace Attendant in the mortal realm, are summoned by the court as Jade Lads.

The Great Emperor transmits his edict: to the Northern Great General, the Dark Martial General, who shall receive the sagely command of the Jade Emperor. "Shall receive" signifies "is deemed worthy of." The Supreme Mystery may bow to the Dark Martial. From the Purple Tenuity Bureau of the Northern Culmen, bearing the Mandate of the August Heaven, each edict is issued with the Treasured Proclamation as its standard, rewarding meritorious deeds in due time.

By the Great Emperor’s decree, the Northern Supreme Mystery Marshal of the Primordial is to personally attend this court and bow to receive the edict from beneath the Three Heavenly Gates. At this assembly, all controllers of the True Unity shall witness the bestowal of the spoken treasure and hear the Jade Lads proclaim the imperial mandate.

The edict is prepared by the Great Elixir Perfected, Academician of the Mysterious at the Jade Flower Institute of the Golden Watchtower, in accordance with the imperial will, its words composed and verified, bearing the Jade Emperor’s seal of investiture—the Jade Seal, as recorded in *The Record of Directions*. The *Treasured Proclamation* states:

"Only you, who embody the auspiciousness of the Primal Yellow qi, guide the fullness of the Ninefold Yang’s majesty, whose virtue exalts your immortal rank and whose might pierces the divine perfected—issuing decrees for two thousand five hundred springs and autumns, your merits equaling forty-two kalpas—have, in the reckoning of years and the transformation of all beings, not erred by even a hair’s breadth.

Now, as the great kalpa of destiny unfolds and the boundaries between orthodoxy and heterodoxy blur, the Six Heavenly Demon Kings arise, harming the people of the Nine Lands. Without true power, how could peace and tranquility be restored? The Three Clarities rely upon you; the Nine Sages depend on you. Once more, you uphold the flourishing of the Dao and its laws, and again, you rectify the perverse and demonic.

You command the dual essences of Water and Fire within your grasp and govern the Generals of Jia and Geng within your discipline. Through this, your divine transformations nourish the myriad beings, and your merits shine resplendent—yet the multitude of sages cannot fully extol your glory.

It is fitting that you return to your origin and revert to your root, restoring your proper position. If not for this exalted title, how could your virtue be made manifest? The imperial seal is bestowed; do not decline in modesty. You are hereby specially appointed as the Great General Dark Martial Who Guards Heaven, Commander-in-Chief of the Three Primordials, Envoy of the Nine Heavens’ Patrols, Left Celestial Pivot of the Northern Culmen, Grand Marshal of the Three Realms overseeing the affairs of divine immortals, ghosts, and spirits, and Judge of the Right Victorious Bureau of the Mysterious Capital. You shall continue as the Supreme Mystery Marshal of the Primordial Harmony and the Reckoner of Promotions, and upon receipt of this decree, you shall act accordingly."

Recorded by the descent of the brush of Perfected Lord Dong. It is decreed that this be proclaimed thrice monthly.

The Right Vigilant Decree of the August Culmen establishes the fixed system for the sixth, sixteenth, and twenty-sixth days of each month. You shall command the divine troops and personally traverse the various heavens to conduct thorough inspections. Wherever you encounter perverse qi or inauspicious stars deviating from their proper courses, swiftly execute and eradicate them.

The palaces of the stellar lodges of the various heavens all reside above the ninefold Brahmanic qi, known as the celestial ortho-qi, which overshadows and sustains the Three Realms, aiding in the completion of Heaven and Earth. *The Star Charts of Gan and Shi* states: "In general, there are two hundred eighty-three celestial offices, comprising a total of one thousand four hundred sixty-four stars, serving as the fixed record." These govern the offices, palaces, goods, and implements of the world below, as well as the people’s livelihoods. Thus, forms arise on earth, while their essences correspond to heaven. *The Book of Changes: Appended Remarks* says: "Heaven and Earth take their positions, and the mountains and marshes communicate their qi." Qi is the fundamental spirit of Heaven and Earth. *Zhuangzi* states: "Heaven possesses six qi—yin, yang, darkness, brightness, wind, and rain—which circulate in accordance with the seasons. These are called the primordial qi, which generate and nurture the myriad things, completing the works of Heaven and Earth."

When a state’s virtue is defiled, calamities and misfortunes are inescapable, manifesting as inauspicious stars and perverse qi. *Records of the Grand Historian* notes: "The cloud of Wei resembled a dog; that of Zhao, an ox; that of Chu, the sun; that of Zhou, a chariot wheel; that of Yue, a horned dragon; that of Qin, a traveler; that of Lu, a horse; that of Song, a carriage; that of Han, a cloth; that of Zheng, a crimson robe; that of Wei, a rat; that of Shu, a state chariot; that of Han, a shattered mountain. When such clouds descend upon an army, they are called ‘camp-head stars.’" *The Yellowstone Duke’s Celestial Writ* says: "Though resembling stars, they are not stars. With sixty-four transformations, they are collectively called ‘inauspicious comets.’ The first is called ‘State Yellow,’ resembling the Old Man Star, its red rays scattered—it portends invaders and insurmountable military disasters. The second, ‘Illuminating Brightness,’ lacks rays or horns, being blue above and white below—where it appears, frequent campaigns arise. The third, ‘Ugly Remnant,’ resembles the Morning Star, its light nearly extinguished—its appearance in the due east is inauspicious. The fourth, ‘Bandit Star,’ has several red rays, its light flickering—its appearance in the due south is ominous. The fifth, ‘Mother Peril,’ resembles Venus but lacks rays or horns—its appearance in the due west is inauspicious. The sixth, ‘Prison River,’ emits three comets, blue within and red without—its appearance in the due north is baleful. (The remainder is omitted for brevity.)"

According to *The Jin Annals of the Five Phases*: "The emperors and kings, their virtue matching Heaven and Earth, harmonize with yin and yang. Their proclamations and decrees move both the hidden and the manifest. The subtlest signs of fortune and misfortune arise in response to stimuli. Generally, the hearts of men align with the will of Heaven. When disasters and chaos accumulate, they become visible: halos embracing the sun, jade pendants adorning the moon, or red crows flying beside the sun, or two suns or two moons appearing and vanishing behind clouds—such evils are extreme. When a ruler’s virtue is defiled, he summons his own replacement, for this too is the will of Heaven. Thus, Heaven first admonishes with calamities and anomalies, warning without arbitrary punishment. If the ruler fails to reform and reflect, perverse qi descends again, and inauspicious stars and monstrous omens appear to warn and alarm. Upon witnessing these, one may infer the will of the August Culmen. Embracing the Supreme’s command to cherish life, you are further charged, O Mysterious Emperor, to pacify, suppress, and subdue the inauspicious, harmonizing and rectifying the transformations to subtly assist the lords of the cosmos."

Additionally, during the Three Primordials—the sacred days when the Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and the Water Bureau convene—these occur on the *yin*, *shen*, and *hai* days of the *chen* month, as well as the fifteenth day, known as the Three Primordial Festivals. According to *The Scripture of Ranks and Instruments*: "The Upper Primordial’s Purple Tenuity Palace comprises three bureaus: the Left Great Yang, the Right Great Yin, and the Central Wind Blade. The Middle Primordial’s Clear Void Palace comprises three bureaus: the Left Cavern Yang, the Right Northern Capital, and the Central Clear Void. The Lower Primordial’s Azure Florescence Palace comprises three bureaus: the Left Clear Source, the Right Cold Night, and the Central Clear Numinous. Beneath these nine bureaus lie one hundred twenty departments, which examine the registers of the ascent and descent of divine immortals and stellar lodges, the records of the rise and fall of lands corresponding to celestial divisions, and the limits of transformations affecting gods and men. They review the lifespans of the rulers, empresses, princes, crown princes, officials, and common people of the great thousand-worlds, along with all records of good and evil deeds. Those who receive great blessings in this life have their cases reviewed every three years. Those who receive moderate blessings are reviewed every nine years. Those who receive minor blessings are reviewed every twenty-four years. Decisions are made regarding the extension or curtailment of lifespans, changes in fortune or misfortune, and the granting or withholding of rewards, with the duration of years and months determined accordingly. Thus, both punishments and blessings are meted out, and merits and transgressions are recompensed alike. They also review the limits of service for ghosts and spirits within the Three Realms, the periods of transformation for fish and dragons, the months and years when the myriad creatures of flight and movement change their forms, the judgments and registrations of karmic retributions in the Nine Dark Realms, and the binding of those who must endure unceasing kalpas—all are meticulously reviewed and settled."

As recorded in *The Sutra of Causes and Conditions*: "On the fifteenth day of the first month, the Upper Primordial’s Palace Lord, the First-Rank Ninefold Qi Bestowing Blessings Heavenly Official, the Purple Tenuity Great Emperor, dispatches ten celestial numinous officials, divine immortal troops, upper sagely perfected ones, and wondrously accomplished perfected persons, along with innumerable hosts, to descend into the human realm and review and determine sins and blessings. On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, the Middle Primordial’s Palace Lord, the Second-Rank Sevenfold Qi Pardoning Sins Earthly Official, the Clear Void Great Emperor, dispatches nine terrestrial numinous officials, divine immortal troops, and the troops of famous mountains and grottoes, along with innumerable hosts, to emerge into the human realm and review and admonish sins and blessings. On the fifteenth day of the tenth month, the Lower Primordial’s Palace Lord, the Third-Rank Fivefold Qi Relieving Calamities Water Official, the Supporting Florescence Great Emperor, dispatches the Nine River Water Emperors, the Twelve River Sources, the Han Valley Great Spirits, the Sunlit Valley Divine Kings, and the water bureau’s numinous officials to arrive in the human realm and review and admonish sins and blessings."

The Mysterious Emperor, in accordance with the received mandate, is hereby appointed as the Commander-in-Chief overseeing the affairs of the Three Primordials’ troops. You shall continue to command and supervise the innumerable soldiers while also investigating the conditions of the mortal realm.

The *Jié* are the Eight Seasonal Nodes. On these days, the yin-yang and Eight Trigrams Spirit Lords are newly appointed to exchange and transfer their worldly duties. On these days, the Trigram Spirits, in accordance with the authority of the North Culmen, issue commands and decrees, open and close yin and yang, and give life or death to the myriad beings.

Furthermore, as recorded in the various true scriptures: The heavens obey the edicts of the Primordial Beginning, and on the days of the Eight Nodes, dispatch the exalted perfected ones, the Three Primordial Ladies of the Pure, and the Nine Numinous Ladies to ascend to the Nine Heavens and perform the Dao to confer immortality. Next, the Ten Directions’ Savior-from-Suffering Heavenly Worthies and jade lads and maidens are sent down to deliver the souls languishing in the long night of the Nine Netherworlds. The Trigram Spirits are also dispatched to review and admonish the regulation of the nodes, where thunder stirs, winds scatter, rain and dew moisten, and the sun’s brilliance shines—water nourishes and brings all things to fruition, governing the myriad affairs of the world.

On the day of *Lìxià* (Beginning of Summer), the Lord of the Beginning Vermilion Heaven, together with the Grand Unity General, the *Xùn* Trigram Great Spirit, and the Red Impetuous One, descends into the human realm to oversee the constant transformation of the *qīngmíngfēng* (clear and bright wind), causing the myriad beings to flourish and grow.

On the day of *Qiūfēn* (Autumn Equinox), the Radiant Numinous Emperor, together with the Following Chief General, the *Duì* Trigram Great Spirit, and the Examiner of the Celestial Handle, descends into the human realm to oversee the fostering transformation of the *yánhéfēng* (closing and opening wind), causing the myriad beings to mature and be harvested.

On the day of *Lìdōng* (Beginning of Winter), the Lord of the Beginning Mysterious Heaven, together with the Ascending Brightness General, the *Qián* Trigram Great Spirit, and the Strong Yu, descends into the human realm to oversee the transformation of the *bùfēng* (unceasing wind), causing the myriad beings to respond to the season’s end.

On the day of *Dōngzhì* (Winter Solstice), the Five Numinous Emperors, together with the Divine Marshal General, the *Kǎn* Trigram Great Spirit, and the Exhausted Oddity, descend into the human realm to oversee the welling transformation of the *guǎngmòfēng* (vast and desolate wind), causing the myriad beings to coil and hide.

Each year, the Eight Trigram Spirit Lords are dispatched in rotation to govern and administer. Each term of office lasts for three qi, forty-five days, while the remaining time is devoted to overseeing the affairs of the lower officials, the people, and the sowing and cultivation of crops.

The Mysterious Emperor, holding the handle of the Northern Culmen’s Celestial Pivot, directs the Eight Trigrams, harmonizes cold and heat, and refines and forges the essence and purity.

On *Jiǎzǐ* days, these belong to the Grand Unity Central Terrace, where the Grand Envoy oversees the passes. The Six Jia Generals of the Primordial Epochs assemble, and the Nine Heavens’ Marshal is summoned to command the jade lads in reviewing and recording, bestowing or depriving the mortal realm of births—male or female—and predetermining the auspicious or inauspicious circumstances of their birth times. Every *Gengshen* day, they depart the human body, ascending to the Thirty-Six Bureaus of the Three Offices of Tai Xuan, and descending to align with the records, reporting good and omitting evil. The Mysterious Emperor oversees the office of the Tai Xuan Marshals, and cases are sent down to the earthly realm to restrain and suppress the affairs of the Hundred Demons, preventing their reckless entry into and exit from the human body.

Thus, the true wanderings and meritorious deeds of the Mysterious Emperor extend throughout the seas within and beyond, their manifest responses resplendent. Those who receive grace are numerous, and those who praise are many—all recorded in the annals, now fittingly annotated.

Rewarding good and punishing evil: all human good and evil arise from the karmic summoning of the three actions of body, speech, and mind. Who does not receive a full harvest of retribution? The true office of the Mysterious Emperor constantly admonishes with matters of reward and punishment.

The *Records of Divine Manifestation* state: In the early Xianping era of the Song dynasty, Cheng Sichang, a merchant from Xinghua Prefecture in Fuzhou, was habitually fond of vegetarianism. While traveling in Mizhou and staying at Jiaoqiao Town, he witnessed hunters cruelly capturing flying birds. Unable to bear the sight of innocent lives being slaughtered, he resolved to print and distribute the *Precepts Against Killing* from his family’s collection. After the woodblocks were carved, on the seventh day of the eleventh month—the descent day of the Perfected Warrior—he burned incense, knelt in reverence, and prayed to the void, saying, "The flying birds of this place die without cause. I beseech the sagely protection to transform the people through this text and guide them toward goodness."

On the day of distribution, the tax barrier chief, Peng Jing, was the first to request a copy. He pasted it on his wall. Unexpectedly, his wife, Hua Sanniang, upon hearing the recitation, flew into a rage, tore the text to pieces, and cast it into filth. She then bought a black carp and, wielding a knife, slaughtered it. The fish thrashed its tail, injuring one of Sanniang’s eyes. Blood spattered the ground, and she wailed in agony. The blood transformed into maggots, and no physician or shaman could cure her. Jing sought out Sichang to berate him, but upon arriving, found him already deceased, seated upright in meditation.

Shortly after, before the town’s garrison hall, Cheng’s body was seen suspended in midair, standing.

The patrol inspector Xuan Dan, sensing the strangeness at dawn, burned incense and inquired of Cheng. The apparition hastily replied: "I am the Perfected Warrior of the Central Heaven. I have observed that the residents of this land, over countless kalpas, have wantonly slaughtered living beings to sate their appetites, amassing grave karmic obstructions—yet their retribution has not yet manifested. First, I revealed Hua’s crime of destroying Cheng Sichang’s exhortative text, decreeing her an evil death as just recompense, for retribution admits no escape. As for the other transgressors, let them heed this warning."

With these words, the vision vanished.

At that time, the Vice Minister of the Ministry of Works, Xiang Guo, passing through on his mission to oversee the mountains and marshes, heard the rumors and questioned Xuan Dan, who presented Cheng Sichang’s handwritten ode. It read:

*"I spare no living breath,
And Heaven grants me a virtuous name.
If still you doubt this truth,
Behold how clear the karmic reckoning."*

Having read it with reverence, he took the text back with him. Upon returning to court, he reported the matter to Emperor Zhenzong, who praised and bestowed posthumous honors, affirming the numinous efficacy of the Perfected Warrior. The event was recorded in the ritual canon, and the imperial composition declared:

*"One Spirit of the Three Primordials,
Responding through the Ten Gates,
Radiant with auspicious light,
All true, all-pervading, vanquishing the demonic."*

Thus, the August Emperor acknowledged the Dark Sovereign’s decree: that Cheng Sichang’s exhortation to a hundred virtues be recorded, and Hua’s punishment as a wicked woman serve to chastise a hundred evils.

*The Book of Stimulus and Response* states: "One who has committed evil deeds but later repents, refraining from all wrongdoing and practicing all virtues, shall in time surely attain good fortune—transforming misfortune into blessing."

To uphold the upright and expel the perverse: the sovereign, revered as the exemplar for all people, sets the standard. When the standard is upright, what in the world will not be set right? Governance lies in fostering loyalty, and ministers aid the people in fully realizing their nature.

Thus, the emperor, wielding the unseen authority of the state, distinguishes the true from the mundane to uphold the upright in governance. How could usurpers and licentious rebels long harm the nation?

*The Record of the Sage’s Manifestation* recounts: After Emperor Gaozong of Tang passed, his coffin stood before the court as the Crown Prince Yuwang ascended the throne. At the time, Empress Wu held power and exiled the emperor to Fangzhou. She then elevated her cousin’s son, He Quanlong, to the post of Regional Inspector and appointed him Palace Observation Envoy, though he devoted himself solely to sorcery. He falsely styled himself the "Seven Essences of the Northern Culmen, Dharma Aide to the State."

The empress, favoring him, allowed Quanlong to wield unchecked authority, slandering and demoting officials. Suddenly, word came of an emergency in the Taichuan region: the western chieftain Zhao Hong, leading demonic troops, had invaded, his forces comprising serpents, tigers, smoke, fire, and a hundred monstrous apparitions. The local command dared not advance.

The ministers proposed sending He Quanlong with his Seven Essences Dharma to repel the threat. Empress Wu approved, and the Privy Councilor Cui Cha bestowed talismans and dispatched three thousand troops to confront the enemy. Half the army perished, and three of Quanlong’s household servants were lost. Helpless, Quanlong watched as the borderlands teetered on collapse.

The court ministers deliberated again and petitioned to summon Pei Tao, a Yellow Gate Attendant, and his sixteen-year-old son, Zhongfang, whose appearance and talents were extraordinary. They were certain he could defeat Zhao Hong’s demonic horde. The empress summoned him, bestowed the title of Grand Master of Splendid Happiness, and granted him five hundred soldiers, exempting him from the usual court farewell.

Returning home to pay respects to his parents, he girded his sword and led his troops straight to the enemy lines. With a sweep of his blade, he routed the foe—Zhao Hong fell from his horse, his troops frozen, his sorcery dissolved. The enemy was captured and brought back to the capital.

Hastening to see Empress Wu, he was invited to ascend the dais and sit. The empress soothed him, saying, "We know you are a divine being."

The Grand Master then exposed He Quanlong’s affair with the fox spirit Yuan Gang, whose sorcery had sullied the nation’s dignity. Though the empress still favored Quanlong, she ordered him to bring hundreds of his household servants into the palace for a public trial of the Seven Essences Dharma.

When Quanlong arrived, he gnashed his teeth and spat water to conjure clouds and mist, sending his servants soaring into the air. He unleashed violent winds, hail, and sleet. Zhongfang brandished his sword and summoned them—one by one, they fell, drawn into his scabbard. He then invoked true fire and incinerated them with a spell.

Thereupon, the assembled ministers celebrated the return of peace, and a general amnesty was proclaimed throughout the land. In the ninth month of the first year of the Tongtian era, the reign title was changed to Shen’gong.

Afterward, the Grand Master took leave of his parents, saying, "I came from Heaven; now I depart to the North." With these words, he bowed and sat in meditation, his body ascending into the clouds amid celestial music. Slowly, he drifted toward the northern skies.

The matter was reported to the throne, and he was posthumously enfeoffed as the Divine Responsive General. Pei Tao resigned his office and requested that his residence be converted into a Daoist abbey. The empress consented, bestowing upon Tao the title Divine Responsive Celebrated Layman of Purity, and the abbey was named accordingly. The Tang dynasty’s fortunes were thus revived.

This was the Dark Sovereign’s warning to later generations of ministers: let none establish themselves as treacherous villains, for those who transgress shall without exception be cast out. Moreover, let people harbor upright thoughts, and they shall surely attain the true and mysterious. Let perverse thoughts not take form, lest they immediately incur dire consequences.

The salvation of celestial and mortal beings lies in the six elements—water, fire, wood, metal, earth, and grain—which arise from the earth and are perfected by Heaven, sustaining human life from birth to death. Thus, the ruler is the people’s Heaven, and food is the Heaven of destiny. The people rely on the ruler for peace, just as the ruler is established by the people. Yet even so, there may come years of famine and scarcity, for such is the work of Creation.

Only a virtuous ruler, in his exalted power, can dissolve calamities, transform disasters into blessings, and succor the myriad people. According to the *Records of the Divine Manifestation*: In the first year of Xiande during the Later Zhou, when Emperor Taizu of Song was leading his forces on campaign against Ying Prefecture, he encountered an immortal at dusk who secretly revealed the signs of his future greatness, saying, "You shall receive the hidden aid of the True Warrior." With these words, the immortal vanished in a flash of light. Taizu, firm in his faith, performed rites of thanksgiving and supplication, and soon thereafter he indeed received the abdication of the Zhou, establishing the Song dynasty. He changed the reign title to Jianlong and rewarded his armies throughout the realm. Only Ying Prefecture was found wanting, and Chen Chou submitted a memorial requesting that the five hundred thousand strings of cash deposited in the imperial treasury by foreign merchants be borrowed to fund the border garrisons and rewards.

The imperial assent was granted, and the funds were dispatched to Zheng, the fiscal commissioner of Gaoyang Pass. Later, the foreign merchants Yi Shouxian and others arrived at the bureau. Chen Chou, having purified himself, submitted a memorial to the court, detailing the matter of the deposited funds. He explained that the Prince of Zhao had previously received an omen from the Star of Venus, and in gratitude, had burned offerings of money and silk to the True Warrior, our gracious patron. Upon reviewing the memorial, it was discovered that an additional fifty thousand strings of cash remained. The Prince of Zhao had sent the merchants to exchange them, and all the wealth was now under his management for his use.

When the merchants finished speaking, they vanished. Chen Chou reported the matter in full, and upon reading his memorial, the emperor was overcome with joy and gratitude.

By the second year, on the first day of the third month, the hundred officials accompanied the emperor to ascend the Hall of Illuminated Virtue, where they deliberated on the various regional lords and kings, each entrenched in their mountains and rivers, their repeated campaigns yet unconquered.

Suddenly, a dense black mist enveloped the hall’s forecourt, obscuring all sight. Chancellor Zhao Pu alone invited the emperor to ascend the Hall of Filial Accomplishment. As they took their seats, a divine figure appeared amidst the clouds above, bowing reverently to the emperor before descending to address him: *"The imperial foundation stands firm, its destiny newly flourishing; like Yao and Shun, you must summon the right men to aid your reign. Beware the folly of later rulers who gained the throne through excess, lest treacherous rebels stain your rule with chaos."*

The Great Ancestor personally inquired, *"What office does the sage hold?"*
The figure replied, *"I am no earthly spirit but serve as the Right Victorious Prefect of the Heavenly Capital. Bound for Yan territory, I overheard your concerns and paused to report: I have just returned from the Three Heavens, where I learned that the Song’s usurpation shall not exceed the span of a reign. The Way of Heaven is just."*

As Zhao Pu bowed in gratitude, the True Warrior took his leave and ascended.

In the autumn of the third year of Jianlong, reports arrived from the two circuits of Hebei: two years of drought had left the military and people without grain, a dire crisis no official could resolve. Then, on the seventh day of the seventh month at dawn, twenty commanderies and prefectures each found their cities piled high with heaps of millet and wheat, their sacks stitched with markings of black cloud and horse paper. The goods had no owner, no porters, and the prefectures, after verifying one another’s accounts, memorialized the court.

The Three Departments reviewed the matter and issued a decree: *"How could such goods lack an owner? This is the virtue of our dynasty moving the True Warrior to release grain from the Heavenly Granary to relieve the two circuits."* In total, some 150,000 *shi* of grain were distributed at low prices to revive the starving military and people.

Upon hearing this, the emperor exclaimed in joy, *"Such grace is no small matter—how dare we not repay it?"* On the day the True Warrior descended, the emperor personally attended the Hall of the Dark Capital, offering incense and reverence.

According to the *Descended Writings of Master Dong*, the Dark Emperor governs through the Dao and virtue, embodying the silent, effortless success of Heaven and Earth. He never ceases to care for all beings, nor does he abandon the lands below for even a moment. Whenever he foresees calamity, he first petitions the Golden Gates with sincerity to mitigate its severity. Even among the rebellious tribes and those who disrupt the Central Kingdom, he extends his teachings, truly the Great Compassionate Savior and Supreme Dharma King.

He dispels demons and neutralizes poisons—wherever lands are afflicted by malevolent forces or plagues, it is invariably due to the people’s transgressions and karmic defilements. As the saying goes, *"Heaven shows no favoritism; only virtue is its support."* When the noble ruler rectifies his heart, he naturally invokes the awe-inspiring radiance of the Divine, dispelling and restraining all inauspicious events.

The *Records of the Divine Manifestation* state: Zhao Guangzu of Shanzhou, deputy strategist under the Right Victorious Prefecture, was demoted to assist the Song for over thirty years. By the early Taiping Xingguo era, he was appointed Grand Scholar of the Hall of Illustrious Literature and Right Remonstrating Censor, before passing away and returning to his post in the Northern Culmen.

His younger cousin, Shi Guangsi, Minister of Rites and Reader-in-Waiting of the Ministry of Rites, was dispatched to govern Hongzhou and concurrently oversee the regions of Tan, Ding, Heng, E, and Jing. These lands bordered the barbarian tribes, where seventy-two ferocious spirits and rampant demonic toxins wantonly claimed lives. The people there, estranged from the true teachings and ignorant of medicine, indulged in heterodox practices, sacrificing to southern deities. They called their sorcery *"Vajra Dharma Rites,"* employing oil, fire, and blades to summon frenzied spirits, with shamans deceiving households to extort wealth.

Guangsi forbade these practices and, unable to suppress them, commanded the Daoist Dan Jumiao of Luofu Grotto to perform a grand *zhang* ritual, fervently praying to the True Warrior. He distributed sacred tablets bearing the deity’s name and taught the people the proper rites. On the days of the deity’s descent, they chanted scriptures and incantations for months on end, until the heterodox practitioners, ferocious spirits, and demonic toxins all vanished into hiding.

Elsewhere, Chen Gongchen of Huaiyang Commandery, a presented scholar, had kept an unusual young tortoise since childhood, feeding it only jujubes. In the year Gongchen passed the imperial examinations, the tortoise suddenly grew large. One night, its shell bore a coiled red serpent. Recognizing this as an auspicious sign, Gongchen commissioned a hall of portraits depicting the True Warrior and enshrined them for worship, with every prayer answered.

Later, as Gongchen was promoted to Assistant Magistrate of Xinyang, he was unexpectedly appointed by the Fiscal Commissioner Fei Qiang to supervise the construction of city walls and manage the laborers. That winter, an epidemic spread, afflicting the military and people and halting the work. As Gongchen sat in distress, he suddenly heard the tortoise speak before him: *"I have learned of the epidemic among your laborers and come to offer an incantation for dispelling it: 'Celestial Stem, Celestial Branch, swiftly drive away the storm. Bestow upon me this hidden merit, and may the madness depart at once.' Recite this thrice while inhaling *qi*, then exhale into a water basin. Sprinkle the water with willow branches to cleanse the afflicted, and they shall recover. This is my repayment for your care. I now return to my duties in the Northern Culmen."*

As the tortoise finished speaking, Gongchen awoke. He performed the ritual, and its efficacy was immediate. Soon after, a letter arrived from home—his tortoise had vanished at the very hour of his dream.

Upon the completion of the city’s repairs, Gongchen reported the matter to the Transport Commissioner, who submitted a detailed memorial to the throne. The imperial court issued a decree ordering the construction of a dual shrine to the Water and Fire Deities at the Xinchang City site, with the incantation to be engraved in stone for the perpetual salvation of the people.

Emperor Huazong posthumously bestowed titles upon the two deities:
The Divine Tortoise was ennobled as *Divine Tortoise of Harmonious Virtue, Auxiliary Administrator of the Supreme Dao, Manifest in Martial Clarity, Wielding Hidden Might to Uphold the Sagely Left, Righteous Attendant of the Cloud Cavalry, Guardian of the State, Protector of Peace, Assistant in Solemnity to the Primordial Origin, Great Celestial Marshal of the Left of the Supreme Unity*.
The Sacred Serpent was ennobled as *Sacred Serpent of Harmonious Virtue, Benevolent Protector of Profound Grace, Solemn in Majestic Compassion, Universally Aiding the Hidden, Executor of Martial Sagacity, Righteous Attendant of the Right, Cloud Cavalry Defender of the State, Keeper of Tranquility, Guardian of the Primordial Mystery, Great Celestial Marshal of the Right of the Supreme Unity*.

Thus was the imperial will fulfilled. This was earnestly carried out.

*(The repetition of "Thus was the imperial will fulfilled. This was earnestly carried out." reflects the Jade Page’s report to the Dark Warrior General in compliance with the command.)*

The Dark Warrior declined the ennobled office and, departing the Northern Culmen’s palace, proceeded at once to the Right Victory Prefecture to assume his appointed duties.
