*Scroll the Second of The Supreme’s Exalted Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Original Transmission of the Great Sage Perfected Warrior of the Dark Heaven* begins.

Within the marketplace dweller’s abode, Fang Tianzi and Pei Shengxuan of the Ascended Mystery received the Inner Teachings Register, while Chen Zhong compiled the annotations. At that moment, a Perfected One named Wondrous Conduct emerged from the ranks, prostrating himself before the Celestial Throne. He declared: "This servant, by past karmic affinity, has been granted to hear the wondrous principles. The Great General of the Northern Quarter, the Dark Warrior General, patrols and inspects the affairs of heaven and humanity, recording good deeds and punishing evil—yet I know not by what karmic cause this General manifests, nor what divine powers he possesses, nor how he subdues gods and spirits. At every court assembly, the tallying and binding of records never cease for even a moment. Now that the foundational rites are complete, may I humbly inquire into these karmic matters? I pray the Great Creator may grant me the slightest awakening, the smallest wisdom."

Among the Ten Poles, the titles of Perfected Ones all bear the name "Wondrous Conduct," yet none surpass those of the Eastern Pole, who lead the ranks. As *Zhuangzi* states: "Only with Perfected Ones does true knowledge arise." Citing this, the August Sovereign of the Void and Lofty declared: "To unite with the True and Constant, without fixed appearance—what could be more wondrous?"

All present at the assembly strictly observed their ranks, save for Wondrous Conduct of the Eastern Pole, who stepped forth, prostrated himself before the Purple Tenuity Emperor, and recited his past vows. Having heard of the Dark Warrior’s wondrous karmic causes, he now entreated to praise the Great Creator’s design and seek the slightest awakening, the smallest wisdom.

The character for *Dao* is "Great"; the name for transformation is "Creation." To revere the Great and embody transformation—this is sageliness. Such a sage indeed possesses the sixfold divine knowledge, capable of commanding and subduing gods and spirits.

At that time, the Great Emperor, veiling his transcendence in mortal guise, replied: "How wondrous, Perfected One, that you act on behalf of the mortal realm! Yet the Dark Warrior’s karmic manifestation is vast and boundless, subtle and unfathomable." (Here, "veiling his transcendence" means concealing his divinity.) Hearing the plea, the Purple Tenuity Emperor leaned forward over his imperial desk, addressing the assembly with admiration for Wondrous Conduct’s earnest inquiry. The Dark Warrior’s manifested powers and sacred duties are indeed profound—thus does Wondrous Conduct serve the mortal realm, awakening the desires of worldly beings, that they may know of the celestial Dark Warrior, cultivate their mortal forms, and attain the sixfold knowledge to govern the merits and transgressions of the Three Realms.

"Vast and boundless" describes his transformations as limitless, pervading all without exception, beyond all tracing. "Subtle and unfathomable" describes his divine changes as inscrutable, embracing all without limit, beyond all comprehension.

According to the *Register of the Sixfold Knowledge from the Upper Chapters of the Numinous Treasure’s Wisdom*: The divine eye’s knowledge sees with lofty wisdom, its crimson pupil gathering the five hues of light, perceiving all without obstruction—above and below, in the four directions and eight quarters—nothing unseen, nothing unclear. The divine ear’s knowledge hears with distant wisdom, its primordial aperture in the void gathering the five sounds, resonating with all vibrations, hearing the Nine Heavens above and the Nine Earths below—nothing unknown, nothing unexamined. The divine nose’s knowledge breathes with empty wisdom, its ethereal cavity gathering the five qi, naturally penetrating yin and yang, coming and going without gate. The divine mouth’s knowledge tastes with subtle wisdom, its harmonious orifice gathering the five flavors, embracing all without rejection, containing all without limit. The divine heart’s knowledge discerns with luminous wisdom, its tongue governing the five spirits, its radiance traversing the ten thousand directions—swift without haste, arriving without movement. The divine hand’s knowledge grasps with profound wisdom, presiding over humanity, regulating the four seasons, its dark sequence permeating the nine subtleties, seizing the origins of life, corresponding to the Celestial Gate above, discerning fortune and misfortune in the hidden.

Thus, the Dark Emperor, by upholding these great precepts, dwells in the mortal realm yet masters the desires of eye, ear, nose, mouth, heart, and hand, thereby attaining governance and uniting his divine nature with the sixfold knowledge. Then his might extends over gods and spirits, and all external demons and inauspicious forces submit at the mere rumor of the Dark Emperor.

For he is the Mysterious Origin Sage Ancestor, protector and deliverer of heaven and humanity, a manifested body of divine subtlety. The Dark Emperor Sage Ancestor is the primordial qi. He is the revered deity of the Three Treasures.

The Heavenly Treasure Lord presides over the primordial qi at the dawn of scripture, known as the Highest Great Possession Jade Clarity Palace. The Numinous Treasure Lord presides over the original qi at the deliverance of humanity, known as the Upper Clarity Mysterious Capital Jade Capital Seven Treasures Purple Tenuity Palace. The Divine Treasure Lord presides over the mysterious qi at the revelation of scripture, known as the Three Sovereigns’ Grotto Spirit Supreme Clarity Grand Ultimate Palace. All issue forth the Great Possession Golden Script.

The Heavenly Treasure illuminates the light of heaven and earth; the Numinous Treasure awakens the souls of the Nine Dark Realms; the Divine Treasure governs the affairs of the myriad spirits. Thus do we know the grace of the Most High’s protection and deliverance, gradually guiding the faculties of humans and celestials toward perfection.

Those who preserve the spirit assist its transformations through divine knowledge. Those who perceive the luminous teach discernment to effect change.

The *Scripture of the Central Dipper* states: "The Great Dao is formless, ever dwelling in the profound and obscure. The holiest among the holy, the most numinous among the numinous, it encompasses all without exclusion, nurturing all beings." For the Dao, being formless, cannot be described by any image; its transformations are myriad, its emptiness unfathomable. This is the primordial qi—nothing else.

The Primordial Heaven generates Earth. The *Scripture of Purity* states: "The Great Dao is formless, giving birth to heaven and earth." The *Scripture of Responding to the Times* states: "The Great Void is imageless; when its simplicity scatters, it becomes humanity. Heaven arrays the images of sun, moon, and stars; Earth forms the shapes of mountains, rivers, seas, and peaks; humanity receives the essence of the five phases and yin-yang—all inheriting the ancestral qi, yet can this be spoken of as having form?"

*Xunzi* says: "Heaven does not speak, yet people revere its height; Earth does not speak, yet people revere its depth. How great are Heaven and Earth!"

Man, if not sincere, cannot transform the myriad things. Thus, the Primordial Beginning enacts the teaching without words, and by force of naming, it is called the *Dao* for comparison.

That which transforms in myriad ways is number. Ten thousand makes ten thousand; a *zhao* is a hundred thousand, and a *yi* is a thousand thousand. A thousand thousand is called the Great Thousandfold World. The mechanism divides a hundred myriad within the Void, and this principle governs its operation. It encompasses the ten thousand heavens, governs the ten thousand realms, divides the ten thousand, illuminates the ten thousand things, transmits the ten thousand methods, controls the ten thousand spirits, gathers and summons the ten thousand *qi*, communicates the ten thousand transformations, repels the ten thousand demons, and does not cling to the ten thousand existences. Such profundities are unfathomable.

Moreover, the Mysterious Primordial Sage Ancestor manifested eighty-one times as Lord Lao. Within the Great Cavern Heaven, he is honored as the Precious Lord, and his inner title is the Mysterious Primordial Sage Ancestor. From the One he generated the Two, thereby opening the heavens of the Great Luo’s Three Realms, and his appellation became the Primordial Beginning. The Lord of the Cavern Mystery and Numinous Treasure, whose inner title is the Jade Dawn Void Sovereign, venerates the threefold light of the undying night, opening the celestial realm of the Nine Empyreans, and his appellation became the Great Dao Lord. The Lord of the Cavern Spirit and Divine Treasure, whose inner title is the Mysterious Primordial Latter Sage, governs the eighty-one *qi* of the ninefold nine, arranging the eighty-one yang heavens, and his manifest appellation became Lord Lao.

The *Scripture of the Primordial Origin* states: "Lord Lao’s countenance resembled that of a child; his beard and hair were hoary white. His inner title in heaven was Laozi." The *Scripture of the Teachings of the Branches* states: "The Primordial Beginning therefore commanded Laozi to incarnate among humanity, whether among the Yi or the Xia, changing his name with the times, expounding precepts and admonitions, and initiating the deliverance of all conditioned beings."

According to the *Comprehensive Tortoise of the Daoist Canon*: During the High Antiquity of the Upper Three Sovereigns, he was called the Mysterious Master of the Ten Thousand Heavens, revealing the Great Law of the Mysterious Center to the world. During the Middle Three Sovereigns, he was called Master Yougu, revealing the *Scripture of Grand Simplicity* to the world. During the Lower Three Sovereigns, he was called the Perfected of the Golden Portal, revealing the *Secret Scripture of the Golden Portal* to the world, teaching the people the Way of Grand Peace and non-action.

In the age of Fuxi of High Antiquity, he was called Master Yuhua, revealing the *Scripture of Primordial Yang* to the world and teaching the Way of following one’s nature and destiny. In the age of Shennong, he was called Master Dacheng, revealing the *Scripture of the Primordial Essence of the Great One* to the world and teaching the Way of cherishing life. In the age of the Yellow Emperor, he was called Master Guangcheng, revealing the *Scripture of Daoist Admonitions* and teaching the study of soaring flight. In the kingdom of Pure Joy, he was called the Purple Primordial Lord, bestowing upon the Mysterious Emperor the *Jade Void Precepts of Grand Harmony*, teaching the supreme precepts of wisdom and the Way of returning to the root.

In the Middle Antiquity of Shaohao, he was called Master Hongmeng in the world. In the age of Zhuanxu, he was called Master Chijing. In the age of Emperor Shun, he was called Master Lutu. In the age of Emperor Yao, he was called Master Yinshou. In the age of Emperor Shun (again), he was called Master Wucheng. In the age of Yu of Xia, he was called Master Zhencheng. In the age of Tang of Shang, he was called Master Xize. In the age of King Wen of Zhou, he was called Lao Dan, serving as the Archivist beneath the Pillars. He revealed the *Two Scriptures of Virtue and the Dao* to the world. At that time, the Keeper of the Pass, Yin Xi, received his teachings. Now, he has been posthumously appointed as the Grand Preceptor of the Great Luo Jade-Pure Sacred Realm, presiding over the affairs of the Heavenly Pivot Institute.

*Zhuangzi* states: "Guan Yin and Lao Dan were the vast and great true persons of antiquity. Serene and formless, their transformations were constant." The immortal elder Ge Hong said: "Laozi is the spirit of heaven and earth; he appears in every age." Eighty-two times he transformed into the Dark Warrior. The name Dark Warrior was established in the later heavens.

According to the *Veritable Record of Planchette Revelations*, the Dark Warrior was originally the transformation of the Five Numinous Primordial Elder of the primordial *qi*, a manifestation of the Primordial Beginning and an alternate embodiment of the Supreme Ultimate. During the Upper Three Sovereigns, he descended as the Perfected of the Grand Beginning. Kong Yingda’s commentary on the *Laozi* states: "The Dao generates the One—this is the Supreme Ultimate. The Supreme Ultimate generates the Two Modes." During the Middle Three Sovereigns, he descended as the Perfected of the Grand Initial. The sun and moon were within the Grand Simplicity, their radiance emerging in the Grand Initial. During the Lower Three Sovereigns, he descended as the Perfected of the Grand Simplicity.

According to the *White Tiger Discourses*: "Once form and omen were established, it was called the Grand Simplicity." This was when Suiren established the Way of human marriage. During the age of the Yellow Emperor, he was born in the kingdom of Pure Joy as a prince, and his Daoist appellation was Master Qianyun. For his meritorious service in the Dao, the Jade Emperor bestowed honors upon him, first granting him the title of Mysterious Emperor.

The Great Dao, by the prior investiture of the Primordial Beginning Emperor, bestowed upon the Five Numinous Primordial Elder the charge of opening the north and summoning water, thereby establishing the root of the primordial yellow and planting its image. Gradually, the *qi* divided and transformed into form. The first was the office of the Supreme Emperor. Reverently manifesting these transformations: the Grand Beginning Heavenly One, the two bodies of the Grand Initial and Grand Yin, the celestial bodies of Chenxing, Yuebo, the Dipper, Ox, Girl, Void, Danger, Chamber, and Wall—twenty-nine bodies; the six Jia and the Ren and Gui—eighteen bodies; the Grand Simplicity’s northern prison of Hai, Zi, Chou, Qian, and Kan—seven bodies; the wind, thunder, rain, lightning, and thunderclap—fifteen bodies; the Qiang Elder, the Eight Slayers, and the human stars—ten bodies. The body of the Mysterious Emperor was the eighty-second transformation.

Thus, it is known that the Dark Warrior is the transformed body of Lord Lao and the numinous verification of the Military Star. Lord Lao’s alternate title is the Supreme Emperor of the Primordial Origin, the Supreme Ultimate as spoken of in the *Book of Changes*. The *Scripture of the Supreme Ultimate’s Division and Transformation of the Grand Beginning* states: "The Dark Warrior is the transformed body of Lord Lao. The Great Emperor and humanity regard him as comparable to the Military Star’s manifestation of numinosity, for the meritorious virtues of the two sages are quite similar."

According to the *Scripture of the Original Birth of the Northern Dipper*: "In the first kalpa of the Dragon Han era, there was the Lady of Purple Light, consort of the King of the Upper Yu Kingdom. One spring day, while she was strolling and playing by the Warm Jade Pool, she removed her garments to bathe. Suddenly, she was moved by the lotus bud, which opened into nine petals, and within it were born nine sons. The lady protected and nurtured them in the palace, her aspiration being only to raise them as sages to assist and support heaven and earth."

The nine sons, upon reaching maturity and donning their caps, each cultivated their conduct to perfection according to their stations. Their merits and practices fulfilled, they ascended to heaven in broad daylight and were all conferred noble offices in the Three Clarities.

The Heavenly August Emperor was the eldest son, assisting in the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace to regulate and transform the multitude of stars, presiding over the Purple Tenuity.

The second son of the Great Emperor aided in the Bright Hall of the North Culmen Central Palace, administering governance over the earth below.

Greedy Wolf, aligned with Heaven, served as the primal lord of the myriad things, extending life.
Gate of Ghosts, aligned with Earth, served as the primal lord of living beings, prolonging destiny.
Store of Wealth, aligned with the Sun, served as the fire-primal lord of emolument, preserving life.
Literary Brilliance, aligned with the Moon, served as the water-primal lord of emolument, augmenting destiny.
Integrity and Chastity, aligned with Earth, served as the river-primal lord of official rank, dispelling calamities.
Military Brilliance, aligned with Water, served as the river-primal lord of longevity, dispersing misfortunes.
Breaking Army, aligned with Metal, served as the sea-primal lord of wives and children, supporting decline.

According to the sixth fascicle of the *Scripture of the Northern Dipper* in the *Commentary on the Cavern of Perfection*: "The jade name of the Military Brilliance auxiliary star is 'Chang of the Upper Primordial Realm'?" When cultivating, one upholds the Great Law of the North Culmen Heavenly Heart, saving beings and benefiting life. His Daoist appellation is "Great Chariot Master," and his virtue is titled "Perfected Lord of Stability." Before long, his merits complete and his practices fulfilled, he received the celestial edict to ascend, whereupon he was appointed Grand Master of Ceremonies in the Purple Tenuity Enclosure, wielding the jade register within the Dipper, holding the office of "Luminous Perfected August Emperor of the Heavenly Gate of Yang" in the Chamber of the Dipper’s House. Aligned with the governance of water, he oversees the river-primal, managing the promotion of immortals and transcendents.

Above, he governs the perfected of the Nine Heavens; in the middle, he commands the flying immortals of the Five Marchmounts; below, he records the progress of those who study the Dao, their accumulated merits and diligence, and all who qualify for promotion. He oversees their advancement, inscribing their names in the jade calendar, and administers the seasonal generation of earthly wealth, the disbursement of celestial granaries, and the treasuries’ receipts and expenditures.

Moreover, though the Dark Warrior was once an ordinary mortal—his cultivation spanning different kalpas since the beginning of the Kaihuang era—he fulfilled his heavenly duties. In all matters, he acted as one body, ever holding the welfare of the black-haired people at heart. Those who relinquished their numinous receptacles and received his grace were many. Thus, the two perfected ones, Purple Tenuity and Radiant Praise, manifested their numinosity in mutual verification.

The two asterisms, Void and Rooftop, commingle the dual essences of water and fire. In the north above the celestial center, they transform into the palace of primordial qi. Void and Rooftop occupy the twenty-sixth celestial division, spanning twenty-five and a half degrees, serving as the lodging for the sun and moon’s celestial courses, complementing the governance of the Solar Emperor and Lunar Sovereign. Here, water and fire reside.

In the year *guisi* of the Flame Emperor’s reign, on the first day of the first month, the day *wuwu* at dawn, the hour *jiayin*, the sun and moon conjoined in union. The two qi merged within the Void and Rooftop asterisms, their divine radiance streaming forth to descend upon the domain of Kui and Lou in the realm of Pure Joy. The Virtuous Victorious Empress, deep in slumber within her palace, her spirit wandering beyond her body, beheld an image of the sun’s round light entering her mouth. She swallowed it and awoke pregnant. By the year’s end, the Flame Emperor’s kingdom fell to Ban Spring, and the Yellow Emperor received the mandate, establishing his capital at Youxiong. In the year *jiawu*, he erected the Horse Standard.

The Lord of Pure Joy gave birth to a sagely son, born of the refined essence of Void and Rooftop, the crystalline flow of water and fire forming his body. In his prime, he received instruction and was transformed by the Dao of the Primordial One.

The *Essential Principles of the Dharma* states: "The Jade Void of Supreme Harmony, the Upper Capital of Purple Tenuity, the Five Constants revolve in curves, the Six Pitches guide the scriptures. Clarity becomes qi, mysterious refinement responds and spreads. The Emperor possesses wondrous methods, the Lord descends the Supreme Diagram. Its symbols pervade the Brahmā realms, its divine residence permeates all transformations. The gates of vast expedient means harbor no distinctions among the myriad wonders. No truth is not manifest, no Dao is not complete. In accord with transformation, in opposition to perverse paths, Heaven forms ten unions, Earth connects myriad ruins. Entering purity and emerging from chaos, responding to change in totality—this realm is the ultimate, its supreme name is the Great Mysterious Capital."

The *Veritable Record* states: The Purple Primordial Lord again transmitted the essentials of the Dao, enjoining him: "In the fourth kalpa of the Dragon Han era, you shall go barefoot and with unbound hair, gathering the true essence of Kan and Li, returning to the root and restoring your position between Void and Rooftop."

At times clad in armor and robed, at others booted yet barefoot, he ever wore his hair in dark blue locks, ever wielded his divine blade. Perfected Lord Dong said: "When the Dark Emperor received the mandate to descend to the lower realms to subdue demons, the Primordial Beginning issued a divine decree, prescribing such attire." As *Zhuangzi* says: "Heaven bestowed upon him form, the Dao bestowed upon him countenance."

His voice shook the Nine Heavens. Having been appointed the Wandering Envoy of the Nine Heavens and concurrently the Investigating Envoy of the Nine Heavens, he oversaw the scrutiny of merits and transgressions, the public affairs of immortals and transcendents. Thus, in the Brahmā Heaven above the Nine Empyreans, how could the Dark Emperor’s awe-inspiring renown not resound?

His might extended to the four quarters. He wielded the authority of the Great Overseer of the Three Realms, monthly inspecting the public affairs of ghosts and spirits across the Four Great Continents. From the east, where the Buddha of Origin was propagated in the Tai region, to the west, where the flowing sands of Jambudvīpa lie; from the south, where Jiaozhi of the Southern Continent resides, to the north, where the gloomy mounds of Uttarakuru stand—all city gods, garrison deities, armaments, soldiers, and horses were subject to his command. How could the gods of the four quarters fail in their duties before the Dark Emperor’s famed authority?

Those who rallied to him bore the black standard wreathed in dark mist; those who followed him were borne by a colossal tortoise and a giant serpent. When the Jade Clarity announced the bestowal of the black standard, it was on the first day of the first month of the first year of the Shousui reign. The raising of the banner, like the rising of dark mist, signified the majesty of his authority. Thereupon, ten billion valiant warriors beheld his banners and standards, all converging in faith, hastening to fulfill the commands of the Great Mysterious One.

Moreover, the Water Essence Forest Tortoise of the Earth’s Axis and the Fire Essence Holy Serpent of the Heavenly Gate bore and surrounded the Dark Emperor’s feet, executing punitive expeditions. The most formidable of all unruly and inauspicious qi between heaven and earth were the Heavenly Gate and Earthly Axis standards.

Divine soldiers and generals, numbering five hundred thousand, followed him; jade lads and jade maidens, arrayed in twenty-four ranks, attended him. "Ranks" here denote ordered rows. This office was the proximate bureau of the Right Victorious Mansion, subordinate to the Northern Numinous Officials. Thus, the left and right divisions managed his majestic regalia and recorded the good and evil deeds, merits and transgressions within the Three Realms.

According to the *Xianzhuan Shiyi* (*Supplement to the Biographies of Immortals*), it is recorded: Han Chancellor Zhang Liang, having withdrawn from the world to ascend to transcendence, held the title of "Great Mystery Lad." As the *Qisheng Ji* (*Records of the Awakening of the Sacred*) states: In Yiyang County of Xinzhou, there stands an imperially bestowed shrine to the "Reclusive Illuminating Filial Maiden," who was originally the Green Radiance Jade Maiden, registrar of the Right Victorious Mansion. Once, Lu Zhongdao and his wife, née Zhang, had long reverently tended the incense of Zhenwu. Though they sought an heir, in their later years, the wife dreamed one night of swallowing a red tassel and conceived, giving birth to a mute girl of unparalleled beauty. At thirteen, she suddenly spoke with crystalline clarity, bidding farewell to her parents: "I am originally the Green Radiance Jade Maiden of the Celestial Twin Maidens Palace. Yesterday, my elder brother, on account of our parents’ plea for an heir to Zhenwu of the North, reviewed the records of their karmic blessings and found no entry for male or female offspring. Yet Zhenwu, moved by their impartial sincerity in this world, memorialized the Three Heavens and received an imperial rescript to dispatch me, transforming into a red tassel to enter the womb. I was to inhabit a female form for a twelve-year term, after which I would return to the celestial assembly. When I departed the heavenly court, Zhenwu graciously instructed: ‘You must not speak while among mortals.’ Now, I have heard from the Song Dynasty’s Bureau of Astronomy that the stellar division of Chen corresponds to Yiyang County, where a hidden immortal of extraordinary destiny is destined to replace me. To avoid revealing celestial secrets, I must depart. Moreover, my allotted lifespan has expired, and I am to return to serve as vice-director of the Right Victorious Mansion’s Auxiliary Bureau, fulfilling duties for seven years before returning to the Twin Maidens Palace." With these words, she passed away. The matter reached the imperial ear, and she was posthumously enfeoffed with her present title. This serves as proof of the fixed allotment of jade lads and jade maidens to this bureau.

They bear the Numinous Talismans of the Northern Emperor. As the *Han Guan Yi* (*Han Dynasty Official Ceremonials*) states: "The *shou* (sash) signifies what one receives, distinguishing rank and manifesting virtue." When the Dark Emperor ascended, he was bestowed by the Golden Tower with the Northern Emperor’s talismanic plaque. Its head was perforated and threaded with a gold-embroidered, cloud-patterned purple-and-white ribbon, called the *shou*. The talismanic script on the plaque was in golden seal script: "The Great Mystery Marshal’s Dragon Script Talisman for Subduing and Transforming."

They wear the Treasured Seal of Qian Yuan. "To wear" means to bear jade pendants upon the body. The *Baihu Tong* (*Comprehensive Discussions in the White Tiger Hall*) records: "Thus, those who cultivate the Dao without end wear jade rings." When the Dark Emperor ascended, the Golden Tower bestowed upon him a jade seal with an interlaced knob, used to seal documents as a token of verification. The seal was named the "Qian Yuan Treasured Seal." The form of the talisman and seal wields authority, modeled after mortal script. One may imagine the celestial script, resplendent and luminous, coalescing into seal characters. Moreover, when the Dark Emperor was enfeoffed and promoted, his duties were augmented by six additional offices, and he was entrusted with six more talismanic seals. Their patterns, dimensions, and seal scripts remain unknown to the mortal world.

To command them are the Duke of Thunder and the Mother of Lightning; to drive them are the Earl of Wind and the Master of Rain. The affairs of the Right Victorious Mansion are overseen by the Heavenly Marshal Tianpeng, who adjudicates the Five Thunder Court, holding the office of "Celestial Great Duke of Thunder." Under his command are the envoys of wind, clouds, lightning, and rain, along with countless legions of flying dragon riders, aquatic marshals, river deities, and their thirty myriad troops, who ceaselessly forge and refine all things beneath the Celestial Realm.

When the Right Victorious Mansion executes punitive expeditions against demonic and unruly forces, these officers act as deputies, jointly upholding the great trust. They obey the commands of the battle standards, swiftly mobilizing their awe-inspiring might to assist in the chastisement of iniquity. According to the *Shangqing Fayin Shu* (*Esoteric Writings of the Highest Clarity*), the names, ranks, and titles of the male and female officials among the great sages are respectfully recorded as follows:

**Five Thunder Court, First Hall:**
Male Official: Wu Tian’an, "Thunder Court Marshal, Great General of Thunderclaps, Penetrating Heaven and Earth, Transforming and Manifesting, Searching and Seizing."

**Second Hall:**
Five Male Officials: "Nine Heavens’ Roaming and Hunting, Punishing the Wicked."

**Third Hall:**
Male Official: Wang Ming, "Thunder Court Commander, Star-Fire Blazing, Urging and Admonishing, Monitoring the Deeds of the Heart, Binding and Seizing Souls."

**Fourth Hall:**
Female Official: Wang Tian’an, "Thunder Court General, Slaying Malevolence and Capturing Dragons."

**Fifth Hall:**
Female Official: Wu Tianming, "Thunder Court General, Destroying Temples and Slaying Corpses."
Female Official: Tian Shouming, "Right Chief Administrator of the Northern Pole’s Exorcising Maidens, Thunder Court’s Four Seasons’ Lightning Affairs, Great Immortal Mother of Seeking Wickedness."

**Vice-Director of the Court:**
Male Official: Tian Shouzhen, "Thunder Court’s Urging Lightning, Erupting Thunder, Swift Thunderclaps, Fire Penetrating Heaven and Earth, Searching and Seizing the Wicked."

**Earl of Wind:**
Jin San, "Great Lord of Wind, Northern Pole’s Right Victorious Court’s Deputy Wind Master, Disciplinarian of the Eight Trigrams’ Wind Dispensation, Investigating Unlawful and Strange Wind Variations."

**Chief Recorder of the Five Thunder Court:**
Xin Hanchen, "Judicial Officer of the Five Thunder Court’s Registers, Annual Wind, Rain, Lightning, and Thunder Responses to Unruly and Demonic Matters."

**Master of Rain:**
Zhang Ya, "Divine Dragon of the Nine Heavens’ Transformation, Registrar and Sovereign of the Lower Prime’s Water Palace, Inspector of All Caverns’ Rain Dispensation, August Spirit-Responding Emperor."

He commands the Dragon Lords of the Five Lakes, Four Seas, Nine Rivers, Eight Streams, Seven Marshes, Twelve Valleys, and the external rain-dispensing cavern dragons—one hundred seventy in total, as recorded in the *Peacock Sutra*.

Now, the Five Thunders and Six Jia, the Eight Malevolent Stars—all are spiritual emanations of the Five Numinous Elder’s primordial qi, manifesting only when their present titles are invoked in offerings. As the *Huainanzi* states: "When thunder and lightning do not arise, wind and rain do not stir." Thus, the Five Thunders issue commands, lightning and fire punish the wicked, wind disseminates the Eight Trigrams, and rain nurtures with teachings, descending in perfect harmony to engender and complete the myriad things. Otherwise, thunder roars and thunderclaps crash, lightning and fire scorch and burn, winds rage and howl, rains pour with hail and sleet—these are not the signs of harmonious elegance but the celestial execution of punitive justice.

As the *Book of Songs* states: "Revere Heaven’s wrath, dare not jest or idle." Before and behind stand the Eight Malevolent Generals; to left and right attend the Six Jia Divine Marshals. These are the **Right Victorious Prefecture of the Mysterious Capital’s** **Northern Eight Malevolent Great Generals of Upholding Might**, whose eight encampments are stationed before the **Canopy Mountain of Fengdu Prison**. Now, with reverence, their names and ranks are revealed:

**Heavenly Malevolent General** Zhang Zishu,
**Earthly Malevolent General** Chen Ziqing,
**Solar Malevolent General** Li Zide,
**Lunar Malevolent General** Fan Zizhang,
**Aqueous Malevolent General** Du Zizhen,
**Igneous Malevolent General** Liu Zida,
**Metallic Malevolent General** Wang Ziyan,
**Stony Malevolent General** Jia Ziyuan.

The **Southern Six Jia Divine Marshals of Assisting Might**, whose six battalions array themselves beside the **Canopy Star of the Supreme Subtlety**, are likewise revealed with due reverence:

**Jiazi Water Marshal** Li Wensi,
**Jiaxu Earth Marshal** Li Shoutong,
**Jiashen Metal Marshal** Li Shouquan,
**Jiawu Fire Marshal** Li Shouzuo,
**Jiachen Wind Marshal** Li Shoujin,
**Jiayin Wood Marshal** Li Shouqian.

According to the *Scripture of Numinous Treasure*, when the **Primordial Beginning** expounded the teachings to deliver humanity within the **Verdant Heaven of the First Dawn**, a baleful upheaval arose in the northeast of the lower realms. Thereupon, the **Divine Duke** received the mandate to sweep away all inauspicious omens. At that time, the **Six Jia** clasped the **Golden Pass**, the **Seven Governors** guarded the **Numinous Altar**, the **Eight Might** sped like lightning, and the **Nine Phoenixes** shattered malevolent forces—all in accord with the **Mysterious Thearch’s** punitive decrees. Before and behind, firm and yielding; left and right, majestic and restraining. Thus was the **Golden Axe** wielded to execute the great celestial criminals, while lesser transgressors were met with retribution. To this day, such commands remain unchanged.

As the *Kaihuang Chapters* declares: "When the myriad demons submit in awe, the ten thousand lands are transformed to preserve peace and tranquility—such is the meaning."

The **Celestial Stem of the Great Unity** leads at the vanguard of the host. "Leads" denotes submission; "at" signifies fortunate attendance. The **Celestial Stem of the Great Unity**, too, is one of the **Five Virtue Divine Lords**, submitting in attendance to serve as an attendant official of the **Supreme Mystery**, ever prepared to enforce might as required. According to the original scripture: those who **escort** bear the **black banner** and **mysterious mist**; those who **follow** ride the **azure tortoise** and **mighty serpent**.

Now, the **Right Celestial Stem** presides over the **black banner**, styled **Inspector of Troops**, and serves as the **White Tiger’s Seven Malevolent Right General**, while the **Lesser Unity** beneath him, styled **Holder of Luminance**, is the **Black Warrior’s Five Malevolent Rear General**. It is said that the **Mysterious Heavenly Thearch’s** might pervades all divine and true beings. He is invested with the rank of **Northern Culmen’s Left Celestial Stem**, the **black banner** planted at the heart of the **Northern Asterism**, honoring its role in engendering and completing the myriad things. He is further invested with the office of **Heaven-Securing Black Warrior, Great Commander of the Three Realms**, and whenever he reverently executes Heaven’s punitive justice, his divine might does not kill wantonly. The **Lesser Unity** beneath the **Right Celestial Stem** is charged with overseeing matters of execution.

As the *Jade Register* states: "When the **dual essences of water and fire** are held in the palm, the **Three and Five** unite in shared merit." The **Three** is the **sacred serpent**, the **Five** the **divine tortoise**. Commanding the **Jia and Geng Marshals** within the **disciplinary framework**, the **Seven and Nine** are brought into harmonious regulation. The **Seven** tame the **azure dragons**, the **Nine** ride the **mysterious steeds**—thus it is known that in driving, restraining, and severing transformations, these marshals are most capable of securing control. **Earth Deities and City Gods** all fall under their command. "All" signifies universal compliance; "fall under" denotes institutional governance. **Earth Deities and City Gods**, present in every **state, prefecture, commandery, county, garrison, town, village, hamlet, and ward**, each hold such office, overseeing the **yin-shadow soldiers and clerks** to surveil affairs within their jurisdiction, all complying with the **Supreme Mystery’s** commands and institutional decrees.

In former times, when **Chaocheng** committed evil, the **Mysterious Thearch** swept it away, yet no **City God or Earth Deity** there had obeyed his commands. A Daoist adept was thus transformed to bear witness, and **Jiao Po** served as the local **Earth Deity**, heeding the Thearch’s directives. The *Records of Manifesting Sageliness* recount: "In ancient times, the four classes of **Chaozhou** grew violent, their wickedness accumulating over kalpas. They wantonly slaughtered living beings to glut their mouths and fatten their flesh, until even the clergy and Daoists emulated the vulgar ways, daily leaving blood and corpses strewn about, their foul vapors ascending to offend the sun, moon, and stars, extinguishing their light and luster. The **Nine Heavens’ Investigative Envoys** reported this to the **Celestial Court**, where the **Jade Emperor of August Heaven**, gazing forth from the **Three Heavenly Gates**, beheld the evil of **Chaozhou** in the **Wu region**. He commanded the **Celestial Minister, Purple Tenuity Thearch**, along with the **Officials of Earth and Water**, to dispatch the **Northern Culmen’s** **Prefectural Vice-Marshal of the Right Victorious Prefecture** to purge the land. The city sank beneath the waves, becoming a lake, forever cleansed.

**Zhenwu**, hastening to court to receive the decree, sighed and petitioned: 'Though this land spans a thousand *li*, not all its people are fated for calamity. I fear this may compound grievous wrongs. Permit your servant to descend and examine the local deities.' The **Great Thearch** replied: 'The **City God and Earth Deity** of this prefecture have already received the **Jade Emperor’s** edict and been transferred elsewhere.' Zhenwu then obeyed the decree and dispatched his subordinate, the **Right Celestial Stem**, to conduct a preliminary investigation. Descending, the latter transformed into a great turtle, dead and afloat upon the Han River. The officials, gentry, and common folk rushed to carve and devour its flesh, none abstaining. Zhenwu, witnessing this depravity, transformed into a wandering Daoist, traversing every door to seek water and verify the truth. Only at **Jiao Po’s** home did he find the virtue of non-killing, where pure water was offered.

Zhenwu said to Jiao Po: 'This city shall soon be swept away into a lake. Hasten to **Sacred Maiden Mountain** and dwell there as the **Earth Deity of the Lake and Mountain**.' With these words, he vanished. Jiao Po gathered her family and children-in-law and ascended the mountain. Upon arrival, she turned to look back and beheld a **black wind**, **torrential rain**, **thunderclaps**, and **raging waves**—in an instant, the city’s foundations vanished, submerged beneath the waters. Clasping her hands to her forehead, she suddenly saw a deity descending from the void, his appearance that of the Daoist who had sought water. He declared: 'These waters are now your domain.' The Daoist then ascended, and officials from neighboring prefectures arrived by boat to inquire of Jiao Po the cause. Each reported to their superiors, and Jiao Po’s family, one after another, passed away in due course."

The Western Jin dynasty enfeoffed her as the **Effulgent Divine Mother**, renaming the Lake Mountain after the Jiao clan—was this not by virtue of the **True Warrior’s** decree and command to preserve this office? All demons were eradicated, and no good was left unsupported. For **essence** is the transformation wrought by demonic beings; when they transgressed, none escaped extermination. Good people, through expedient means, benefited the world, and the unseen true administrators lent their aid.

The *Records of the Divine Manifestation* were compiled. For instance, when **Duke Wei**, **Han Qi**, governed **Daming Prefecture**, in the autumn of the second year of the **Qi-Ning** era (the *jiyou* year), an urgent report arrived from the Yellow River’s drought officials: "A monstrous **turtle spirit** has long emerged here, harming living beings. Now it has surfaced again upon the waters, stirring furious waves, collapsing embankments, and unleashing violent floods—none know how many lives have been swept away." Upon hearing this, the Duke swiftly dispatched his aide **Zheng Gui** and Vice-Administrator **Hua Dun** to manage the crisis. Arriving at the dike, the two donned their court robes, burned incense, and reverently invoked the **North Pole True Warrior**, saying: "We beseech your divine aid to assist Zheng Gui in slaying the demon." They then drew their bows and arrows, striking the turtle, which sank beneath the waters. The river’s flow returned to order, and the embankments were restored.

One night, Gui seemed to dream as two officials seized him, declaring: "We have been sent by the **Yama Palace** to summon you to testify regarding the killing of the turtle." They led him to a mountain prefecture, where the two officials murmured to each other: "The True Warrior descends here today." Gui, overhearing, said: "The **Wind-Swept Nether Mountain Prefecture** governs the reckoning of good and evil among the people of the upper and lower realms." As he followed them inside, he hastened to plead his case. A decree was issued, and the records of the aquatic beings were examined. Presently, the ledger revealed that the turtle’s former incarnation had been a man, born in **Da Yuan** in the Western Capital, named **Cheng Xuan**, the son of the chivalrous **Qi Ming**. He had governed **Yunmeng City** lawlessly, and on the day **Emperor Gaozong of Tang** dispatched the general **Chen Yuanzhong** to suppress the west, the city fell. Cheng perished in flames, and his soul was assigned as the **City God** of this region, where he wantonly demanded sacrifices and wrongfully took lives. The **Fengdu** authorities, learning of this, punished him by demoting him to the post of **Tide-Driving Sand-Shifting Earth Deity** within the **Four Scorching Regions** of the Yellow River in **Zhuozhou**. Then, in the third year of the **Xianheng** era (the *gengwu* year), his soul entered a turtle’s womb. Upon maturing, it migrated to the **Seven Pools** of the Yellow River within the borders of the **Great Song’s Northern Capital**, where it stirred floods for four hundred years, wrongfully claiming tens of thousands of lives.

The **Holy Judgment of the True Warrior** declared: "Though this turtle deserved to be dismembered in death, it still dares to lodge false accusations and demand redress from the officials of the mortal realm. Moreover, Zheng Gui acted under Duke Wei’s decree, and Han Qi shall soon ascend to the rank of **Perfected One of the Purple Palace**—I shall personally memorialize on his behalf." Gui bowed in gratitude and inquired further. The Sage dispatched a **talisman-bearing envoy** to escort the **divine turtle** and the attending official Zheng Gui to the **Yama Court** to present the case. The demonic turtle, still pleading for a reprieve, claimed its body had taken five hundred years to form. The King commanded the talisman envoy to manifest the divine turtle, which was enveloped in golden light and crushed into fine dust, scattered across the earthly administrations. Zheng Gui was permitted to return to life, and from that time forth, such calamities vanished from the mortal realm.

They ascended to the **Golden Portal** and proceeded to **Kunlun**, opening the **Gate of Heaven** and sealing the **Gate of Earth**, traversing the obscure and unfathomable to scrutinize the limits of fortune and misfortune. The **Golden Portal** is the general title for the imperial courts of the **Three Heavens of Great Purity**, where the **Celestial Thearchs** reside—namely, the **Jade Clarity Golden Portal**, the **Upper Clarity Golden Portal**, and the **Great Clarity Golden Portal**. **Kunlun** refers to the **Supreme Foundation**, the sacred mountain **Yu Jing** of the **Mystic Capital**, where the palaces of the **Three Heavens**—**Qingwei**, **Yuyu**, and **Dachi**—are established. In ancient times, the **Dark Thearch** was summoned to attend the **Primordial Beginning**; upon receiving his mandate, he acted with such merit among humans and spirits that he was appointed to govern separate domains, opening the yang and closing the yin—hence the phrase "opening the Gate of Heaven and sealing the Gate of Earth." At fixed intervals, he emerges from obscurity and enters tranquility, weaving through the myriad directions, traversing the **Three Realms** to scrutinize transformations and adaptations, bestowing deliverance as circumstances allow, encompassing all matters of action and inaction.

According to the *Veritable Records of the Descended Brush*, whenever the assembled perfected ones pay court to the **Jade Thearch of the Vast Heaven**, the **Four Saints** lead the procession, announcing their arrival. They reside in the **ren-gui** direction—*reside* meaning to dwell in stillness. When the **Great Ultimate** first divided into the **Two Modes**, the **Heavenly One** generated water, and the **Earthly Two** conceived fire, establishing the **ren-gui** direction. Positioned to the north of the **Purple Tenuity**, this aligns with the *Yi Jing*’s principle of **najiang**. **Ren** and **gui** are the purest essences of **qian** and **kun**: the active yang of **qian** generates **jia** and **ren**, while the passive yin of **kun** generates **yi** and **gui**, forming the harmonious qi of heaven and earth’s yin and yang. The stillness within **qian** transforms **ren** into the **li** sun, while the movement within **kun** transforms **gui** into the **kan** moon. Alternating between advance and retreat, waxing and waning, they embrace the **wu-ji** while carrying yin and holding yang, governing the transformation of the myriad things—truly the crucible of water and fire that forges souls and spirits.

According to the *Veritable Records of the Descended Brush*, the palace where the **Dark Thearch** resides is named the **Palace of Heavenly Unity and True Celebration**, situated in the northern reaches of the **Purple Tenuity**, between the **Supreme Elegance** and **Vast Emptiness** of the **Two Supreme Heavens**. Its towering halls are formed naturally from wondrous qi, adorned with jade-like trees, where divine winds chime in harmony with the **gong** and **shang** tones. Crimson light and purple mist perpetually shroud its heights—this is the **Realm of Jade Clarity, the Formless Realm**. Assisting him are the **Generals of Jia and Geng**, who may ride a **dark steed** or mount a **blue-green dragon**.

Those who assist do so to establish order and fulfill duties in accordance with the celestial arrangement. The **Generals of Jia and Geng** serve as the aides to the marshal, comprising four principal and deputy officers: **Jia, Xu, Geng, and Chen**. **Jia** embodies benevolence and love, while **Geng** upholds righteousness and propriety, enforcing decrees and commands. **Xu** embodies sincerity and trust, and **Chen** governs the breath and vital forces, following the **Big Dipper’s handle** and **celestial pivot**, akin to the roles of **Zaofu** and **Wang Liang**, or the **Left and Right Regulators**, overseeing the governance of the **Dark Thearch’s** **Stable of Dark Steeds** and **Dragon Enclosure**.

The principal and deputy generals **Jia and Xu** are charged with tending the **dark steeds**, guiding the reins and wielding the whip. According to the *Yi’s* **Na Jia** system, **Jia** corresponds to **Qian**, while **Xu** aligns with **Qian’s** companion star. Together, their positions lie between **Shi** and **Bi**, mirroring the celestial governance of **Zaofu** and **Wang Liang**. The principal and deputy generals **Geng and Chen** oversee the rearing and training of the **blue-green dragons**, assisting the officers in charge of swift flight and celestial navigation. In the *Yi’s* **Na Jia** system, **Geng** corresponds to **Zhen**, while **Chen** aligns with **Zhen’s** companion star. Their positions lie beneath **Jiao** and **Kang**, reflecting the celestial roles of the **Left and Right Regulators**.

To **ride** is to **drive**. The **dark steed** is of a deep black hue, standing eight *chi* in height. Known as the **Primordial Steed**, it originates from the **Celestial Chariot** in **Kui**, its essence derived from the *Yi’s* **Qian’s** vigor. **Qian** symbolizes the horse, harmonizing the **yin** register with **yang**, enabling its boundless and vigorous movement. To **mount** is to **straddle**. **Blue-green** signifies a verdant hue, while the **dragon** is a single-horned serpent. It is said to bear the **Dragon Horn**, a distinct region of the **Thearch’s Seat**. The *Yi’s* *Shuo Gua* states: **Zhen** embodies movement. **Zhen** represents the dragon, at times concealed, at others ascending within **yin**, ever attended by wind and rain. Its eyes flash like lightning, its brows stretch like cloud formations, its body spans a thousand *zhang*, and upon its head rest the **One or Two Celestial Terraces**.

According to the *Veritable Records of the Descended Brush*, when the **Dark Thearch** was yet mortal, he stood nine *chi* tall, his face round as the full moon, his brows arched like dragons, his eyes bright as a phoenix’s, his hair and beard flowing and resplendent, his complexion clear as ice. Upon his head rested a **Nine Qi Jade Crown**, and his body was clad in **Pine and Creeping Fig Robes**. After his ascension, whenever he descended to subdue demons and restrain spirits, his divine form expanded to a thousand *zhang*, his brows like clouds, his eyes like lightning. The **Three Terraces and Six Stars** served as his crown. The **Upper Terrace** governs **life and destiny**, its upper star corresponding to the **Son of Heaven**, its lower to the **Queen Consort**. The **Middle Terrace** governs the **imperial lineage**, its upper star corresponding to **dukes, princes, and kings**, its lower to **ministers and grandees**. The **Lower Terrace** governs **official emoluments and military affairs**, its upper star corresponding to **scholars and gentlemen**, its lower to the **common folk**. The **Three Terraces and Six Stars** of the **Supreme Subtlety** stand in pairs, their radiance cascading upon the **Dark Thearch’s** crown, a model later emulated by mortals in crafting their own headwear.

The *Astronomical Records* of the Jin states: The **Three Terraces** form the **Celestial Stairway**, where the **Great One** harmonizes **yin and yang**, governs the **cosmic principles**, and manifests the **verification of virtue and the proclamation of omens**. According to the **Talismanic Incantations of the Legalists**:
- The **Upper Terrace**, one and yellow, dispels misfortune like the pine.
- The **Middle Terrace**, two and white, protects the body and secures the household.
- The **Lower Terrace**, three and blue-green, cures illness and averts pestilence.

Thus, the **Three Terraces** descend in celestial manifestation, their divine radiance resplendent, illuminating virtue and obstructing transgression. In their **movement**, they mirror **Mountains and Waters Concealed**; in their **stillness**, they reflect **Heaven and Earth in Harmony**. Through these transformations, their **spiritual efficacy** is revealed.

According to the *True Treasury of Jade Essence of the Great Mystery Capital*, the **Ancestral Qi** transforms through the **Changes**, initiating the response to destiny. The **Primordial Chaos** conceals and reveals, its transformations intermingling. The **profound principles of movement, concealment, activity, and tranquility** form the method of **transmuting golden liquid into spirit**, refining it into hardness for daily application. The **Old Man of Mount Taihua** once said: Those who cultivate the **external** embrace the **boundless and infinite**; those who cultivate the **internal** attain the **formless and shadowless**. External cultivation refines the **Great Void**, while internal cultivation circulates **qi**. Thus, when the **external spirit** is at peace and the **internal qi** harmonizes, it is called the **reversal of spirit and the return to the primordial**.

**Movement and Concealment**—**Gen Mountain** as the **breath of the nose**, inhaling and exhaling the **qi of Kan**, circulating the blood with fluidity, nurturing **virtue** to achieve **sagely accomplishment**. The **Lord of Supreme Elegance and Joyous Heaven** said: Take **non-action** as the foundation for **above and below, left and right, front and back**, harmonizing **qi and spirit**, thereby perpetually attaining the **wondrousness of the natural**. This is called **entrusting the body to the practice of the Dao, transmitting the true mandate**.

**Stillness and Harmony**—**Kun Earth Mother** as the **Yellow One**, **Qian Heaven Father** as the **Ancestral Origin**, where **being and non-being** alternate, and **yang** emerges from within **yin**. The **Imperial Lord of Western Florescence** said: If one can rest and guide the breath with the spirit, knowing its source, one may perceive the **original spirit**, avoiding attachment to illusions or being seized by dreams. This is the **circulation of Kun’s spirit to transform into Qian’s image**.

According to the *Golden and Azure Hidden Communication of the Dragon and Tiger Superior Canon*: The sixty-four hexagrams all emerge from **Qian and Kun**, yet one must first pass through **Pi and Tai** before discussing **Zhun and Meng**. As **Zhang Pingshu’s** *Continuation of the Dao of the Yi* states: The **Dao of the Yi** wondrously encompasses the **substance and function of creation and transformation**, ultimately relying on **symbolic representation**. Upon careful examination of this text, the **One** is found within.

**Qian above and Kun below** form **Heaven and Earth in Stagnation**, with **Qian and Kun** as the **cauldron and vessel**. **Kun above and Qian below** form **Earth and Heaven in Harmony**, their interaction like the **sun and moon**. **Water and Thunder Zhun** guards the **One** and preserves the **Three**, halting the **moon’s hare and fire’s fowl**. **Mountain and Water Meng** achieves **sagely accomplishment and spiritual transformation**, circulating the **primordial chaos to nurture the original essence**. For humanity, all harmony derives from the **primordial qi of the One**. If one skillfully tends the **primordial cauldron** and adeptly circulates the **One Qi**, it is sufficient to transcend the **Five Phases** and attain the **true Dao**.

The *Returning to Life Chapter* states:
*East, south, west, north—master them well,*
*Intermingle Qian and Kun, the female and male.*
*Fire’s timing must be steadfast and precise,*
*Blowing and breathing rely on Xun’s wind.*

The *Scripture of Yin Convergence* states: *Heaven unleashes its killing mechanism, dragons and serpents rise from the land*—referring to the **Earth Gate** in the **Xun** position of the southeast, before the **last quarter moon**. **Kun** lodges its body in the **Earth Gate**, the **Earth Mother** seeking the **One**. From the **One**, **Zhun** is born; from the **Two**, the **Three** is sought, completing **Meng’s** difficulty and ease. Like qi seeking like, **hardness transforms into softness first**, enabling the spirit to have a measure and qi to have a flow.

**Movement follows the heavens**, roots sprouting in the **Xun** hour. Based on the **inner dynamics of Meng and Zhun’s** generation and completion, add the **Four Odds and Eight Evens**, symbolizing the **sun and moon’s** rightward revolution of **three hundred and sixty degrees**. Carry the **self’s earth** to nourish the **metal lead**, focusing the nose on inhaling the **true black of the beginning blue-green**, entering the **Muddy Pellet**. **Metal generates true water**, and the **fire timing of the fire-drill furnace** forges and refines.

The *Scripture of Hidden Correspondences* states: When humans unleash their killing mechanism, heaven and earth overturn—this refers to the northwest **Qian** position of the **Celestial Gate** after the first quarter moon. **Qian** originally occupies the Celestial Gate, while **Kun** has no fixed position; when the lunar phase approaches **Qian**, it is because **Qian** and **Kun** undergo three transformations, giving rise to **Pi** and **Tai** at the **Yin** and **Shen** positions. **Yin** generates **Li** fire to form **Ji** earth, while **Shen** generates **Kan** water to conceal **Wu** fire.

In stillness, one guards the earth, with roots in the **Qian** hour, while externally preserving the numerical strategies of **Qian** and **Kun**. **Pi** and **Tai** alternate daily like the heavens’ leftward revolution of three hundred and sixty degrees. **Wu** fire seizes **wood mercury**; next, with the tongue, one swallows thirty-six gulps of **Flowery Nectar**, transforming fire into true earth and transmuting spirit to command it.

The *Oral Instructions of the Dark Mystery and True Yang Perfected* states: "Within the body, use years and months; within the day, use hours and moments"—this means taking the day as the year and the hour as the season. Simply allow external spirits to shift and change while internally consolidating and nurturing qi. Externally, one should adapt to transformations in accordance with the times; internally, spirit becomes steadfast and qi solidifies. This method of cultivation is the most expeditious.

Lesser adepts encounter transformation and return to the true; true adepts open the path to ascend. The *Jade Purity and Great Clarity Chapter* states: The **Jade Purity** begins its transformation in the **Great Clarity**, evolving to the utmost extreme. Upholding correctness to enter the true, it transforms qi to seize impurities, rectifies and governs all spirits, refines treasures to reflect light, gathers the five constants into the infant, unifies the statutes and ordinances, delivers and uplifts sentient beings. When spirit descends and qi harmonizes, it preserves and refines perpetual tranquility, entering the realm of the true. All demons silently collapse.

This path is called the **Upper Realm**; scholars must attend to it with utmost care. From days to months to years, cultivate without pause or regression. The great achievement requires thirty thousand days; the lesser, one hundred days. Ascension follows the corresponding method for ordained practitioners. With utmost sincerity, swiftly cross the ocean of karmic deeds to ascend to the **Upper Jade Capital**.

Thus, it is known that the **Dark Emperor** cultivated for forty-two years to accomplish this supreme Way, attaining all divine penetrations.

Here ends the second scroll of *The Supreme’s Exalted Scripture of the Dark Mystery, the Great Sage True Martial’s Original Transmission, and the Wondrous Divine Incantations*.
