The third scroll of *The Supreme’s Exalted Scripture of the Dark Mystery, the Great Sage True Martial’s Original Transmission, and the Wondrous Divine Incantations*.

**Fang Tianzi Pei Sheng**, a layman of **Chan**, received the **Inner Teachings Register**; **Chen Yong** compiled and annotated.

At that time, the Perfected One bowed twice and prostrated, saying: "This humble servant’s fortune is boundless to receive such a thread of discourse. The wondrous practice is praised, and the **Purple Tenuity** unfolds its teachings—this is the guiding principle of the warp and weft of the scriptures. Yet regarding the **Generals of the Dark Martial**, who are the emanations of the **Dark Origin**, how did their beginnings arise, and what were their affairs? I humbly request a detailed explanation to dispel my ignorance and coarseness."

**Ignorance** means lack of wisdom; **coarseness**, lack of intelligence. Thus, the wondrous practice, with humility and harmony, expounds and clarifies the detailed circumstances of the **Dark Martial**, universally enabling the assembled multitude to hear the numinous causes. It is also hoped that all beings in the three realms and heavens may fully comprehend the profound purport and essential principles of the **Dark Martial’s** wondrous records.

Thereupon, the **Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity** unfolded his dark words, explaining those causes and resolving the supreme matters.

Formerly, in the **Palace of the Desireless Heaven** above the **Great Luo Realm**, there was the **King of Pure Joy**. This king of **Pure Joy** was a sagely and wise ruler who, through his endeavors, conceived the **Dark Emperor**, succeeding his father’s mandate. Ultimately, by virtue of the pure and faithful merit cultivated in previous lives, his destiny transcended the **Palace of the Desireless Heaven**. He clothed and fed himself from the celestial kitchens, receiving all the spontaneous joys of heaven.

The *Scripture of the Void Sovereign*’s *Exalted Scripture of the Dark Mystery, the Great Sage True Martial’s Original Transmission, and the Wondrous Divine Incantations*, Scroll Three, states: "One who performs a thousand good deeds bestows blessings upon seven generations; the deceased soul becomes an immortal. When ten thousand good deeds are complete, a jade tally descends to welcome them, a thousand spirits come to pay homage, and they ascend at dawn."

The **Dark Emperor**, having cultivated the true and achieved results, received the Celestial Edict, which proclaimed: The **Old Heavenly Lord of the Nine-Fives** descended and declared, "Your sagely father and sagely mother are already in the **Nine Empyreans**." The **Nine Empyreans** are the **Jade Purity’s** **Realm of No-Form**, where thirty-six celestial palaces are arrayed, all subordinate to the three realms of the **Great Luo**.

The **Dark Emperor’s** parents came to reside in the **Dragon-Transformed Brahma-Passage Heaven**, within the **Palace of the Desireless**. According to the *Scripture of Purple Radiance*: The kingdom of **Pure Joy** is a land of immortals beyond the seas, located west of the **Yuezhi** country in the Western Regions, beneath the stellar divisions of **Kui** and **Lou**.

The **Virtuous Victorious Queen** dreamed of swallowing the sun and, upon waking, conceived. Her qi did not admit evil; daily she practiced the Way. After fourteen months—over four hundred days—on the third day of the third month in the **Jiawu** year of the **Kaihuang** era, at the hour of **Wu**, he was born in the royal palace. His appearance was extraordinary. After growing up, he renounced his home and bid farewell to his parents.

According to the *Veritable Record of Planchette Descents*: When the **Dark Emperor** was born, it coincided with the **Kaihuang** initial kalpa of heaven, the first year of the **Yellow Emperor’s Purple Cloud** era on earth, in the **Jiawu** year, the third day of the third month, the **Jiayin** day, at the **Gengwu** hour. He embodied the essence of the **Great Yang**, incarnating through conception and emerging from his mother’s left knee.

At his birth, auspicious clouds covered the kingdom, rare fragrances filled the air, and the land transformed into gold and jade. The omens of auspicious responses are too numerous to record. His childhood name was **An Yu**. Born with divine numinosity, his actions were mysterious and manifest. By the age of seven, he had perused all classics and comprehended them silently. Gazing upward and examining below, there was nothing he did not understand. He concealed his heart in the Dao, his aspirations aligned with the **Great Void**, wishing to serve the **Supreme Emperor** and universally bless the people.

His father, the king, did not wish to suppress his aspirations. At fifteen, he bid farewell again, and the king granted his leave, bestowing upon him the Daoist name **Qian Yunzi**. According to the *Veritable Record*: The **Supreme** granted the **Dark Emperor** the surname **Li**, taking it from the source of clan transformation.

According to the *Planchette Descent at the Altar of Mount Heaven in Xizhou, Western Regions*: The sacred father’s jade name is pronounced **Gu Wo**. The **Dark Emperor’s** jade name is **Qi**. According to the *Record of the Awakening of Sagacity*: When the **Dark Emperor** responded to transformation during the Tang, his surname was **Pei**, and his given name was **Zhongfang**. According to the *Scripture of Original Birth*: His grandfather’s name was **Niu Zi**, his clan name was **Duan Shouyou**, and his secret name consisted of four characters: **Ze Xia Yan Cheng**.

In the presence of the sacred seat, one should ensure these jade names are not violated.

Within this scripture, where the two characters *cheng* (乘) appear, they may be silently recited in secret pronunciation to serve as avoidance. When presenting petitions or submitting written prayers to the **Dark Emperor**, one must not inscribe any of the tabooed names within the memorials. For two-character taboos, their combined use is forbidden; if used singly, the character should be written incomplete.

He entered **Mount Wudang** to cultivate the Dao for forty-two years, where his merit was perfected and his fruition fulfilled. Ascending to heaven in broad daylight, the **Jade Emperor** issued a decree, enfeoffing him as **Supreme Mystery**, charged with guarding the northern quarter. Thus began the cause of his manifestation at the frontier.

**Wudang**, in ancient times, was called **Mount Taihe**. According to the *Nine and Five Scripture of Heaven and Earth’s Latitude and Longitude*: After **Yu** had tamed the waters and divided the land into nine provinces, he established the five sacred peaks and defined the boundaries of the four great rivers. In his virtue of sustaining the earth, he entrusted the oversight of all famous mountains and great rivers to divine spirits. Upon examining the region beneath the *Yi* and *Mao* constellations, there was a mountain called **Taihe**. Elders of old transmitted that this was the place where, in high antiquity, **Xuanwu** attained the Dao and ascended in flight. Thus, the name **Taihe** was changed, and it was enfeoffed as **Mount Wudang**.

According to the *Veritable Record*: The prince left the palace and sought out secluded valleys, where he encountered the **Jade Purity Sagely Ancestor, Purple Prime Lady**, who bestowed upon him the **Supreme Dao of the Limitless**. The Lady said: “You may cross the eastern sea and journey to the region beneath the *Yi* and *Jiao* constellations, where a mountain arises from the *Qian* and *Dui* trigrams, winding for fifty thousand *li*, its waters issuing from the *Zhen* palace. Since the time of the **Great Ultimate**, this mountain has existed, corresponding above to the two heavens of **Manifest Stability** and **Ultimate Peace**. You may enter this mountain and dwell among its central peaks, choosing the loftiest, **Purple Empyrean**. When two thousand five hundred years have passed after the **Great Harmony’s** ascension, during the fourth kalpa of the **Dragon Han** era, you shall let down your hair and go barefoot, gathering the true essence of *Kan* and *Li*, returning to the root and restoring your position. Above, you shall become a minister of the **Three Realms**; below, a great sage of the **Ten Directions**. Only then will your name be manifest for a hundred million kalpas, equal in duration to heaven and earth, sun and moon—such is the fulfillment of your fruition.”

Having spoken, the **Purple Prime Lady** ascended upon the clouds and departed. The prince then followed his master’s instructions, crossing the eastern sea, and indeed beheld the mountain of which she had spoken. Its waters were hidden and submerged, with seventy-two peaks, one summit soaring emerald-green, piercing the **Purple Empyrean**. Below, there was a cliff facing the sun, serene and empty. Thus, he heeded his master’s admonition: the mountain was named **Mount Taihe**, the peak **Purple Empyrean Peak**, and the cliff **Purple Empyrean Cliff**. There he divined his dwelling.

Abiding in profound emptiness and mysterious unity, he silently communed with the myriad perfected. For forty-two years, he mastered the **Supreme Dao**. In the fifty-seventh year of the **Yellow Emperor’s Purple Cloud** era, during the *gengyin* year, on the ninth day of the ninth month, the *bingxu* day, at dawn, auspicious clouds and celestial blossoms descended like rain, filling the mountain valleys. For miles around, the forests and peaks resounded with the spontaneous music of immortal hymns. The prince stood with hands clasped upon **Purple Empyrean Peak**. In an instant, the clouds dispersed, revealing five perfected immortals, **Wei Xian**, with an entourage so grand it was beyond the ordinary. All who saw or heard descended and gathered. The prince bowed deeply, reverently welcoming them.

The five perfected said: “We are the **Nine and Five Elder Heavenly Lords**, acting by decree of the **Three Clarities’ Jade Emperor**, to open your path.” At noon, the five perfected proclaimed the decree. The prince bowed twice, kowtowing, then rose to receive the decree and accept the bestowal. After changing his ceremonial robes, he gathered his jade tablet, mounted a flying cloud, and ascended upon a jade chariot with a feather canopy and jeweled wheels, proceeding to pay homage in the **Nine Clarities’ Realm**.

As for the **Jade Emperor’s decree**, it is the celestial seal-script of one hundred sixty-eight characters contained within this scripture. Upon receiving this, he was appointed to the office of **Supreme Mystery**, and only then did his traces become manifest, so that the world might know the cause of his cultivation.

The perfected one bowed deeply and again prostrated himself, addressing the **Purple Tenuity Great Emperor**: “The **Jade Emperor’s** decree of enfeoffment must contain a wondrous intent. I dare ask for its general purport, to enlighten my humble understanding.”

At that time, the **Purple Tenuity Great Emperor** replied to **Miaoxing**: “The celestial scripture is secret and profound; how can it be discussed or proclaimed? To reveal heavenly mysteries would be most improper. The hidden language of the **Great Brahma**—how could it be made known to the multitude? The affairs of the **Purple Tenuity** at the center of the northern pole are to assist the **Golden Watchtower of the August Heaven**, issuing decrees, bestowing praise, and admonishing the eastern regions—this is the extent of the matter. In accordance with the imperial edict of the **Three Clarities’ Jade Emperor**, the decree was issued and its provisions carried out. Once transcribed, it was sealed within the **Purple Palace**. Moreover, the regulations of the **Illustrious Perfected** are not to be lightly transgressed. To recklessly divulge the sacred teachings would risk the fault of careless disclosure.”

At that time, **Miaoxing**, moved by the sincerity of the assembly, inquired of the **Great Emperor’s** intent. With utmost humility and reverence, he specially restrained the multitude, establishing vows and covenants, so that those whose aspirations aligned with the rites might proceed.

**Miaoxing the Perfected One** bowed with hands clasped and kowtowed, then addressed the throne: “Though my karmic affinity is shallow, I trust in the sagely compassion, which bends to consider the multitude of perfected. If I were to lightly disclose or neglect this, I would fall into evil destinies, becoming a **lower ghost** for ten thousand kalpas and a thousand rebirths, forever revolving through the six paths of defilement—all called **evil destinies**, the **dark officials of the nether realms**, collectively known as **lower ghosts**.”

Then the **Purple Tenuity Great Emperor**, moved by this perfected one’s earnest devotion and repeated entreaties, proclaimed the imperial decree to instruct the assembly.

*Bowing with hands clasped* refers to holding a tablet and kneeling in the ritual of opening the altar. *Kowtowing* means bowing the head to the ground in prostration. *Three entreaties* means nine bows with hands clasped, three prostrations, and three risings.

**Miaoxing** earnestly petitioned and then established vows: though his karmic affinity was shallow, he dared not show reverence in word while violating it in heart. Should he transgress, he willingly accepted the fate of becoming a **lower ghost**. Having made three entreaties on behalf of the multitude, he received the **Great Emperor’s** decree. The **Attendant Secretary** was dispatched to open the jade casket with a jade key, revealing the **Dark Emperor’s** decree of ascension to be proclaimed.

This secret script is written in golden seal-script, a square *zhang* in size, called the **Celestial Talisman**. Whoever beholds it shall forever dwell among the **heavenly immortals**; whoever hears it shall not pass through **hell**. What, then, is this secret?

The proclamation from the Golden Gates beneath the Three Heavens of the Radiant Celestial Pole reaffirms the exalted seal of this **Celestial Talisman**. According to the *Veritable Records*, the talismanic script and imperial decree were composed and inscribed by the **Perfected Sovereign of Heaven**. The characters, a square *zhang* in size, are eight-pointed with flying rays, each stroke a *chi* in length. This is the form of the **Crimson Writ of Jade Characters**, its shape wrought in inlaid gold. To dwell forever among the **heavenly immortals** is to ascend to the **Boundless Immortal Courts of this Assembly**, where all may behold it and thereby elevate their rank.

As for those who hear it: during the late Eastern Han, the **Most High** descended to Shu and transmitted the **Mysterious Warrior’s** scripture to the **Perfected Lord Zhang Daoling**, entrusting its dissemination to the world. Lord Zhang then rendered the golden seal-script’s profound meaning into a common written form, benefiting all who study the Dao. Those who recite or hear it preserve the **Great Mystery’s qi** within the **Kidney Palace**, fortifying the gates of the **Ear Residence** with keen hearing. Thus, the **Earth Bureau’s Black Register** cannot record those who have accrued eight hundred merits. When such practitioners reach life’s end, their souls shall not descend into the **earth-prison hells**.

According to the *Collected Works of Celestial Master Du Guangting*: the Dao first spread without beginning, formless amid the Han’s chaos. Qi congealed in the vast expanse, patterns coalesced within the Great Void, their sinuous strokes forming characters with eight-pointed flying rays. The **Primordial Beginning** commanded the **Perfected Sovereign of Heaven** to model and transcribe them, naming them the **Celestial Writ of Jade Seal-Script**—the primordial form of all writing.

Its **Vernal Writ** states:
This scripture’s celestial talisman and decree descend by inspired brush, as recorded in the *Veritable Book*. A missive from the Three Offices beneath the Golden Gates of the Radiant Celestial Pole is hereby issued:

Thus, the **Divine Child Jing Le**, Prince of the Pure Joy Kingdom, at seven years of age, and the **Dao-seeking Youth of the Avoided State**, at fifteen, with both parents—
You, whose transformation arises from the **Primordial Qi of the Great Origin**, whose birth is the **Celestial One’s** honor, the **Supreme Yin’s** singularity, the **Purple Sovereign’s** sacred form—
Though silent, you teach; by guarding the center, you forget words. The **Perfected Lord of Learning** cannot fathom your divinity; none know the **Emperor’s** likeness—only that your **virtue** attains the divine.
Through measureless kalpas, you dissolve the blades of demons, unraveling entanglements. Subtly present, you guard the **primordial qi**, ensuring its eternal endurance.
Empty the heart yet fill the belly; purify the heart and diminish desires. Embrace the One and follow the **Perfected**; harmonize with light and merge with dust. Conceal brilliance and obscure clarity; carve open creation, hollow the self, and refine the essence. Scatter the uncarved block, return to simplicity—lumpish, unhewn.
For six million years, since the **Yan Kang** kalpa’s inception in the *gengyin* year, eighty-two incarnations have passed. The **Five Spirits’** elder first took the **Mysterious Warrior’s** form.
Bending the whole to straighten the crooked, humbling the self to realize the Dao, raising the many to extend the few—like water, you descend to measure all things, renewing the old. You transform decay and innovate.
Nurturing yin to foster yang, yin births yang, the female *gui* and male *ren* revive the dead to become human. Fearing the heavens’ chaos, you safeguard life and preserve the scriptures.
Your merit does not rely on boasting; your beneficence spreads without attachment. Your **virtue** is true, not seeking lofty recognition. True stillness endures in eternal purity.
Now, it is fitting to once more manifest the decree of the **Radiant Celestial Pole**, commanding the **Great Mystery’s** might to eternally guard the **Northern Heavens**. Assume sole governance, pity the people, and punish rebellion. When portents of treachery appear, swiftly capture and annihilate them. Suppress demonic vapors and wayward qi; quell their reckless rampage.
Hold the **Chart and Registers**; grasp the **Cosmic Ultimate Diagram**. Swear oaths to subdue demonic traces; pacify demonic toil with the **Great Punishment’s** expulsion.
The **Imperial Perfected’s** numinous assembly and the **Earthly Perfected’s** governance—your brush is vast, your ministers drive spirits and mount dragons. Commanding dragons and steeds, you lead the **Ten Titled Armies**. The generals of *jia* and *geng* days uphold discipline; their reins are specially granted. By your movement, you achieve success; your arts are lauded, your merits recorded.
Encircling the Six Directions and Twelve Divisions, you patrol by month and day, universally bestowing fortune. Manifesting in myriad forms, you descend to bless heaven and earth.
The Dao parallels heaven and earth; the **Great Dao’s** comparison may be decreed. Ascend in flight—all **Perfected** acclaim it; the **Nine Purities’** myriad **Perfected** ride together to the **Imperial Court**.

**Hereby Appointed:**
**Grand Marshal of the Great Mystery**
**Director of the Bureau of Harmonious Transitions**

**Decree Received. To Be Executed.**

The Purple Tenuity thus spoke to the Perfected, saying: "This document is a secret decree of the Jade Emperor, a solemn proclamation of the Heavenly Thearch—it must not be lightly transmitted, lest one incur punitive censure."

The Three Proclamations treasured by the Great Emperor of Purple Tenuity state:
First: "The celestial writ is arcane; how may it be discussed or disseminated? One fears the leakage of Heaven’s mechanisms."
Second: "The Jade Emperor’s secret decree must not be lightly transmitted, lest one incur punitive censure."
Third: "Unless one is a Perfected of the highest order, secrecy is fitting."

The transmission of these admonitions warns that reverence in speech may yet conceal dissonance in the heart.

The *Scripture of the Green Cause* states: "Those who in this life enjoy longevity, wealth, and nobility have, in past lives, revered and trusted the Great Dao, deriving therefrom its wondrous principles. Those whose families endure unwaning prosperity across kalpas have, in past lives, extended devotion to the Orthodox and Perfected, achieving merit and virtue thereby. Those who in this life possess keen talent, profound insight, and deep comprehension of the subtle principles that illuminate the true nature have, in past lives, upheld sacred scriptures and refrained from reckless transmission."

The Perfected bowed deeply and addressed the Emperor again, saying: "I have heard that the General of the Dark Warrior possesses boundless divine efficacy, yet does not occupy the ranks of the myriad deities but instead guards the northern quadrant. The cause of his wondrous function and the covenant of his numinous brilliance must hold profound significance. I humbly beseech an explanation to dispel my ignorance."

The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct further inquired into the abstruse mysteries of the Dark Warrior, asking why he holds exclusive governance and is stationed in the north.

The Great Emperor’s voice responded to the Perfected, saying: "In the heavens above the north, the host of luminaries pay homage—without the most divine, who could restrain and govern? At the center of the heavens, within the northern pole, stands the imperial court of Purple Tenuity. The Bureau of Harmonious Transitions lies north of the Purple Court, and the Dark Emperor’s august governance ranks to the right of the Four Marshals of the Celestial Offices, guiding the myriad phenomena of the forest of existence. Thus, the scriptures say, 'The host of luminaries pay homage in their duties,' and the Dark Emperor’s achievements and merits are commensurate with this office.

Whenever the assembly of Perfected gathers to pay court to the August Celestial Honored One, the Four Saints serve as the vanguard of the ranks.

The *Veritable Record* states: When the Primordial Ascended within the Jade Clarity Palace and convened the assembly of the Celestial Thearchs of the Myriad Heavens, reviewing and promoting the host of Perfected across the Three Realms and appointing the Nine Heavens’ offices, the Jade Gentleman Attendant of the Celestial Marshal opened the Great Cinnabar Jade Casket and produced the *Jade Chronicle of Merit and Demerit of the Myriad Heavens*. The decree commanded the Golden Watchtower Attendant-in-Chief, the Celestial Marshal Divine Lord Han the Venerable; the Golden Watchtower Director of Destinies, the Perfected Han; the Golden Watchtower Recorder of Names, the Perfected of the Jade Chronicle of Destinies; the Golden Pass Director of Merit, the Nine Heavens’ Investigator Perfected Lord; and the Golden Watchtower Director of Demerit, the Nine Heavens’ Treasurer of Blessings Perfected Lord—all to open the chronicle and examine the merits of the Three Officials and the Four Saints. Since the opening of the Great Void and the emergence of the Divine Unity, he has borne the merit of protecting Heaven and aiding Earth in nurturing transformation. His achievements were memorialized to the Three Clarities, whereupon the Jade Emperor personally conducted the ritual, bestowing the title of 'Perfected Subordinate to the Emperor.' Thereupon, the Dark Warrior was summoned to the court, ascending the Seven-Treasured Jade Terrace. The Golden Watchtower Attendant-in-Chief, the Grand Academician of the Hall of Primordial Numinosity, the Direct Servitor of the Three Heavenly Gates, the Custodian of the Treasury of Numinosity, the Memorialist, the Golden Perfected, the Purple Yang Grand Master, the Radiant and Virtuous Transcendent Lord Xuanyuan, who holds the register, was dispatched to the Three Heavenly Gates of the August Ultimate. The jade tablet conveyed the mandate, and the office was granted: the Dark Warrior was invested with the Heaven-Connecting Twelve-Tiered Cap, the dark ceremonial robe adorned with the sun, moon, mountains, dragons, and cosmic imagery, the dark jade ritual tablet, the red-soled dark shoes, the jasper banner and precious staff, the Nine-Dragon Jade Brush. The Dark Warrior bowed to receive them and completed his change of attire.

Thereafter, the Transcendent Lord reverently recited the Threefold Edict of the Jade Clarity Palace, saying: "The august Great Dao, the majestic Supreme Perfected, at the division of the Great Ultimate, gave birth to the transformations of the Primordial Mystery. Its wondrous pivot encompasses the mechanisms of the myriad heavens, and all honor the Celestial Honored One as the sagely and luminous sovereign of their affairs. How vast and exalted are his blessings—how dare we not revere them?"

With reverence, we consider the Great Primordial Master, the Great General of the Dark Warrior of the Great Mystery, the Commander-in-Chief of the Three Origins, the Marshal of the Nine Heavens’ Patrols, the Right Celestial Pivot of the Northern Pole’s Right Wall, the Grand Commander of the Three Realms—continuing in his former office as Director of the Bureau of Harmonious Transitions and Adjudicator of the Right Victory Office of the Mysterious Capital.

The Register of the Supreme Purple Emperor and the Perfected of Heavenly Unity states: "His numinosity penetrates the supremely wondrous, opening the mysteries of primordial transformation. His Dao is replete and resplendent, governing the essence of the Void and Danger constellations. He nurtures the primordial of Heaven and completes the records of Earth. He upholds the transformations of the four seasons and extends the disciplines of the eight nodes. Manifesting in myriad forms, he universally blesses Heaven and Earth. His merit equals that of fifty million kalpas; his virtue parallels the thirty-two heavens and nine auroras. Above, he relies on the true majesty of the Ten Poles; below, he depends on the vast transformations of the divine. He bestows benefits upon the people and accumulates sagely virtue throughout the Jade Chronicle. In accordance with the registers and talismans, he is deemed a Perfected Subordinate to the Emperor—how dare we not honor him?"

To manifest his virtue, he was specially appointed as the Jade Void Preceptor and Minister, the Dark Celestial Thearch, and Marshal of the Nine Heavens’ Investigators.

The golden script of the register states: "The Dao gives birth to the One qi, which transforms the Three Powers. It crystallizes the true within the splendor of the Nine Poles and dawns radiantly in the excellence of the Six Heavens. Subtle and resplendent, profound and luminous, its merit is boundless—it is fitting to bestow honor. We hope you will not decline out of modesty. I shall henceforth assist the Great Dao, enduring across kalpas, and protect the myriad people, extending blessings eternally."

The dragon script descended in illumination, to be forever concealed in the Mysterious Capital.

With reverence, we proclaim the ennoblement: His Sagely Father is the Heavenly Lord of Pure Joy, the Radiant and Perfected Great Emperor; his Sagely Mother is the Queen Mother of Victorious Goodness, the Jasper Perfected Transcendent. Below, they shade the Celestial Pass: the General of the Fire Essence Containing Yin, the Venerable Dark Spirit of Vermilion Numinosity; and the General of the Water Essence Nurturing Yang, the Venerable Dark Spirit of Black Numinosity—both reside in the Palace of True Felicity of Heavenly Unity.

Gazing upon the Dark Emperor’s achievements and merits, we see that his authority today encompasses the governance of merit and demerit across the Three Realms. The circumstances of his true blessings still rely on his majestic assistance, for his divine efficacy is indeed boundless.

The Perfected then inquired of the Purple Tenuity: "If there are those among the celestial and human realms who, with sincere devotion, revere and honor him, will they obtain blessings and benefits?"

The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, contemplating the myriad phenomena and aligning with the hearts of Heaven and humanity, further inquired about the blessings of reverence and how they might transform the destinies of humans and gods.

The Great Emperor replied: "This divine general, on the sixth, sixteenth, and twenty-sixth days of every month, when the various heavens conduct their investigations..."

These various heavens govern the public affairs of the Realm of Form and Desire. The guardianship of the Dark Emperor involves patrolling and inspecting the Two Luminaries, the Three Celestial Bodies, the Five Phases, the myriad phenomena, and the affairs of the stellar palaces, suppressing and pacifying unruly comets and malevolent stars. Thus, the original scripture states: "Thrice each month, he leads the divine troops in person to the various heavens to conduct thorough inspections. Whenever encountering perverse qi or malevolent stars, he swiftly executes and destroys them—such is his duty."

The heavens of the Realm of Form belong to the Three Qi Lords of the Upper Primordial. They summon the celestial beings of the spring retinue, along with the eighteen Heavenly Lords governing the inner and outer realms, whose august titles are reverently recorded as follows: the Nine Heavens of the Five Qi Heavenly Lord, governing the North; the Primordial Numinous Supreme Heaven’s Beginning Plain Heavenly Lord, governing the Southwest; the Wondrous Numinous Treasure Flower Heaven’s Nine Qi Heavenly Lord, governing the East; the Jade Flower Boundless Heaven’s Beginning Cinnabar Heavenly Lord, governing the Southeast; the Great Void True Ultimate Heaven’s One Qi Heavenly Lord, governing the Upper Realm; the Jade Pure Void Emperor Heaven’s Beginning Mysterious Heavenly Lord, governing the Northwest; the Plain Numinous Radiant Origin Heaven’s Seven Black Heavenly Lord, governing the West; the Jade Numinous Plain Flower Heaven’s Beginning Azure Heavenly Lord, governing the Northeast; the Supreme Numinous True Origin Heaven’s Three Qi Heavenly Lord, governing the South; the Southern Culmen Jade Script Heaven’s Outer Nine Heavens Wisdom Virtue Heavenly Venerable, governing the North; the Twin Gates Transformation Body Heaven’s Majestic Model Heavenly Venerable, governing the Southwest; the Utmost Wondrous Transformative Void Heaven’s Benevolent Love Heavenly Venerable, governing the East; the Primordial True Treasure Radiance Heaven’s Compassionate Harmony Heavenly Venerable, governing the Southeast; the Opening Numinous Transmitting Dao Heaven’s Bearing Virtue Heavenly Venerable, governing the Lower Realm; the Central Culmen Total Life Heaven’s Accomplished Transformation Heavenly Venerable, governing the Northwest; the Primordial Pass Universal Salvation Heaven’s Righteous Deliberation Heavenly Venerable, governing the West; the Accomplished Virtue Radiant Crystal Heaven’s Wisdom Accumulation Heavenly Venerable, governing the Northeast; and the Radiant Flowing Light Heaven’s Ritual Teaching Heavenly Venerable, governing the South.

The Heaven of Transformative Peace in the Realm of Form is a place beyond the Five Phases, where the celestial beings of the spring retinue are clothed and fed from the celestial pantries. This originates from the fact that all practitioners of cultivation may attain it. The *Commentary on the Numinous Treasure Scriptures* states: "A person who performs a hundred good deeds has their name recorded by the Eastern Flower [Realm]; upon completing three hundred good deeds, they transcend the karma of bodily actions. With pure conduct at life’s end, their spirit ascends according to their merits, soaring to this realm like a flying bird. Those who further cultivate and achieve a thousand good deeds extend blessings to seven generations of ancestors, whose spiritual souls and essences gather to form the spring retinue."

The heavens of the Realm of Desire belong to the Three Qi Lords of the Middle Primordial, who summon the celestial spring retinues. These six heavens and ten realms occupy the lowest positions, bordering the crowns of the human world, and their names are listed below. The titles and domains of the various heavens are as follows: the Victorious Goodness Heavenly King, governing the Northern Realm; the Wondrous Transformation Heavenly King of the Heaven of Self-Transformation, governing the Eastern Realm; the Wondrous Virtue Heavenly King of the Heaven of Joyful Transformation, governing the Central Realm; the Pure and Serene Heavenly King of the Tuṣita Heaven, governing the Southern Realm; the Numinous Harmony Heavenly King of the Yama Heaven, governing the Western Realm; and the Pure Harmony Heavenly King of the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, along with the Four Heavenly Kings guarding the Central Realm—the Eastern Realm’s Guardian, the Heavenly King of the State; the Southern Realm’s Guardian, the Heavenly King of Growth; the Western Realm’s Guardian, the Heavenly King of Vast Sun; and the Northern Realm’s Guardian, the Heavenly King of Many Hearings.

The *Numinous Treasure Scriptures* state: "A person who performs ten good deeds has their lifespan recorded by the Controller of Destiny; upon completing fifty good deeds, they are befriended by the Five Emperors. Gradually, the three karmic actions are purified, and body and spirit begin to forget their burdens. They attain the wonders of the Five Phases, and at the end of their heavenly mandate, their spiritual soul directly ascends to these heavenly realms to enjoy great bliss." Moreover, the Dark Emperor, by his ordained duty, perpetually nurtures the Primordial of Heaven.

**The Ten Patrolling Journeys**
The Ten Journeys refer to the Ten Great Grotto-Heavens. Patrolling and inspecting them is the public duty of the immortals. According to the *Repentance Before Heaven*, each grotto-heaven establishes its own immortal officials and bureaus to collectively manage the registers of the myriad beings, recording merits and demerits. On the seventh day of the first month, the eighth day of the second month, the ninth day of the third month, the fourth day of the fourth month, the fifth day of the fifth month, the seventh day of the sixth month, the seventh day of the seventh month, the thirteenth day of the eighth month, the ninth day of the ninth month, the twenty-first day of the tenth month, the seventh day of the eleventh month, and the twenty-seventh day of the twelfth month, they descend to the human world to eradicate demonic forces, expel pestilence, protect human well-being and longevity, and fulfill the mandate of Heaven. Those whose qi is upright and whose hearts are pure, who are wholly loyal and perfectly filial, have their names inscribed on jade tablets and are recommended for ascension as immortals. There are further profound regulations, too numerous to recount.

The Perfected bowed again and inquired of the Purple Tenuity Great Emperor: "We have heard the causes of manifest transformation, and the reverence of celestial and human beings. But how should the General of the Dark Warrior be venerated, and what expedient means should be employed to obtain blessings and benefits? We humbly request your instruction."

The Wondrous Conduct Perfected asked about the offerings and rites for those who take refuge.

At that time, the Great Emperor addressed the Perfected, saying: "Within Heaven and Earth, those who wholeheartedly revere and honor the Dark Warrior, throughout their lives abstaining from the flesh of scaled fish, the stench of raw meat, self-slaughtered or poisoned creatures, and foul impurities, as well as from scallions, garlic, and leeks; who refrain from indulging in lust and desire, and avoid contact with corpses and childbirth—if they can sever these attachments, they may then devote themselves sincerely. On every day of his descent, they will receive auspicious blessings."

The Great Emperor spoke of "within Heaven and Earth" to refer to all people in the great thousand-world realm. Those who wholeheartedly venerate the Dark Warrior, maintaining incense and offerings with sincerity and reverence, and adhering to the prohibitions of this scripture, truly benefit their well-being. As the *Scripture of Responding to the Mandate* states: "Eat and drink according to circumstances, without straining the spirit or fixating on appearances. Drink to nourish the blood and flesh of the physical body, and eat to replenish the qi of the viscera." According to the *Numinous Treasure Great Precepts Scripture*: "The primordial spirit within the body must be kept pure and undefiled. Do not consume foul and rank foods, for they obstruct the channels of the meridians and entangle the six viscera. Moreover, fatty meats and pungent spices cloud the gates of the spirit, steam the five viscera, and generate manifold illnesses and afflictions."

How can one hope for longevity without understanding the relationship between form and spirit? This scripture preserves the celestial years of humanity and dispels calamities and afflictions. These are the essential methods to be observed and guarded.

Foul and rank foods include the flesh of soft-shelled turtles, alligators, tortoises, turtles, snakes, eels, and black carp. The meat of oxen, horses, and wild beasts is termed "rank." Additionally, one must avoid animals that have died of themselves or been poisoned. "Died of themselves" refers to creatures that perish without cause while still alive. "Poisoned" denotes remnants left by fierce beasts after seizing and devouring their prey. Consuming such self-dead or maimed creatures shortens one’s lifespan—this is the principle.

According to *Sun the Perfected One’s Dietary Prohibitions*: "Defiled substances include horse meat, which is impure, and dog meat, which is filthy. *Licai* is wild garlic, and excessive consumption dissipates the spirit. Though garlic may be used medicinally, prolonged intake obstructs the spirit’s qi. Coriander’s pungent odor penetrates the flesh and causes forgetfulness. Mustard greens, leeks, and *peng* are all classified as pungent vegetables."

Indulgence in lust depletes essence and harms the kidneys, causing the Dark Warrior to depart. Excessive desire scatters qi and dissipates spirit, prompting the Vermilion Bird to abandon one. Those who handle corpses invite dead spirits to haunt and startle the soul, driving the Azure Dragon away. Attending childbirth exposes one to blood’s foulness, which assaults the po, causing the White Tiger to flee. Should one inadvertently consume forbidden foods, recite the scripture’s purificatory incantation for the body, and the impure qi will be expelled from within.

Only when assisting with the corpses of parents or teachers may one wait until after burial, don fresh garments, and then approach the sacred to pay homage to the immortals. As the *Appended Judgments to the Book of Changes* states: "What Heaven aids is compliance; what humanity reveres is sincerity." Sincerity is wholehearted devotion—offering incense morning and evening, knocking at the Jade Void’s gate, and with earnest intent, beseeching the Supreme Mystery Perfected One. Follow the records of good deeds in the *Salted Departments*, and submit them to the Right Victory Prefecture. Auspicious blessings will surely descend, illuminating your household. Progress gradually, and Heaven will protect you. The night before the sacred descent is the appointed time.

First, purify body and mind, allowing no turbid thoughts to disturb them. "First purify" means to cleanse bodily filth in advance. Confucius said: "Bathing is for ritual purity, not for adornment." "Allowing no turbid thoughts" means to dispel the chaos within one’s breast. The Most High said: "When the mind is settled, the spirit naturally becomes clear." He also said: "When form and spirit are both wondrous, they unite with the Dao in truth."

By the fifth watch, personally prepare incense and candles, pure fruits, and jujube broth. The incense conveys sincerity to the perfected; only aloeswood incense will do. Yellow wax candles are prized for their luminous brightness in sacrifice. Pure fruits are the five fruits, with pomegranates and plums forbidden. Jujube broth is made from jujubes dried in boiling water and sun-steeped. The *Inner Transmission of Yin Xi* states: "Immortals often entertain guests with jujubes."

Pure water is also excellent. The offering of pure water stems from the Tang dynasty’s posthumous enfeoffment of the Most High Lord Lao as Ancestor. When Emperor Xianzong visited Guangping Park, he sat in a pavilion at night and beheld the Perfected Warrior descending in majestic form, standing amidst the clouds. The emperor burned incense and personally inquired about the celestial court’s ritual protocols. The Perfected Warrior replied: "Medicinal incense can convey sincerity; without incense, sincerity cannot reach the vault of heaven. Pouring water can cleanse impure *qi*; all purity arises from this, so offerings must include water." After speaking, the emperor expressed his gratitude, and the Perfected Warrior ascended to heaven. This occurred on the night of the eighth day of the eighth month in the first year of the Yuanhe era, within the Tang palace.

Beholding this, how could the desires of the Supreme Sages be otherwise? We must express our sincerity and adhere to this. There are three ranks in the array, yet the will must remain pure and undivided.

The three ranks in the array are as follows: On the third day of the third month each year, the Dark Emperor feasts with the Divine Father and Divine Mother in the Jade Pool Grotto-Heaven of the Jasper Lake, in gratitude for the day of his birth. One incense burner, two candles, and pure offerings of jujube soup shall be arranged, dividing the setting into three positions.

As for maintaining pure and undivided will, on all other days of descent, only one position is required for incense, candles, fruit, and soup. Bowing in reverence and making supplications, no wish shall go unanswered. For all who pray with upright sincerity, the Supreme Sages shall grant every request.

The *Record of the Awakening of the Sage* states: During the reign of Emperor Renzong of the Song, troubled by misfortune, he summoned the Daoist Master Wang Bochu of the Cavern Spirit lineage to divine auspices in the palace. On the day of the altar rite, the emperor burned a sealed prayer written in his own hand, prostrated himself, and sent forth his spirit to present the memorial to the celestial vault. The following day, Master Bochu reported: "Yesterday, as I ascended to the Supreme Heaven to present the petition, upon returning from court and reaching the Western Gate of Heaven, General Ge announced that the Perfected Warrior had already secured the emperor’s favor. By the Jade Emperor’s imperial brush, an edict was granted, extending the emperor’s lifespan by one *ji*." Delighted, the emperor bestowed an imperial seal and conferred a title upon the Perfected Warrior. In the second year of the Jiayou era, on the first day of the first month, it was decreed that the Hall of Eternal Life in the Mysterious Capital of the Precious Response Pavilion be established along the imperial avenue.

This is respectfully recorded hereafter.
