They lie in wait for human errors, spreading poisonous qi to slay the old and young, male and female, cutting short lives before their allotted years, forcing them to die prematurely. All such cases are recorded by the Three Officials in the Right Bureau, preventing rebirth. Thus, their souls drift without refuge, their grievances accumulating, their resentment dense and unyielding."

The Primordial Beginning, together with the assembled sages and perfected beings, beholding this evil, how could they not grieve for the lives ensnared by kalpic fate?

The *Beidi Jing* states: "At the end of the kalpa, the true qi of the Three Heavens gradually wanes, while the perverse qi of the Six Caverns surges forth, causing humans and ghosts to become indistinguishable, right and wrong to blur. The qi of imprisoned darkness emerges, arising from the One and spreading from the north. From one, two are born—the qi of sorrow and anguish intertwines. From two, three arise—the qi of demonic delusion entangles. Then four are formed—the qi of licentiousness and depravity seeps in, wantonly flowing into human meridians, attacking the heart and assaulting the kidneys, damaging the lungs and withering the liver. The spleen and stomach become clouded with yellow, while primordial yang and the black and white aspects turn against each other. Thus, the Six Heavenly Demon Kings seize the opportunity to invade, and the Eight Bureau Plague Offices rampage, spreading poison without restraint. Only those who cultivate goodness shall, in form and fate, avoid falling into the calamities of the kalpic realm."

The *Most High’s Exalted Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Primordial Transmission of the Great Sage True Warrior of the Mysterious Heaven, Scroll Five* concludes.
The *Most High’s Exalted Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Primordial Transmission of the Great Sage True Warrior of the Mysterious Heaven, Scroll Six* begins.
Compiled and annotated by Chen You of the *Record of the Inner Teachings of Ascending the Mysteries* by Fang Tianzi Pei of the Marketplace.

The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct addressed the Primordial Beginning on high: "The host of Perfected Ones pity the multitude of beings—by what means may they be delivered?"
The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct inquired of the Purple Tenuity: "Pitying the affairs of this time, by what divine power did the host of Perfected Ones before the Primordial Beginning resolve them?"
The Heavenly Worthy then struck his teeth once, and a radiance streamed ten thousand leagues to the north, summoning the Great Mysterious General to sever and slay the host of demons and deliver the multitudes.
The Great Emperor affirmed in response: "The Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy, taking pity on the ten thousand kinds in the kalpic convergence of life and death, deemed it urgent to sever and slay the host of demons and deliver the multitudes. Thus he struck his teeth once."
This is called the Dao emitting one qi to engender the ten thousand things.
"Radiance streaming ten thousand leagues" refers to the celestial light issuing forth to establish and secure its majestic power.
The affairs of the north pertain to the Purple Tenuity of the Northern Culmen, who upholds and executes the mandate of the kalpic destiny.
Only by summoning the Great Mysterious General to ascend and attend the Jade Clarity, heeding the Primordial Beginning’s decree to execute and purge the demonic miasma, could the one be set in motion to perfect the ten thousand assemblies.
The Perfected One said: "I do not yet understand—by what cause does this general hold dominion over the north, his might subduing the ghosts below and sweeping away the demonic miasma?"
The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct had not yet fully grasped this, and so again inquired whether the Great Mysterious General truly possessed the power to subdue the demonic hordes below.
The Great Emperor replied: "Before this spirit unfolded the workings of creation, he first discerned the numinous. Assuming names and titles, he delivered beings and succored creatures, neither boasting of his goodness nor vaunting his abilities. Bearing the mandate of the Jade Emperor, he was enfeoffed as the Dark Warrior."
The Great Emperor, having heard the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct’s earnest inquiry, thus recounted the fundamental origins of the Dao.
In the time before the Great Simplicity was divided, when heaven and earth were merged in form, the sun and moon obscured their brilliance, and the eight trigrams concealed their spirit—this was the era before creation unfolded.
The original qi of the Dark Emperor was already within it.
Thus it is said he first received the numinous.
For a detailed annotation, see the passage on the eighty-second transformation into the Dark Warrior in the preceding section of this scripture.
Knowing to assume names and titles, he responded to the transformations of the lower realm, delivering beings and succoring creatures.
Thus, whenever the Dark Emperor manifested in the world, he advanced the teachings and doctrines, universally aiding living beings, broadly bestowing benefits upon life, practicing the Dao among humankind without self-aggrandizement, accumulating sagely merits without self-conceit—such was the enduring nature of the Dao.
According to the *Jade Calendar of the Primordial Cavern*, the Western Florescence Emperor Lord said: "Of old, the ren and gui were apportioned within the Great Clarity, establishing the image of the secondary kalpa and circulating through the Water Bureau as its source.
Water is the highest good yet does not claim goodness for itself, thus it attains unity with heaven and earth and endures, benefiting the ten thousand things without seeking benefit for itself, flowing through the ten thousand things without seeking passage for itself. The ten thousand things, benighted and obstructed, stained and attached, are cleansed without exception—this is called possessing the vast dharma of the multitude."
If one discusses the Dao of cultivation and compares it to the initial progress of a learner, its perfection may swiftly be achieved.
Only the Dark Emperor, in his youth, wielded the numinous with efficacy in the ren and gui, his merits moving the Three Heavens. From the day of his ascension, he was commissioned as the Great Mysterious Marshal.
He was further able to pacify heaven and earth, and by the grace of the Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven, he was enfeoffed as the Great General Dark Warrior.
The Perfected One said: "How may this general be dispatched to the lower realm to universally deliver the multitudes, sparing them from untimely death, liberating the deceased, and ensuring the living enjoy peace and well-being?"
The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, having inquired in sequence, asked how the striking of teeth in the Golden Portal and the streaming radiance served as command.
Would this scripture, upon reaching the realm of calamity, serve to punish and pacify?
The Heavenly Worthy summoned him with a flying talisman.
The Purple Tenuity Great Emperor responded with the above words.
The Primordial Beginning issued the decree, which was called the "Flying and Soaring Esoteric Edict."
Its text is the "Divine Incantation to Subdue the Heavenly Demons" within this scripture, comprising its words and meaning.
Whenever one recites this incantation, the moment its sound is uttered, it summons the Dark Emperor with great fidelity—this is called the "Method of Swift Summoning."
Upon receiving the decree, the Dark Warrior, General Xuanwu, led his divine troops to the cinnabar steps of the Never-Night Palace.
The cinnabar steps refer to the palace terrace; the Dark Emperor, bearing the decree, proceeded to the Eight Radiant Gate of the Grand Empyrean.
The *Red Writ of the Chaotic Cavern* states: "The qi of the nine lights coalesced to form the Nine Empyreans of the Never-Night Heaven."
He beheld the Great Dao of the mighty name.
Laozi said: "I know not its name; I style it the Dao, and by force call it Great." Thus the Primordial Beginning is titled the Great Dao.
He bowed, knelt, and prostrated, then advanced to speak: "By what cause today do I receive this talisman and special decree? Fortunate to behold your compassionate countenance, what is the wondrous intent? I refine and subdue the terrace, humbly receiving the command."
At that time, the Dark Warrior, in audience, bowed his head and listened with reverence, obeying the decree.
The *Veritable Record of the Descended Brush* states: "The Primordial Beginning expounded the Dharma in the Jade Clarity’s sacred realm. The gates of heaven trembled open, and below, baleful qi surged and clashed, suffusing the celestial light. Thereupon, he commanded the Jade Emperor to issue a decree, instructing the Purple Tenuity of the Northern Culmen, the Purple Tenuity Great Emperor, to swiftly depart the Eight Radiant Throne and promptly obey the Vast Heaven’s edict. The Jade Tablet bore the command, and all were seated, saying: 'In yang, it was by encircling King Wu’s punitive expedition against Zhou that the altars of the state were pacified; in yin, it was by dispatching the Dark Warrior to subdue demons that humans and ghosts were separated.'
The Heavenly Worthy proclaimed: 'I observe the grievous qi of the lower realm surging to heaven; the great assembly is alarmed, and the lofty Perfected compete in pity. You shall go there—I esteem this.'
The Dark Warrior thereupon received the command."
The Great Emperor echoed the Jade Sound of the Primordial Beginning.
According to the *Jade Calendar of the Primordial Cavern*: "By the end of the Five Emperors’ era, in the two kalpas of Heavenly Dragon and Han above and the gradual subsiding of the great flood below, the people began to till the soil, and living beings first had sufficient clothing and food. It was then that King Zhou of Yin ruled the world, his licentious heart losing the Dao, deceiving and defying Heaven on high. Daily he committed transgressions, his malevolence and poison rampant. Thus the Six Heavenly Demon Kings were provoked, leading the host of ghosts to perpetrate every calamity, harming the innocent without restraint. Grievous qi coiled and congealed, surging upward to the Grand Empyrean."

The host of sacred perfected and lofty immortals before the Numinous Treasure Dao were all alarmed, moved to compassion and pondering how to deliver this karmic world.

As all beheld the arrival of the Great Mystery Dark Warrior, bearing the sacred command, the Primordial Beginning Most High soothed and instructed: "The Great Dao ought to have its entrusted agent—how I revere this!" Thereupon, the Celestial Court bestowed upon him golden armor, a dark robe, a black banner, and a dark standard, dispatching him by decree to the lower realm to subdue the demons.

Taking leave of Heaven, he turned his radiance back in reflection, unbound his hair and went barefoot, treading upon the tortoise and serpent. The Great Mystery Marshal, bearing the talisman of the Water Emperor, purified the turbid and subdued the perverse.

According to the *Scripture of Responding to the Kalpa*: "In later ages, when demonic influences flourished and extravagant cults arose, the paths of evil daily grew and monthly waxed. Thus the host of perfected ones grieved in pity, for living beings, sunk in delusion and chaos, no longer beheld the Primordial Beginning but turned their thoughts to heterodox currents, abandoning the true teaching." The Great Mystery, obeying the command, untangled bonds and loosed fetters, bestowing wisdom upon the myriad things and serving as a bridge for all, universally guiding them to perceive the Dao. This was called *Turning the Light Back in Reflection to the Upper Prime*.

As recorded in the *Veritable Record of Descended Brushstrokes*, the Most High commanded the Dark Warrior: "You shall go forth with unbound hair and bare feet, treading upon the tortoise and serpent. Your divine retinue shall surge forth like thunder, with heavenly soldiers as your escort." In an instant, he traversed the cosmos, suppressing the cruel and venomous demons, capturing the wanton and rampant pestilences. In the realm of hidden souls, sufferings and ailments were dispelled; humans and ghosts were parted, grievances dissolved. The common people lived in peace, and the land was purified.

The *Record of Divine Manifestations* states: "The demonic hosts encamped and spread across the northeastern wilderness near Mount E, within the ghostly realm." According to the *Veritable Record of Descended Brushstrokes*, the Great Mystery Marshal battled the Six Heavenly Demon Kings in the wilds of the Cavernous Yin. At that time, the Demon Kings transformed the *qi* of Kan and Li into a verdant tortoise and a colossal serpent, which had only just taken form when the Marshal, by divine power, subdued them beneath his feet. The ghostly multitudes were bound in the Great Cavern of Fengdu, and the people at last found peace as the universe was purified.

The *Scripture of Great Peace* records: "The Perfected Lord received the talismanic command, the divine radiance, and the precious scripture from the Primordial Beginning, leading the heavenly soldiers to capture the Demon Kings of the Celestial Pass and Earthly Axis. Suddenly, they appeared as a colossal green-black tortoise, its form shifting five times, and as a serpent of ten thousand *zhang*, its form shifting thrice. The Perfected Lord soared into the sky, pacing the *qian* and treading the Dipper, transforming into a body of a thousand *zhang*. Wielding his sword, he shattered the two demons’ forms: the tortoise shrank to the size of a fist, five *cun* in length, and the serpent to the length of a whip, three *chi*. United, they were trodden beneath the Perfected Lord’s feet."

The transformations of the two demons are here revealed:
The green-black tortoise first transformed, its color like golden light, its shell seams dark green;
Second, its color like jasper, its shell seams suffused with gold;
Third, its color like dark yellow, its shell patterns gleaming green;
Fourth, its color like deep green, its shell seams suffused with silver;
Fifth, its head became that of a dragon, its body that of a giant turtle, emitting purple-golden light, its shell inlaid with jasper.

The colossal serpent first transformed, its form like gold, its scales like cinnabar;
Next, its body appeared in azure-green, its scales woven with golden threads;
Finally, its head resembled a dragon of lapis lazuli, its body dark yellow, its scales interspersed with gold and jade.

The *Sutra of the Primordial Heavenly Venerable on the Perfected Warrior* states: "Leading the Six Ding, Six Jia, Five Thunders, and Eight Mighties, he descended to the lower realm. Within seven days, all the world’s demons were captured and severed, humans and ghosts parted, households dissolved of their bonds."

The *Book of Documents* records: "On the *wu-wu* day, King Wu crossed the Meng Ford; on the *jia-zi* day, he shattered the capital of Zhaoge. Within seven days, he overthrew the Shang, executed Zhou, pacified the altars of soil and grain, dispersed the wealth of Lutai, and distributed the grain of Juqiao. Only then did the common people of the world attain peace." Thus, the land was purified and at peace, all owing to the governance of the Central Heaven’s Purple Tenuity, the Celestial Official Great Emperor, who by decree secretly administered its rise and fall.

The Dark Warrior again beheld the Heavenly Venerable and recounted the power of the Dao, the completion of his task, and the descent of the turbid and ascent of the pure. Having accomplished his righteous war and benevolent punitive campaign, the Dark Emperor again ascended to the Jade Purity to report to the Primordial Beginning. Returning in auspicious radiance, he resumed his original position.

The *Record of Descended Brushstrokes* states: "The Dark Emperor triumphantly returned to the Pure Capital and faced the Golden Portal." The Primordial Beginning declared: "Before the Great Beginning of the Prior Heaven, you were originally the transformation of the Five Numinous Ones of the North, the Dark Elder of the Great Yin, the Celestial One of Purple *Qi*—the root of the ten thousand images. Having passed through two thousand five hundred years, you now return to your original direction, resuming your root and position." Thereupon, the Primordial Beginning commanded the Jade Emperor to issue a jade decree, appointing him to the office of the Right Victorious Mansion of the Northern Culmen. On the Zhongyuan Festival of that year, the decree and treasure were proclaimed in the Purple Tenuity Hall.

The Wondrous Practitioner thus learned of the Purple Prime Lord’s transmission of the Dark Emperor’s method: *Exchanging Qian and Spreading the Dipper*.

*Exchanging Qian and Spreading the Dipper* was the Dark Emperor’s original practice. As the Perfected Scribe of the Purple Tenuity Gallery, when propagating the true teaching, "exchanging *qian*" refers to renewing the virtue of the sun, while "spreading the Dipper" refers to practicing the Way of the Central Culmen. Thus, virtue and the Way subdue all without deliberation.

According to the *Comprehensive Tortoise Collection of Master Du*: "The Supreme Lord’s second dispatch sent the Dark Barbarian and Azure Water Envoy to bestow it upon King Yu of the Si clan. Having received it, Yu labored diligently for his state and exerted himself for the world in matters of irrigation." Yang Xiong’s *Model Sayings* states: "In ancient times, the Si clan governed the waters and soil, and the shamans emulated Yu. Today’s Daoist arts thus first bear the name *Yu’s Step*." Therefore, the methods of the former sages are not the reckless and deceitful practices of today’s shamans and spirit-mediums. Even slight transgressions invite heavenly punishment, as detailed in the ritual protocols at the beginning of the scriptures.

*Stimulating Kun and Pointing the Mainstay* aids the Celestial Pass above.
*Stimulating Kun and Pointing the Mainstay* is also called the method of *Treading the Earth’s Threads and Flying the Heavenly Net*. It unites the power of creation and destruction, activates the mechanism of the Celestial Pass’s revolutions, and manifests the guidance of the Dao. By applying virtue, one attains it. Thus, in great matters, it purifies the cosmos; in small matters, it protects and shelters the myriad people.

In ancient times, from the Middle Antiquity onward, King Yu upheld and practiced the teachings, thereby subduing and taming the fierce flood-dragons, savage beasts, demons, specters, malevolent spirits, and all manner of venomous creatures—expelling them to the farthest reaches. Thereafter, he dredged the rivers and streams, guiding their currents to flow into the Four Seas, so that the people of the world might each dwell securely in their homes.

*Stimulating Kun* is the method of *Treading the Earth’s Threads*. One treads forward and backward in three revolutions, making nine steps in total, thus forming the primordial altar and ritual mat, embodying the capacity of the Kun’s virtue to bear all things. One must recite the altar-founding incantation with reverence, and the spirits will heed the call without fail. The incantation reads:

*"The Qian’s honored radiance shines,
The Kun’s compliance inwardly aligns.
The Two Modes harmonize in peace,
The Six Directions thrive in purity.
Heaven’s match, Earth’s embrace,
Eternal tranquility and clarity.
Resonating with the Primordial Sovereign,
Above the robe, below the skirt.
Zhen ascends, Gen arises,
Kan flows, Li illumines.
Xun governs, Dui brings forth life.
Vacuous steps, dragon’s majesty,
Heaven’s Gate, Earth’s Portal,
Man’s Door, Ghost’s Path—
Who guards me? The August Heaven’s Luminous Lord.
Today’s Yu’s Step,
Aligns with the Celestial Mainstay above.
Ghosts and spirits submit in reverence,
Banishing all inauspiciousness below.
Desires fulfilled as wished,
Manifesting timely numinous radiance.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Supreme Decree commands!"*

*Pointing the Mainstay* is the method of *Flying the Heavenly Net*. Standing at the center of the altar, one traces the joints of the fingers with the left and right hands, extending to the five Dipper’s deviant positions, then flicks and exhales qi to ascend, emulating the revolving jade mechanism and the flowering canopy that shelters all. The mudra is formed with the left hand, all five fingernails concealed—termed the *Seal of the Great Law Lord of All Heavens*. The right hand holds the sword level, reciting incantations toward each direction and consecrating water to spray. The incantation reads:

*"I bathe my body in the moon,
Refine my essence in the sun.
Sun and moon assist my form,
The twenty-eight constellations unite with me.
A thousand calamities, ten thousand misfortunes—dispelled,
My water is pure.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Supreme Decree commands!"*

Upon reciting the incantation to the word *"consecrate,"* one brandishes the sword toward the high ground in the southeast, orally drawing in the numinous qi of the Jade Clarity of Divine Empyrean, and visualizes it. Then, one sips the pure water from the vessel and sprays it forth.

Once the altar is established, one must still guard against malevolent forces, lest defilement or corruption taint the ritual master’s garments. According to celestial statutes, punitive measures are to be enacted as follows:

The *Grotto-Heaven Blade Branch* and *Earth-Core Blade Branch* dispel evil;
The *Human Blade Branch*, *Metal Blade Branch*, *Wood Blade Branch*, *Water Blade Branch*, *Fire Blade Branch*, and *Earth Blade Branch* vanquish bandits and raiders.
The *Blade Branch* severs plague demons,
The *Blade Branch* slays flood-dragons,
The *Blade Branch* subdues the Seven Demons,
Executes the Two Ghosts,
The *Blade Branch* shatters the Five Sufferings, Eight Adversities, and Nine Calamities,
Eradicates the hundred diseases.
If evil persons seek to harm, one presses the third joint of the left little finger to subdue and vanquish their malice, causing the perpetrator to suffer misfortune. Pressing the third joint of the right little finger grants them life and releases them. This is called the *Dispelling Evil Blade Branch Method*.

Further scriptural instructions exist but are not fully recorded here. This is indeed the ladder to profound mysteries and the gateway to primordial truth. Should a practitioner of steadfast intent officiate at the altar and encounter any malevolent, anomalous, or inauspicious entities, it is fitting to show mercy once. However, one must not rashly establish this altar or carelessly execute the slaughter of spirits, lest the ritual master’s hidden virtue be diminished.

The *Yu’s Step* here recorded must not be casually transmitted to the uninitiated. As they remain unenlightened, it is presented for the benefit of beginners whose names have not yet been registered in the celestial rolls through proper ordination. Those who have not received transmission from a master must not presume to practice it.

The incantation further states:

This incantation is the great divine mantra of the Dark Emperor’s original deeds. When recited, it establishes the nine-step net’s boundary within the demonic camp, aiding the Celestial Pass above, flying to enshroud the Six Directions and Eight Extremities, and seizing control of victory. Reciting this mantra once, its authority prevails mightily. Within seven days, the myriad demons of the Six Heavens are fully subdued.

In the *Great Beginning* and *Great Simplicity*,
The *Great Beginning* was a vast expanse, nameless and formless.
At the inception of the *Great Simplicity*, there was yet no shape.
No image, no form—
The Dao is originally imageless,
Merging with spontaneity.
Virtue is originally formless,
Establishing the primordial root.
None knew the heavy and turbid,
Its bounds untransformed,
Its measure unknown.
The heavy and turbid congealed and settled,
Who could discern the light and pure?
Encompassing yet undivided,
Its compass unknowable.
The light and pure ascended and clarified,
Accumulating yang to form Heaven.

I, within the primordial chaos—
The Dark Emperor, distinct and resolute,
Preceding Heaven and Earth in the chaos,
Transformed images and divided auspices.
Separating darkness and light—
The *Xu* and *Wei* constellations’ luster,
The true essence of *Kan* and *Li*,
Assisting the sun and moon,
Dividing darkness and light.
Heaven attained its vigor,
Heaven received the One qi,
Qian’s strength shone forth,
Crystalline and resplendent,
Weaving day and night.
Earth attained its tranquility,
Earth received the One qi,
Kun’s compliance bore all,
Firm and utterly still,
Sustaining the boundless.
The people attained sustenance,
Humanity embraced the One,
Endowed with harmonious balance,
Few desires, little selfishness,
Their years and kalpas multiplied.
All things attained sprouting,
The myriad things never exhausted,
Burgeoning from the One,
Their origins inexhaustible,
Interacting and flowing.
Evil attained rectification,
The yin and the myriad杂,
Their kinds diverse,
The Great Mystery’s One rectifies all.
Spirits attained numinosity,
Spiritual clarity received the One,
Transforming naturally,
Luminous and expansive,
Illuminating boundlessly.
Within the Three Powers,
Heaven and Earth unite as One,
The primordial qi is formless,
Humans attain primordial awareness,
Penetrating inner illumination.
The myriad kinds flourish,
The lord of the state receives the One,
All people prosper,
Insects and plants,
Each fulfills its life.
The Great Dao dispersed,
The Dao preceded the Supreme Ultimate,
The root of Heaven and Earth,
Scattering into the myriad things,
All relying on its generation.
Benevolence and righteousness arose,
Heaven’s virtue, great virtue,
Yin and yang, soft and hard,
Now termed *punishment* and *virtue*,
Initiating their application and concealment.

Rites and music having arisen,
The Three Canons and Five Rites
Ordered human relations with restraint.
Music’s systems established,
Nine transformations revealed purity.
Yet perversity and deceit spread,
Externally exhausted, internally decayed—
Abandoning rites, forsaking music,
Violence, insolence, and treachery
Arose in reckless profusion.
The Six Principles were lost,
Ruler and minister confounded,
Father and son disordered,
Husband and wife estranged—
The Six Principles wholly undone.
The Four Peoples contended.
The Four Occupations honored scholars,
Then farmers, artisans, merchants,
Each failing to master their craft,
Vying in envy and boastful strength.
Above, no magnanimity:
King Zhou’s tyranny and cruelty,
The Dao diminished, laws collapsed,
No lenience shown,
The state imperiled, its borders forgotten.
Below, no loyalty:
Flattering lords, exalting tigers,
Favorites and ministers expanded,
Punishments multiplied—roasting and branding—
Chaos reigned, no fidelity remained.
Some became demons, some ghosts:
Six afflictions brought punishment,
Deluded spirits and plague ghosts emerged,
Calamity struck everywhere,
Unrelenting misfortune endured.
Some became specters, some spirits:
Heaven’s disasters, earth’s harms,
Omens appeared, baleful vapors arose,
The hundred grains failed to ripen,
Legacy plagues became epidemics.
Indulging in cruelty and poison,
People grew vicious and overbearing,
Feeding on bitterness, gratifying desires,
Burying curses, glutting on victory,
Shortening human lifespans.
Disturbing the lives of the people:
Heretical ways and demonic arts,
Wandering malevolence, erupting curses,
Disrupting the people’s lives,
Extorting illicit gains.
Entire households afflicted:
Dark schemes and mutual harm,
Retribution met with execution,
Bodies tainted by accumulated evil,
Whole families stricken.
Years of penal suffering:
Years and months accumulated,
Renouncing benevolence and righteousness,
Loyalty and filial piety wholly abandoned,
Condemned by yin, judged by yang.
Wealth and possessions dissipated:
Nameless riches,
How long could they fill the house?
Suddenly scattered,
Descendants could not preserve them.
Kin left solitary:
Blood ties and flesh,
Who would willingly sever them?
Alone, like birds
Temporarily flocking.
Lives cut short in vain:
Lives lightly cast away,
Through self-inflicted transgressions,
After death,
Falling into demonic realms.
Disasters and misfortunes entwined:
Three disasters, six harms,
How could they wrongly entangle you?
Punishment descends upon you,
Sins filling to the brim.
Foul and impure qi:
Mutually harming living things,
Fattening the belly—
How could one know the essence of filth?
Obscuring the Three Luminaries,
Ascending to the Celestial Court.
The kalpa’s end neared,
All evils mutually punished,
Seven cries of curses,
Exhaled to reach the Celestial Court.
The Heavenly Honored One issued a decree:
The Primordial Beginning, in compassionate creation,
Opened the gate of vast expedience,
And commanded the Dark Emperor
To universally save all beings.
Let us attain peace:
The Dark Emperor, by edict,
Bestowed universal blessings upon living beings,
The Three Origins’ men and women
All gathered in tranquility.
All specters shall be eradicated:
If any spirits or demons
Erupt untimely in pestilence,
Defying his command,
They shall be seized and cut down.
No ghost shall escape boiling:
Nameless ghostly entities,
Daring to rise in ferocity,
Inciting calamity, demanding sacrifices,
Shall be hunted and cooked.
The officials of epidemics:
The Eight Divisions and Five Pestilences,
Who oversee the wicked,
Shall not permit the spread of poison
To harm the innocent.
Bound and submissive:
Those who dare disobey
Shall be allowed to display their ferocity,
Seized, bound, and shackled,
Beaten and flogged.
Ghosts and spirits annihilated:
Manifestations of gods and ghosts,
Daring to act with ferocity,
Harboring malevolent spirits,
Shall be uniformly exterminated.
Evil demons overthrown:
Demons guarding ghostly posts,
Consorting with perversity—unacceptable.
The Supreme Mystery shall know all,
Offenders shall be toppled.
I command ten billion valiant warriors:
The Supreme Mystery’s marshals lead heroic legions,
Rain Masters, Wind Lords,
Lightning Mothers, Thunder Lords,
Generals Jia and Geng,
The Eight Slayers, Celestial Stems,
The Six Jia Great Spirits,
Earth Rulers, City Gods.
Fifty million troops:
The Supreme Mystery holds office,
Overseeing all camps,
Commanding the armies,
Fifty million soldiers.
Heaven above, earth below:
Soaring through heaven, overturning earth,
Protecting the common people,
Governing within and without,
Subduing demons, controlling spirits.
Following my ascent and descent:
Waving banners, drumming in procession,
Rising and falling without cease,
Protecting heaven, aiding earth,
Extending grace to humanity.
Those who resist me shall perish:
There is King Gun,
Who defied the Dark Emperor’s sacred decree—
Instantly destroyed.

King Gun embarked on his official career, indulging in delicacies of milk, turtle, and eel. At every post he held, he demanded his subordinates procure these creatures to sate his cravings. His wife and children, who revered the incense and flame of True Warrior, often urged him to abstain from such fare, but Gun paid no heed.

One day, appointed as Commissioner of the Imperial Carriage Bureau to govern Xingzhou, he journeyed alone to his post. Suddenly, he was stricken with agonizing heart pain, groaning day and night, helpless against the torment. He heard voices calling for his life, and a host of turtles and eels swarmed to gnaw at his flesh. Then, a disheveled divine figure arrived, wielding a sword to drive them away. Gun revived unharmed, realizing it was True Warrior who had saved him. Upon completing his term and returning home, he commissioned the transcription of a full canon of scriptures, which he donated to Yanfu Abbey in gratitude to the celestial court.

Soon after, he received an imperial summons to serve as Vice Chancellor of the Directorate of Education. Boarding a boat to the capital, he encountered a Daoist on the banks of the Bian River, who read his fortune and said: "You shall surely be appointed Compiler-in-Chief upon arrival, but I fear you will also be assigned to oversee the affairs of the *geng* and *xin* directions. You must decline this post, or else both your lifespan and fortune will be cut short—you will starve to death in the snow, your bones left unburied." Enraged, Gun rebuked the diviner, who vanished in an instant.

Upon reaching the capital, Gun was indeed granted the title of Imperial Censor and Academician of the Tianzhang Pavilion. He was then dispatched to the Western Regions, where his critical remarks toward the Tibetan ruler Li Wanquan brought humiliation upon the state. Fearing punishment under his own country’s laws, he fled at the border, enticing his attendants to join him in Yangshan. There, a relentless snowstorm trapped them beneath a rocky overhang, where they languished without fire or food.

Suddenly, True Warrior descended from the heavens, rebuking him: "Gun, you spurned my warning on the banks of the Bian. What now?" Gun, realizing his folly, could only repent too late. Gradually, he wasted away in darkness, starving to death.

Those who heed me shall live:
Take Sun Cheng, who faithfully served the Dark Emperor. Even at death’s door, he was restored to life.

Sun Cheng, a Vice Minister of Justice temporarily assigned as Hanlin Academician and Reader-in-Waiting, was appointed imperial envoy to the Western Regions. While passing through the road to Fengxiang, a commoner approached him and said: "Are you not bound as envoy to the Western Tibetans? This mission is not fated for your destiny. If you proceed, you will face peril, and many will suffer with you. To escape calamity, you must fervently invoke the name of my master, True Warrior, and you shall attain the full measure of your heavenly allotted lifespan."

"I, too, once served the state," the man continued, "but now I hold the immortal office of overseeing the affairs of the Three Luo Mountains, Jade Peak, the Jasper Flask Grotto, and the Dragon Pool. I am Zhong Jinming, and I came especially to warn you." With that, he vanished.

Upon reflection, Sun Chengzhi proceeded to the western frontier and attended a banquet hosted by the Tibetan ruler Li Xijing. By chance, a poetic prompt was presented: *"The sun and moon rise in the east and set in the west"*—a seven-character line. Chengzhi found himself unable to compose a matching verse, enraging the ruler, who ordered him bound and imprisoned. Overcome with terror and humiliation, fearing disgrace to the state, he returned to the court only to face execution.

In his moment of utmost dread, Chengzhi recited the sacred name of True Warrior several times. Soon after, a memorandum from the Chancellery and the Secretariat arrived in haste, stating: *"Sun Chengzhi merits execution. However, considering his prior encounter with the divine messenger Zhong Jinming, who foretold the outcome of his mission, it is evident that the state should not recklessly impose such a severe penalty. By imperial decree, his crime is pardoned."*

A separate edict was issued to Fengxiang Prefecture, commanding the construction of a shrine hall for Zhong Jinming, where his statue was to be enshrined in the likeness of a white-robed immortal. He was canonized as *Immortal Guide of Serene Virtue* (Shandao Anji Xianjun), his glory eternally celebrated for aiding the nation. Thus, Chengzhi, through his devotion, was delivered from death and granted new life.

*"Those who revile me bring only shame upon themselves."*

Among the worldly multitude, there are many ignorant sorts who, through wickedness, offend the Mysterious Emperor. By their bodily and verbal transgressions, they invite only disgrace upon themselves. Consider the case of the rogues Feng Chongda, Gao Shaolang, and You Xinger from Zizhou. These three men formed a gang and frequented the seedy quarters of the riverside. One day, they went to the home of the diviner Lu Qian to have their fortunes told. Before the incense and the image of the True Warrior, they drew a lot, but the omen was inauspicious. They immediately hurled abuse, cursing foully as they departed.

Thereafter, in the two prefectures of Kui and Fu, a band of fierce brigands arose, plundering the wealth of wealthy households and killing the official Yang Zhujiao. The constables were unable to capture them. At the time, the Vice Minister of Justice, Zhang Shiming, was serving as Pacification Commissioner. He issued a proclamation offering rewards and called upon all manner of people to come forward with information. Within the allotted time, Lu Qian suddenly appeared to lodge a complaint, stating that the perpetrators were Feng Chongda, Gao Shaolang, and You Xinger from Zizhou. Together with the constables, he went to the side of Longxing Temple in Zizhou, where they were all apprehended. When brought to Kuifu, however, they vanished in an instant. The case of the brigands was documented and transferred to Zizhou, where Lu Qian was summoned to claim his reward. Yet Lu refused to sign the confession or submit the required documents, repeatedly insisting: *"My family has, for three generations, made a living by selling divination lots, and we have always revered the True Warrior. Though it is true that Feng Chongda and the others once came to my home to draw lots, and the omen was inauspicious, they immediately cursed the Sage and left. I never left my home to report this matter to the authorities."*

Upon reviewing the case, the commander of Kuifu examined the circumstances and memorialized the throne. The Three Departments deliberated and concluded: *"Were it not for the unseen aid of the True Warrior, how could such a band of outlaws, who harmed officials and preyed upon the people, have been captured?"* The reward, amounting to seven parts, was duly granted to Lu Qian to be used for incense and offerings in atonement. As for Feng Chongda and his accomplices, their crimes were referred to the market executioner for dismemberment. Is it not evident that those who revile and dishonor the True Warrior fail to show reverence and faith? The retribution is swift indeed.

Those who honor me shall be exalted. Consider Di Qing, whose reverence moved the Mysterious Emperor to descend in majesty and attach himself to Di’s person, aiding him in attaining glory. Di Qing, a native of Xihe in Fen Prefecture, had in his youth served as a scribe in his village. He diligently maintained the incense and offerings to the True Warrior. In the early years of the Baoyuan era, one night he encountered a spirit who bestowed upon him gold and a white robe. Hearing of the military campaign in Shaanxi, he wished to join the effort. He prayed to the True Warrior and drew a lot to determine an auspicious direction before setting out. Upon reaching Yan’an Prefecture, he presented himself to Fan Zhongyan, the Military Commissioner and Gentleman for Dispersing Orders. At first sight, Fan recognized him as an extraordinary man and appointed him as an aide. Di Qing was sent to confront the two million invading troops of Zhao Yuanhao. Through repeated battles, he achieved repeated victories, and the military commanders all hailed him as *"the Heavenly General of the North."* His fame reached the ears of the Campaign Commander, Han Qi, who memorialized the throne on Di Qing’s behalf. Subsequently, by imperial decree, Di Qing and a company of twenty-eight aides, including Liao Dao, were summoned to the capital. Each day, they were permitted to don their armor and wooden swords and perform a martial dance in the Jiade Guangzhen Hall. There, they demonstrated their equestrian formations before Emperor Renzong. Among their number, one man stood out for his radiant and imposing presence. Before his horse, a tortoise and serpent frolicked upon the ground. As Minister Song Xiang was presenting his report, the luminous figure suddenly vanished. The emperor inquired as to Di Qing’s position in the formation, and Di’s response accorded with the imperial perception. He was then appointed Commander of the Capital’s Cavalry and Infantry. He was further dispatched to pacify the western frontier. Upon hearing of his approach, Zhao Yuanhao submitted and sued for peace. When the barbarian chieftain Nong Zhigao rebelled in the two Guang provinces, Di Qing once again achieved victory. By imperial decree, he was appointed Military Affairs Commissioner, concurrently overseeing the Bureau of Military Affairs, the Court of Imperial Entertainments, and the nationwide administration of military, horse, salt, and iron affairs. He lived to the age of fifty, at which time he underwent liberation through the corpse. He was posthumously enfeoffed as Duke Wuxiang. Thus, through his lifelong devotion to the True Sage, his name shone brightly even after death.

Those who pay me ritual homage shall enjoy longevity. Consider Wu Yuansi, who, through his sincere observance of the rites to the Mysterious Emperor, was blessed with longevity for his entire family. Yuansi’s household resided in Baisha Village, Jiangdu, Yangzhou, where they farmed and lived by the plow. Each winter, they held a grand sacrifice to the Three Realms, giving thanks for the blessings and protection of the gods. One day, they happened to encounter the Daoist Tang Qingyu from Taizhou, who had come to their door to solicit alms and provisions. Observing the Wu household employing a spirit-medium and arranging the altars of the celestial bureaus, mingling the True Warrior with common deities and offering bloody sacrifices in the same manner, Tang admonished Yuansi: *"Have you not heard that the True Warrior of the Central Heaven descends each month to inspect the good and evil deeds of humanity? If you rely on spirit-mediums and offer impure sacrifices, you risk offending the celestial realm, turning blessings into calamity."*

Upon hearing this, Yuansi turned his heart toward sincere faith. He commissioned Daoist rites, reconstructing the rituals with proper solemnity. On the day of the fast, over twenty wandering Daoists arrived to attend the gathering. The Daoist Chen Boyang bowed and inquired after their origins. One among them replied: *"We have learned that a prayer assembly is being held here and have come from the realm beyond to attend."* When the feast concluded, they departed, leaving behind a black robe upon the seat. It shimmered with radiant light and emitted a wondrous fragrance. Yuansi knelt in reverence and carefully preserved it.

Thereafter, when officials were ordered to register the elderly in their jurisdictions, it was found that in the Wu household alone, eight individuals had surpassed a hundred years of age. Among them, Wu Gui had reached the age of one hundred and fourteen. His steps were light and vigorous, and he attended the imperial banquet with unimpaired sight and hearing. When the prefect Chen Suping inquired into the circumstances, he memorialized the throne accordingly. The emperor specially granted Wu Gui an official title and ordered the construction of a commemorative gate to honor his filial piety, ritual propriety, and longevity.

Those who reject me shall perish. High-ranking officials and powerful ministers who do not believe in the Mysterious Emperor, who slander his descending admonitions as false and absurd, shall be swiftly struck down by malignant illness and die. Consider Chen Zhi, a minister under the usurper Wang Yanzheng of Min. When he learned that Li Sheng, the Founding Ancestor of Southern Tang, intended to invade Min territory and had already advanced his troops to the border, he was suddenly forced to retreat. The ruler of Min, upon hearing the report, grew suspicious and dispatched Shao Kang to deliver a letter to the Southern Tang court, seeking an explanation. The Southern Tang replied: *"When I personally led my troops to the border, I saw a divine host emerging from the clouds to greet me. One among them declared: ‘I am the Local Deity of Xianyuan in the Min Mountains. By the command of the True Warrior, my Enlightened Lord, I have come to admonish Your Majesty. You must cease hostilities to secure good fortune and spare the people from suffering. Moreover, the fate of the Min ruler’s lineage is not yet exhausted. In the year Gengwu, he shall ascend to the celestial realm. Furthermore, the territory of Min is not destined to belong to Your Majesty.’"*

Upon the deity’s departure, I thus withdrew my troops.

In gratitude to the True Warrior, I performed the jiao offering and presented a memorial that very night, wherein I received a revelation concerning the "Ascent to the Celestial Realm"—this pertained to the Zhou’s fire mandate and the Southern Face Hall plaque of the Song ruler.

Upon reading the letter, the ruler of Min convened his officials to discuss peace. Only Chen Zhihan, Military Commissioner of Shaowu, vehemently opposed the proposal, insisting: *"The great enterprise of our state cannot be abandoned on the basis of empty, fantastical words. I submit that we should never seek reconciliation with the Southern Tang. Instead, let us raise our armies and punish them."*

After leaving court, Zhihan returned home. Soon after dismounting, he fell into a frenzy, shrieking that he had erred in defying the virtue of the divine void. Moments later, he collapsed, blood gushing from his seven orifices, and died an ill-omened death.

By this decree, the Dark Emperor swears:
To govern all that is to come,
The Great Mysterious Code encompasses all things.
Let humans and spirits alike heed:
Those who follow the true Way shall erase their transgressions;
Spirits shall harm none and be freed from exile, ascending in rank.
Swiftly, as the Great Mysterious Law commands!

Turn your thoughts with haste and act as bidden.
The Great Mysterious Lord of Unity,
Most divine, most refined,
Brings forth prosperity and nurtures the flowering of essence.
His law and command govern all,
Delivering sentient beings.

He holds sway over the Three Realms,
Near and far in an instant,
Recording evil, preserving good,
Restraining and seizing the wicked.
His decrees manifest clearly—
As demonstrated by recent human affairs,
And compiled in the *Memorials to the Sage-Initiator*,
All are well aware.

For those who heed or disregard the Dark Emperor’s scriptures, incantations, teachings, admonitions, and models of conduct, retribution is plainly recorded in the annals.

Moreover, the Dark Emperor’s oath—*"Let humans and spirits alike heed"*—reveals the two paths of life and death, the causes of misfortune and blessing, all under the jurisdiction of the Great Mysterious Heavenly Court.

The Great Sage of the Dark Heavens commands the divine host,
Illuminating like the sun, moon, and stars,
Transforming like thunder, lightning, wind, and rain.
On Jia and Geng days, the duty generals govern the corpse-spirits within the body.
The eight seasonal qi spirits, in their ordered sequence, oversee the good and evil of the human heart.

All is subject to the decree of the Northern Pole Emperor,
Retribution issued from the Right Victory Office.
Those who do good shall be blessed with a hundred fortunes,
Their prosperity flowing to descendants.
Those who do evil shall be cursed with a hundred calamities,
Their legacy extinguished, their line severed.

Though the foolish may delude themselves, believing they have escaped,
When the day of reckoning arrives,
They shall traverse every evil realm.
Yet the Dark Emperor, in his compassion, still grants absolution.

The *Record of the Sage-Initiator* states:
*"Wherever dwellings are afflicted by ancient tombs, towering forests, or lingering souls of the restless dead—entities that, over time, become spirits, clinging to grasses and trees, dripping blood, hurling fire and stones at gates—or where mountain and river deities, earth-shrine spirits, or those who gather in private temples, illicitly establish incense altars, or where sorcerers and mediums convene, giving rise to malevolent forces that extort offerings from households, harassing and ruining the people—let all who suffer such demonic afflictions revere the incense of the True Warrior. They shall attain true rectitude, forever subduing all demons, and welcome auspiciousness into a purified household."*

At that time, the Wondrously Practiced Perfected One—
*"At that time"* refers to the conclusion of this segment of the original transmission’s causes and conditions.

The Wondrously Practiced Perfected One, through cultivating the fundamental practices of the earth and engaging in manifold acts of guidance and enlightenment, had yet to awaken and lead forth those who sought learning.

The August Heavenly Worthy of the Void said: "Before your birth, all was chaos, undifferentiated—nothing existed. Sight and hearing could not unite with the True and Constant; without luminous signs, what could be called wondrous practice?"

He further declared: "With concentrated mind and arduous practice, sever all worldly desires. Let no deluded thoughts arise, no attachments cling. Refine spirit with qi, refine form with spirit, until both form and spirit attain subtlety. The body merges with spontaneity, gathering the myriad dharmas into one self, dispersing the one self to transform into the myriad scenes. Unbound by existence or non-existence, forever transcending birth and death—this is called a Perfected One."

Countless Flying Heavenly Deities and Lords, innumerable speakers, and the Flying Heavenly Mounted Attendants all attended the assembly at once, their numbers beyond reckoning. The Flying Heavenly Deity-Kings, appointed by the Five Elder Thearchs to their offices, oversee the heavens day and night without respite.

The *Chapter on Generating Spirit* states: "They encompass the Heavenly Immortals, harmonizing the myriad transformations, nurturing and tending to the multitudes."

The assembly of True Immortals—*The Scripture on Stabilizing Contemplation of the Numinous Treasure* says: "Those who extend their years for thousands of ages are called Immortals."

The Perfected One of True Yang said: "Immortals ascend through five ranks: ghost immortals, human immortals, earth immortals, spirit immortals, and heavenly immortals."

The *Śūraṅgama Sūtra* states: "There are ten kinds of immortals in cultivation: earth-walking immortals, flying immortals, wandering immortals, void-walking immortals, heavenly-walking immortals, penetrating immortals, illuminating immortals, Dao-walking immortals, essence-walking immortals, and absolute-walking immortals."

Generally, those who have accrued merit in the Dao and conduct in the world, whose merit and conduct are complete, ascend to dwell in the Grotto-Heavens. There, they assume offices and are ranked among the Immortal Officials. If they further render great merit to heaven and earth and great conduct across past and present, they gradually advance through the immortal ranks, ascending through the thirty-six Grotto-Heavens and the eighty-one Yang Heavens, transcending into the realm of spontaneity and non-being—these are called True Immortals.

Upon hearing these teachings, all present leapt for joy, bowed in reverence, and extolled the merit and virtue. The secret records, inscribed on jade tablets, were sealed and presented to the Grand Pure Palace of the Supreme Ultimate when the discourse of the Great Thearch of Purple Tenuity concluded. The Starry Perfected Ones and the Immortal Assemblies all knelt to take their leave, rising together to praise the sublime virtues of the Dark Thearch. These records, vast as the jade tablets, were sealed and conveyed to the Grand Pure Palace of the Supreme Ultimate. In accordance with the Mysterious Statutes, they are transmitted to the Worthy Ones of the lower realms once every forty thousand kalpas, and have long been revered and practiced.

The Great Thearch further affirmed this scripture, saying: "Will the Most High surely entrust this to a banished immortal for transmission to the human world? Indeed, it was bestowed upon the Han dynasty’s Recluse Zhang for circulation."

Thereafter, banished immortals transmitted it to the human world, urging them to live diligently and avoid killing—such was the intent of the Most High.

"Hereafter" refers to the period from the Middle Antiquity onward. As for banished immortals, they are perfected beings punished by the Supreme Emperor, condemned to retain their forms and descend into the mortal realm. Only after receiving a special pardon from the Supreme Emperor may they ascend again. Let us recount a few examples:

Heavenly Master Zhang was banished for ten years due to his excessive severity in slaying ghosts. The Perfected Lord Xu of the Western Jin was condemned to twelve years for failing to honor his ancestors, thereby committing the crime of disobedience and regicide.

The *Household Transmission of the Han Heavenly Master* states: In the first year of Emperor Zhi’s *Benchu* reign (the *bingshu* year), the Perfected One sought to traverse and pacify the mountains. He moved to Yuntai Mountain in Guizhou, where he built a chamber. After residing there for forty-nine days, he suddenly heard celestial music resounding in the sky. Gazing upward with solemn reverence, he beheld the Most High Lord Lao leading his retinue, lingering for a long while without descending. Presently, an emissary delivered a decree: "Daoling, based on your meritorious deeds, you are fit to assume the rank of Supreme Immortal of the Nine Perfected. However, for your entry into Shu to subdue the ghostly prisoners of the netherworld, you improperly summoned wind and rain, disturbed the stars, commanded the deities, and shook the mountains and rivers. The killing aura darkened the skies, lacking the virtue of cherishing life. The Supreme Emperor has issued a decree of punishment: you shall remain in the mortal realm for now, which is why the Most High cannot draw near to you." The Perfected One listened with trepidation.

Another messenger then called out to Daoling: "The decree from the Lord of the Lower Primordial has absolved your transgressions."

The decree specially grants you the Three Eights for atonement, erasing the Black Register, and delivering the sacred writ of the Mystic Ancestor. The Perfected One bowed in acceptance, and only then did the sagely procession depart. The Perfected One then returned to reside on Mount Heming.

The *Scripture of the Southern Dipper* states: "The Most High descended for the third time, bestowing a thousand scrolls of scriptures—all essential teachings for cultivation—intending to transmit them to those of the Dao, that they might attain deliverance in this very body and abide eternally through endless kalpas."

In the second year of Yongshou during the reign of Emperor Huan, the Perfected One entrusted all categories of scriptures, registers, and seals to his eldest son, Heng, with these instructions: "Let each generation henceforth pass this to one son, and transmit it to none but our clan’s lineal descendants." Three years after Heng’s succession, in the ninth month, the Perfected One once more journeyed to Mount Yuntai and ascended at noon on the ninth day.

In the second year of Guanghe during the reign of Emperor Ling, the year *jiwei*, Heng retired to Mount Yangping in Pengzhou, where he transmitted the teachings to his eldest son, Lu. Lu later moved to Nanzheng City in Hanzhong. By the year *yiwei* during the reign of Emperor Xian, Cao Cao, the Duke of Wei, conquered the city. Lu’s younger brother, Zhang Wei, was executed, but Lu declined the offer of enfeoffment and, at the end of the Jian’an era, passed the ancestral teachings to his eldest son, Zi, who had no heir.

His younger brother, Sheng, carrying the burden of the lineage, journeyed south to the lands of Sun Quan of Wu. Arriving at the summit of Mount Long in Shangrao Prefecture, he beheld the lingering traces of the ancestral Perfected One—cinnabar caves, wells, and stoves still remained. Thereupon, he built a hut at the mountain’s foot and took up residence.

In the year *dingsi*, upon hearing that Emperor Ming of Wei had conquered Shu and that the ancestral Perfected One’s family repository had been burned, Zhao Cheng hastened back to Shu. He inherited the dharma seat from his elder cousin Zi and returned it to Sun Hao.

In the first year of Ganlu, the year *jiazi*, he established the Orthodox Unity Mystic Altar at his dwelling, transmitting the ancestral secret methods and talismans to all quarters, initiating and instructing disciples. Among the graded registers was the *Secret Record of the Supreme General of the Mystic Heavenly Perfected Warrior*, which was disseminated upon request.

Disciples of the Dao, bow your heads and uphold these teachings. Those who truly practice them shall exhort one another, and all who hear of this shall do likewise.

Following the moral teachings of this scripture, which first cultivates the five human relationships—ruler and minister, father and son, husband and wife, elder and younger brothers, and friends—those who wholeheartedly embrace its faith without transgressing principle shall naturally attain a pure heart and a luminous spirit, penetrating the profound essence of the *Meng* and *Tai* hexagrams. Many have achieved manifest virtue through this path. This is indeed the ever-radiant teaching; how could it ever perish?

Yet though it suffered destruction in Wei and dispersal in the Western Jin, there remained reclusive adepts who preserved its truths. Through transmission and transcription into multiple versions, each with its own lineage of transmission, the origins of the Perfected Warrior’s cause are recounted—though their details vary, their fundamental meaning remains largely the same. These texts now circulate in the world under the title *Jade Stem Transmission*.

During the *Yuankang* era of Emperor Hui of the Western Jin, the Daoist Perfected Lord Huang Fu transmitted the *Scripture of the Northern Dipper and Perfected Warrior*. In the *Xianhe* era of Emperor Cheng of the Eastern Jin, Daoist Ji Wenhua received the *Purple Radiance Scripture* from the Primordial Lady of Purple Vacuity, while the Perfected Lord Wang of Pure Emptiness Grotto transmitted the *Scripture of Great Peace*. Celestial Master Kou Qianzhi later presented it to Emperor Taiwu of the Northern Wei.

The *Perfected Warrior Scripture of the Purple Tenuity Divine Incantations, Numinous Treasure, and the Great Spontaneous Divine Soldiers for Protecting the State and Dispelling Demons* emerged in the time of Emperor Xuanzong of Tang, transmitted through the lineage of Perfected Master Su. The scripture states: In the second year of the *Shanghuang* era, on the eighth day of the third month, the Venerable Lord expounded upon the *Xu* and *Wei* constellations in the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace, entrusting his essence to the responsive transformation of the Sacred Father and Mystic Mother. His surname arose from the conjoining of the Three Qi into a great mass, which, in the *jianshen* month, split at dawn to form a being five hundred *zhang* in length.

The *Scripture of the Perfected Warrior’s Karmic Origins*, transmitted orally by the Master of Embracing Simplicity and the Perfected of the Great Ultimate, shares a similar purport with the original transmission. However, some corrupted passages describe the *Xu* and *Wei* constellations entrusting their essence in the Palace of Vast Spirit, transforming into a great mass that split at dawn on the seventh day of the *jianshen* month—details that invite skepticism, particularly the ambiguity regarding his parents.

As *Zhuangzi* says: "Seventy percent of my words are parables; my daily utterances are like the overflowing of a goblet." Moreover, the patterns of heaven reside above, while the patterns of humanity reside in the middle; neither can be altered, for they are the natural patterns that transform people.

The *Marvelous Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Perfected Warrior, Great Sage of the Mystic Heaven, and His Original Transmission* was personally received by Celestial Master Zhang Daoling of Han from the Venerable Lord of the Great Ultimate. The *Veritable Record of the Perfected Warrior, Preceptor of Jade Vacuity* was compiled by the Divine Responsive and Benevolent Primordial Lord Dong, Chief Minister of the Heavenly Mechanism in the Seven Treasures Purple Tenuity Palace of the Great Luo Heaven, and transmitted to the Daoist Zhang Mingdao.

The Perfected Lord declared: "The Jade Register of the Mystic Emperor is a secret celestial text, not to be heard in the middle or lower realms. Now, at the behest of the Veritable Record, it is transcribed from the Mystic Capital."

The Preface by Zhang, Perfected of Primordial Unity and Inspector of the Grotto-Heaven on Mount Wushan in the Golden Watchtower, states: "The texts of the primordial pre-celestial era do not descend to the middle or lower realms but are concealed in the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace and the Mystic Capital’s repository, transmitted but once in ten thousand kalpas—how could they be casually known? Thus, the deeds of the Mystic Emperor before the pre-celestial era remain beyond comprehension. Even the true lords of the middle realm dare not speak of them, so profound is their reverence. How much less could the common folk of the lower realm, who merely hear and repeat tales, grasp their meaning?

Now, unless one is a high minister who has refined his spirit through alchemical practice, penetrated the secret texts, and attained self-realization, how could the teachings be widely disseminated? Only thus can all under heaven come to know the profound mysteries. In this way, one may truly understand Confucius and Śākyamuni, and without relying on a master, attain the subtlest truths and fathom their vastness.

Having learned that the *Veritable Record* has been bestowed upon the famous mountains and inscribed upon bamboo slips, I dare not remain silent. With incense lit, I respectfully compose this preface to commemorate its origins."

I, humble and fortunate, have lived in an age of flourishing transmission and have compiled these secret celestial texts. Though distinctions exist, they are recorded here to illuminate the mind without extinction. Those who recite and uphold these teachings shall, according to their merit, attain inconceivable virtues. Together, they shall invoke the inner talismans of *Xu* and *Wei*, aiding the perfection of the spirit of water and fire, and ensuring manifest blessings. Not only will their names be inscribed on the Jade Tablets of the Great Clarity, granting them a share in rebirth, but they shall surely receive boundless fortune.

Here ends the sixth fascicle of the *Annotated Marvelous Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Perfected Warrior, Great Sage of the Mystic Heaven, and His Original Transmission*, as expounded by the Venerable Lord of the Great Ultimate.

chunks.original_text: 太上说玄天大圣真武本传神咒妙经注 经名：太上说玄天大圣真武本传神魂妙经注。 宋陈伀集疏。 六卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞神部玉诀类。 太上说玄天大圣真武本传神咒妙经注卷之一 郦人方田子佩升玄内教箓陈伀集疏 太上，太者尊也，上者高也。 乃太古造道之祖，是玉清圣境无上法王元始上帝、上清真境三界医王灵宝上帝、太清仙境十方导师混元上帝，天地人之祖炁，本三清上帝出。 《淮南子》曰：太上之道，生万物而不有，成万象而不宰。 又曰：太上养化，其次正法。 是故此世历代人主，追尊三清，并号太上之称也。 说者，释也。 乃太上演说诸部经法，皆引进妙门之渐。 《老子》曰：太上立德，其次立功。 按此经乃出北极宫紫微令紫微大帝，准太上立功之敕命，因乘兹而所说耶。 缘龙汉四劫元年，应大罗三天永寿元年，元始上帝於上元之日，圣命驾御太霄八景始青天中，敷演至道灵宝度人之法，欲将导三十六天上帝及诸真宰。 忽然天门震辟，乃见是下土，时当开皇三劫运终之变，恶气冲突。 按《董真君实录》，下世帝纣，淫心失道，矫侮上天，遂感六天魔王，伤害九地黎庶之故也。 元始乃命昊天太上开天执符御历合真体道金阙玉皇大天帝制韶，降于北极省施行。 阳助周武伐纣，平治社稷。 阴遣太玄大将降魔，间分人鬼。 应七日中，两皆克平，则宇宙清肃矣。 玄天，玄者一也，天者霄也。 乃北方一景紫霄太玄天，泛天一之炁化，今玄帝位居之。 因昔在下土黄帝五十七年，天韶飞升，府署驻在此境也。 开化水所，乃九霄之首矣。 虚一之无，化西南景霄始素天，曰二景。 纯一之炁，化东方青霄青元天，曰三景。 灵一之炁，化东南碧霄始分天，曰四景。 虚梵之界，化五景，神霄昊极天玉帝阙。 至一之炁，化西北琅霄始玄天，曰六景。 玄一之炁，化西方玉霄太素天，曰七景。 太一之无，化东北太霄始青天，曰八景。 下覆南阎洞浮，乃元始驾此救度群黎之处。 元梵之炁，化南方绛霄太丹天，日九景。 是故九霄之内，分置五劫之年，以记天元也。 大罗三天守，建立年号也。 玄帝十五岁时，感遇紫元君，曰：子契太和，必当升举矣。 大圣，大者化也，圣者生也。 玄帝师告之，升举日后，上为三境辅臣，下作十方大圣也。 在二千五百岁之后，果黄帝庚寅岁飞升。 按《提纲》论历代帝系年谱，至商纣二十三年己巳岁，恰二千五百载。 按《通鉴》乃文王受命之年。 武王元年己卯，遇紫元君授记之数，一十年矣。 天摄坎离，二精玄武也。 世灭无道商纣，乃周武也。 真武，真者正也，武者神也。 本号玄武，避宋朝庙讳，改赐曰真武，况临讨果行不杀之严也。 玉帝遣镇北方，及至降纣世六魔之日，敕慰披发跣足，赐建阜纛玄旗，躬披铠甲，功成而摄，踏龟蛇回天，而天称元帅，世号福神。 玄帝是日仰上叹曰：今果符师语。 《董真君实录》载云：又於大宋仁宗朝嘉佑二年丁酉岁，上应大罗天真化三年也。 至其五月五日，三清上帝并升玉宸殿，敕九天司马开历，考万天功过，校正三官四圣，自太虚开化，神一挺生，有保天佑地，化育韦生。 四年正月初一日，钻玉华院撰制玉册讫，宣诏三官四圣，於上元节日，并赴七宝琼台。

**The Supreme Lord’s Annotated Scripture of the Wondrous Divine Incantations of the Primordial Transmission of the Great Sage Perfected Warrior of the Mysterious Heaven**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Lord’s Annotated Scripture of the Wondrous Divine Incantations of the Primordial Transmission of the Spirit-Soul of the Great Sage Perfected Warrior of the Mysterious Heaven*
**Compiled and Annotated by Chen You of the Song Dynasty**
**Six Scrolls**
**Source Text:** *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, *Dongshen* Section, *Yujue* Category

---

### *The Supreme Lord’s Annotated Scripture of the Wondrous Divine Incantations of the Primordial Transmission of the Great Sage Perfected Warrior of the Mysterious Heaven, Scroll One*
**Compiled and Annotated by Chen You, Disciple of the Inner Teachings of Ascending the Mysteries, Fang Tianzipei of Li**

**"Supreme Lord" (Taishang):** *Tai* (Supreme) denotes reverence; *shang* (Lord) denotes exaltation. This refers to the Primordial Ancestor who established the Dao in the most ancient times—the **Supreme Lord of the Jade Clarity Sacred Realm, the Peerless Dharma King of the Primordial Beginning**; the **True Lord of the Upper Clarity Realm, the Healer-King of the Three Realms, the Numinous Treasure Emperor**; and the **Supreme Lord of the Grand Clarity Immortal Realm, the Guide of the Ten Directions, the Primordial Unity Emperor**. He is the ancestral *qi* of Heaven, Earth, and Humanity, emanating from the Three Clarities.

*The Huainanzi* states: *"The Dao of the Supreme Lord gives birth to the myriad things yet does not possess them; it completes the ten thousand forms yet does not govern them."* It further says: *"The Supreme Lord nurtures transformation; the next best establishes the Dharma."*

Thus, the rulers of successive dynasties have revered the Three Clarities, all honoring them with the title *Taishang*.

**"Expounds" (Shuo):** Means "to elucidate." The Supreme Lord’s teachings of the various scriptures and methods all serve as gradual steps toward the wondrous gate.

*Laozi* says: *"The Supreme Lord establishes virtue; the next best establishes merit."* This scripture was issued by the **Purple Tenuity Emperor of the Northern Culmen Palace**, in accordance with the Supreme Lord’s decree to establish merit—thus, it was expounded on this basis.

In the first kalpa of the **Dragon Han Eon**, corresponding to the first year of the **Eternal Longevity Era of the Great Luo Three Heavens**, on the **Upper Prime Day**, the **Primordial Beginning Emperor** ascended the **Eight Radiant Heavens of the Grand Empyrean** and expounded the **Numinous Treasure Scripture of the Dao for Salvation**, intending to guide the **Thirty-Six Heavenly Emperors and all True Lords**. Suddenly, the gates of Heaven shook open, revealing the lower realms below, where the **Third Kalpa of the Kaihuang Era** was drawing to a close, and malevolent *qi* surged violently.

According to *The Authentic Record of Master Dong*, the last ruler of the Xia, **King Zhou**, had lost the Dao through licentiousness, defying Heaven. This provoked the **Six Heavenly Demon Kings**, who harmed the people of the Nine Lands. The Primordial Beginning Emperor then commanded the **Supreme August Jade Emperor of the Golden Watchtower, the Heavenly Sovereign Who Opens the Heavens, Holds the Talisman, and Governs the Calendar in Unity with the True Dao**, to descend to the **Northern Culmen Province** and enforce the decree. In the yang realm, he aided **King Wu of Zhou** in overthrowing Zhou and pacifying the realm; in the yin realm, he dispatched the **Great Mysterious General** to subdue demons and separate humans from spirits. Within seven days, both endeavors succeeded, and the cosmos was purified.

**"Mysterious Heaven" (Xuantian):** *Xuan* (Mysterious) signifies the One; *tian* (Heaven) signifies the Empyrean. This refers to the **Purple Empyrean of the Great Mysterious Heaven in the Northern Quadrant**, transformed by the *qi* of the **Celestial One**. The **Mysterious Emperor** now presides over it, for in the fifty-seventh year of the **Yellow Emperor’s** reign in the lower realms, he ascended by celestial decree, and his palace was established in this realm. As the origin of the **Water Transformation**, it is the foremost of the **Nine Empyreans**.

The **Void of the One** transforms into the **Western-Southern Empyrean of the Primordial Simplicity**, called the **Second Radiance**.
The *qi* of **Pure Unity** transforms into the **Eastern Azure Empyrean of the Azure Primordial Heaven**, called the **Third Radiance**.
The *qi* of **Numinous Unity** transforms into the **Southeastern Verdant Empyrean of the Primordial Division**, called the **Fourth Radiance**.
The **Realm of the Void and Brahman** transforms into the **Fifth Radiance**, the **Jade Emperor’s Palace of the Supreme August Heaven of the Numinous Empyrean**.
The *qi* of **Ultimate Unity** transforms into the **Northwestern Jade Empyrean of the Primordial Mystery**, called the **Sixth Radiance**.
The *qi* of **Mysterious Unity** transforms into the **Western Jade Empyrean of the Grand Simplicity**, called the **Seventh Radiance**.
The **Supreme Void of the Great One** transforms into the **Northeastern Grand Empyrean of the Primordial Azure**, called the **Eighth Radiance**.
Below, it covers the **Southern Flaming Realm of the Mortal World**, where the **Primordial Beginning Emperor** descended to save the multitudes.
The *qi* of the **Primordial Brahman** transforms into the **Southern Crimson Empyrean of the Grand Cinnabar Heaven**, called the **Ninth Radiance**.

Thus, within the **Nine Empyreans**, the years of the **Five Kalpas** are recorded to mark the celestial epochs. The **Three Heavens of the Great Luo** maintain the reign titles.

At the age of fifteen, the **Mysterious Emperor** encountered the **Purple Primordial Lady**, who said: *"Your harmony with the Great Peace ensures your ascension."* His master later told him that after his ascension, he would serve as an **assistant minister in the Three Realms above** and a **Great Sage of the Ten Directions below**. After **2,500 years**, he indeed ascended in the **Gengyin Year of the Yellow Emperor**.

According to *The Outline of Imperial Lineages and Chronologies*, this corresponds to the **twenty-third year of King Zhou’s reign in the Jisi Year**, precisely **2,500 years** later. *The Comprehensive Mirror* records this as the year **King Wen received the Mandate**. In the **first year of King Wu’s reign (Jimao Year)**, it had been **ten years** since the **Purple Primordial Lady’s prophecy**.

The **Heavenly Conjunction of Kan and Li**—the **Mysterious Warrior of the Two Essences**—overthrew the **tyrannical Shang Zhou**, ushering in the **Zhou Wu era**.

**"Perfected Warrior" (Zhenwu):** *Zhen* (Perfected) means "upright"; *wu* (Warrior) means "divine." Originally titled **Mysterious Warrior**, this was changed to **Perfected Warrior** to avoid the taboo of the **Song Dynasty’s temple name**, reflecting his **stern discipline of non-killing in punitive expeditions**. The **Jade Emperor** sent him to guard the **North**, and during the **demon-subduing era of King Zhou’s fall**, he was commanded to **unbind his hair and go barefoot**, granted the **Black Banner of the Sacred Mound**, and **donned armor in person**. After his triumph, he **trampled the Tortoise and Serpent and returned to Heaven**, where he was hailed as **Marshal** and revered as the **Fortune God**.

On that day, the **Mysterious Emperor** looked up and sighed: *"Today, my master’s words have come true!"*

*The Authentic Record of Master Dong* states: In the **second year of the Jiayou Era (Dingyou Year) of the Song Emperor Renzong’s reign**, corresponding to the **third year of the True Transformation Era of the Great Luo Heaven**, on the **fifth day of the fifth month**, the **Three Clarity Lords** ascended the **Jade Palace Hall**. The **Marshal of the Nine Heavens** was ordered to open the celestial records, review the merits and transgressions of the **Ten Thousand Heavens**, and rectify the **Three Officials and Four Saints**. Since the **opening of the Great Void and the birth of the Divine One**, they had **protected Heaven, aided Earth, and nurtured all life**.

On the **first day of the first month of the fourth year**, the **Jade Flower Abbey** completed the engraving of the **Jade Register**. A decree was proclaimed to the **Three Officials and Four Saints**, summoning them to the **Seven-Treasure Jeweled Terrace** on the **Upper Prime Festival**.

chunks.original_text: 当亚帝真时，昊夫玉尊亲行典仪，册封至玄武，加号太上紫皇天一真人，玉虚师相玄天上帝，领九天探访使职，及下荫龟蛇号。 本传。 本者源也，传者流也，乃金阙日历院编修史文也。 况历代帝主，各有典礼，徽宗诏制，褒其威助感应事也。 其上天探访真司，一一摘之，誊言奏达玄都，补入金格玉历。 凡遇上命考绩，则金阙侍中司马大神韩君丈人，及司命可韩真人、司录定名真君、司功九天探访真君、司过九天储福真君，并具实保举，续成一家之书，谓之日《本传》矣。 今者，又自天降《玄帝实录》一本下凡，因襄阳紫虚坛班长张明道，出示蒋人玉庐，刊印于世矣。 仰知玄帝圣神之事，固未易知哉。 所编撰者，乃太真西王左上卿，上清天机都承旨，神应元惠真君，飞霞灵光真人，中黄先生臣董素皇，所编集成。 上元九天掌籍玉堂学士，充下元水府转运使，兼九地提点刑狱公事，上仙元皇君张亚，为之叔焉。 末纪曰：时在上天延康七劫无上大罗天开化十三年，下世大宋孝宗淳熙十一年，系中上元甲子内岁次甲辰正月辛卯朔十五日乙巳。 二真续批降曰：凡观之士，当洗心跪诵之矣。 神咒，神者明也，咒者誓也。 上帝立此取会大信合同之约语。 按《伏魔经》曰：飞扬隐语也。 乃是大道橐钥之吁，神之听之，一闻扣真召灵，罔不来格。 宜惟交乾布斗，或激坤指罡，上佐天关，於坛心叩齿祝香，随意告盟，至心持诵，志感大圣玄帝，灵通经纬，恍惚万方，不疾而速，不行而至，其诸善应获大吉祥，承此之制命耶。 妙经，妙者达也，经者径也。 《玄帝本事》咒曰：天得以健，地得以宁，民得以养。 是故三才万物，皆赖大道一元之气，而运转洪钧矣。 尔时妙行，有为众之诚。 大帝发光明于道，谈养一之法，开蒙泰之机，指日用之时，皆玄帝历行之衍也。 故道在天而混成元气，在地而潜统元形，泱人之志意元识。 达元识者，了此经中玄奥，而能行之也。 本经云： 玄帝降曰，其於福利，保人庆寿，以全天命； 其有气正心纯，忠全孝尽，名书玉简，保举升仙。 宜在酌水丰香，露情悫实。 本经曰：稽首祷告，无愿不从。 是时谪仙张天师，三遇太上降化，按《南斗经》，授以经籍千轴，皆修行之要道，将传付有道者，令生身受度，使永劫长存。 然此经亦在千轴数内矣。 咦，此书载道，见玄天大开方便之门，道在人行，跻太上域，引登仙之径。 《老子》曰：合抱之木，生於毫末； 九层之台，起于累土； 千里之行，始于足下。 又曰：慎终如始，则无败事。 《孟子》曰：夫道若大路然，岂难知哉，人病不求耳。 尔时 尔时者，谓如是闻也。

Therefore, the **Dao in Heaven coalesces into primordial qi**, while on Earth it **latently governs primordial form**, and within humanity it **stirs primordial consciousness**. According to the *Scripture of the Southern Dipper*, he was bestowed a thousand scrolls of scriptures, all essentials of cultivation, to be transmitted to those of the Dao. These enabled **embodied deliverance**, ensuring **eternal existence through endless kalpas**. This scripture, too, was among those thousand scrolls.

Alas! This book carries the Dao, revealing the **Dark Heaven’s vast gate of expedient means**. The Dao lies in human practice, ascending to the **realm of the Supreme**, guiding one along the **path to immortality**. *Laozi* said: "A tree of arm-spanning girth grows from a tiny sprout; a nine-tiered terrace rises from mounds of earth; a journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step." **At that time**—that is, "thus have I heard."

chunks.original_text: 隶金阙太清境制御万灵公事所。 向紫微之殿前， 是殿号，乃金阙北极省堂之名也。 而左右分司，无不统摄，为三光运化之庭，法阴阳开闭之所。 《天文志》曰：紫微垣一十五星，西蕃七星，东蕃八星，在北斗北。 一曰紫微大帝之座也。 洎诸天官星宿，且昭昭然，则下土皆可睹焉。 列诸天之上圣， 大抵紫微垣内中外品官，各有司主计一百一十八名，积数七百八十二星，皆理璇玑之政。 为三界最要之有司者，乃南北二斗、东西两曹、五方五星、六宫六曜、二十八宿、十二宫神，此六班犹六部尚书之佐。 飞天神王，秉监察御史，督内外台职无极仙众，承机察八纮边境之差。 诸僚曹等准制，於三元日，咸遵北极紫微令事，校录结籍。 南北二斗， 南斗秉爵秩禄俸之籍，北斗宰生死是非之簿也。 按《南斗经》曰：南斗六司与北斗七政，分职共理三才六合八卦九宫，总辖中外百辟官品，乃紫微大微两极都曹也。 上系十二分次，天真灵神。 下统十二分野，地祇主者，四渎五岳、九州八纮、名山大川、城隍社庙。 中及人民群类万物，无不计系其簿籍掌握。 南斗六司真君尊号：天府司命上相镇国真君，天相司录上相镇岳真君，天梁延寿保命真君，天同益算保生真君，天枢度厄文昌炼魂真君，天机上生监簿大理真君。 北斗七政星君尊号：天璇贪狼太星君，地玑巨门元星君，机人禄存真星君，权时文曲纽星君，玉衡康贞纲星君，闿阳武曲纪星君，瑶光破军关星君。 每月於三七日，二斗星君各遣星光童子，案下人间，校戒生死罪福事也。 东西两曹， 东斗注算，司会玉灵瑶篇，考绩世人德业，治性善状。 西斗记名，校勘群生，受度灭绝关历大计之令。 《东斗经》曰：东斗帝君之命，主算延年，复流下世，能度三涂、五苦、八难之厄，能与削死上生。 《西斗经》曰：玄元上清大成帝君，主天之柄，威狱号令，降魔制神，典司内外伐戮之事，搜察容隐邪僻之形； 下记世人，有善必录，有恶必记，名号散殊，生死之限，常有八百万亿，轮转周回，善恶根本，如缠如索，昭然不隐。 东斗五星尊号：苍灵延生真君，灵光护命真君，开天大卫集福真君，大明和阳保和真君，尾极总监真君。 西斗四星尊号：白标帝君，高元真君，曲皇灵真君，将巨威真君。 夫两曹真司，下降人间，定制於月之一日五、九日，东斗降； 七、九、十五日，西斗降。 洎五方之五星， 司庚辛、甲乙、壬癸、丙丁、戊己之五方，乃金木水火土，五常形气之星。 《七星神咒经》曰：天地设位，乃建五行，巡历天下，察无道之国，观不祥之人。 凡处墟域之内，蠢动含生，命系于天。 《混元经纂要》：东方岁星主仁，生甲乙，化草木，司春令，宰蠕蛸飞动千种化生之虫，凡十二岁纬一周天。 西方太白主义，生庚辛，化金石，司秋令，宰带角无角千种胎生之兽，凡历一岁纬一周天。 南方荧惑主礼，生丙丁，化烟火，司夏令，宰匾毛羽翼千种卯生之禽，凡二岁纬一周天。 北方辰星主智，生壬癸，化水泉，司冬令，宰带甲无鳞千种湿生之族，凡历一岁纬一周天。 中央镇星主信，生戊己，化尘土，司四季，宰圣贤愚痴千种躲灵之人，凡二十九岁纬一周天。 若国主能肃温，又良哲恭清俭圣让者，皇极建也。

chunks.original_text: 则自然五星降祥，泽被有国。 《天下洪范要》曰：貌恭肃。 岁星应，顺木曲直，降时雨，言从又。 太白应，顺金从革，降时旸，视明哲。 荧惑应，顺火炎上，降时燠，听聪谋。 辰星应，顺水润下，降时寒，思睿圣。 镇星应，顺土稼穑，降时风，斯乃人。 君德契，五福均，延于兆庶矣。 如其反是，则星辰凌犯，彗孛冲破，遂生刀兵，水旱流离，凶衅以致，死亡兆庶也。 《命书》曰：五星缠天次，有顺留逆伏之段名，临照男女，当生四柱，顺吉逆凶也。 及六宫之六曜， 司太阳、太阴、天一、太一、黄旛、豹尾之六宫，主昼、夜、晦、明、风、雨之六运，乃日曜、月曜、木曜、水曜、火曜、土曜。 六曜右行天次，并准紫微格制，运缠迟速也。 《消灾经》曰：欲界众生，惟务苟贵，不修正道，不知有五行推运十一曜照临，主其灾福。 至如火土留伏，金木凌犯，罗计勃逆，日、月薄蚀，以政州县播迁，人民灾难，水火、虫蝗、刀兵相犯，悉皆由也。 《天文志》曰：国无政，不善用，则自取日月谪。 见于天垂六极之变者，警惧惩戒人君者也。 日帝众阳宗，配人君司生育，一岁一周天。 如蚀，警人主，政不臧，皇不振，神志盹罔，社稷厥极弱，其见日蚀罚常阴，月皇众阴宗配后妃及大臣，司刑罚蚀，惩奸佞臣子。 一月一周天，言不从胆张借轻，百姓厥极忧，则见月蚀罚常阳，紫界续木曜，配五福司学业。 二十八年纬一周天，主人威仪，貌不恭，意狂俊，夺农时厥极恶，木带冰零罚常雨。 月孛续水曜，配宗庙司祀享。 九岁一周天，怒见毛头彗尾，听不聪，情纵急，逆天时厥极贫，水祸肸蛮罚常寒。 罗喉续火曜，配助业司阳德。 一十八年一周天，怒蚀其日月，视不明，心逆舒，奔法律厌极，疾火掷血流罚常焕。 计都续土曜，配稼穑司阴德。 一十八年一周天，怒则崩摧山川，思不容虑妄蒙，侮父母厌极，凶饥馑流荒，罚常风。 夫太平之世，日不蚀星不悖，盖德之至矣。 应世间男女，皆以太阳起命官也。 太阴到处为身宫也。 天一司人五福，太一掌人夭横，罗惩男，计都戒女，於是六曜之内，日月明分昼夜也。 罗计孛紫，并暗曜化人迁善，每罚凶人则光现。 二十八宿音秀， 居四方，列周天，为三百六十五度余，隶七政，日月水火木金土，所缠之舍，曰二十八宿。 以正岁月昏旦，立四方经七。 虚昴星房副日帝政，危毕张心副月皇政，壁参箕轸副辰星政，室嘴翼尾副荧惑政，斗奎并角副岁星政，牛娄鬼亢副太白政，女胃柳氏副镇星政。 又常循治年月日时，而成岁功也。 降浃六十甲子，男女曰胎星。 凡按节气分真，下理二十四治幽狱公事。 按《天文志》宰天子、储君、后妃、宗庙、文武官寮制度，及天下万物之像。 并付：斗木文昌星君，司爵禄，冬至日紏真多治； 牛金大武星君，司牺牲，小寒日紏昌利治； 女土天须星君，司剪裁，大寒日紏庇堂洽； 虚日天任星君，司填墓，立春日紏涌泉治； 危月天一星君，司五谷，雨水日紏北平治； 室火天社星君，司营室，紏督军粮库府事； 壁水蕴德星君，司图书，惊垫日紏稠梗治； 奎木贵豕星君，司禁暴，春分日紏主簿治； 娄金义武星君，司祭祀，清明日紏蒙秦治； 胃土天博星君，司厨仓，谷雨日紏平盖治；

chunks.original_text: 昴日天耳星君，司边兵，立夏日紏云奎治； 毕月灵独星君，司弋猎，小满日紏尽口治； 紫火天藏星君，司葆旅，标稔示斩刈储敛； 参水文明星君，司城郭，芒种日紏公慕治； 井木天戚星君，司法令，夏至日紏玉局治； 鬼金天目星君，司诛斩，小暑日紏平纲洽； 柳土天赋星君，司草木，大暑日紏邶邙治； 星日天步星君，司服举，立秋日紏葛紏治； 张月天寿星君，司斗秤，处暑日紏后城治； 翼火天虚星君，司乐舞，白露日紏本竹治； 轸水文章星君，司车骑，秋分日紏秦中治； 角木华盖星君司天庭，主灵寿农祥贤良事； 亢金太极星君，司公庙，寒露日紏阳平治； 氏土玉关星君，司君臣，霜降日紏鹤鸣治； 房日天校星君，司明堂，布政定四表朝路事； 心月天爰星君，司嫁娶，立冬日紏漓沅治； 尾火将威星君，司继嗣，小雪日紏庚除治； 箕水天舌星君，司后妃，大雪日紏隶上治。 按《正一旨要》治山者，二十八宿下圄也。 明建福庭，钻集世人善恶事，左司炁仙官录善，右司炁鬼官记恶，每遇天官会日，各宿二司，誊呈成年录籍矣。 十二宫神， 周天又外十二官次号，曰子丑寅卯辰巳午未申酉戌亥之位也。 司下土男女属相形名，日鼠牛虎兔龙蛇马羊猴鸡狗猪之呼也。 每一宫各有一神君统辖，斡伍将军五员，各领阴阳史士亿万之众，混通参校一十二分野，内产天下含生日用之事也。 宝瓶宫子次，玄枵神君，宰齐地青州分野，统甲子、丙子、戊子、庚子、壬子五将，掌鼠属男女禄料。 磨蝎宫丑次，星纪神君，宰吴越扬州分野，统乙丑、丁丑、己丑、辛丑、癸丑五将，掌牛属男女禄料。 人马宫寅次，析木神君，宰燕地幽州分野，统丙寅、戊寅、庚寅、壬寅、甲寅五将，掌虎属男女禄料。 天蝎宫卯次，大火神君，宰宋地豫州分野，统丁卯、己卯、辛卯、癸卯、乙卯五将，掌兔属男女禄料。 天秤宫辰次，寿星神君，宰郑地兖州分野，统戊辰、庚辰、壬辰、甲辰、丙辰五将，掌龙属男女禄料。 双女宫巳次，鹑尾神君，宰楚地荆州分野，统己巳、辛巳、癸巳、乙巳、丁巳五将，掌蛇属男女禄料。 狮子官午次，鹑火神君，宰周地三河分野，．统庚午、壬午、甲午、丙午、戊午五将，掌马属男女禄料。 巨蟹宫未次，鹑首神君，宰秦地雍州分野，统辛未、癸未、乙未、丁未、己未五将，掌羊属男女禄料。 阴阳宫申次，实况神君，宰魏地益州分野，统壬申、甲申、丙申、戊申、庚申五将，掌猴属男女禄料。 金牛宫酉次，大梁神君，宰赵地冀州分野，统癸酉、乙酉、丁酉、己酉、辛酉五将，掌鸡属男女禄料。 白羊宫戌次，降娄神君，宰鲁地徐州分野，统甲戌、丙戌、戊戌乃庚戌、壬戌五将，掌狗属男女禄料。 双鱼宫亥次，摄訾神君，宰卫地并州分野，统乙亥、丁亥、己亥、辛亥、癸亥五将，掌猪属男女禄料。 夫宫神参将，各各分守，成年合属月建内三旬日，分颛记世人善恶事，并俟三元校会日，历转紫微令司矣。 属将六十员姓名，详见后甲子之句下。 飞天神王， 飞天神王者，乃探访功过之都使也。 号曰：东胡老君，西氏老君，南越老君，北羌老君，中伧老君。 阙署五方，为万神之宗，总司飞行掾吏玉童玉女妙行真人等，计一千二百四十万众。
