chunks.original_text: 游观太空，每遇五腊节日，仍校勘世人，予夺祸福。 天腊节正月一日，东方胡老君集众老，会于九炁青龙阙，共议校定世人神气时限长短及祷嗣胤等事，然后申达玄祖。 地腊节五月五日，当南方越老君集众老，会于三炁丹台阙内，校定世人官禄福相及血属盛衰等事。 道德腊节七月七日，当西方氏老君集众老，会于七炁素灵阙中，校定世人骨体肥瘦及学事业利钝毁誉等事。 民岁 腊节十月一日，北方羌老君集众老，会于五炁素灵阙内，校定世人禄料更变饮食退耗官爵衰微寿算及疾病轻重事。 王侯腊节十二月蜡日，谓国运於冬至石极第三摹日是也。 当中央伧老君集众老，会于一炁戊己阙中，校定世人灾青、怪梦、否泰、日时驿马衰旺生死处所事。 五老誊五会之欸，俟三元节亲诣默上紫微帝庭之所。 无极仙众， 日月星光分躔底照人间，径过三十五万六千九百七十一里，乃八纮境地耶。 八结之外，去北极迂远，谓日无极之境也。 司无极仙曹等众有差。 按《因缘经》太上立敕，令诸天上帝召命五帝神王，分遣九府、四司、七星童子、十天将军、八神童子、妙行真人、天仙飞仙、考士· 考兵，例九亿万众，分头职方。 或云，或雨，或风，或露，或鸟，或兽，或大，或小，或短，或长，或显，或隐，种种变化，持籍秉笔，探察搜审，昼夜无闲，书记功过，於三元限节之日，还司校佥矣。 咸亲帝座，肃拱宸威。 咸亲者，谓皆觐也。 时六．部星官曹寮及探访神王妙行仙众，朝谒御几，莫不肃拱，宸庭之威，各持事恭敬也。 本官自有三府三十六曹，每曹考官一员，考史一千二百，执箓把籍，威仪堪堪，列宸庭之一。 按《三元品诫经》紫微宫治三府。 左府事，所其生籍，司太阳火官考之。 右府事，主其死籍，司太阴水官考之。 中府，主具生死罪福之籍，司风刀考之。 三府准太玄女青上元夫人统辖，是司制度诸曹，案录籍事，谨题上元明真曹，上元监正曹，上元梵行曹，案局额目于后。 上元灵阙曹，上元禁神曹，上元通明曹，上元正神曹，上元开明曹，上元玉都曹，上元南上曹，上元元功曹，上元三灵曹，上元明梵曹，上元威灵曹，上元太清曹，上元宣威曹，上元明都曹，上元太常曹，上元都灵曹，上元太仪曹，上元盟法曹，上元考正曹，上元明威曹，上元九都曹，上元司巫曹，上元四明曹，上元监天曹，上元司煞曹，上元盟天曹，上元幽都曹。 上元威仪曹，上元太阴曹，上元下元曹，上元监司曹，上元太明曹，上元监灵曹，每群真朝会紫微殿，各曹僚分掌 起居事。 总领一切上真禅号，高下尊卑，典仪功过； 总领一切上真众圣，朝礼旋行，典仪功过； 总领一切上真大圣，旋宴从驾，典仪功过； 总领一切生死图簿，录籍功过； 总领一切生死命籍功过； 总领一切生死功德，轻重功过； 总领一切生死功德，轻重功过； 总领一切鬼神执役，报对轮转功过； 总领一切鬼神幽谪，开度年限功过； 总领一切鬼神升度，死魂更生，轻重功过； 总领一切死魂，受炼更生，箓籍功过； 总领一切神仙，得道位清净，品秩功过； 总领万魔，讴歌功过一，且三界九州十方万国，一切得道位者及神鬼人，悉皆较戒也。 时有玉童， 如世给事中丞职，是殿呼玉童。

They roam and observe the Great Void, and on each of the Five La Days, they examine and assess the worldly, bestowing or withdrawing fortune and misfortune.

On the Heavenly La Day, the first day of the first month, the Eastern Hu Elder Lord gathers the assembly of elders at the Nine Qi Azure Dragon Gate to collectively deliberate and determine the duration of people’s spiritual qi, the timing of their prayers for descendants, and other matters, which are then reported to the Mysterious Ancestor.

On the Earthly La Day, the fifth day of the fifth month, the Southern Yue Elder Lord convenes the elders at the Three Qi Cinnabar Terrace Gate to assess the official ranks, blessings, and physiognomy of the worldly, as well as the prosperity or decline of their blood relations.

On the Moral La Day, the seventh day of the seventh month, the Western Shi Elder Lord gathers the elders at the Seven Qi Pale Spirit Gate to evaluate the robustness or frailty of people’s physiques, the success or failure of their studies and careers, and their reputations.

On the People’s Yearly La Day, the first day of the tenth month, the Northern Qiang Elder Lord assembles the elders at the Five Qi Pale Spirit Gate to determine changes in people’s stipends, fluctuations in their diets, the rise and fall of their official ranks, the length of their lifespans, and the severity of their illnesses.

On the Royal La Day, the La Day of the twelfth month—specifically the third *mo* day after the winter solstice— the Central Cang Elder Lord gathers the elders at the One Qi Wuji Gate to assess calamities, strange dreams, fortunes and misfortunes, the waxing and waning of "post-horses" in time, and the locations of life and death.

The Five Elders record the proceedings of the five assemblies and await the triennial Three Primordials festival to personally present them at the silent audience in the Purple Tenuity Imperial Court.

The Boundless Immortal Hosts,
The radiance of the sun, moon, and stars shines upon the mortal realm, traversing a distance of 356,971 *li* to reach the Eight Vast Territories. Beyond the Eight Knots, far removed from the Northern Culmen, lies the Boundless Realm. The ranks of the Boundless Immortal Offices vary.

According to the *Sutra of Causes and Conditions*, the Supreme Lord issued a decree commanding the Heavenly Thearchs to summon the Five Divine Kings of the Emperors. They dispatched the Nine Bureaus, Four Offices, Seven Star Lads, Ten Heavenly Generals, Eight Divine Lads, Wondrously Acting Perfected Ones, Celestial Immortals, Flying Immortals, Examiners of Scholars, and Examiners of Soldiers—altogether nine hundred million myriad beings—each assigned to their respective domains. Some manifest as clouds, some as rain, some as wind, some as dew, some as birds, some as beasts, some as great, some as small, some as short, some as tall, some as visible, some as hidden. In myriad transformations, they hold registers and wield brushes, ceaselessly investigating, searching, and scrutinizing day and night. They record merits and transgressions, and on the appointed days of the Three Primordials, return to their offices for review and verification.

They all approach the imperial throne, reverently paying homage to the august majesty. "They all approach" signifies that all attend the audience. At that time, the officials of the Six Departments of the Stellar Offices, along with the Divine Kings of Investigation, the Wondrously Acting Immortal Hosts, and the courtly assembly, present themselves before the imperial steps, each reverently holding their positions with solemn respect for the court’s authority.

The original office itself comprises Three Bureaus and Thirty-Six Offices. Each office has one Examiner and one thousand two hundred Scribes who hold registers and wield records, their dignified demeanor resplendent as they stand in the imperial court.

According to the *Scripture of the Three Primordials’ Precepts and Admonitions*, the Purple Tenuity Palace governs the Three Bureaus:
- The Left Bureau oversees the Register of Life, examined by the Fire Official of the Great Yang.
- The Right Bureau oversees the Register of Death, examined by the Water Official of the Great Yin.
- The Central Bureau oversees the Registers of Life, Death, Sin, and Blessing, examined by the Wind Blade.

The Three Bureaus are under the jurisdiction of the Supreme Lady of the Great Mystery, the Azure Lady of the Upper Primordial. They administer the systems of the various offices, manage the recording of registers, and meticulously submit them to the Upper Primordial Offices of Luminous Perfection, the Upper Primordial Office of Surveillance, and the Upper Primordial Office of Brahman Conduct. The titles of the offices are listed as follows:

Whenever the hosts of perfected beings assemble in the Purple Tenuity Hall, the officials of each office oversee the proceedings. They collectively manage:

- The services and retributions of all ghosts and spirits as they fulfill their duties and undergo cyclic transformations, and the records of their merits and transgressions;
- The confinement and deliverance of all ghosts and spirits in the nether realms, and the records of their merits and transgressions regarding the duration of their deliverance;
- The ascension and deliverance of all ghosts and spirits, the rebirth of deceased souls, and the weight of their merits and transgressions;
- The refinement and rebirth of all deceased souls, and the records of their merits and transgressions;
- The attainment of the Dao and the purity of rank among all divine immortals, and the records of their merits and transgressions;
- The ranks and merits of the myriad demons in their praises and songs.

Moreover, across the Three Realms, the Nine Provinces, the Ten Directions, and the myriad states, all beings—whether divine immortals, ghosts, or humans—who attain the Dao and its ranks are subject to these admonitions and assessments.

At times, Jade Lads,
akin to the office of the Palace Attendant in the mortal realm, are summoned by the court as Jade Lads.

They are known as the Eastern Hu Elder Lord, the Western Shi Elder Lord, the Southern Yue Elder Lord, the Northern Qiang Elder Lord, and the Central Cang Elder Lord. Stationed in the five directions, they preside as the ancestors of the myriad spirits, commanding an assembly of flying clerks, jade lads, jade maidens, and wondrously acting perfected ones—numbering twelve million four hundred thousand in total.

chunks.original_text: 传大帝之敕：北方大将玄武将军，宜禀玉皇圣命。 宜禀者，称与也。 太玄可拜玄武也。 北极紫微省，奉昊天顾命，每敕发诰宝为旌，赏功力事于时大帝诏北方太玄元帅躬赴本殿拜受三天门下诰敕，是会司真一时咸睹降赐语宝，及听玉童宣麻也。 敕 乃金阙翰林玉华院司玄学士大丹真人准敕旨，裁撰检辞，玉帝敕启，受命之玺印。 《记方》谓：玉符也。 《诰宝》曰：惟卿混黄一炁之瑞，导备九阳之尊，德隆仙品，威贯神真，出号二千五百春秋，功齐四十二劫，甲子校迁民物，无失毫分。 兹以运数大劫，邪正混同，感生六天魔王，伤害九地黎庶，傥非真力，何得清宁。 三清是赖，九圣得依，再扶道法之隆，又复邪魔之正。 降水火二精於掌握，摄甲庚两将於纪纲。 因兹神化万汇，咸荣功高，众圣难尽褒崇。 当容返本还元，理许归根复位，若不徽称，焉可显德。 玺书锡降，厥勿谦辞，可特拜镇天玄武大将军、三元都总管、九天游奕使、北极左天罡、三界大都督神仙鬼神公事、判玄都右胜府，依前太玄元帅元和迁校府事，册到奉行。 出董真君降笔实录。 令每月三度，

The Great Emperor transmits his edict: to the Northern Great General, the Dark Martial General, who shall receive the sagely command of the Jade Emperor. "Shall receive" signifies "is deemed worthy of." The Supreme Mystery may bow to the Dark Martial. From the Purple Tenuity Bureau of the Northern Culmen, bearing the Mandate of the August Heaven, each edict is issued with the Treasured Proclamation as its standard, rewarding meritorious deeds in due time.

By the Great Emperor’s decree, the Northern Supreme Mystery Marshal of the Primordial is to personally attend this court and bow to receive the edict from beneath the Three Heavenly Gates. At this assembly, all controllers of the True Unity shall witness the bestowal of the spoken treasure and hear the Jade Lads proclaim the imperial mandate.

The edict is prepared by the Great Elixir Perfected, Academician of the Mysterious at the Jade Flower Institute of the Golden Watchtower, in accordance with the imperial will, its words composed and verified, bearing the Jade Emperor’s seal of investiture—the Jade Seal, as recorded in *The Record of Directions*. The *Treasured Proclamation* states:

"Only you, who embody the auspiciousness of the Primal Yellow qi, guide the fullness of the Ninefold Yang’s majesty, whose virtue exalts your immortal rank and whose might pierces the divine perfected—issuing decrees for two thousand five hundred springs and autumns, your merits equaling forty-two kalpas—have, in the reckoning of years and the transformation of all beings, not erred by even a hair’s breadth.

Now, as the great kalpa of destiny unfolds and the boundaries between orthodoxy and heterodoxy blur, the Six Heavenly Demon Kings arise, harming the people of the Nine Lands. Without true power, how could peace and tranquility be restored? The Three Clarities rely upon you; the Nine Sages depend on you. Once more, you uphold the flourishing of the Dao and its laws, and again, you rectify the perverse and demonic.

You command the dual essences of Water and Fire within your grasp and govern the Generals of Jia and Geng within your discipline. Through this, your divine transformations nourish the myriad beings, and your merits shine resplendent—yet the multitude of sages cannot fully extol your glory.

It is fitting that you return to your origin and revert to your root, restoring your proper position. If not for this exalted title, how could your virtue be made manifest? The imperial seal is bestowed; do not decline in modesty. You are hereby specially appointed as the Great General Dark Martial Who Guards Heaven, Commander-in-Chief of the Three Primordials, Envoy of the Nine Heavens’ Patrols, Left Celestial Pivot of the Northern Culmen, Grand Marshal of the Three Realms overseeing the affairs of divine immortals, ghosts, and spirits, and Judge of the Right Victorious Bureau of the Mysterious Capital. You shall continue as the Supreme Mystery Marshal of the Primordial Harmony and the Reckoner of Promotions, and upon receipt of this decree, you shall act accordingly."

Recorded by the descent of the brush of Perfected Lord Dong. It is decreed that this be proclaimed thrice monthly.

chunks.original_text: 昊极右剧令，初六日、十六日、二十六日为定制。 统领神兵，躬往诸天，徧为巡察。 凡遇邪气，及有祆星逆次流躔，速须剪戮。 诸天星宿宫，并居九霄梵炁之上，谓之天文正炁，覆焘三界，佐成乾坤也。 《甘石星图记》曰：大抵二百八十三官，共积一千四百六十四星，以为定纪。 乃总主下土官宫品物，及民用之什。 故形生於地，精应于天。 《易·系辞》曰：天地设位，山泽通气。 气者，本天地之精神。 《庄子》曰：天有六气，阴阳晦明风雨，应时运行，谓之元气，孳萌万物，完天地施使然也。 国家秽德，祸孽莫遗，示现祆星邪气耳。 《史记》云：卫云形如狗，赵云形如牛，楚云形如日，周云形如车轮，越云形如螭，秦云形如行人，鲁云形如马，宋云形如车，韩云形如布，郑云形如绛衣，魏云形如鼠，蜀云形如国车，汉云形如破山，堕军谓之营头星。 《黄石公天境书》曰：状似星非星，六十四变，总名日曰祆彗也。 一曰国黄，状若老人星，芒散而赤，主寇兵难敌。 二曰照明而无芒角，上青下白，临处多征。 三曰丑残，状若辰星，其光似灭，多见正东凶。 四曰贼星，赤芒数道，星光闪烁，多见正南。 五曰母危，状若太白而无芒角，多见正西凶。 六曰狱汉，下出三彗，内青外赤，多见正北，且姑置勿载。 按《晋五行志》曰：夫帝王者，德配天地，叶契阴阳，发号施令，动关幽显，休咎之微，随感而作，大抵人心符天意耶。 祸乱积而见，抱珥佩璚，或赤乌夹日之飞，或隔云隐现两日两月，斯恶匪甚矣。 人君秽德，自召革替，犹是天心。 故尝先以灾异谴示，无妄典谪。 尚失修省，再陨邪气，祆星怪象出现，以警惧之。 睹此可推昊极，体太上好生之命，仍敕玄帝，抚镇讨伏不祥，咸和正化，秒助宇宙君主也。 又遇三元， 天地水府三官集圣之辰寅，申亥建之，且十五日也，乃三元节。 按《品械经》上元紫微宫三府，左太阳、右太阴、中风刀； 中元清虚官三府，左洞阳，右北都，中清虚； 下元青华宫三府，左清源、右寒夜、中清灵。 九府下一百二十曹案，上考诸天神仙升降之籍，星宿照临国土分野兴亡之簿，应干神人变化之限。 中考大千世界，国主后妃诸王太子百官人民寿限之期，一切善恶功过之名。 见世受大福者，三年一结核。 见受中福人，九年一结核。 诸受小福人，则二十四年一结核。 议定延促年龄，更变荣桔予夺，年月分限之数，是以罪福俱行，功过同报。 下考三界之内，应鬼神执役之限，定鱼龙变化之期，及飞走万类改易身形年月，判次九幽罪对之名注托生，及拘执年劫不辍须央，一一校结也。 右按《因缘经》云：正月十五日，上元宫主一品九炁赐福天官紫微大帝，於是日分遣十天灵官、神仙兵马、上圣高真、妙行真人、无鞅数众，同下人间，校定罪福也。 七月十五日，中元宫主二品遣七炁赦罪地官清虚大帝，於是日分遣九地灵官、神仙兵马及名山洞府、神仙兵马、无鞅数众，同出人间，校戒罪福也。 十月十五日，下元宫主三品五炁解厄水官扶朵大帝，於是日分遣九江水帝、十二河源、汉谷大神及旸谷神王、水府灵官，同到人间，校戒罪福也。 玄帝准奉拜命都总管三元兵马事，仍麾督无鞅兵，并察凡情。
chunks.translated_text:
The Right Vigilant Decree of the August Culmen establishes the fixed system for the sixth, sixteenth, and twenty-sixth days of each month. You shall command the divine troops and personally traverse the various heavens to conduct thorough inspections. Wherever you encounter perverse qi or inauspicious stars deviating from their proper courses, swiftly execute and eradicate them.

The palaces of the stellar lodges of the various heavens all reside above the ninefold Brahmanic qi, known as the celestial ortho-qi, which overshadows and sustains the Three Realms, aiding in the completion of Heaven and Earth. *The Star Charts of Gan and Shi* states: "In general, there are two hundred eighty-three celestial offices, comprising a total of one thousand four hundred sixty-four stars, serving as the fixed record." These govern the offices, palaces, goods, and implements of the world below, as well as the people’s livelihoods. Thus, forms arise on earth, while their essences correspond to heaven. *The Book of Changes: Appended Remarks* says: "Heaven and Earth take their positions, and the mountains and marshes communicate their qi." Qi is the fundamental spirit of Heaven and Earth. *Zhuangzi* states: "Heaven possesses six qi—yin, yang, darkness, brightness, wind, and rain—which circulate in accordance with the seasons. These are called the primordial qi, which generate and nurture the myriad things, completing the works of Heaven and Earth."

When a state’s virtue is defiled, calamities and misfortunes are inescapable, manifesting as inauspicious stars and perverse qi. *Records of the Grand Historian* notes: "The cloud of Wei resembled a dog; that of Zhao, an ox; that of Chu, the sun; that of Zhou, a chariot wheel; that of Yue, a horned dragon; that of Qin, a traveler; that of Lu, a horse; that of Song, a carriage; that of Han, a cloth; that of Zheng, a crimson robe; that of Wei, a rat; that of Shu, a state chariot; that of Han, a shattered mountain. When such clouds descend upon an army, they are called ‘camp-head stars.’" *The Yellowstone Duke’s Celestial Writ* says: "Though resembling stars, they are not stars. With sixty-four transformations, they are collectively called ‘inauspicious comets.’ The first is called ‘State Yellow,’ resembling the Old Man Star, its red rays scattered—it portends invaders and insurmountable military disasters. The second, ‘Illuminating Brightness,’ lacks rays or horns, being blue above and white below—where it appears, frequent campaigns arise. The third, ‘Ugly Remnant,’ resembles the Morning Star, its light nearly extinguished—its appearance in the due east is inauspicious. The fourth, ‘Bandit Star,’ has several red rays, its light flickering—its appearance in the due south is ominous. The fifth, ‘Mother Peril,’ resembles Venus but lacks rays or horns—its appearance in the due west is inauspicious. The sixth, ‘Prison River,’ emits three comets, blue within and red without—its appearance in the due north is baleful. (The remainder is omitted for brevity.)"

According to *The Jin Annals of the Five Phases*: "The emperors and kings, their virtue matching Heaven and Earth, harmonize with yin and yang. Their proclamations and decrees move both the hidden and the manifest. The subtlest signs of fortune and misfortune arise in response to stimuli. Generally, the hearts of men align with the will of Heaven. When disasters and chaos accumulate, they become visible: halos embracing the sun, jade pendants adorning the moon, or red crows flying beside the sun, or two suns or two moons appearing and vanishing behind clouds—such evils are extreme. When a ruler’s virtue is defiled, he summons his own replacement, for this too is the will of Heaven. Thus, Heaven first admonishes with calamities and anomalies, warning without arbitrary punishment. If the ruler fails to reform and reflect, perverse qi descends again, and inauspicious stars and monstrous omens appear to warn and alarm. Upon witnessing these, one may infer the will of the August Culmen. Embracing the Supreme’s command to cherish life, you are further charged, O Mysterious Emperor, to pacify, suppress, and subdue the inauspicious, harmonizing and rectifying the transformations to subtly assist the lords of the cosmos."

Additionally, during the Three Primordials—the sacred days when the Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and the Water Bureau convene—these occur on the *yin*, *shen*, and *hai* days of the *chen* month, as well as the fifteenth day, known as the Three Primordial Festivals. According to *The Scripture of Ranks and Instruments*: "The Upper Primordial’s Purple Tenuity Palace comprises three bureaus: the Left Great Yang, the Right Great Yin, and the Central Wind Blade. The Middle Primordial’s Clear Void Palace comprises three bureaus: the Left Cavern Yang, the Right Northern Capital, and the Central Clear Void. The Lower Primordial’s Azure Florescence Palace comprises three bureaus: the Left Clear Source, the Right Cold Night, and the Central Clear Numinous. Beneath these nine bureaus lie one hundred twenty departments, which examine the registers of the ascent and descent of divine immortals and stellar lodges, the records of the rise and fall of lands corresponding to celestial divisions, and the limits of transformations affecting gods and men. They review the lifespans of the rulers, empresses, princes, crown princes, officials, and common people of the great thousand-worlds, along with all records of good and evil deeds. Those who receive great blessings in this life have their cases reviewed every three years. Those who receive moderate blessings are reviewed every nine years. Those who receive minor blessings are reviewed every twenty-four years. Decisions are made regarding the extension or curtailment of lifespans, changes in fortune or misfortune, and the granting or withholding of rewards, with the duration of years and months determined accordingly. Thus, both punishments and blessings are meted out, and merits and transgressions are recompensed alike. They also review the limits of service for ghosts and spirits within the Three Realms, the periods of transformation for fish and dragons, the months and years when the myriad creatures of flight and movement change their forms, the judgments and registrations of karmic retributions in the Nine Dark Realms, and the binding of those who must endure unceasing kalpas—all are meticulously reviewed and settled."

As recorded in *The Sutra of Causes and Conditions*: "On the fifteenth day of the first month, the Upper Primordial’s Palace Lord, the First-Rank Ninefold Qi Bestowing Blessings Heavenly Official, the Purple Tenuity Great Emperor, dispatches ten celestial numinous officials, divine immortal troops, upper sagely perfected ones, and wondrously accomplished perfected persons, along with innumerable hosts, to descend into the human realm and review and determine sins and blessings. On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, the Middle Primordial’s Palace Lord, the Second-Rank Sevenfold Qi Pardoning Sins Earthly Official, the Clear Void Great Emperor, dispatches nine terrestrial numinous officials, divine immortal troops, and the troops of famous mountains and grottoes, along with innumerable hosts, to emerge into the human realm and review and admonish sins and blessings. On the fifteenth day of the tenth month, the Lower Primordial’s Palace Lord, the Third-Rank Fivefold Qi Relieving Calamities Water Official, the Supporting Florescence Great Emperor, dispatches the Nine River Water Emperors, the Twelve River Sources, the Han Valley Great Spirits, the Sunlit Valley Divine Kings, and the water bureau’s numinous officials to arrive in the human realm and review and admonish sins and blessings."

The Mysterious Emperor, in accordance with the received mandate, is hereby appointed as the Commander-in-Chief overseeing the affairs of the Three Primordials’ troops. You shall continue to command and supervise the innumerable soldiers while also investigating the conditions of the mortal realm.

chunks.original_text: 节， 八节日也。 当日更差阴阳八卦神君，交割世职也。 是日卦神，准听北极事，发号施令，开闭阴阳，生杀万物。 又按诸真经载云：诸天奉承元始诰命，於八节之日，分遣上圣高真、三素元君、九灵夫人，上诣九天行道授仙。 次遣十方救苦天尊、玉童玉女，下度九幽长夜之苦魂，及遣卦神校戒节制，雷动风散，雨泽日炬，水润生成，世间万物事。 立春日，始青天君同功曹将军、艮卦大神、稽摄提，按在人间，司渐化条风，芽条万物。 春分日，青灵帝君同太冲将军、震卦大神通视按在人间，司益化明庶风，孳萌万物。 立夏日，始丹天君同太一将军、巽卦大神赤奋若，按在人间，司常化清明风，荣大万物。 夏至日，丹灵帝君同胜先将军、离卦大神、共缺文，按在人间，司鼎化景风，鼓万物齐见。 立秋日，始素天君同傅送将军、坤卦大神诸比，按在人间，司观化冻风，使万物生味。 秋分日，皓灵帝君同从魁将军、兑卦大神、皋稽，按在人间，司孚化阎阖风，成敛万物。 立冬日，始玄天君同登明将军、乾卦大神、强禺，按在人间，司垢化不风使万物应锺。 冬至日，五灵帝君同神后将军、坎卦大神、穷奇，按在人间，司井化广莫风，宛藏万物。 每成年徧差，八卦神君理治。 凡一任除三气四十五日，余摄行下士生民种作等事。 玄帝秉北极，在天罡之柄，提纲八卦，调和寒暑，陶铸精粹。 甲子， 此日属太一中台，大使司关，会六甲元辰将，启九天司马，命童校录，予夺凡间胎产男女，预定当生日时吉凶事。 夫太一中台者，北极中宫事也。 大使，是紫微大帝也。 按《保胎经》云：元始常遣六甲直符将军、玉童玉女、从官符吏，持符执节，降在 人间，保胎护命，安魂定魄也。 甲子将军王文卿，丙子将军邢孙卿，戊子将军乐石阳，庚子将军杨仲升， 壬子将军宿上卿，乙丑将军龙季卿，丁丑将军赵子玉，己丑将军范仲阳， 辛丑将军林卫卿，癸丑将军江汉卿，甲寅将军明文章，丙寅将军张仲卿， 戊寅将军虞子张，庚寅将军褚进卿，壬寅将军丘孟卿，乙卯将军戴公阳， 丁卯将军司马卿，己卯将军石文阳，辛卯将军郭子良，癸卯将军苏他家， 甲辰将军孟非卿，丙辰将军霍叔英，戊辰将军楚季卿，庚辰将军尹佳卿， 壬辰将军武雉卿，乙巳将军唐文卿，丁巳将军崔巨卿，己巳将军何文昌， 辛巳将军杨仲公，癸巳将军史公宋，甲午将军卫上卿，丙午将军魏文公， 戊午将军从元光，庚午将军冯仲卿，壬午将军马子明，乙未将军杜仲阳， 丁未将军石叔通，己未将军时通卿，辛未将军王文章，癸未将军吕威明， 甲申将军扈文长，丙申将军朱伯众，戊申将军范伯阳，庚申将军华文阳， 壬申将军侯博卿，乙酉将军孔利公，丁酉将军臧文公，己酉将军成文长， 辛酉将军那元玉，癸酉将军孙仲房，甲戌将军江子展，丙戌将军车元升， 戊戌将军范少卿，庚戌将军史子仁，壬戌将军乐进卿，乙亥将军庞明心， 丁亥将军张文通，己亥将军酆都卿，辛亥将军左子行，癸亥将军左石松。 众帅等，每上赴中台校迁日，则先关申九天游奕使司，然后俱离人寰，玄帝统元和迁校府司，案下人间浃扶化育也。 庚申， 此日属太玄上宫，制民三尸。

The *Jié* are the Eight Seasonal Nodes. On these days, the yin-yang and Eight Trigrams Spirit Lords are newly appointed to exchange and transfer their worldly duties. On these days, the Trigram Spirits, in accordance with the authority of the North Culmen, issue commands and decrees, open and close yin and yang, and give life or death to the myriad beings.

Furthermore, as recorded in the various true scriptures: The heavens obey the edicts of the Primordial Beginning, and on the days of the Eight Nodes, dispatch the exalted perfected ones, the Three Primordial Ladies of the Pure, and the Nine Numinous Ladies to ascend to the Nine Heavens and perform the Dao to confer immortality. Next, the Ten Directions’ Savior-from-Suffering Heavenly Worthies and jade lads and maidens are sent down to deliver the souls languishing in the long night of the Nine Netherworlds. The Trigram Spirits are also dispatched to review and admonish the regulation of the nodes, where thunder stirs, winds scatter, rain and dew moisten, and the sun’s brilliance shines—water nourishes and brings all things to fruition, governing the myriad affairs of the world.

On the day of *Lìchūn* (Beginning of Spring), the Lord of the Beginning Azure Heaven, together with the Merit Clerk General, the *Gèn* Trigram Great Spirit, and the Regulator of the Celestial Handle, descends into the human realm to oversee the gradual transformation of the *tiáofēng* (sprouting wind), causing the myriad beings to bud and branch.

On the day of *Chūnfēn* (Spring Equinox), the Azure Numinous Emperor, together with the Grand Impetus General, the *Zhèn* Trigram Great Spirit, and the Inspector of Pervasive Vision, descends into the human realm to oversee the flourishing transformation of the *míngshùfēng* (bright and abundant wind), causing the myriad beings to germinate and sprout.

On the day of *Lìxià* (Beginning of Summer), the Lord of the Beginning Vermilion Heaven, together with the Grand Unity General, the *Xùn* Trigram Great Spirit, and the Red Impetuous One, descends into the human realm to oversee the constant transformation of the *qīngmíngfēng* (clear and bright wind), causing the myriad beings to flourish and grow.

On the day of *Xiàzhì* (Summer Solstice), the Vermilion Numinous Emperor, together with the Victorious Foremost General, the *Lí* Trigram Great Spirit, and [text missing], descends into the human realm to oversee the culmination of the transformation of the *jǐngfēng* (scorching wind), stirring the myriad beings to appear in full.

On the day of *Lìqiū* (Beginning of Autumn), the Lord of the Beginning White Heaven, together with the Conveying Messenger General, the *Kūn* Trigram Great Spirit, and the Multitudes of Peers, descends into the human realm to oversee the observation of the transformation of the *dòngfēng* (freezing wind), causing the myriad beings to develop flavor.

On the day of *Qiūfēn* (Autumn Equinox), the Radiant Numinous Emperor, together with the Following Chief General, the *Duì* Trigram Great Spirit, and the Examiner of the Celestial Handle, descends into the human realm to oversee the fostering transformation of the *yánhéfēng* (closing and opening wind), causing the myriad beings to mature and be harvested.

On the day of *Lìdōng* (Beginning of Winter), the Lord of the Beginning Mysterious Heaven, together with the Ascending Brightness General, the *Qián* Trigram Great Spirit, and the Strong Yu, descends into the human realm to oversee the transformation of the *bùfēng* (unceasing wind), causing the myriad beings to respond to the season’s end.

On the day of *Dōngzhì* (Winter Solstice), the Five Numinous Emperors, together with the Divine Marshal General, the *Kǎn* Trigram Great Spirit, and the Exhausted Oddity, descend into the human realm to oversee the welling transformation of the *guǎngmòfēng* (vast and desolate wind), causing the myriad beings to coil and hide.

Each year, the Eight Trigram Spirit Lords are dispatched in rotation to govern and administer. Each term of office lasts for three qi, forty-five days, while the remaining time is devoted to overseeing the affairs of the lower officials, the people, and the sowing and cultivation of crops.

The Mysterious Emperor, holding the handle of the Northern Culmen’s Celestial Pivot, directs the Eight Trigrams, harmonizes cold and heat, and refines and forges the essence and purity.

On *Jiǎzǐ* days, these belong to the Grand Unity Central Terrace, where the Grand Envoy oversees the passes. The Six Jia Generals of the Primordial Epochs assemble, and the Nine Heavens’ Marshal is summoned to command the jade lads in reviewing and recording, bestowing or depriving the mortal realm of births—male or female—and predetermining the auspicious or inauspicious circumstances of their birth times. chunks.original_text: 道言：凡胎之躯，才得成形，便有百骸表裹之神，伺察人为百事，唯三尸神领众辄言。 夫太玄号者，乃北极都畿境号也。 上宫者，乃紫微上元宫名也。 按《生神品经》载太上曰：吾以道炁运化，取象乾坤阴阳，两半假合成人，变化神识，各立司存名位。 曰脑神，曰泥丸，顶中神通天，顶前神朱阳，顶后神玄冥，顶左神青光，顶右神白章，发神曰苍华，额神日天庭，左眉神翠童，右眉神羽童，左目神曰光，右目神月光，左顾神玉关，右额神玉梁，鼻左窍通阳，鼻右鼾阴，口左神命童，口右神天粮，齿神日命关，左牙神天锺，右牙神天磬，舌神曰赤童，上唇神停盖，下唇神静舆，左颐神黄父，右颐神黄母，颈左神柱人，颈右神升平，左肩神远山，右肩神远安，左肘神飞龙，右肘神伏虎，左手神天丁，右手神天邹，左指神甲卒，右指神御凶，腋左神扶干，腋右神扶刀，左肋神卫边，右肋神防非，胸神曰天田，背神曰紫房，脊神曰运阳，腹神曰包灵，脐神曰中平，脾神曰黄常，心神曰丹元，肝神曰无英，肺神曰白元，肾神曰桃康，腰左神动关，腰右神摇停，阴神曰幽关，尸神曰幽阙，左股神玄岳，右股神玄山，左膝神转生，右膝神幽停，左胫神天柱，右胫神天关，左腂神幽狐， 右腂神幽狼，左脚神轮空，右脚神运虚，骨神曰内丁，肉神曰卫非，皮神曰包罗。 按《道喻》云：已上身神，谓之百魔。 《中黄经》曰：一者，上尸彭琚，居脑中。 二者，中尸彭质，居明堂。 三者，下尸彭矫，居腹胃。 俱各长七寸，结气成神，如赤子状，荣卫流通，运化自然； 与天地合。 每到庚申日，出入人身，上诣太玄三府署中三十六曹，下合属案内言善辍恶也。 玄帝统太玄元帅职司，案降下土弹镇百魔公事，无令妄自出入人身也。 一月一辰，降於下界， 且三元八节，甲子庚申，及三六日，则辅助造道也。 又复成年定制一十二次，秉三界大都督威柄，准一月一辰树意，案行天下，操扶社稷，普福乾坤矣。 其诸降日分在本经后十洞巡游之句下。 於是，玄帝真游功德，则溥海内外，显应昭然，承恩者庶广，称扬者颇众，皆形于方册，今谪宜为之注。 录善罚恶， 凡人之善恶，因起自身、口、意三业之感召，孰不至满稔之报。 盖玄帝真司，常警以赏罚事。 《启·圣记》云：宋朝祥符初，福州兴化军一商人程嗣昌，素好恬啖，因游密州驻交桥镇，睹猎辈酷捕飞禽，物命枉杀不忍观。 闻念将家藏戒杀图文印施，命工镂板毕，遇十一月初七真武降日，遂焚香叩拜灵空，告云此地飞禽无辜致死，愿惟圣佑图文化民从善。 及施日，税拦头彭景首请一本，张贴于壁，不期妻华三娘，才闻所诵，发怒碎搪弃秽中，即买一枚黑鲤，竟操刀刽之，其鱼跃尾，刺损阿华一目，迸血被地，苦吟万状，血乃化虫，，医巫莫疗。 景觅嗣昌诟骂，才脱潜抵，遗颂坐逝矣。 无何，镇寨厅前，见程太足悬· 空立。

chunks.original_text: 巡检宣旦知异，乃灶香问程。 太遽对言曰：吾是中天真武也，察知此地居民，累劫酷捕物命，恣充口腹，业障深重，尚未彰报。 先显阿华毁程嗣昌劝文罪，当处恶死，报岂容逃，余民犯别听。 言乾不见。 时虞部员外郎向郭，提点山泽公事过彼，闻风讶审宣旦，示程嗣昌亲笔颂文。 曰：我不伤残命，皇天赐善名，诸人还未信，报应甚分明。 洎读毕恳而怀归，回朝敷奏真宗皇帝，嘉赐赞谥，真武灵验，事仰誊白，附礼典照，应御制曰：三元一神，通应十门，炜烨光祥，咸真灭顶。 故仰知玄帝，录一程嗣昌者，劝百善。 罚一华嚚妇者，惩百恶。 《感应篇》曰：其有曾行恶事，后自改悔，诸恶莫作，众善奉行，久久必获吉庆，谓转祸成福者也。 辅正除邪， 君上尊为万姓之表，表正则天下何物不正，政在克忠，辅臣俾民咸遂其性。 故帝历阴相社稷之权，每分真寄凡，以辅正有国，僭称妖淫岂能久害邦国哉。 《启圣记》云：唐高宗崩，於柩前立皇太子豫王登极，时武后擅政，放帝居房州，后即擢母弟之子贺全龙，充管内提点，除殿前观察使，惟习妖术是务，诈号曰北极七元助国正法也。 后每奇之，全龙恃宠擅权，谗黜百僚。 忽闻泰川路告急，奏今西鄙诸耶王赵宏，统妖兵入境，助战威武者，乃蛇虎烟火、百端精怪，今本司用兵不前。 群臣议奏贺全龙行本身七元法往克。 武后依敕，下枢密崔察授符，给兵三千，领抵寇锋，大军亡半，家童折三，全龙无措，边郡转危求收。 朝臣再议，保奏黄门侍郎裴涛一未仕子仲芳，年登十六二貌异材神，必能次胜赵宏妖寇。 后宣见，赐光禄大夫，官兵五百，敕免朝辞。 归拜父母，佩剑提兵，直抵寇阵，乃挥剑折冲，其赵宏倒戈堕马，兵僵妖溃，尽擒回朝。 趋见武后，赐登殿坐。 敕抚曰：朕知卿天神人耶。 光禄始奏贺全龙，事狐女元纲妖术，有玷国风。 后尚保爱全龙，宣令担家童数百入内，当殿比试七元法。 全龙至，叩牙叹水以成云雾，童子皆腾空际，放荡狂风骤霰雨雹。 光禄挥剑招之，一一堕描，入剑鞘内，举真火咒焚灭。 於是，莘臣称贺太平，放大赦遍布天下。 时通天元年九月，竟改号神功元年也。 光禄既闻，告别父母，曰：儿自天来，今从北去。 言讫退揖坐逝，不觉尸腾云际，仙乐嘹晓，冉冉投北方而去。 事奏圣听，追封爵号神应将军。 涛奏纳官，请宅为观，武后依，赠涛号神应庆清居士，就名观额，唐祚复兴也。 乃玄帝警示后世人臣，无设奸雄之佞，犯者无不摈绝。 且人怀正念，必至真玄，邪念未成，立遭恶趣。

The patrol inspector Xuan Dan, sensing the strangeness at dawn, burned incense and inquired of Cheng. The apparition hastily replied: "I am the Perfected Warrior of the Central Heaven. I have observed that the residents of this land, over countless kalpas, have wantonly slaughtered living beings to sate their appetites, amassing grave karmic obstructions—yet their retribution has not yet manifested. First, I revealed Hua’s crime of destroying Cheng Sichang’s exhortative text, decreeing her an evil death as just recompense, for retribution admits no escape. As for the other transgressors, let them heed this warning."

With these words, the vision vanished.

At that time, the Vice Minister of the Ministry of Works, Xiang Guo, passing through on his mission to oversee the mountains and marshes, heard the rumors and questioned Xuan Dan, who presented Cheng Sichang’s handwritten ode. It read:

*"I spare no living breath,
And Heaven grants me a virtuous name.
If still you doubt this truth,
Behold how clear the karmic reckoning."*

Having read it with reverence, he took the text back with him. Upon returning to court, he reported the matter to Emperor Zhenzong, who praised and bestowed posthumous honors, affirming the numinous efficacy of the Perfected Warrior. The event was recorded in the ritual canon, and the imperial composition declared:

*"One Spirit of the Three Primordials,
Responding through the Ten Gates,
Radiant with auspicious light,
All true, all-pervading, vanquishing the demonic."*

Thus, the August Emperor acknowledged the Dark Sovereign’s decree: that Cheng Sichang’s exhortation to a hundred virtues be recorded, and Hua’s punishment as a wicked woman serve to chastise a hundred evils.

*The Book of Stimulus and Response* states: "One who has committed evil deeds but later repents, refraining from all wrongdoing and practicing all virtues, shall in time surely attain good fortune—transforming misfortune into blessing."

To uphold the upright and expel the perverse: the sovereign, revered as the exemplar for all people, sets the standard. When the standard is upright, what in the world will not be set right? Governance lies in fostering loyalty, and ministers aid the people in fully realizing their nature.

Thus, the emperor, wielding the unseen authority of the state, distinguishes the true from the mundane to uphold the upright in governance. How could usurpers and licentious rebels long harm the nation?

*The Record of the Sage’s Manifestation* recounts: After Emperor Gaozong of Tang passed, his coffin stood before the court as the Crown Prince Yuwang ascended the throne. At the time, Empress Wu held power and exiled the emperor to Fangzhou. She then elevated her cousin’s son, He Quanlong, to the post of Regional Inspector and appointed him Palace Observation Envoy, though he devoted himself solely to sorcery. He falsely styled himself the "Seven Essences of the Northern Culmen, Dharma Aide to the State."

The empress, favoring him, allowed Quanlong to wield unchecked authority, slandering and demoting officials. Suddenly, word came of an emergency in the Taichuan region: the western chieftain Zhao Hong, leading demonic troops, had invaded, his forces comprising serpents, tigers, smoke, fire, and a hundred monstrous apparitions. The local command dared not advance.

The ministers proposed sending He Quanlong with his Seven Essences Dharma to repel the threat. Empress Wu approved, and the Privy Councilor Cui Cha bestowed talismans and dispatched three thousand troops to confront the enemy. Half the army perished, and three of Quanlong’s household servants were lost. Helpless, Quanlong watched as the borderlands teetered on collapse.

The court ministers deliberated again and petitioned to summon Pei Tao, a Yellow Gate Attendant, and his sixteen-year-old son, Zhongfang, whose appearance and talents were extraordinary. They were certain he could defeat Zhao Hong’s demonic horde. The empress summoned him, bestowed the title of Grand Master of Splendid Happiness, and granted him five hundred soldiers, exempting him from the usual court farewell.

Returning home to pay respects to his parents, he girded his sword and led his troops straight to the enemy lines. With a sweep of his blade, he routed the foe—Zhao Hong fell from his horse, his troops frozen, his sorcery dissolved. The enemy was captured and brought back to the capital.

Hastening to see Empress Wu, he was invited to ascend the dais and sit. The empress soothed him, saying, "We know you are a divine being."

The Grand Master then exposed He Quanlong’s affair with the fox spirit Yuan Gang, whose sorcery had sullied the nation’s dignity. Though the empress still favored Quanlong, she ordered him to bring hundreds of his household servants into the palace for a public trial of the Seven Essences Dharma.

When Quanlong arrived, he gnashed his teeth and spat water to conjure clouds and mist, sending his servants soaring into the air. He unleashed violent winds, hail, and sleet. Zhongfang brandished his sword and summoned them—one by one, they fell, drawn into his scabbard. He then invoked true fire and incinerated them with a spell.

Thereupon, the assembled ministers celebrated the return of peace, and a general amnesty was proclaimed throughout the land. In the ninth month of the first year of the Tongtian era, the reign title was changed to Shen’gong.

Afterward, the Grand Master took leave of his parents, saying, "I came from Heaven; now I depart to the North." With these words, he bowed and sat in meditation, his body ascending into the clouds amid celestial music. Slowly, he drifted toward the northern skies.

The matter was reported to the throne, and he was posthumously enfeoffed as the Divine Responsive General. Pei Tao resigned his office and requested that his residence be converted into a Daoist abbey. The empress consented, bestowing upon Tao the title Divine Responsive Celebrated Layman of Purity, and the abbey was named accordingly. The Tang dynasty’s fortunes were thus revived.

This was the Dark Sovereign’s warning to later generations of ministers: let none establish themselves as treacherous villains, for those who transgress shall without exception be cast out. Moreover, let people harbor upright thoughts, and they shall surely attain the true and mysterious. Let perverse thoughts not take form, lest they immediately incur dire consequences.

chunks.original_text: 济拔天人， 水、火、木、金、土、谷六物，因地生而天成，人得养生送死。 故君为民之天，食乃命之天，民赖君安，君以民立，尚有凶年歉岁，造化然耳。 唯有德君，上能解劫变灾凶，回为休祥，资接兆民。 按《启圣记》：宋太祖在　周显德元年，行营征瀛斤，路逢夕羽士，密告贵极兆云：总得真武阴助。 言讫化光去。 太祖信诚，章醮露答毕，而果承周禅，国号曰宋，改元建隆，徧赏天下军旅。 惟瀛州阙乏，陈畴奏请，表至迷库积蕃商寄钱五万贯，欲借充边戍犒赏。 回旨依，给付高阳关郑度支遣，讫续据蕃商伊寿先等到司。 陈畴斋周，朝通关文，牒迷寄库钱事，因赵王昨会太白金星告兆，烧献钱币，赠吾恩主真武，照疏收外，出剩钱五万，遣吾换易，凡财椿管赵王使用讫。 言毕，商人不见。 畴具实奏，上览喜慰不胜。
chunks.translated_text:
The salvation of celestial and mortal beings lies in the six elements—water, fire, wood, metal, earth, and grain—which arise from the earth and are perfected by Heaven, sustaining human life from birth to death. Thus, the ruler is the people’s Heaven, and food is the Heaven of destiny. The people rely on the ruler for peace, just as the ruler is established by the people. Yet even so, there may come years of famine and scarcity, for such is the work of Creation.

Only a virtuous ruler, in his exalted power, can dissolve calamities, transform disasters into blessings, and succor the myriad people. According to the *Records of the Divine Manifestation*: In the first year of Xiande during the Later Zhou, when Emperor Taizu of Song was leading his forces on campaign against Ying Prefecture, he encountered an immortal at dusk who secretly revealed the signs of his future greatness, saying, "You shall receive the hidden aid of the True Warrior." With these words, the immortal vanished in a flash of light. Taizu, firm in his faith, performed rites of thanksgiving and supplication, and soon thereafter he indeed received the abdication of the Zhou, establishing the Song dynasty. He changed the reign title to Jianlong and rewarded his armies throughout the realm. Only Ying Prefecture was found wanting, and Chen Chou submitted a memorial requesting that the five hundred thousand strings of cash deposited in the imperial treasury by foreign merchants be borrowed to fund the border garrisons and rewards.

The imperial assent was granted, and the funds were dispatched to Zheng, the fiscal commissioner of Gaoyang Pass. Later, the foreign merchants Yi Shouxian and others arrived at the bureau. Chen Chou, having purified himself, submitted a memorial to the court, detailing the matter of the deposited funds. He explained that the Prince of Zhao had previously received an omen from the Star of Venus, and in gratitude, had burned offerings of money and silk to the True Warrior, our gracious patron. Upon reviewing the memorial, it was discovered that an additional fifty thousand strings of cash remained. The Prince of Zhao had sent the merchants to exchange them, and all the wealth was now under his management for his use.

When the merchants finished speaking, they vanished. Chen Chou reported the matter in full, and upon reading his memorial, the emperor was overcome with joy and gratitude.

This was the Dark Sovereign’s warning to later generations of ministers: let none establish themselves as treacherous villains, for those who transgress shall without exception be cast out. Moreover, let people harbor upright thoughts, and they shall surely attain the true and mysterious. Let perverse thoughts not take form, lest they immediately incur dire consequences.

chunks.original_text: 至二年三月一日，百官陪驾，升端明殿，论议诸道侯王，各据山河，累征未克事。 俄顷，黑雾叆叇殿前，四目不通。 丞相赵普独邀驾登孝成殿。 方坐，仰见云际一神人，恭揖皇帝，遽降启曰：皇基鼎祚运新昌，尧舜须依人唤将，莫似后奢才得位，逆奸依玷乱施张。 太祖躬问：圣者何职？ 降曰：吾非土地，职系天都右胜府事，吾欲适燕地乃遥闻圣虑，特当驻报，吾囊赴三天，闻宋僭不踰纪帝。 普躬谢圣论间，真武辞升。 至建隆三年秋，据河北二路申闻，两载旱荒，军民乏粮，事大不堪，官史莫能措画。 忽於七月七日清晨，二十军州各有粟麦，堆垛盈城，糜袋缝记，总是黑云马纸粘糊。 况其物货无主，亦无夫脚，州军互审，申奏朝廷。 三司看讫回旨，物货岂得无主，盖是国家德感真武，出天仓粟麦，垂济二路。 横计已得十五万石，仰低价赈粜，接活军民方苏。 上闻喜曰：恩非小可，曷敢不报。 遇真武降日，帝躬驾玄都殿，香火瞻敬。 按董真君降笔云：玄帝以道德开化，如天地湛然默有成功之理，无一时不念众生，无一刻不怜下土，每知劫数，必先以开济之诚，上奏金阙，匈减分数，至於蛮夷猾夏之处，亦行教化，可谓大慈普救无上法王也。 祛妖摄毒， 凡被妖毒灾告干扰之地，未有不随人愆业乘染也。 大抵皇天无亲，德是辅，唯君子正心，则自然感格帝威光，祛禳制摄诸不祥事。 《启圣记》云：赵州石光祖，乃右胜府下副参谋官，谪降佐辅宋三十余年，至太平兴国初，拜观文殿大学士右谏议大夫，解逝复还北极职事矣。 从弟尚书礼部侍读石光嗣，出镇洪州兼知此地，及潭鼎衡鄂荆。 期连蛮貊，当被七十二猖神，横流邪毒，枉害人命。 况彼一带居民，少亲正教，不识医药，惟务左道，祭赛南神。 况斯民盛习此等妖卫，自号金刚法事，施用油火刀刃，移发狂魂，巫言息家，实幻惑财物也。 光嗣禁止，竟不令行，遂命罗浮洞道士淡居邈章醮，恳祷真武，仪散圣号位牌，教民奉事仪式，於下降日咸诵经咒，积有岁月，其左道妖民猖神邪毒悉皆潜伏矣。 又淮阳军进‘士陈拱臣，幼年获一小龟，其状异常，收养于家，一味食枣。 拱臣洎登科之岁，顿然龟大，无何一宵，龟身负一赤蛇盘绕。 拱臣知是祥瑞，求画真武圣容一堂，延供久之，祷无不佑。 拱臣擢信阳参军，忽承转运费瓖，委充监修筑城部辖役夫。 值冬，疫疠流行，军民染患，久滞工役。 拱臣闷坐，恍见龟前作人语，曰：吾闻参军部役遭瘟，特来献祛禳之咀曰，天罡天魁，立驱电雾，施我阴功，狂横速去。 一炁念三徧，仰面向西北方收炁，吹水盂中，用杨技濡洒息身即愈。 略此佃谢见养之恩，吾今还北极事。 言讫而觉，既行其验立应。 忽家书至，迷养龟已失，同梦时也。
chunks.translated_text:
By the second year, on the first day of the third month, the hundred officials accompanied the emperor to ascend the Hall of Illuminated Virtue, where they deliberated on the various regional lords and kings, each entrenched in their mountains and rivers, their repeated campaigns yet unconquered.

Suddenly, a dense black mist enveloped the hall’s forecourt, obscuring all sight. Chancellor Zhao Pu alone invited the emperor to ascend the Hall of Filial Accomplishment. As they took their seats, a divine figure appeared amidst the clouds above, bowing reverently to the emperor before descending to address him: *"The imperial foundation stands firm, its destiny newly flourishing; like Yao and Shun, you must summon the right men to aid your reign. Beware the folly of later rulers who gained the throne through excess, lest treacherous rebels stain your rule with chaos."*

The Great Ancestor personally inquired, *"What office does the sage hold?"*
The figure replied, *"I am no earthly spirit but serve as the Right Victorious Prefect of the Heavenly Capital. Bound for Yan territory, I overheard your concerns and paused to report: I have just returned from the Three Heavens, where I learned that the Song’s usurpation shall not exceed the span of a reign. The Way of Heaven is just."*

As Zhao Pu bowed in gratitude, the True Warrior took his leave and ascended.

In the autumn of the third year of Jianlong, reports arrived from the two circuits of Hebei: two years of drought had left the military and people without grain, a dire crisis no official could resolve. Then, on the seventh day of the seventh month at dawn, twenty commanderies and prefectures each found their cities piled high with heaps of millet and wheat, their sacks stitched with markings of black cloud and horse paper. The goods had no owner, no porters, and the prefectures, after verifying one another’s accounts, memorialized the court.

The Three Departments reviewed the matter and issued a decree: *"How could such goods lack an owner? This is the virtue of our dynasty moving the True Warrior to release grain from the Heavenly Granary to relieve the two circuits."* In total, some 150,000 *shi* of grain were distributed at low prices to revive the starving military and people.

Upon hearing this, the emperor exclaimed in joy, *"Such grace is no small matter—how dare we not repay it?"* On the day the True Warrior descended, the emperor personally attended the Hall of the Dark Capital, offering incense and reverence.

According to the *Descended Writings of Master Dong*, the Dark Emperor governs through the Dao and virtue, embodying the silent, effortless success of Heaven and Earth. He never ceases to care for all beings, nor does he abandon the lands below for even a moment. Whenever he foresees calamity, he first petitions the Golden Gates with sincerity to mitigate its severity. Even among the rebellious tribes and those who disrupt the Central Kingdom, he extends his teachings, truly the Great Compassionate Savior and Supreme Dharma King.

He dispels demons and neutralizes poisons—wherever lands are afflicted by malevolent forces or plagues, it is invariably due to the people’s transgressions and karmic defilements. As the saying goes, *"Heaven shows no favoritism; only virtue is its support."* When the noble ruler rectifies his heart, he naturally invokes the awe-inspiring radiance of the Divine, dispelling and restraining all inauspicious events.

The *Records of the Divine Manifestation* state: Zhao Guangzu of Shanzhou, deputy strategist under the Right Victorious Prefecture, was demoted to assist the Song for over thirty years. By the early Taiping Xingguo era, he was appointed Grand Scholar of the Hall of Illustrious Literature and Right Remonstrating Censor, before passing away and returning to his post in the Northern Culmen.

His younger cousin, Shi Guangsi, Minister of Rites and Reader-in-Waiting of the Ministry of Rites, was dispatched to govern Hongzhou and concurrently oversee the regions of Tan, Ding, Heng, E, and Jing. These lands bordered the barbarian tribes, where seventy-two ferocious spirits and rampant demonic toxins wantonly claimed lives. The people there, estranged from the true teachings and ignorant of medicine, indulged in heterodox practices, sacrificing to southern deities. They called their sorcery *"Vajra Dharma Rites,"* employing oil, fire, and blades to summon frenzied spirits, with shamans deceiving households to extort wealth.

Guangsi forbade these practices and, unable to suppress them, commanded the Daoist Dan Jumiao of Luofu Grotto to perform a grand *zhang* ritual, fervently praying to the True Warrior. He distributed sacred tablets bearing the deity’s name and taught the people the proper rites. On the days of the deity’s descent, they chanted scriptures and incantations for months on end, until the heterodox practitioners, ferocious spirits, and demonic toxins all vanished into hiding.

Elsewhere, Chen Gongchen of Huaiyang Commandery, a presented scholar, had kept an unusual young tortoise since childhood, feeding it only jujubes. In the year Gongchen passed the imperial examinations, the tortoise suddenly grew large. One night, its shell bore a coiled red serpent. Recognizing this as an auspicious sign, Gongchen commissioned a hall of portraits depicting the True Warrior and enshrined them for worship, with every prayer answered.

Later, as Gongchen was promoted to Assistant Magistrate of Xinyang, he was unexpectedly appointed by the Fiscal Commissioner Fei Qiang to supervise the construction of city walls and manage the laborers. That winter, an epidemic spread, afflicting the military and people and halting the work. As Gongchen sat in distress, he suddenly heard the tortoise speak before him: *"I have learned of the epidemic among your laborers and come to offer an incantation for dispelling it: 'Celestial Stem, Celestial Branch, swiftly drive away the storm. Bestow upon me this hidden merit, and may the madness depart at once.' Recite this thrice while inhaling *qi*, then exhale into a water basin. Sprinkle the water with willow branches to cleanse the afflicted, and they shall recover. This is my repayment for your care. I now return to my duties in the Northern Culmen."*

As the tortoise finished speaking, Gongchen awoke. He performed the ritual, and its efficacy was immediate. Soon after, a letter arrived from home—his tortoise had vanished at the very hour of his dream.

chunks.original_text: 修城完日，以由罡禀漕台，瓖详体具奏，朝廷回降旨，下就信场城建立水火二神殿，咒文勒石，永为救民。 化宗追封敕赐二神，号曰：神龟同德佐理至应大道显明武济阴威翼圣左正侍云骑护国保宁辅肃玄初太一天大左将军，圣蛇同德佑理至惠诚重威慈普济阴办武圣右正侍云骑护国保静辅肃守玄太一天大右将军。 以副上意。 切切为之。 以副上意，切切为之之句，是玉童缴白玄武将军遵命也。 玄武辞谢诰职，出离北极之宫，即日赴右胜府，置理任所委公事矣。 太上说玄天大圣真武本传神咒妙经卷之一竟 太上说玄天大圣真武本传神咒妙经卷之二

chunks.original_text: 廛人方田子佩升玄内教箓陈伀集疏 时有真人，名曰妙行，特离斑次，竦伏帝前。 曰：臣宿有因缘，得闻妙理。 北方大将，玄武将军，巡察天人，录善罚恶，不知此将，应化何因，有何神通，鬼神降伏？ 是殿每朝会，较结录籍，不辍须臾，具元仪毕，许请问诸因缘事。 愿惟大造，少悟小聪。 十极之中真人位号，皆有妙行之称，唯东极官中者最，作是班之领首。 《庄子》曰：且有真人然后有真知。 引证彼真人之行虚皇尊曰：与真常会，无有明相，孰为妙行。 时会中诸来者，俱恪守班次，惟束极妙行，出算越班，伏奏练求於紫微帝前，而自颂宿契，得闻玄武有妙理之因，故发愿唯问赞大造之副，少悟小聪之恳为请耶。 夫道之字曰大也，化之名曰造也，仰之大而化之之谓圣。 此圣者，果神智六通，能摈摄鬼神事。 是时，大帝隐凡而言：妙哉真人，能为凡间。 然其玄武应化之因，渺邈难穷，希夷莫究。 隐凡者，乃伏凡也。 时紫微大帝闻请，则听然伏御几案而俯示大众，兴以赞羡妙行真人诚发妙哉之问。 玄武应化神通，职业盛事耶，故妙行善能为凡间，启尘俗之人普欲，使将来知有天神玄武，凡身修炼，了证六通总司三界功过等事。 且渺邈难穷者，谓通化无绪，无所不入，莫可得而穷者也。 希夷莫究者，谓神变难测，无所不容，莫可得而究者也。 按《灵宝智慧上品证六通谱》曰：天眼神通，视智高慧，通目中朱童，总五色之光，洞观无碍，自上自下，四方八面，无所不照，无所不明。 地耳神通，听智远慧，虚廓中元窗，总五声之音，声感响应，上闻九天，下听九地，无所不知，无所不究。 东鼻神通，空智清慧，寥孔神黄宁，总五气之氛，洞妙自然，出入阴阳，往来无门。 西口神通，虚智微慧，郎窍官太和，总五味之清，洞达神英，虚无不纳，颐无不容。 南心神通，清智明慧，开舌司正伦，总五神之柄，洞杳飞芒，经纬万方，不疾而速，不行而至。 北手神通，微智遐慧，深主司人，关法四时，玄序洞妙九微，把握生端，上应天关，阴察祸福。 是故玄帝，由持此之大戒，处凡而能摄伏眼、耳、鼻、口、心、手之尘欲，乃得经济，而神性兼通於六洞也。 然后威加鬼神应，诸外道不祥莫不闻风而 伏玄帝欤。 盖乃玄元圣祖，护度天人，应化之身，神明之妙。 玄帝圣祖乃祖炁也。 三宝之尊神是欤。 天宝君主圣祖始炁出书时，号高上大有玉清宫。 灵宝君主元炁出书度人时，号上清玄都玉京七宝紫微宫。 神宝君主玄炁出书时，号三皇洞神太清太极宫。 并出大有金书。 天宝以开天地之光，灵宝以开九幽长夜之魂，神宝以制万灵之事。 故知太上护度应化之恩，每随人天诸根性渐令入诸圆成也。 存神者，助神通以化之。 见明者，教明察令变之。 《中斗经》曰：大道无形，常居杳冥，圣中之圣，灵中之灵，包罗无外，含养众生。 盖无形之为道，非有象之可言，变化亿千，虚无难测。 盖元炁也，非弗是也。 元始天生地。 《清净经》曰：大道无形，生育天地。 《应运经》曰：太虚无象，朴散为人，天布日月星辰之象，地结山川海岳之形，人禀五行阴阳之秀，皆本祖炁相承，弗是有象可言耶。 《苟子》曰：天不言而人推高焉，地不言而人推厚焉，天地为大矣。
chunks.translated_text:
Within the marketplace dweller’s abode, Fang Tianzi and Pei Shengxuan of the Ascended Mystery received the Inner Teachings Register, while Chen Zhong compiled the annotations. At that moment, a Perfected One named Wondrous Conduct emerged from the ranks, prostrating himself before the Celestial Throne. He declared: "This servant, by past karmic affinity, has been granted to hear the wondrous principles. The Great General of the Northern Quarter, the Dark Warrior General, patrols and inspects the affairs of heaven and humanity, recording good deeds and punishing evil—yet I know not by what karmic cause this General manifests, nor what divine powers he possesses, nor how he subdues gods and spirits. At every court assembly, the tallying and binding of records never cease for even a moment. Now that the foundational rites are complete, may I humbly inquire into these karmic matters? I pray the Great Creator may grant me the slightest awakening, the smallest wisdom."

Among the Ten Poles, the titles of Perfected Ones all bear the name "Wondrous Conduct," yet none surpass those of the Eastern Pole, who lead the ranks. As *Zhuangzi* states: "Only with Perfected Ones does true knowledge arise." Citing this, the August Sovereign of the Void and Lofty declared: "To unite with the True and Constant, without fixed appearance—what could be more wondrous?"

All present at the assembly strictly observed their ranks, save for Wondrous Conduct of the Eastern Pole, who stepped forth, prostrated himself before the Purple Tenuity Emperor, and recited his past vows. Having heard of the Dark Warrior’s wondrous karmic causes, he now entreated to praise the Great Creator’s design and seek the slightest awakening, the smallest wisdom.

The character for *Dao* is "Great"; the name for transformation is "Creation." To revere the Great and embody transformation—this is sageliness. Such a sage indeed possesses the sixfold divine knowledge, capable of commanding and subduing gods and spirits.

At that time, the Great Emperor, veiling his transcendence in mortal guise, replied: "How wondrous, Perfected One, that you act on behalf of the mortal realm! Yet the Dark Warrior’s karmic manifestation is vast and boundless, subtle and unfathomable." (Here, "veiling his transcendence" means concealing his divinity.) Hearing the plea, the Purple Tenuity Emperor leaned forward over his imperial desk, addressing the assembly with admiration for Wondrous Conduct’s earnest inquiry. The Dark Warrior’s manifested powers and sacred duties are indeed profound—thus does Wondrous Conduct serve the mortal realm, awakening the desires of worldly beings, that they may know of the celestial Dark Warrior, cultivate their mortal forms, and attain the sixfold knowledge to govern the merits and transgressions of the Three Realms.

"Vast and boundless" describes his transformations as limitless, pervading all without exception, beyond all tracing. "Subtle and unfathomable" describes his divine changes as inscrutable, embracing all without limit, beyond all comprehension.

According to the *Register of the Sixfold Knowledge from the Upper Chapters of the Numinous Treasure’s Wisdom*: The divine eye’s knowledge sees with lofty wisdom, its crimson pupil gathering the five hues of light, perceiving all without obstruction—above and below, in the four directions and eight quarters—nothing unseen, nothing unclear. The divine ear’s knowledge hears with distant wisdom, its primordial aperture in the void gathering the five sounds, resonating with all vibrations, hearing the Nine Heavens above and the Nine Earths below—nothing unknown, nothing unexamined. The divine nose’s knowledge breathes with empty wisdom, its ethereal cavity gathering the five qi, naturally penetrating yin and yang, coming and going without gate. The divine mouth’s knowledge tastes with subtle wisdom, its harmonious orifice gathering the five flavors, embracing all without rejection, containing all without limit. The divine heart’s knowledge discerns with luminous wisdom, its tongue governing the five spirits, its radiance traversing the ten thousand directions—swift without haste, arriving without movement. The divine hand’s knowledge grasps with profound wisdom, presiding over humanity, regulating the four seasons, its dark sequence permeating the nine subtleties, seizing the origins of life, corresponding to the Celestial Gate above, discerning fortune and misfortune in the hidden.

Thus, the Dark Emperor, by upholding these great precepts, dwells in the mortal realm yet masters the desires of eye, ear, nose, mouth, heart, and hand, thereby attaining governance and uniting his divine nature with the sixfold knowledge. Then his might extends over gods and spirits, and all external demons and inauspicious forces submit at the mere rumor of the Dark Emperor.

For he is the Mysterious Origin Sage Ancestor, protector and deliverer of heaven and humanity, a manifested body of divine subtlety. The Dark Emperor Sage Ancestor is the primordial qi. He is the revered deity of the Three Treasures.

The Heavenly Treasure Lord presides over the primordial qi at the dawn of scripture, known as the Highest Great Possession Jade Clarity Palace. The Numinous Treasure Lord presides over the original qi at the deliverance of humanity, known as the Upper Clarity Mysterious Capital Jade Capital Seven Treasures Purple Tenuity Palace. The Divine Treasure Lord presides over the mysterious qi at the revelation of scripture, known as the Three Sovereigns’ Grotto Spirit Supreme Clarity Grand Ultimate Palace. All issue forth the Great Possession Golden Script.

The Heavenly Treasure illuminates the light of heaven and earth; the Numinous Treasure awakens the souls of the Nine Dark Realms; the Divine Treasure governs the affairs of the myriad spirits. Thus do we know the grace of the Most High’s protection and deliverance, gradually guiding the faculties of humans and celestials toward perfection.

Those who preserve the spirit assist its transformations through divine knowledge. Those who perceive the luminous teach discernment to effect change.

The *Scripture of the Central Dipper* states: "The Great Dao is formless, ever dwelling in the profound and obscure. The holiest among the holy, the most numinous among the numinous, it encompasses all without exclusion, nurturing all beings." For the Dao, being formless, cannot be described by any image; its transformations are myriad, its emptiness unfathomable. This is the primordial qi—nothing else.

The Primordial Heaven generates Earth. The *Scripture of Purity* states: "The Great Dao is formless, giving birth to heaven and earth." The *Scripture of Responding to the Times* states: "The Great Void is imageless; when its simplicity scatters, it becomes humanity. Heaven arrays the images of sun, moon, and stars; Earth forms the shapes of mountains, rivers, seas, and peaks; humanity receives the essence of the five phases and yin-yang—all inheriting the ancestral qi, yet can this be spoken of as having form?"

*Xunzi* says: "Heaven does not speak, yet people revere its height; Earth does not speak, yet people revere its depth. How great are Heaven and Earth!"

chunks.original_text: 人不诚则不能化万物，是故元始行不言之教，而强名曰道较之。 变化亿千者，数也。 且万得十千，兆则百千，亿计千千矣。 千千名大千世界，机分百万於虚无中，推运是理也。 弥纶万天，统御万界，以分万，以明万物，以传万法，制御万灵，摄召万炁，以通万化，槟斥万魔，不着万有。 云云莫测。 且玄元圣祖，八十一次显为老君，大洞天宝君，内号曰玄元圣之祖也。 乃生一成二，以开大罗三境之天，出号曰元始也。 洞玄灵宝君，内号曰玉晨虚皇，尊法三三不夜之光，开九霄之天境，出号曰大道君也。 洞神神宝君，内号曰玄元后圣，君法九九八十一炁，布列八十一阳天，方显号曰老君也。 《混元经》曰：老君颜若婴兄，生成须发皓白，上天内号曰老子。 《叔教品经》曰：元始故命老子托化人间，或夷或夏，随世改号，演说科诫，开度一切有为群品也。 按《道藏总龟》载：当太古上三皇时，号万天玄师，出玄中大法於世。 中三皇时，号曰有古先生，出太素经於世。 下三皇时，号曰金阙真人，出金阙秘经於世。 教民以太平无为之道也。 上古伏义氏时，号曰郁华子，当出元阳经於世，教顺性命之道。 神农氏时，号曰大成子，出太一元精经於世，教以好生之道。 轩辕氏时，号广成子，出道诫经，教以飞腾之学。 游净乐国时，号紫元君，授玄帝太和玉虚之诀，教以智慧上品大戒，乃归根之道。 中古少昊时，世号曰鸿蒙子。 颛顼时，世号曰赤精子。 帝舜时，世号曰录图子。 帝尧时，世号曰尹寿子。 帝舜时，世号曰务成子。 夏禹时，世号曰真成子。 商汤时，世号曰锡则子。 周文王时，世号老聘，官佐柱下史，出道德二经於世，时关令尹喜受学，今补为大罗玉清圣境太师之官，判天枢院事。 《庄子》曰：关尹老聘，古之博大真人也。 寂寞无形，变化无常。 仙翁葛洪曰：老子是天地之精神，无世不出。 八十二次变为玄武。 玄武名成於后天之际。 按《降笔实录》玄武果先天始炁五灵玄老之化，乃元始化身，太极别体。 上三皇时，下降为太始真人。 孔颖达疏《老子》云，道生一，此太极是也。 太极生两仪。 中三皇时，下降为太初真人。 日月在太易时，含光太初时发辉。 下三皇时，下降为太素真人。 按《白虎通》载：形兆既成，名曰太素。 此燧皇立人夫妇之道化。 当黄帝时，生净乐国为王子，时道号潜云子。 於道有功，玉帝奖勋，始封玄帝之号也。 夫大道者，元始帝先赐封五灵玄老，开北召水，乃元黄植象之根。 次渐分气化形一，一为上帝之官也。 谨显诸化，太始天一，二身太初太阴，辰星月孛，斗、牛、女、虚、危、室、壁二十九身，六甲、壬癸一十八身，太素北狱亥子丑乾坎七身，风、雷、雨、电、霹雳一十五身，羌老八煞人星一十身，至玄帝身，乃第八十二次化也。 故知玄武者，老君变化之身，武曲显灵之验。 老君别号，曰混元上帝易有太极是也。 《太极分化太始经》。 曰：老君变化之身也，大帝人以其从弟武曲显灵事，验处为比者，盖两圣功德颇类。 按《北斗本生经》曰：昔龙汉初劫，有周上御国紫光夫人，於上春日游玩，至温玉池边，方脱衣澡盥，忽感莲蕊，九苞一开发，中有化生九子。 夫人护抱，鞠养宫中，志愿惟成圣哲，佐辅乾坤。
chunks.translated_text:
Man, if not sincere, cannot transform the myriad things. Thus, the Primordial Beginning enacts the teaching without words, and by force of naming, it is called the *Dao* for comparison.

That which transforms in myriad ways is number. Ten thousand makes ten thousand; a *zhao* is a hundred thousand, and a *yi* is a thousand thousand. A thousand thousand is called the Great Thousandfold World. The mechanism divides a hundred myriad within the Void, and this principle governs its operation. It encompasses the ten thousand heavens, governs the ten thousand realms, divides the ten thousand, illuminates the ten thousand things, transmits the ten thousand methods, controls the ten thousand spirits, gathers and summons the ten thousand *qi*, communicates the ten thousand transformations, repels the ten thousand demons, and does not cling to the ten thousand existences. Such profundities are unfathomable.

Moreover, the Mysterious Primordial Sage Ancestor manifested eighty-one times as Lord Lao. Within the Great Cavern Heaven, he is honored as the Precious Lord, and his inner title is the Mysterious Primordial Sage Ancestor. From the One he generated the Two, thereby opening the heavens of the Great Luo’s Three Realms, and his appellation became the Primordial Beginning. The Lord of the Cavern Mystery and Numinous Treasure, whose inner title is the Jade Dawn Void Sovereign, venerates the threefold light of the undying night, opening the celestial realm of the Nine Empyreans, and his appellation became the Great Dao Lord. The Lord of the Cavern Spirit and Divine Treasure, whose inner title is the Mysterious Primordial Latter Sage, governs the eighty-one *qi* of the ninefold nine, arranging the eighty-one yang heavens, and his manifest appellation became Lord Lao.

The *Scripture of the Primordial Origin* states: "Lord Lao’s countenance resembled that of a child; his beard and hair were hoary white. His inner title in heaven was Laozi." The *Scripture of the Teachings of the Branches* states: "The Primordial Beginning therefore commanded Laozi to incarnate among humanity, whether among the Yi or the Xia, changing his name with the times, expounding precepts and admonitions, and initiating the deliverance of all conditioned beings."

According to the *Comprehensive Tortoise of the Daoist Canon*: During the High Antiquity of the Upper Three Sovereigns, he was called the Mysterious Master of the Ten Thousand Heavens, revealing the Great Law of the Mysterious Center to the world. During the Middle Three Sovereigns, he was called Master Yougu, revealing the *Scripture of Grand Simplicity* to the world. During the Lower Three Sovereigns, he was called the Perfected of the Golden Portal, revealing the *Secret Scripture of the Golden Portal* to the world, teaching the people the Way of Grand Peace and non-action.

In the age of Fuxi of High Antiquity, he was called Master Yuhua, revealing the *Scripture of Primordial Yang* to the world and teaching the Way of following one’s nature and destiny. In the age of Shennong, he was called Master Dacheng, revealing the *Scripture of the Primordial Essence of the Great One* to the world and teaching the Way of cherishing life. In the age of the Yellow Emperor, he was called Master Guangcheng, revealing the *Scripture of Daoist Admonitions* and teaching the study of soaring flight. In the kingdom of Pure Joy, he was called the Purple Primordial Lord, bestowing upon the Mysterious Emperor the *Jade Void Precepts of Grand Harmony*, teaching the supreme precepts of wisdom and the Way of returning to the root.

In the Middle Antiquity of Shaohao, he was called Master Hongmeng in the world. In the age of Zhuanxu, he was called Master Chijing. In the age of Emperor Shun, he was called Master Lutu. In the age of Emperor Yao, he was called Master Yinshou. In the age of Emperor Shun (again), he was called Master Wucheng. In the age of Yu of Xia, he was called Master Zhencheng. In the age of Tang of Shang, he was called Master Xize. In the age of King Wen of Zhou, he was called Lao Dan, serving as the Archivist beneath the Pillars. He revealed the *Two Scriptures of Virtue and the Dao* to the world. At that time, the Keeper of the Pass, Yin Xi, received his teachings. Now, he has been posthumously appointed as the Grand Preceptor of the Great Luo Jade-Pure Sacred Realm, presiding over the affairs of the Heavenly Pivot Institute.

*Zhuangzi* states: "Guan Yin and Lao Dan were the vast and great true persons of antiquity. Serene and formless, their transformations were constant." The immortal elder Ge Hong said: "Laozi is the spirit of heaven and earth; he appears in every age." Eighty-two times he transformed into the Dark Warrior. The name Dark Warrior was established in the later heavens.

According to the *Veritable Record of Planchette Revelations*, the Dark Warrior was originally the transformation of the Five Numinous Primordial Elder of the primordial *qi*, a manifestation of the Primordial Beginning and an alternate embodiment of the Supreme Ultimate. During the Upper Three Sovereigns, he descended as the Perfected of the Grand Beginning. Kong Yingda’s commentary on the *Laozi* states: "The Dao generates the One—this is the Supreme Ultimate. The Supreme Ultimate generates the Two Modes." During the Middle Three Sovereigns, he descended as the Perfected of the Grand Initial. The sun and moon were within the Grand Simplicity, their radiance emerging in the Grand Initial. During the Lower Three Sovereigns, he descended as the Perfected of the Grand Simplicity.

According to the *White Tiger Discourses*: "Once form and omen were established, it was called the Grand Simplicity." This was when Suiren established the Way of human marriage. During the age of the Yellow Emperor, he was born in the kingdom of Pure Joy as a prince, and his Daoist appellation was Master Qianyun. For his meritorious service in the Dao, the Jade Emperor bestowed honors upon him, first granting him the title of Mysterious Emperor.

The Great Dao, by the prior investiture of the Primordial Beginning Emperor, bestowed upon the Five Numinous Primordial Elder the charge of opening the north and summoning water, thereby establishing the root of the primordial yellow and planting its image. Gradually, the *qi* divided and transformed into form. The first was the office of the Supreme Emperor. Reverently manifesting these transformations: the Grand Beginning Heavenly One, the two bodies of the Grand Initial and Grand Yin, the celestial bodies of Chenxing, Yuebo, the Dipper, Ox, Girl, Void, Danger, Chamber, and Wall—twenty-nine bodies; the six Jia and the Ren and Gui—eighteen bodies; the Grand Simplicity’s northern prison of Hai, Zi, Chou, Qian, and Kan—seven bodies; the wind, thunder, rain, lightning, and thunderclap—fifteen bodies; the Qiang Elder, the Eight Slayers, and the human stars—ten bodies. The body of the Mysterious Emperor was the eighty-second transformation.

Thus, it is known that the Dark Warrior is the transformed body of Lord Lao and the numinous verification of the Military Star. Lord Lao’s alternate title is the Supreme Emperor of the Primordial Origin, the Supreme Ultimate as spoken of in the *Book of Changes*. The *Scripture of the Supreme Ultimate’s Division and Transformation of the Grand Beginning* states: "The Dark Warrior is the transformed body of Lord Lao. The Great Emperor and humanity regard him as comparable to the Military Star’s manifestation of numinosity, for the meritorious virtues of the two sages are quite similar."

According to the *Scripture of the Original Birth of the Northern Dipper*: "In the first kalpa of the Dragon Han era, there was the Lady of Purple Light, consort of the King of the Upper Yu Kingdom. One spring day, while she was strolling and playing by the Warm Jade Pool, she removed her garments to bathe. Suddenly, she was moved by the lotus bud, which opened into nine petals, and within it were born nine sons. The lady protected and nurtured them in the palace, her aspiration being only to raise them as sages to assist and support heaven and earth."

chunks.original_text: 诸子洎壮，冠乃各修，因地功行俱满，白昼冲天，并受得三清贵职矣。 天皇大帝长子也，佐紫微上宫纪纲，元化众星，主领紫微。 大帝第二子，佐北极中宫明堂布政下土。 贪狼配天，为元主万物，为延生。 巨门配地，为元主物命，为延命。 禄存配日，为火元主禄，为保命。 文曲配月，为水元主禄，为益算。 廉贞配其土，为江元主官爵，为消灾。 武曲配水，为河元主寿，为散祸。 破军配金，为海元主妻儿，为扶衰。 按传洞真注《北斗经》第六，武曲辅星玉讳昌上元处？ 凡修炼时，奉行北极天心大法，救物利生，道号曰太车子，德称曰定真君。 不日行满功圆，承天诏飞升，官拜紫微垣太常，执事斗中玉册，位房斗中纪明真皇天闿阳宫所，配事水政，主录河元，主管神仙升进公事。 上总九天上真，中统五岳飞仙，下记学道之身，历诸功勤，合转阶级者，悉总调达，注名玉历，管摄下土岁时发生地财度支天仓府库出纳事。 且玄武寄凡，自开皇初劫，虽异世所修，并充天职，临事同体，悉以苍生为心，其舍灵受所赐者多矣。 於是，二真紫微、徽赞显灵而同验耶。 本虚危之二宿，交水火之两精， 天中北上，乃化玄炁之宫，有虚危二宿，位分占天次二十六度二十五分半，是日月两曜纬躔之舍，副日帝月皇之政，水火在。 昔炎帝癸巳岁正月朔戊午日旦甲寅时，日月合璧，二炁混虚危宿，度神彩流，降奎娄之域净乐国境也。 善胜皇后偶寝宫酣熟，灵游躯外，见像日圆光入口，吞之而觉有孕。 是岁末，炎帝国灭于版泉，黄帝受命，都建有熊，甲午岁立马。 净乐君诞生圣子，乃虚危分秀，水火流晶，而成形体，壮年受学，玄元化度。 《法要义旨》曰：太和玉虚，紫微上都，五常回曲，六律引书，清朗为炁，玄秀应敷，帝有妙法，君降极图，象徧梵境，通运神居，广方便门，众妙无殊，无真不现，无道不俱，顺于变化，逆于邪途，乾为十合，坤连万墟，入净出浑，应变总如，此境至极，上号曰太玄都。 《实录》云：紫元君复授道要毕，嘱曰：子当龙汉四劫，披发跣足，摄坎离真精，归根复位，返本於虚危之间也。 或挂甲而衣袍，或穿靴而跣足，常披绀发，每仗神锋， 董真君曰：玄帝准告命，往下方降魔日，元始有敕神，如斯结束。 《庄子》曰：天与之形，道与之貌是耶。 声震九天， 既拜九天游奕使，又领九天采访使，司察功过，神仙公事。 於是九霄梵天之上，玄帝威声岂不震欤。 威分四部。 专三界大督之柄，按月徧四大部洲鬼神公事。 束自播本佛于岱部，西至流沙瞿耶尼部，南至交址阎浮提部，北极幽陵郁单越部，应城隍镇戍械甲兵马等神，并听节制。 况玄帝令名威权，岂得四部之神只不职欤。 拥之者早纛玄雾，蹑之者苍龟巨蛇。 玉清宣赐皂纛时，当、水寿元年上元节也。 树旗事若玄雾兴生，乃表威权之望。 於是乎，十亿烈士咸睹旌旄，皆同会信，悉赴太玄之命。 又地轴水精林龟，天关火精圣蛇，捧拥玄帝足下，司行讨伐。 天上天下，一应不正妖气最威者，是天关地轴纛鸯也。 神兵神将，从之者皆五十万； 玉童玉女，侍之者各二十四行。 行也者，列次也。 此职右胜府之近司，属隶北灵官为次也。 则左右分掌威仪，及书记三界中善恶功过等事。
chunks.translated_text:
The nine sons, upon reaching maturity and donning their caps, each cultivated their conduct to perfection according to their stations. Their merits and practices fulfilled, they ascended to heaven in broad daylight and were all conferred noble offices in the Three Clarities.

The Heavenly August Emperor was the eldest son, assisting in the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace to regulate and transform the multitude of stars, presiding over the Purple Tenuity.

The second son of the Great Emperor aided in the Bright Hall of the North Culmen Central Palace, administering governance over the earth below.

Greedy Wolf, aligned with Heaven, served as the primal lord of the myriad things, extending life.
Gate of Ghosts, aligned with Earth, served as the primal lord of living beings, prolonging destiny.
Store of Wealth, aligned with the Sun, served as the fire-primal lord of emolument, preserving life.
Literary Brilliance, aligned with the Moon, served as the water-primal lord of emolument, augmenting destiny.
Integrity and Chastity, aligned with Earth, served as the river-primal lord of official rank, dispelling calamities.
Military Brilliance, aligned with Water, served as the river-primal lord of longevity, dispersing misfortunes.
Breaking Army, aligned with Metal, served as the sea-primal lord of wives and children, supporting decline.

According to the sixth fascicle of the *Scripture of the Northern Dipper* in the *Commentary on the Cavern of Perfection*: "The jade name of the Military Brilliance auxiliary star is 'Chang of the Upper Primordial Realm'?" When cultivating, one upholds the Great Law of the North Culmen Heavenly Heart, saving beings and benefiting life. His Daoist appellation is "Great Chariot Master," and his virtue is titled "Perfected Lord of Stability." Before long, his merits complete and his practices fulfilled, he received the celestial edict to ascend, whereupon he was appointed Grand Master of Ceremonies in the Purple Tenuity Enclosure, wielding the jade register within the Dipper, holding the office of "Luminous Perfected August Emperor of the Heavenly Gate of Yang" in the Chamber of the Dipper’s House. Aligned with the governance of water, he oversees the river-primal, managing the promotion of immortals and transcendents.

Above, he governs the perfected of the Nine Heavens; in the middle, he commands the flying immortals of the Five Marchmounts; below, he records the progress of those who study the Dao, their accumulated merits and diligence, and all who qualify for promotion. He oversees their advancement, inscribing their names in the jade calendar, and administers the seasonal generation of earthly wealth, the disbursement of celestial granaries, and the treasuries’ receipts and expenditures.

Moreover, though the Dark Warrior was once an ordinary mortal—his cultivation spanning different kalpas since the beginning of the Kaihuang era—he fulfilled his heavenly duties. In all matters, he acted as one body, ever holding the welfare of the black-haired people at heart. Those who relinquished their numinous receptacles and received his grace were many. Thus, the two perfected ones, Purple Tenuity and Radiant Praise, manifested their numinosity in mutual verification.

The two asterisms, Void and Rooftop, commingle the dual essences of water and fire. In the north above the celestial center, they transform into the palace of primordial qi. Void and Rooftop occupy the twenty-sixth celestial division, spanning twenty-five and a half degrees, serving as the lodging for the sun and moon’s celestial courses, complementing the governance of the Solar Emperor and Lunar Sovereign. Here, water and fire reside.

In the year *guisi* of the Flame Emperor’s reign, on the first day of the first month, the day *wuwu* at dawn, the hour *jiayin*, the sun and moon conjoined in union. The two qi merged within the Void and Rooftop asterisms, their divine radiance streaming forth to descend upon the domain of Kui and Lou in the realm of Pure Joy. The Virtuous Victorious Empress, deep in slumber within her palace, her spirit wandering beyond her body, beheld an image of the sun’s round light entering her mouth. She swallowed it and awoke pregnant. By the year’s end, the Flame Emperor’s kingdom fell to Ban Spring, and the Yellow Emperor received the mandate, establishing his capital at Youxiong. In the year *jiawu*, he erected the Horse Standard.

The Lord of Pure Joy gave birth to a sagely son, born of the refined essence of Void and Rooftop, the crystalline flow of water and fire forming his body. In his prime, he received instruction and was transformed by the Dao of the Primordial One.

The *Essential Principles of the Dharma* states: "The Jade Void of Supreme Harmony, the Upper Capital of Purple Tenuity, the Five Constants revolve in curves, the Six Pitches guide the scriptures. Clarity becomes qi, mysterious refinement responds and spreads. The Emperor possesses wondrous methods, the Lord descends the Supreme Diagram. Its symbols pervade the Brahmā realms, its divine residence permeates all transformations. The gates of vast expedient means harbor no distinctions among the myriad wonders. No truth is not manifest, no Dao is not complete. In accord with transformation, in opposition to perverse paths, Heaven forms ten unions, Earth connects myriad ruins. Entering purity and emerging from chaos, responding to change in totality—this realm is the ultimate, its supreme name is the Great Mysterious Capital."

The *Veritable Record* states: The Purple Primordial Lord again transmitted the essentials of the Dao, enjoining him: "In the fourth kalpa of the Dragon Han era, you shall go barefoot and with unbound hair, gathering the true essence of Kan and Li, returning to the root and restoring your position between Void and Rooftop."

At times clad in armor and robed, at others booted yet barefoot, he ever wore his hair in dark blue locks, ever wielded his divine blade. Perfected Lord Dong said: "When the Dark Emperor received the mandate to descend to the lower realms to subdue demons, the Primordial Beginning issued a divine decree, prescribing such attire." As *Zhuangzi* says: "Heaven bestowed upon him form, the Dao bestowed upon him countenance."

His voice shook the Nine Heavens. Having been appointed the Wandering Envoy of the Nine Heavens and concurrently the Investigating Envoy of the Nine Heavens, he oversaw the scrutiny of merits and transgressions, the public affairs of immortals and transcendents. Thus, in the Brahmā Heaven above the Nine Empyreans, how could the Dark Emperor’s awe-inspiring renown not resound?

His might extended to the four quarters. He wielded the authority of the Great Overseer of the Three Realms, monthly inspecting the public affairs of ghosts and spirits across the Four Great Continents. From the east, where the Buddha of Origin was propagated in the Tai region, to the west, where the flowing sands of Jambudvīpa lie; from the south, where Jiaozhi of the Southern Continent resides, to the north, where the gloomy mounds of Uttarakuru stand—all city gods, garrison deities, armaments, soldiers, and horses were subject to his command. How could the gods of the four quarters fail in their duties before the Dark Emperor’s famed authority?

Those who rallied to him bore the black standard wreathed in dark mist; those who followed him were borne by a colossal tortoise and a giant serpent. When the Jade Clarity announced the bestowal of the black standard, it was on the first day of the first month of the first year of the Shousui reign. The raising of the banner, like the rising of dark mist, signified the majesty of his authority. Thereupon, ten billion valiant warriors beheld his banners and standards, all converging in faith, hastening to fulfill the commands of the Great Mysterious One.

Moreover, the Water Essence Forest Tortoise of the Earth’s Axis and the Fire Essence Holy Serpent of the Heavenly Gate bore and surrounded the Dark Emperor’s feet, executing punitive expeditions. The most formidable of all unruly and inauspicious qi between heaven and earth were the Heavenly Gate and Earthly Axis standards.

Divine soldiers and generals, numbering five hundred thousand, followed him; jade lads and jade maidens, arrayed in twenty-four ranks, attended him. "Ranks" here denote ordered rows. This office was the proximate bureau of the Right Victorious Mansion, subordinate to the Northern Numinous Officials. Thus, the left and right divisions managed his majestic regalia and recorded the good and evil deeds, merits and transgressions within the Three Realms.

chunks.original_text: 按《仙传拾遗》记曰：汉相张良，避世登真，位号太玄童子。 按《启圣记》云：信州弋阳县，有敕封额寂照孝女之祠，原本右胜府中掌籍绿霞琼女也。 因陆中道同妻张氏，素勤恪真武香火，惟求嗣续，至晚年，妻夜梦吞红缨感孕，诞一哑女，颜色绝伦。 至十三岁，一日忽琅然发声，告别父母，曰：儿本是上天双女宫绿霞琼女，兄昨因父母求嗣於北方真武，蒙参照父母枝庆案籍，即无胎产男女之名，真武遂以父母有处世平等之诚，保奏三天，蒙回降敕旨，下点差儿化红缨投胎，充女身注一纪寿，终归上会，儿离天府时，承真武慈旨，汝到人间切勿发声。 今闻宋朝司天监言，陈国分野当弋阳县，下有阴贵仙骨异人，现定来刷儿身，恐泄天机未便。 况儿寿限过期，当归听北极右胜府副判司，祇备差使，一任七年，满日得返双女官矣。 言讫奄逝，事达圣听，敕赠今号也。 以此表证是府玉童玉女定制额也。 绶北帝之灵符， 《汉官仪》曰：绶者，有所承受也，所以别尊卑，彰有德也。 玄帝於飞升时，受金阙赐北帝灵符之册牌。 首见窍穿，以销金飞云紫白文带，谓之绶也。 牌面符书，乃金篆文，日太玄元帅龙文摄化之符。 佩乾元之宝印。 佩也者，身服玉佩也。 《白虎通》载：故能修道无穷即佩环，玄帝飞升时，金阙赐佩绞钮玉印，以封事为信验者也。 印章命日乾元宝印，符印上式权，且以凡间书模也。 想天文敷焕，凝结成篆，况玄帝增封拜，加重职六事，奉权命符印，又六颗矣。 规成模范，大小及文篆，则凡世所未得见闻流传也。 驱之有雷公、电母，御之有风伯、雨师。 北极右胜府事，天蓬大元帅判五雷院事，职阶日都天大雷公也。 所辖风、云、电、雨之使，及飞龙骑吏左右亿千兵马、水府力士河伯吏兵共三十万众，日夜周纬陶铸，都天之下万汇诸品物耶。 右胜府事讨罚鬼魔不正事，则是等准副共合大信，遵依挥纛行营之命，骚驰驾御威奋赫奕助罚不正公事。 按《上清法隐书》所录，诸大圣者官叔阶职品男官女官姓讳，谨显之于后。 五雷院属第一厅，男官雷霆院事霹雳大总管通天入地变现搜捉大将军吴天安。 第二厅、男官兴驾霹雳九天游奕讨罚奸五员。 第三厅，男官雷霆号令星火炎飞怂警下过心事监魂缚魄大将军王明。 第四厅，女官雷霆院斩祟擒龙大将军王天安。 第五厅，女官雷霆院破庙斩尸大将军吴天明，电母都使北极驱邪女官右总管雷霆四时电光事大仙母寻奸大将军田守明。 同知院事男官雷霆院催电发震欻霹雳火通天入地搜奸急捉大将军田守真。 风伯大君北极右胜院风伯副箕使纪纲八卦行风使案纠不法怪异风变事大将军金三。 五雷院都大签书诸部雷霆录籍岁行风雨电射应干不正邪魔事判官辛汉臣。 雨师神龙九天开化掌籍主宰充下元水府转运使检校诸洞行雨公事元皇灵应帝君张亚。 统五湖四海九江八河七泽十二汉谷行雨龙君外行雨洞龙右一百七十号，见《孔雀经》。 夫五雷六甲八煞； 皆五灵玄老炁化分灵孕，凡荐修今号方出也。 《淮南子》曰：雷电不兴，风雨不作。 是故五雷号令，电火征奸，风布八卦，雨泽行教，乃降至和，生成万物。 不然，雷轰霹雳，电火烁焚，风烈怒号，雨骤霰雹，斯非韶雅之象，天行诛讨耶。
