According to the *Xianzhuan Shiyi* (*Supplement to the Biographies of Immortals*), it is recorded: Han Chancellor Zhang Liang, having withdrawn from the world to ascend to transcendence, held the title of "Great Mystery Lad." As the *Qisheng Ji* (*Records of the Awakening of the Sacred*) states: In Yiyang County of Xinzhou, there stands an imperially bestowed shrine to the "Reclusive Illuminating Filial Maiden," who was originally the Green Radiance Jade Maiden, registrar of the Right Victorious Mansion. Once, Lu Zhongdao and his wife, née Zhang, had long reverently tended the incense of Zhenwu. Though they sought an heir, in their later years, the wife dreamed one night of swallowing a red tassel and conceived, giving birth to a mute girl of unparalleled beauty. At thirteen, she suddenly spoke with crystalline clarity, bidding farewell to her parents: "I am originally the Green Radiance Jade Maiden of the Celestial Twin Maidens Palace. Yesterday, my elder brother, on account of our parents’ plea for an heir to Zhenwu of the North, reviewed the records of their karmic blessings and found no entry for male or female offspring. Yet Zhenwu, moved by their impartial sincerity in this world, memorialized the Three Heavens and received an imperial rescript to dispatch me, transforming into a red tassel to enter the womb. I was to inhabit a female form for a twelve-year term, after which I would return to the celestial assembly. When I departed the heavenly court, Zhenwu graciously instructed: ‘You must not speak while among mortals.’ Now, I have heard from the Song Dynasty’s Bureau of Astronomy that the stellar division of Chen corresponds to Yiyang County, where a hidden immortal of extraordinary destiny is destined to replace me. To avoid revealing celestial secrets, I must depart. Moreover, my allotted lifespan has expired, and I am to return to serve as vice-director of the Right Victorious Mansion’s Auxiliary Bureau, fulfilling duties for seven years before returning to the Twin Maidens Palace." With these words, she passed away. The matter reached the imperial ear, and she was posthumously enfeoffed with her present title. This serves as proof of the fixed allotment of jade lads and jade maidens to this bureau.

They bear the Numinous Talismans of the Northern Emperor. As the *Han Guan Yi* (*Han Dynasty Official Ceremonials*) states: "The *shou* (sash) signifies what one receives, distinguishing rank and manifesting virtue." When the Dark Emperor ascended, he was bestowed by the Golden Tower with the Northern Emperor’s talismanic plaque. Its head was perforated and threaded with a gold-embroidered, cloud-patterned purple-and-white ribbon, called the *shou*. The talismanic script on the plaque was in golden seal script: "The Great Mystery Marshal’s Dragon Script Talisman for Subduing and Transforming."

They wear the Treasured Seal of Qian Yuan. "To wear" means to bear jade pendants upon the body. The *Baihu Tong* (*Comprehensive Discussions in the White Tiger Hall*) records: "Thus, those who cultivate the Dao without end wear jade rings." When the Dark Emperor ascended, the Golden Tower bestowed upon him a jade seal with an interlaced knob, used to seal documents as a token of verification. The seal was named the "Qian Yuan Treasured Seal." The form of the talisman and seal wields authority, modeled after mortal script. One may imagine the celestial script, resplendent and luminous, coalescing into seal characters. Moreover, when the Dark Emperor was enfeoffed and promoted, his duties were augmented by six additional offices, and he was entrusted with six more talismanic seals. Their patterns, dimensions, and seal scripts remain unknown to the mortal world.

To command them are the Duke of Thunder and the Mother of Lightning; to drive them are the Earl of Wind and the Master of Rain. The affairs of the Right Victorious Mansion are overseen by the Heavenly Marshal Tianpeng, who adjudicates the Five Thunder Court, holding the office of "Celestial Great Duke of Thunder." Under his command are the envoys of wind, clouds, lightning, and rain, along with countless legions of flying dragon riders, aquatic marshals, river deities, and their thirty myriad troops, who ceaselessly forge and refine all things beneath the Celestial Realm.

When the Right Victorious Mansion executes punitive expeditions against demonic and unruly forces, these officers act as deputies, jointly upholding the great trust. They obey the commands of the battle standards, swiftly mobilizing their awe-inspiring might to assist in the chastisement of iniquity. According to the *Shangqing Fayin Shu* (*Esoteric Writings of the Highest Clarity*), the names, ranks, and titles of the male and female officials among the great sages are respectfully recorded as follows:

**Five Thunder Court, First Hall:**
Male Official: Wu Tian’an, "Thunder Court Marshal, Great General of Thunderclaps, Penetrating Heaven and Earth, Transforming and Manifesting, Searching and Seizing."

**Second Hall:**
Five Male Officials: "Nine Heavens’ Roaming and Hunting, Punishing the Wicked."

**Third Hall:**
Male Official: Wang Ming, "Thunder Court Commander, Star-Fire Blazing, Urging and Admonishing, Monitoring the Deeds of the Heart, Binding and Seizing Souls."

**Fourth Hall:**
Female Official: Wang Tian’an, "Thunder Court General, Slaying Malevolence and Capturing Dragons."

**Fifth Hall:**
Female Official: Wu Tianming, "Thunder Court General, Destroying Temples and Slaying Corpses."
Female Official: Tian Shouming, "Right Chief Administrator of the Northern Pole’s Exorcising Maidens, Thunder Court’s Four Seasons’ Lightning Affairs, Great Immortal Mother of Seeking Wickedness."

**Vice-Director of the Court:**
Male Official: Tian Shouzhen, "Thunder Court’s Urging Lightning, Erupting Thunder, Swift Thunderclaps, Fire Penetrating Heaven and Earth, Searching and Seizing the Wicked."

**Earl of Wind:**
Jin San, "Great Lord of Wind, Northern Pole’s Right Victorious Court’s Deputy Wind Master, Disciplinarian of the Eight Trigrams’ Wind Dispensation, Investigating Unlawful and Strange Wind Variations."

**Chief Recorder of the Five Thunder Court:**
Xin Hanchen, "Judicial Officer of the Five Thunder Court’s Registers, Annual Wind, Rain, Lightning, and Thunder Responses to Unruly and Demonic Matters."

**Master of Rain:**
Zhang Ya, "Divine Dragon of the Nine Heavens’ Transformation, Registrar and Sovereign of the Lower Prime’s Water Palace, Inspector of All Caverns’ Rain Dispensation, August Spirit-Responding Emperor."

He commands the Dragon Lords of the Five Lakes, Four Seas, Nine Rivers, Eight Streams, Seven Marshes, Twelve Valleys, and the external rain-dispensing cavern dragons—one hundred seventy in total, as recorded in the *Peacock Sutra*.

Now, the Five Thunders and Six Jia, the Eight Malevolent Stars—all are spiritual emanations of the Five Numinous Elder’s primordial qi, manifesting only when their present titles are invoked in offerings. As the *Huainanzi* states: "When thunder and lightning do not arise, wind and rain do not stir." Thus, the Five Thunders issue commands, lightning and fire punish the wicked, wind disseminates the Eight Trigrams, and rain nurtures with teachings, descending in perfect harmony to engender and complete the myriad things. Otherwise, thunder roars and thunderclaps crash, lightning and fire scorch and burn, winds rage and howl, rains pour with hail and sleet—these are not the signs of harmonious elegance but the celestial execution of punitive justice.

chunks.original_text: 《诗》云：敬天之怒，无敢戏豫。 卫前后则八煞将军，随左右则六甲神将。 乃玄都右胜府正卫威北八煞大将军，八营驻札于酆都狱华盖山之前也。 谨显诸煞姓名之次第。 天煞将军张子庶，地煞将军陈子青，日煞将军李子德，月煞将军范子章，水煞将军杜子贞，火煞将军刘子大，金煞将军王子言，石煞将军贾子元。 副翼卫司威南六甲大神将，六寨营伍旁列于太微垣华盖星之下也。 又谨显诸将姓讳。 甲子水将李文思，甲戌土将李守通，甲申金将李守全，甲午火将李守左，甲辰风将李守进，甲寅木将李守迁。 按说灵宝经时，元始在始青天中演教度人，偶下土东北凶变，则神公受命普扫不祥也。 斯时，六甲抱金关，七政守灵坛，八威奔电激，九凤破凶邪，并准副玄帝讨罚。 前后刚泽，左右徽控也。 可谓金钺前戮巨天，后刑非特，此时至今号令亦尔。 《开皇章》曰：群魔钦至，化万国保康宁是谓也。 天罡太一，率於驱使之前； 率也者，宾伏也。 於也者，幸侍也。 天罡太一亦系五德神君，乃宾伏幸侍，充太玄从官，常备准威用。 按本经载云：拥之者，皂纛、玄雾。 蹑之者，苍龟、巨蛇也。 乃右天罡，掌皂纛，讳监兵，乃白虎七煞右将军及下太一，载圣足，讳执明，本玄武五煞后将军。 盖闻玄天上帝，威贯神真也。 授职阶北极左天罡之罡，皂纛旗心端设北辰，贵其生成万汇也。 又阶职镇天玄武三界大都督之官，每恭行天讨罚凶，则神武不杀也。 其右天罡下太一颛行司杀事也。 按《玉册》曰：降水火二精於掌握，则三五合同功也。 三乃圣蛇，五乃神龟也。 摄甲庚两将於纪纲，得七九齐制用也。 七驯苍虬，九御玄骏，故知驱策斩变，惟此数将最能关固。 社令城隍，悉处指挥之下。 悉也者，皆听也。 处也者，制度也。 社令城隍，系在所国土州府军县镇监乡村疃里，各有斯职，分领阴景卒吏，机察本界中事，皆听太玄指挥制度使令也。 昔者巢城犯恶，当玄帝荡没彼处，无得城隍社令遵副，自化道士证明，焦婆充彼处土地，听指挥也。 《启圣记》云：昔巢州四民凶暴，乃积劫累聚，杀害物命，恣充口腹脂肥，以至僧道之流亦皆仿效俗态，逐日血尸狼藉，秽气上冲，触犯日月星辰，亦灭光色。 是时九天察访使上奏天廷，昊天玉皇驾御出三天门，观览间，果见吴分巢州地恶人凶，乃命天官紫微大帝及地水二官，取岳司委实北极方，诏右胜府副帅下荡此境，连城陷没为洲，永清净也。 真武趋朝得旨，叹奏：臣闻地方千里，未必人人在劫，切恐大冤愈结，容臣下审地祇。 大帝复曰：此州城隍社令，悉预奉玉帝敕旨，迁任他所。 真武遂遵副敕命，仍遣部下右天罡，先行审察，既降遂变一大鳌，死浮汉面，果官吏士庶互报，哄来分脔无不食者。 真武亦睹斯恶，自化为凡流道士，巡门遍经，觅水验实，唯焦婆家有不杀之德，饷水清净。 真武谓焦婆曰：此城不久当荡为湖也，可速登圣女山居，作湖山土地道士。 言讫不见。 婆挈家同子妇，竟登是山，既至回观，睹黑风巨雨霹雳洪波，於顷刻间不见城基，泛为水界。 婆手加额，忽瞻见空际一神，状貌若觅水道士，降言此水属汝所管也。 道士既升，邻州官史乘橄到山，询婆元因，各申所属，婆春忽相继损世。

As the *Book of Songs* states: "Revere Heaven’s wrath, dare not jest or idle." Before and behind stand the Eight Malevolent Generals; to left and right attend the Six Jia Divine Marshals. These are the **Right Victorious Prefecture of the Mysterious Capital’s** **Northern Eight Malevolent Great Generals of Upholding Might**, whose eight encampments are stationed before the **Canopy Mountain of Fengdu Prison**. Now, with reverence, their names and ranks are revealed:

**Heavenly Malevolent General** Zhang Zishu,
**Earthly Malevolent General** Chen Ziqing,
**Solar Malevolent General** Li Zide,
**Lunar Malevolent General** Fan Zizhang,
**Aqueous Malevolent General** Du Zizhen,
**Igneous Malevolent General** Liu Zida,
**Metallic Malevolent General** Wang Ziyan,
**Stony Malevolent General** Jia Ziyuan.

The **Southern Six Jia Divine Marshals of Assisting Might**, whose six battalions array themselves beside the **Canopy Star of the Supreme Subtlety**, are likewise revealed with due reverence:

**Jiazi Water Marshal** Li Wensi,
**Jiaxu Earth Marshal** Li Shoutong,
**Jiashen Metal Marshal** Li Shouquan,
**Jiawu Fire Marshal** Li Shouzuo,
**Jiachen Wind Marshal** Li Shoujin,
**Jiayin Wood Marshal** Li Shouqian.

According to the *Scripture of Numinous Treasure*, when the **Primordial Beginning** expounded the teachings to deliver humanity within the **Verdant Heaven of the First Dawn**, a baleful upheaval arose in the northeast of the lower realms. Thereupon, the **Divine Duke** received the mandate to sweep away all inauspicious omens. At that time, the **Six Jia** clasped the **Golden Pass**, the **Seven Governors** guarded the **Numinous Altar**, the **Eight Might** sped like lightning, and the **Nine Phoenixes** shattered malevolent forces—all in accord with the **Mysterious Thearch’s** punitive decrees. Before and behind, firm and yielding; left and right, majestic and restraining. Thus was the **Golden Axe** wielded to execute the great celestial criminals, while lesser transgressors were met with retribution. To this day, such commands remain unchanged.

As the *Kaihuang Chapters* declares: "When the myriad demons submit in awe, the ten thousand lands are transformed to preserve peace and tranquility—such is the meaning."

The **Celestial Stem of the Great Unity** leads at the vanguard of the host. "Leads" denotes submission; "at" signifies fortunate attendance. The **Celestial Stem of the Great Unity**, too, is one of the **Five Virtue Divine Lords**, submitting in attendance to serve as an attendant official of the **Supreme Mystery**, ever prepared to enforce might as required. According to the original scripture: those who **escort** bear the **black banner** and **mysterious mist**; those who **follow** ride the **azure tortoise** and **mighty serpent**.

Now, the **Right Celestial Stem** presides over the **black banner**, styled **Inspector of Troops**, and serves as the **White Tiger’s Seven Malevolent Right General**, while the **Lesser Unity** beneath him, styled **Holder of Luminance**, is the **Black Warrior’s Five Malevolent Rear General**. It is said that the **Mysterious Heavenly Thearch’s** might pervades all divine and true beings. He is invested with the rank of **Northern Culmen’s Left Celestial Stem**, the **black banner** planted at the heart of the **Northern Asterism**, honoring its role in engendering and completing the myriad things. He is further invested with the office of **Heaven-Securing Black Warrior, Great Commander of the Three Realms**, and whenever he reverently executes Heaven’s punitive justice, his divine might does not kill wantonly. The **Lesser Unity** beneath the **Right Celestial Stem** is charged with overseeing matters of execution.

As the *Jade Register* states: "When the **dual essences of water and fire** are held in the palm, the **Three and Five** unite in shared merit." The **Three** is the **sacred serpent**, the **Five** the **divine tortoise**. Commanding the **Jia and Geng Marshals** within the **disciplinary framework**, the **Seven and Nine** are brought into harmonious regulation. The **Seven** tame the **azure dragons**, the **Nine** ride the **mysterious steeds**—thus it is known that in driving, restraining, and severing transformations, these marshals are most capable of securing control. **Earth Deities and City Gods** all fall under their command. "All" signifies universal compliance; "fall under" denotes institutional governance. **Earth Deities and City Gods**, present in every **state, prefecture, commandery, county, garrison, town, village, hamlet, and ward**, each hold such office, overseeing the **yin-shadow soldiers and clerks** to surveil affairs within their jurisdiction, all complying with the **Supreme Mystery’s** commands and institutional decrees.

In former times, when **Chaocheng** committed evil, the **Mysterious Thearch** swept it away, yet no **City God or Earth Deity** there had obeyed his commands. A Daoist adept was thus transformed to bear witness, and **Jiao Po** served as the local **Earth Deity**, heeding the Thearch’s directives. The *Records of Manifesting Sageliness* recount: "In ancient times, the four classes of **Chaozhou** grew violent, their wickedness accumulating over kalpas. They wantonly slaughtered living beings to glut their mouths and fatten their flesh, until even the clergy and Daoists emulated the vulgar ways, daily leaving blood and corpses strewn about, their foul vapors ascending to offend the sun, moon, and stars, extinguishing their light and luster. The **Nine Heavens’ Investigative Envoys** reported this to the **Celestial Court**, where the **Jade Emperor of August Heaven**, gazing forth from the **Three Heavenly Gates**, beheld the evil of **Chaozhou** in the **Wu region**. He commanded the **Celestial Minister, Purple Tenuity Thearch**, along with the **Officials of Earth and Water**, to dispatch the **Northern Culmen’s** **Prefectural Vice-Marshal of the Right Victorious Prefecture** to purge the land. The city sank beneath the waves, becoming a lake, forever cleansed.

**Zhenwu**, hastening to court to receive the decree, sighed and petitioned: 'Though this land spans a thousand *li*, not all its people are fated for calamity. I fear this may compound grievous wrongs. Permit your servant to descend and examine the local deities.' The **Great Thearch** replied: 'The **City God and Earth Deity** of this prefecture have already received the **Jade Emperor’s** edict and been transferred elsewhere.' Zhenwu then obeyed the decree and dispatched his subordinate, the **Right Celestial Stem**, to conduct a preliminary investigation. Descending, the latter transformed into a great turtle, dead and afloat upon the Han River. The officials, gentry, and common folk rushed to carve and devour its flesh, none abstaining. Zhenwu, witnessing this depravity, transformed into a wandering Daoist, traversing every door to seek water and verify the truth. Only at **Jiao Po’s** home did he find the virtue of non-killing, where pure water was offered.

Zhenwu said to Jiao Po: 'This city shall soon be swept away into a lake. Hasten to **Sacred Maiden Mountain** and dwell there as the **Earth Deity of the Lake and Mountain**.' With these words, he vanished. Jiao Po gathered her family and children-in-law and ascended the mountain. Upon arrival, she turned to look back and beheld a **black wind**, **torrential rain**, **thunderclaps**, and **raging waves**—in an instant, the city’s foundations vanished, submerged beneath the waters. Clasping her hands to her forehead, she suddenly saw a deity descending from the void, his appearance that of the Daoist who had sought water. He declared: 'These waters are now your domain.' The Daoist then ascended, and officials from neighboring prefectures arrived by boat to inquire of Jiao Po the cause. Each reported to their superiors, and Jiao Po’s family, one after another, passed away in due course."

chunks.original_text: 西晋封灵显圣母，改湖山从焦姓号，岂不因真武处分指挥保斯职乎。 有妖皆剪，无善不扶。 精乃物妖之感化，有犯则无不剪除也。 善人方便益世，暗中真司扶助。 纂《启圣记》。 如魏公韩琦判大名府时，炁宁二年己酉岁秋，据黄河燥吏驰报曰：本澡尝有一巨龟之精，出害生灵久矣。 今又出浮於水面，怒涛汕发，坝□崩隳，水势暴横，莫知漂溺人命。 公闻，急遣幕使郑圭通判华惇措置。 奉旨至堤，二人朝服焚香，仰扣北极真武曰：愿降灵助郑圭剪妖。 遂张弓矢，射中龟沉，水顺童整□完。 忽一夕，圭奄若梦间，被二史拘，曰：吾承阎罗府追汝，证对杀龟公事。 执行至一山府，二史自相语曰：真武今日降此。 圭闻间故，曰：校勘中下二界黎庶应造善恶，并属此风吥罗山府所理也。 圭越从入，急趋雪故，蒙旨下案，检会水族格历。 俄斋簿呈，龟前身本人，生西京大宛，为齐明侠子，名程宣也。 治云梦城不法，唐高宗遣大将陈元忠讨西，其城下日，火烧身死，魄充此地城隍，擅自邀祭，枉害人命，酆都紏知，罚为黄河四烁卓州界内推潮运沙土地之职。 却於咸亨三年庚午岁，魄气投龟胎，既生长，辄徙黄河七澡大宋北京界内，兴发水灾，已四百年，共枉杀黎民生命万数。 真武圣判曰：龟死本当碎尸，尚敢妄词，冤执阳间属官理索性命，况郑圭遵魏公旨，韩琦不日除赴紫府真人之位，当吾保奏也。 圭拜谢问，圣遣符使怀神龟，与承吏郑圭，同赴韦阎罗庭申察事，因妖龟尚言希求生路，身乃五百岁成器之形。 王敕符使出其神龟，金光罩挟妖龟，腾空碎为微尘，飘扬撒尽地司，令郑圭还生，从此人间永无斯祸。 朝金阙而赴昆仑，开天门而闭地户，杳冥恍惚，审察穷通。 金阙者，乃大罗三天上帝宸庭总号也。 日金阙玉清、金阙上清、金阙太清也。 昆仑者，谓无上之基玄都玉京山名也。 乃清微、禹余、大赤三天官殿，建在斯山内也。 昔日诏玄帝趋赴朝见元始，是时奉命行事，功着人鬼，分途司主，开阳闭阴，故谓开天门闭地户也。 分期出杳入宴，恍惚经纬万方，往来审察三界，穷变通化，随宜开度，一切有为无为事理。 右按降笔实录，每群真朝会昊天玉皇上帝，则四圣为都班之首，引领起居也。 居其壬癸之方， 居者，安处也。 太极始判分二仪，开天一生水，阖地二孕火，立为壬癸之方，列紫微北面，易纳甲义。 壬癸者，乃乾坤之至精也。 乾阳动生甲壬成，坤阴静生乙癸就，乃化天地阴阳之和气也。 乾中静变壬为离日，坤中动化癸为坎月，迭往迭来，盈吴戊己，而负阴抱阳，司化万物，实紧水火陶魂铸魄也。 按降笔实录云：玄帝所居之阙，号曰天一真庆宫，处紫微北上，在太素秀乐太虚无上两天之间，宫殿巍峨，皆自然妙炁所结，琳琅玉树，灵风自鸣，声合宫商之韵，红光紫雾常覆其上，此处则玉虚无色界也。 助有甲庚之将。 或乘玄骏，或跨苍虬。

The Western Jin dynasty enfeoffed her as the **Effulgent Divine Mother**, renaming the Lake Mountain after the Jiao clan—was this not by virtue of the **True Warrior’s** decree and command to preserve this office? All demons were eradicated, and no good was left unsupported. For **essence** is the transformation wrought by demonic beings; when they transgressed, none escaped extermination. Good people, through expedient means, benefited the world, and the unseen true administrators lent their aid.

The *Records of the Divine Manifestation* were compiled. For instance, when **Duke Wei**, **Han Qi**, governed **Daming Prefecture**, in the autumn of the second year of the **Qi-Ning** era (the *jiyou* year), an urgent report arrived from the Yellow River’s drought officials: "A monstrous **turtle spirit** has long emerged here, harming living beings. Now it has surfaced again upon the waters, stirring furious waves, collapsing embankments, and unleashing violent floods—none know how many lives have been swept away." Upon hearing this, the Duke swiftly dispatched his aide **Zheng Gui** and Vice-Administrator **Hua Dun** to manage the crisis. Arriving at the dike, the two donned their court robes, burned incense, and reverently invoked the **North Pole True Warrior**, saying: "We beseech your divine aid to assist Zheng Gui in slaying the demon." They then drew their bows and arrows, striking the turtle, which sank beneath the waters. The river’s flow returned to order, and the embankments were restored.

One night, Gui seemed to dream as two officials seized him, declaring: "We have been sent by the **Yama Palace** to summon you to testify regarding the killing of the turtle." They led him to a mountain prefecture, where the two officials murmured to each other: "The True Warrior descends here today." Gui, overhearing, said: "The **Wind-Swept Nether Mountain Prefecture** governs the reckoning of good and evil among the people of the upper and lower realms." As he followed them inside, he hastened to plead his case. A decree was issued, and the records of the aquatic beings were examined. Presently, the ledger revealed that the turtle’s former incarnation had been a man, born in **Da Yuan** in the Western Capital, named **Cheng Xuan**, the son of the chivalrous **Qi Ming**. He had governed **Yunmeng City** lawlessly, and on the day **Emperor Gaozong of Tang** dispatched the general **Chen Yuanzhong** to suppress the west, the city fell. Cheng perished in flames, and his soul was assigned as the **City God** of this region, where he wantonly demanded sacrifices and wrongfully took lives. The **Fengdu** authorities, learning of this, punished him by demoting him to the post of **Tide-Driving Sand-Shifting Earth Deity** within the **Four Scorching Regions** of the Yellow River in **Zhuozhou**. Then, in the third year of the **Xianheng** era (the *gengwu* year), his soul entered a turtle’s womb. Upon maturing, it migrated to the **Seven Pools** of the Yellow River within the borders of the **Great Song’s Northern Capital**, where it stirred floods for four hundred years, wrongfully claiming tens of thousands of lives.

The **Holy Judgment of the True Warrior** declared: "Though this turtle deserved to be dismembered in death, it still dares to lodge false accusations and demand redress from the officials of the mortal realm. Moreover, Zheng Gui acted under Duke Wei’s decree, and Han Qi shall soon ascend to the rank of **Perfected One of the Purple Palace**—I shall personally memorialize on his behalf." Gui bowed in gratitude and inquired further. The Sage dispatched a **talisman-bearing envoy** to escort the **divine turtle** and the attending official Zheng Gui to the **Yama Court** to present the case. The demonic turtle, still pleading for a reprieve, claimed its body had taken five hundred years to form. The King commanded the talisman envoy to manifest the divine turtle, which was enveloped in golden light and crushed into fine dust, scattered across the earthly administrations. Zheng Gui was permitted to return to life, and from that time forth, such calamities vanished from the mortal realm.

They ascended to the **Golden Portal** and proceeded to **Kunlun**, opening the **Gate of Heaven** and sealing the **Gate of Earth**, traversing the obscure and unfathomable to scrutinize the limits of fortune and misfortune. The **Golden Portal** is the general title for the imperial courts of the **Three Heavens of Great Purity**, where the **Celestial Thearchs** reside—namely, the **Jade Clarity Golden Portal**, the **Upper Clarity Golden Portal**, and the **Great Clarity Golden Portal**. **Kunlun** refers to the **Supreme Foundation**, the sacred mountain **Yu Jing** of the **Mystic Capital**, where the palaces of the **Three Heavens**—**Qingwei**, **Yuyu**, and **Dachi**—are established. In ancient times, the **Dark Thearch** was summoned to attend the **Primordial Beginning**; upon receiving his mandate, he acted with such merit among humans and spirits that he was appointed to govern separate domains, opening the yang and closing the yin—hence the phrase "opening the Gate of Heaven and sealing the Gate of Earth." At fixed intervals, he emerges from obscurity and enters tranquility, weaving through the myriad directions, traversing the **Three Realms** to scrutinize transformations and adaptations, bestowing deliverance as circumstances allow, encompassing all matters of action and inaction.

According to the *Veritable Records of the Descended Brush*, whenever the assembled perfected ones pay court to the **Jade Thearch of the Vast Heaven**, the **Four Saints** lead the procession, announcing their arrival. They reside in the **ren-gui** direction—*reside* meaning to dwell in stillness. When the **Great Ultimate** first divided into the **Two Modes**, the **Heavenly One** generated water, and the **Earthly Two** conceived fire, establishing the **ren-gui** direction. Positioned to the north of the **Purple Tenuity**, this aligns with the *Yi Jing*’s principle of **najiang**. **Ren** and **gui** are the purest essences of **qian** and **kun**: the active yang of **qian** generates **jia** and **ren**, while the passive yin of **kun** generates **yi** and **gui**, forming the harmonious qi of heaven and earth’s yin and yang. The stillness within **qian** transforms **ren** into the **li** sun, while the movement within **kun** transforms **gui** into the **kan** moon. Alternating between advance and retreat, waxing and waning, they embrace the **wu-ji** while carrying yin and holding yang, governing the transformation of the myriad things—truly the crucible of water and fire that forges souls and spirits.

According to the *Veritable Records of the Descended Brush*, the palace where the **Dark Thearch** resides is named the **Palace of Heavenly Unity and True Celebration**, situated in the northern reaches of the **Purple Tenuity**, between the **Supreme Elegance** and **Vast Emptiness** of the **Two Supreme Heavens**. Its towering halls are formed naturally from wondrous qi, adorned with jade-like trees, where divine winds chime in harmony with the **gong** and **shang** tones. Crimson light and purple mist perpetually shroud its heights—this is the **Realm of Jade Clarity, the Formless Realm**. Assisting him are the **Generals of Jia and Geng**, who may ride a **dark steed** or mount a **blue-green dragon**.

chunks.original_text: 助有者，顺立成局务也。 甲庚将者，将乃帅之佐，有正副四员，甲、戌、庚、辰也。 甲仁爱，庚义宜，关制令命。 戌信诚，辰吹嘘，魁罡爰从，喻若造父王良，左右摄提之职，掌玄帝马院龙底之政也。 甲、戌将正副者，除牧玄骏之使，乃引辔执策之承。 易纳甲义，甲乃乾之应，戌乃乾之比，一将名位处室壁之间，应天象如造父王良政焉。 庚、辰将正副者，豢驯苍虬之纪，佐袭逐飞御之官。 易纳甲义，庚乃震之应，辰乃震之比，二将名位处角亢之下，应天象，若左右摄提任焉。 乘者，驾也。 玄骏者，玄乃骊黑色，骏乃形之高八尺也。 日元马，本奎比河中天驷，分精易说卦乾健也。 乾为马，而应阴纪阳，故能往复踊健也。 跨者，骑也。 苍乃青碧色，虬是独角龙也。 曰标携龙角，帝座之别区也。 《易·说卦》曰：震乃动也。 震为龙，时潜升阴中之阳，常风雨奉之。 目闪电光，眉横云阵，身长千丈，顶戴一二台。 按降笔实录云：玄帝为几人时，身长九尺，面如满月，龙眉凤目，绪发美髯，颜如冰清，头顶九炁玉冠，身披松萝之服。 自飞升后，每奉降魔制妖，神变千丈大身，云眉电目。 三台六星为冠。 上台司命主寿，上星应天子，下星应女主。 中台司中主宗室，上星应诸侯公王，下星应卿大夫。 下台司禄主兵，上星应士子，下星应庶人。 太微三台六星，两两相比，倾光随覆玄帝之顶，世人仿效为冠名。 晋《天文志》：三台为天阶，太一和阴阳、理纲纪，主开德宣符之验。 右按法家符祝曰：上台一黄，松却不祥。 中台二白，护身镇宅。 下台三青，治病除瘟。 故知三台垂象，神光焕赫而能昭德塞违者也。 其动也，山水蒙； 其静也，地天泰。 以兹显化，故乃神通。 按《太玄都真藏玉华荃》云：祖炁化易，启肇应运，混元隐显，变易交参。 夫蒙泰动静玄义，乃金液化神炼以成刚曰用之法也。 昔太华老人云：修外者，无极无穷。 修内者，无形无影。 外修太虚，内修气运，故得外神安而内气合，乃名颠倒返神之数也。 动蒙艮山为鼻息，出入坎气，血通流利，用育德而成圣功。 太素秀乐天君曰：以无为上下左右前后，以气神和之，故能常得自然之妙，谓寄身行道托命传真也。 静泰坤地母为黄一，乾天父乃祖始，有无交相阴中发阳。 西华帝君曰：若能寝处，引息其神，知其所出，可见本神，不为幻影所着，不为梦寐所夺，此为运坤神而变乾象也。 按《金碧潜通龙虎上经》曰：六十卦体尽出乾坤中，还须经否泰始可议屯蒙。 按张平叔《续易道》曰：故易道妙尽造化之体用，遂达托象，审於斯文，盖一在其中矣。 乾上坤下，天地否，乾坤为鼎器。 坤上乾下，地天泰，交感如日月。 水雷屯守一存三，兔鸡月停火。 山水蒙圣功神化，运混沌育元精。 盖人伦禀协，无出一炁之元。 若夫善颐元鼎善运一炁，是不足度于五行可成真道。 《复命篇》曰：东南西北要精通，交感乾坤雌与雄，火侯直须牢稳审，吹嘘全藉巽家风。 《阴符经》曰：天发杀机，龙蛇起陆，谓后弦之前束南巽位地户也。 坤寄体地户，坤母索一，二生屯，就二而索三，成蒙难易，同气相求，刚化先柔，使神有所度而气有所流。 动法运天，根发巽时，以据内动蒙屯生成之数，加四奇八耦，象日月之右转三百六旬度之，载己土而养金铅，专以鼻袭始青真黑，入于泥九，金生真水，燧炉火侯结练。

Those who assist do so to establish order and fulfill duties in accordance with the celestial arrangement. The **Generals of Jia and Geng** serve as the aides to the marshal, comprising four principal and deputy officers: **Jia, Xu, Geng, and Chen**. **Jia** embodies benevolence and love, while **Geng** upholds righteousness and propriety, enforcing decrees and commands. **Xu** embodies sincerity and trust, and **Chen** governs the breath and vital forces, following the **Big Dipper’s handle** and **celestial pivot**, akin to the roles of **Zaofu** and **Wang Liang**, or the **Left and Right Regulators**, overseeing the governance of the **Dark Thearch’s** **Stable of Dark Steeds** and **Dragon Enclosure**.

The principal and deputy generals **Jia and Xu** are charged with tending the **dark steeds**, guiding the reins and wielding the whip. According to the *Yi’s* **Na Jia** system, **Jia** corresponds to **Qian**, while **Xu** aligns with **Qian’s** companion star. Together, their positions lie between **Shi** and **Bi**, mirroring the celestial governance of **Zaofu** and **Wang Liang**. The principal and deputy generals **Geng and Chen** oversee the rearing and training of the **blue-green dragons**, assisting the officers in charge of swift flight and celestial navigation. In the *Yi’s* **Na Jia** system, **Geng** corresponds to **Zhen**, while **Chen** aligns with **Zhen’s** companion star. Their positions lie beneath **Jiao** and **Kang**, reflecting the celestial roles of the **Left and Right Regulators**.

To **ride** is to **drive**. The **dark steed** is of a deep black hue, standing eight *chi* in height. Known as the **Primordial Steed**, it originates from the **Celestial Chariot** in **Kui**, its essence derived from the *Yi’s* **Qian’s** vigor. **Qian** symbolizes the horse, harmonizing the **yin** register with **yang**, enabling its boundless and vigorous movement. To **mount** is to **straddle**. **Blue-green** signifies a verdant hue, while the **dragon** is a single-horned serpent. It is said to bear the **Dragon Horn**, a distinct region of the **Thearch’s Seat**. The *Yi’s* *Shuo Gua* states: **Zhen** embodies movement. **Zhen** represents the dragon, at times concealed, at others ascending within **yin**, ever attended by wind and rain. Its eyes flash like lightning, its brows stretch like cloud formations, its body spans a thousand *zhang*, and upon its head rest the **One or Two Celestial Terraces**.

According to the *Veritable Records of the Descended Brush*, when the **Dark Thearch** was yet mortal, he stood nine *chi* tall, his face round as the full moon, his brows arched like dragons, his eyes bright as a phoenix’s, his hair and beard flowing and resplendent, his complexion clear as ice. Upon his head rested a **Nine Qi Jade Crown**, and his body was clad in **Pine and Creeping Fig Robes**. After his ascension, whenever he descended to subdue demons and restrain spirits, his divine form expanded to a thousand *zhang*, his brows like clouds, his eyes like lightning. The **Three Terraces and Six Stars** served as his crown. The **Upper Terrace** governs **life and destiny**, its upper star corresponding to the **Son of Heaven**, its lower to the **Queen Consort**. The **Middle Terrace** governs the **imperial lineage**, its upper star corresponding to **dukes, princes, and kings**, its lower to **ministers and grandees**. The **Lower Terrace** governs **official emoluments and military affairs**, its upper star corresponding to **scholars and gentlemen**, its lower to the **common folk**. The **Three Terraces and Six Stars** of the **Supreme Subtlety** stand in pairs, their radiance cascading upon the **Dark Thearch’s** crown, a model later emulated by mortals in crafting their own headwear.

The *Astronomical Records* of the Jin states: The **Three Terraces** form the **Celestial Stairway**, where the **Great One** harmonizes **yin and yang**, governs the **cosmic principles**, and manifests the **verification of virtue and the proclamation of omens**. According to the **Talismanic Incantations of the Legalists**:
- The **Upper Terrace**, one and yellow, dispels misfortune like the pine.
- The **Middle Terrace**, two and white, protects the body and secures the household.
- The **Lower Terrace**, three and blue-green, cures illness and averts pestilence.

Thus, the **Three Terraces** descend in celestial manifestation, their divine radiance resplendent, illuminating virtue and obstructing transgression. In their **movement**, they mirror **Mountains and Waters Concealed**; in their **stillness**, they reflect **Heaven and Earth in Harmony**. Through these transformations, their **spiritual efficacy** is revealed.

According to the *True Treasury of Jade Essence of the Great Mystery Capital*, the **Ancestral Qi** transforms through the **Changes**, initiating the response to destiny. The **Primordial Chaos** conceals and reveals, its transformations intermingling. The **profound principles of movement, concealment, activity, and tranquility** form the method of **transmuting golden liquid into spirit**, refining it into hardness for daily application. The **Old Man of Mount Taihua** once said: Those who cultivate the **external** embrace the **boundless and infinite**; those who cultivate the **internal** attain the **formless and shadowless**. External cultivation refines the **Great Void**, while internal cultivation circulates **qi**. Thus, when the **external spirit** is at peace and the **internal qi** harmonizes, it is called the **reversal of spirit and the return to the primordial**.

**Movement and Concealment**—**Gen Mountain** as the **breath of the nose**, inhaling and exhaling the **qi of Kan**, circulating the blood with fluidity, nurturing **virtue** to achieve **sagely accomplishment**. The **Lord of Supreme Elegance and Joyous Heaven** said: Take **non-action** as the foundation for **above and below, left and right, front and back**, harmonizing **qi and spirit**, thereby perpetually attaining the **wondrousness of the natural**. This is called **entrusting the body to the practice of the Dao, transmitting the true mandate**.

**Stillness and Harmony**—**Kun Earth Mother** as the **Yellow One**, **Qian Heaven Father** as the **Ancestral Origin**, where **being and non-being** alternate, and **yang** emerges from within **yin**. The **Imperial Lord of Western Florescence** said: If one can rest and guide the breath with the spirit, knowing its source, one may perceive the **original spirit**, avoiding attachment to illusions or being seized by dreams. This is the **circulation of Kun’s spirit to transform into Qian’s image**.

According to the *Golden and Azure Hidden Communication of the Dragon and Tiger Superior Canon*: The sixty-four hexagrams all emerge from **Qian and Kun**, yet one must first pass through **Pi and Tai** before discussing **Zhun and Meng**. As **Zhang Pingshu’s** *Continuation of the Dao of the Yi* states: The **Dao of the Yi** wondrously encompasses the **substance and function of creation and transformation**, ultimately relying on **symbolic representation**. Upon careful examination of this text, the **One** is found within.

**Qian above and Kun below** form **Heaven and Earth in Stagnation**, with **Qian and Kun** as the **cauldron and vessel**. **Kun above and Qian below** form **Earth and Heaven in Harmony**, their interaction like the **sun and moon**. **Water and Thunder Zhun** guards the **One** and preserves the **Three**, halting the **moon’s hare and fire’s fowl**. **Mountain and Water Meng** achieves **sagely accomplishment and spiritual transformation**, circulating the **primordial chaos to nurture the original essence**. For humanity, all harmony derives from the **primordial qi of the One**. If one skillfully tends the **primordial cauldron** and adeptly circulates the **One Qi**, it is sufficient to transcend the **Five Phases** and attain the **true Dao**.

The *Returning to Life Chapter* states:
*East, south, west, north—master them well,*
*Intermingle Qian and Kun, the female and male.*
*Fire’s timing must be steadfast and precise,*
*Blowing and breathing rely on Xun’s wind.*

The *Scripture of Yin Convergence* states: *Heaven unleashes its killing mechanism, dragons and serpents rise from the land*—referring to the **Earth Gate** in the **Xun** position of the southeast, before the **last quarter moon**. **Kun** lodges its body in the **Earth Gate**, the **Earth Mother** seeking the **One**. From the **One**, **Zhun** is born; from the **Two**, the **Three** is sought, completing **Meng’s** difficulty and ease. Like qi seeking like, **hardness transforms into softness first**, enabling the spirit to have a measure and qi to have a flow.

**Movement follows the heavens**, roots sprouting in the **Xun** hour. Based on the **inner dynamics of Meng and Zhun’s** generation and completion, add the **Four Odds and Eight Evens**, symbolizing the **sun and moon’s** rightward revolution of **three hundred and sixty degrees**. Carry the **self’s earth** to nourish the **metal lead**, focusing the nose on inhaling the **true black of the beginning blue-green**, entering the **Muddy Pellet**. **Metal generates true water**, and the **fire timing of the fire-drill furnace** forges and refines.

Its towering halls are formed naturally from wondrous qi, adorned with jade-like trees, where divine winds chime in harmony with the **gong** and **shang** tones. Crimson light and purple mist perpetually shroud its heights—this is the **Realm of Jade Clarity, the Formless Realm**. Assisting him are the **Generals of Jia and Geng**, who may ride a **dark steed** or mount a **blue-green dragon**.

chunks.original_text: 《阴符经》曰：人发杀机，天地返覆，谓前弦之后西北乾位天门也。 乾本位天门，坤无定位，月节临乾，盖乾坤三变而兴否泰居寅申也。 寅生离火成己土，申生坎水伏戊火也。 静法守地，根在乾时，而当外存乾坤二策之数，否泰日往来如天道之左旋三百六旬一周，戊火以袭木汞，次以舌下华津饮三十六咽，使火化真土，变神以御。 玄灵正阳真人诀曰：身中用年月，日中用时刻，谓以日为年以辰为节也。 但任外神迁变，而以内气固养，外当随化应时，内得神坚气固，以此修之最为捷法也。 下士遇化而归真，真士开度以上升。 《玉虚太清章》 曰：玉虚之始化于太清，变运上极，持正入真，化炁摄秽，匡御众灵，炼宝回光，五常集婴，律令统纪，度拔众生，神降炁平，保练常宁，以入真界，诸魔潜倾。 此道名上境，学者谨谛，听日月至年，运修进无回停，大功三万曰，小功百曰，升应有绿法士用之。 以虔诚速度诸业海，超登上玉京。 故知玄帝修四十二年，成兹上道，得证诸神通矣。 太上说玄天大圣真武本传神咒妙经卷之二竟 太上说玄天大圣真武本传神咒妙经卷之三 廛人方田子佩升内教箓陈伀集疏 是时，真人再拜稽首曰：臣之庆幸，荷此纶辞。 妙行称赞，紫微敷演，乃经纶端绪之教。 然其玄武之将军，乃玄元之应化，其始之迩，其事云何，愿赐详言，以开蒙鄙。 蒙者，不智也。 鄙者，不慧也。 故妙行谦和，宣明开析玄武详节，普使会众咸闻灵因，亦愿三界人天，尽知玄武妙纪深趣之旨要也。 於是紫微大帝，敷以玄言，释彼所因，解无上事。 昔大罗境上无欲天宫净乐国王， 夫净乐国君，能圣哲主务，而感生玄帝，继踵於考命，终曰得乘生前所种清信功力，命超无欲天宫，衣饭天之厨箱，受诸快乐自然。 《虚皇经》玄天大圣真武本传神咒妙经卷三曰：人有千善，福及七祖，死魂为仙，万善既备，玉符下迎，千神来朝，白日登晨。 玄帝修真果效奉天诏曰，九五老天君降言曰，子之圣父圣母已在九霄矣。 九霄境乃玉虚无色界，中列三十六天宫，总隶大罗三境。 玄帝父母得居，龙变梵度天无欲宫中。 按《紫光经》云：净乐国境乃海外仙国，在西域月支国之西，星分奎娄二宿之下。 善胜皇后，梦而吞日，觉乃怀孕，其母气不纳邪，日常行道，既经一十四月，乃及四百余辰，於开皇元年甲午之岁三月三曰午时，降诞於王宫。 相貌殊伦，后既长成，遂舍家辞父母。 按降笔实录云：玄帝降诞时，正当上天开皇初劫，乃下世黄帝紫云元年岁在甲午戊辰月初三甲寅曰庚午时，符太阳之精，托胎化生，产母左滕。 当生之时，瑞云覆国，异香芬然，土地皆变金玉，瑞应之祥，兹不尽载。 立小字曰安于，生而神灵，举措隐显，年及七岁，经典一览，悉皆默会，仰观俯察，靡所不通，潜心念道，志契太虚，愿事上帝，普福兆民。 於是父王不愿抑志，年十五再辞，王许，赐道号曰潜云子。 按实录云：太上赐玄帝李姓，盖取宗化之源。 按《西域国西州天山坛降笔》载，圣父玉讳告，姑沃切。 玄帝玉讳乞。 按《启圣记》，玄帝应化，唐时裴姓讳仲芳。 按《本生经》，祖讳牛孳，宗讳端受右，暗讳四字贼瞎言乘。 凡对圣席语，宜令勿犯上诸玉讳。

The *Scripture of Hidden Correspondences* states: When humans unleash their killing mechanism, heaven and earth overturn—this refers to the northwest **Qian** position of the **Celestial Gate** after the first quarter moon. **Qian** originally occupies the Celestial Gate, while **Kun** has no fixed position; when the lunar phase approaches **Qian**, it is because **Qian** and **Kun** undergo three transformations, giving rise to **Pi** and **Tai** at the **Yin** and **Shen** positions. **Yin** generates **Li** fire to form **Ji** earth, while **Shen** generates **Kan** water to conceal **Wu** fire.

In stillness, one guards the earth, with roots in the **Qian** hour, while externally preserving the numerical strategies of **Qian** and **Kun**. **Pi** and **Tai** alternate daily like the heavens’ leftward revolution of three hundred and sixty degrees. **Wu** fire seizes **wood mercury**; next, with the tongue, one swallows thirty-six gulps of **Flowery Nectar**, transforming fire into true earth and transmuting spirit to command it.

The *Oral Instructions of the Dark Mystery and True Yang Perfected* states: "Within the body, use years and months; within the day, use hours and moments"—this means taking the day as the year and the hour as the season. Simply allow external spirits to shift and change while internally consolidating and nurturing qi. Externally, one should adapt to transformations in accordance with the times; internally, spirit becomes steadfast and qi solidifies. This method of cultivation is the most expeditious.

Lesser adepts encounter transformation and return to the true; true adepts open the path to ascend. The *Jade Purity and Great Clarity Chapter* states: The **Jade Purity** begins its transformation in the **Great Clarity**, evolving to the utmost extreme. Upholding correctness to enter the true, it transforms qi to seize impurities, rectifies and governs all spirits, refines treasures to reflect light, gathers the five constants into the infant, unifies the statutes and ordinances, delivers and uplifts sentient beings. When spirit descends and qi harmonizes, it preserves and refines perpetual tranquility, entering the realm of the true. All demons silently collapse.

This path is called the **Upper Realm**; scholars must attend to it with utmost care. From days to months to years, cultivate without pause or regression. The great achievement requires thirty thousand days; the lesser, one hundred days. Ascension follows the corresponding method for ordained practitioners. With utmost sincerity, swiftly cross the ocean of karmic deeds to ascend to the **Upper Jade Capital**.

Thus, it is known that the **Dark Emperor** cultivated for forty-two years to accomplish this supreme Way, attaining all divine penetrations.

Here ends the second scroll of *The Supreme’s Exalted Scripture of the Dark Mystery, the Great Sage True Martial’s Original Transmission, and the Wondrous Divine Incantations*.

---

The third scroll of *The Supreme’s Exalted Scripture of the Dark Mystery, the Great Sage True Martial’s Original Transmission, and the Wondrous Divine Incantations*.

**Fang Tianzi Pei Sheng**, a layman of **Chan**, received the **Inner Teachings Register**; **Chen Yong** compiled and annotated.

At that time, the Perfected One bowed twice and prostrated, saying: "This humble servant’s fortune is boundless to receive such a thread of discourse. The wondrous practice is praised, and the **Purple Tenuity** unfolds its teachings—this is the guiding principle of the warp and weft of the scriptures. Yet regarding the **Generals of the Dark Martial**, who are the emanations of the **Dark Origin**, how did their beginnings arise, and what were their affairs? I humbly request a detailed explanation to dispel my ignorance and coarseness."

**Ignorance** means lack of wisdom; **coarseness**, lack of intelligence. Thus, the wondrous practice, with humility and harmony, expounds and clarifies the detailed circumstances of the **Dark Martial**, universally enabling the assembled multitude to hear the numinous causes. It is also hoped that all beings in the three realms and heavens may fully comprehend the profound purport and essential principles of the **Dark Martial’s** wondrous records.

Thereupon, the **Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity** unfolded his dark words, explaining those causes and resolving the supreme matters.

Formerly, in the **Palace of the Desireless Heaven** above the **Great Luo Realm**, there was the **King of Pure Joy**. This king of **Pure Joy** was a sagely and wise ruler who, through his endeavors, conceived the **Dark Emperor**, succeeding his father’s mandate. Ultimately, by virtue of the pure and faithful merit cultivated in previous lives, his destiny transcended the **Palace of the Desireless Heaven**. He clothed and fed himself from the celestial kitchens, receiving all the spontaneous joys of heaven.

The *Scripture of the Void Sovereign*’s *Exalted Scripture of the Dark Mystery, the Great Sage True Martial’s Original Transmission, and the Wondrous Divine Incantations*, Scroll Three, states: "One who performs a thousand good deeds bestows blessings upon seven generations; the deceased soul becomes an immortal. When ten thousand good deeds are complete, a jade tally descends to welcome them, a thousand spirits come to pay homage, and they ascend at dawn."

The **Dark Emperor**, having cultivated the true and achieved results, received the Celestial Edict, which proclaimed: The **Old Heavenly Lord of the Nine-Fives** descended and declared, "Your sagely father and sagely mother are already in the **Nine Empyreans**." The **Nine Empyreans** are the **Jade Purity’s** **Realm of No-Form**, where thirty-six celestial palaces are arrayed, all subordinate to the three realms of the **Great Luo**.

The **Dark Emperor’s** parents came to reside in the **Dragon-Transformed Brahma-Passage Heaven**, within the **Palace of the Desireless**. According to the *Scripture of Purple Radiance*: The kingdom of **Pure Joy** is a land of immortals beyond the seas, located west of the **Yuezhi** country in the Western Regions, beneath the stellar divisions of **Kui** and **Lou**.

The **Virtuous Victorious Queen** dreamed of swallowing the sun and, upon waking, conceived. Her qi did not admit evil; daily she practiced the Way. After fourteen months—over four hundred days—on the third day of the third month in the **Jiawu** year of the **Kaihuang** era, at the hour of **Wu**, he was born in the royal palace. His appearance was extraordinary. After growing up, he renounced his home and bid farewell to his parents.

According to the *Veritable Record of Planchette Descents*: When the **Dark Emperor** was born, it coincided with the **Kaihuang** initial kalpa of heaven, the first year of the **Yellow Emperor’s Purple Cloud** era on earth, in the **Jiawu** year, the third day of the third month, the **Jiayin** day, at the **Gengwu** hour. He embodied the essence of the **Great Yang**, incarnating through conception and emerging from his mother’s left knee.

At his birth, auspicious clouds covered the kingdom, rare fragrances filled the air, and the land transformed into gold and jade. The omens of auspicious responses are too numerous to record. His childhood name was **An Yu**. Born with divine numinosity, his actions were mysterious and manifest. By the age of seven, he had perused all classics and comprehended them silently. Gazing upward and examining below, there was nothing he did not understand. He concealed his heart in the Dao, his aspirations aligned with the **Great Void**, wishing to serve the **Supreme Emperor** and universally bless the people.

His father, the king, did not wish to suppress his aspirations. At fifteen, he bid farewell again, and the king granted his leave, bestowing upon him the Daoist name **Qian Yunzi**. According to the *Veritable Record*: The **Supreme** granted the **Dark Emperor** the surname **Li**, taking it from the source of clan transformation.

According to the *Planchette Descent at the Altar of Mount Heaven in Xizhou, Western Regions*: The sacred father’s jade name is pronounced **Gu Wo**. The **Dark Emperor’s** jade name is **Qi**. According to the *Record of the Awakening of Sagacity*: When the **Dark Emperor** responded to transformation during the Tang, his surname was **Pei**, and his given name was **Zhongfang**. According to the *Scripture of Original Birth*: His grandfather’s name was **Niu Zi**, his clan name was **Duan Shouyou**, and his secret name consisted of four characters: **Ze Xia Yan Cheng**.

In the presence of the sacred seat, one should ensure these jade names are not violated.

chunks.original_text: 本经内有言乘二字，可密音默诵之，以当回避也。 如献欸投词祈求所欲者，於玄帝疏内无得书犯诸讳字，诸两字讳者不许联用，如是单用一字，书令字不完。 入武当山修道四十二年，功成果满，白日升天，玉皇有诏，封为太玄，镇於北方，显边之因，自此始也。 武当者，古名太和山。 按《九五经纬天地历》 曰：禹平水土之后，分治九州，拜立五岳，定封四渎范围，厚载之德，名山大川悉以神圣主之。 乃考翼秒之下，有山曰太和，故老相传云，上古玄武得道飞升之地，更太和之名，就封曰武当山。 按《实录》云：王子离宫，寻访幽谷，遂感玉清圣祖紫元君，授无极上道。 元君曰：子可越海束历於翼较之下，有山自乾兑起迹，盘旋五万里，水出震官。 自有太极之时，便生是山，上应显定极风太安皇崖二天之下。 子可入是山，择众峰之中冲高紫霄者居之。 当契太和升举后二千五百岁，龙汉四劫中，当披发跣足，摄坎离真精，归根复位，上为三境辅臣，下作十方大圣，方得显名亿劫，与天地曰月齐，并是其果满也。 语毕元君升云而去。 王子乃依师语越海束，果见师告之山，山水藏没，有七十二峰，一岑耸翠，上凌紫霄，下有一岩，当阳虚寂，於是探师之诫目，山曰太和山，峰曰紫霄峰，岩曰紫霄岩，因卜居焉。 潜虚玄一，默会万真，四十二年，大得上道。 至黄帝紫云五十七年岁次庚寅九月丙戌初九丙寅曰，自清晨有祥云天花，似雨而下，迷漫山谷，去山四方，林峦震响，自作步虚仙乐之音，王子拱手立于紫霄峰上，须臾云散，见五真韦仙，导从甚盛非凡，见闻悉皆降集，王子稽首，祇奉拜迎。 五真曰：吾等乃九五老天君，准奉三清玉帝诏命，与子启途。 曰当午，五真宣诏，王子再拜稽首，兴受诏领赐，品仪易服讫，乃敛圭奉，乘飞云玉辖羽盖琼轮上升，朝赴九清境矣。 夫玉皇有诏者，是斯经内一百六十八字天书篆文也。 承此赴除太玄之职，方始显迹，於凡知有所修之因也。 真人稽首再拜，白紫微大帝曰：玉皇诏封，必有妙旨，敢问大略，以开小聪。 尔时告於妙行曰：天书秘密，何可谈扬，恐泄天机，深为不便，大梵隐语，奚使众闻。 北极中天紫微令事，遵佐金阙昊天，发敕赞劳，褒勉约东，论事而已。 时依应三清玉帝玺书，颁降准事，施行毕誊，秘于紫馆，况明真有格，未易冒禁，露谈宝训，恐致轻泄之愆也。 於时妙行，开存众之诚，请问大帝旨意之故，谦谦然宝惜，特为遏众信，结誓立盟，使夫理志合仪者矣。 妙行真人拜手稽首，复奏言曰：臣虽缘薄，圣必恩宽，曲念众真，特垂大便，苟轻泄慢，当堕恶途，万劫千生，长为下鬼。 六趣杂染轮回，总号恶途，应是冥宫幽史，皆曰下鬼。 是时，紫微大帝，念此真人着意勤拳，再三请问，遂宣帝软，以示众真。 拜手者，执简启坛礼跪也。 稽首者，倪首至地俯伏也。 三请者，则九拜手三三倪兴也。 妙行殷懃奏请，遂乃设誓，虽缘浅薄，不敢口敬心违，违者甘当处下鬼之趣。 动拳为众三请，蒙大帝敕旨，遣给事侍中启琅函玉匣，出示玄武飞升天诏宣唱也。 夫此秘言，金书篆字，大方一丈，号曰天符。 见之者永处天仙，聆之者不历地狱。 言夫此秘者？

Within this scripture, where the two characters *cheng* (乘) appear, they may be silently recited in secret pronunciation to serve as avoidance. When presenting petitions or submitting written prayers to the **Dark Emperor**, one must not inscribe any of the tabooed names within the memorials. For two-character taboos, their combined use is forbidden; if used singly, the character should be written incomplete.

He entered **Mount Wudang** to cultivate the Dao for forty-two years, where his merit was perfected and his fruition fulfilled. Ascending to heaven in broad daylight, the **Jade Emperor** issued a decree, enfeoffing him as **Supreme Mystery**, charged with guarding the northern quarter. Thus began the cause of his manifestation at the frontier.

**Wudang**, in ancient times, was called **Mount Taihe**. According to the *Nine and Five Scripture of Heaven and Earth’s Latitude and Longitude*: After **Yu** had tamed the waters and divided the land into nine provinces, he established the five sacred peaks and defined the boundaries of the four great rivers. In his virtue of sustaining the earth, he entrusted the oversight of all famous mountains and great rivers to divine spirits. Upon examining the region beneath the *Yi* and *Mao* constellations, there was a mountain called **Taihe**. Elders of old transmitted that this was the place where, in high antiquity, **Xuanwu** attained the Dao and ascended in flight. Thus, the name **Taihe** was changed, and it was enfeoffed as **Mount Wudang**.

According to the *Veritable Record*: The prince left the palace and sought out secluded valleys, where he encountered the **Jade Purity Sagely Ancestor, Purple Prime Lady**, who bestowed upon him the **Supreme Dao of the Limitless**. The Lady said: “You may cross the eastern sea and journey to the region beneath the *Yi* and *Jiao* constellations, where a mountain arises from the *Qian* and *Dui* trigrams, winding for fifty thousand *li*, its waters issuing from the *Zhen* palace. Since the time of the **Great Ultimate**, this mountain has existed, corresponding above to the two heavens of **Manifest Stability** and **Ultimate Peace**. You may enter this mountain and dwell among its central peaks, choosing the loftiest, **Purple Empyrean**. When two thousand five hundred years have passed after the **Great Harmony’s** ascension, during the fourth kalpa of the **Dragon Han** era, you shall let down your hair and go barefoot, gathering the true essence of *Kan* and *Li*, returning to the root and restoring your position. Above, you shall become a minister of the **Three Realms**; below, a great sage of the **Ten Directions**. Only then will your name be manifest for a hundred million kalpas, equal in duration to heaven and earth, sun and moon—such is the fulfillment of your fruition.”

Having spoken, the **Purple Prime Lady** ascended upon the clouds and departed. The prince then followed his master’s instructions, crossing the eastern sea, and indeed beheld the mountain of which she had spoken. Its waters were hidden and submerged, with seventy-two peaks, one summit soaring emerald-green, piercing the **Purple Empyrean**. Below, there was a cliff facing the sun, serene and empty. Thus, he heeded his master’s admonition: the mountain was named **Mount Taihe**, the peak **Purple Empyrean Peak**, and the cliff **Purple Empyrean Cliff**. There he divined his dwelling.

Abiding in profound emptiness and mysterious unity, he silently communed with the myriad perfected. For forty-two years, he mastered the **Supreme Dao**. In the fifty-seventh year of the **Yellow Emperor’s Purple Cloud** era, during the *gengyin* year, on the ninth day of the ninth month, the *bingxu* day, at dawn, auspicious clouds and celestial blossoms descended like rain, filling the mountain valleys. For miles around, the forests and peaks resounded with the spontaneous music of immortal hymns. The prince stood with hands clasped upon **Purple Empyrean Peak**. In an instant, the clouds dispersed, revealing five perfected immortals, **Wei Xian**, with an entourage so grand it was beyond the ordinary. All who saw or heard descended and gathered. The prince bowed deeply, reverently welcoming them.

The five perfected said: “We are the **Nine and Five Elder Heavenly Lords**, acting by decree of the **Three Clarities’ Jade Emperor**, to open your path.” At noon, the five perfected proclaimed the decree. The prince bowed twice, kowtowing, then rose to receive the decree and accept the bestowal. After changing his ceremonial robes, he gathered his jade tablet, mounted a flying cloud, and ascended upon a jade chariot with a feather canopy and jeweled wheels, proceeding to pay homage in the **Nine Clarities’ Realm**.

As for the **Jade Emperor’s decree**, it is the celestial seal-script of one hundred sixty-eight characters contained within this scripture. Upon receiving this, he was appointed to the office of **Supreme Mystery**, and only then did his traces become manifest, so that the world might know the cause of his cultivation.

The perfected one bowed deeply and again prostrated himself, addressing the **Purple Tenuity Great Emperor**: “The **Jade Emperor’s** decree of enfeoffment must contain a wondrous intent. I dare ask for its general purport, to enlighten my humble understanding.”

At that time, the **Purple Tenuity Great Emperor** replied to **Miaoxing**: “The celestial scripture is secret and profound; how can it be discussed or proclaimed? To reveal heavenly mysteries would be most improper. The hidden language of the **Great Brahma**—how could it be made known to the multitude? The affairs of the **Purple Tenuity** at the center of the northern pole are to assist the **Golden Watchtower of the August Heaven**, issuing decrees, bestowing praise, and admonishing the eastern regions—this is the extent of the matter. In accordance with the imperial edict of the **Three Clarities’ Jade Emperor**, the decree was issued and its provisions carried out. Once transcribed, it was sealed within the **Purple Palace**. Moreover, the regulations of the **Illustrious Perfected** are not to be lightly transgressed. To recklessly divulge the sacred teachings would risk the fault of careless disclosure.”

At that time, **Miaoxing**, moved by the sincerity of the assembly, inquired of the **Great Emperor’s** intent. With utmost humility and reverence, he specially restrained the multitude, establishing vows and covenants, so that those whose aspirations aligned with the rites might proceed.

**Miaoxing the Perfected One** bowed with hands clasped and kowtowed, then addressed the throne: “Though my karmic affinity is shallow, I trust in the sagely compassion, which bends to consider the multitude of perfected. If I were to lightly disclose or neglect this, I would fall into evil destinies, becoming a **lower ghost** for ten thousand kalpas and a thousand rebirths, forever revolving through the six paths of defilement—all called **evil destinies**, the **dark officials of the nether realms**, collectively known as **lower ghosts**.”

Then the **Purple Tenuity Great Emperor**, moved by this perfected one’s earnest devotion and repeated entreaties, proclaimed the imperial decree to instruct the assembly.

*Bowing with hands clasped* refers to holding a tablet and kneeling in the ritual of opening the altar. *Kowtowing* means bowing the head to the ground in prostration. *Three entreaties* means nine bows with hands clasped, three prostrations, and three risings.

**Miaoxing** earnestly petitioned and then established vows: though his karmic affinity was shallow, he dared not show reverence in word while violating it in heart. Should he transgress, he willingly accepted the fate of becoming a **lower ghost**. Having made three entreaties on behalf of the multitude, he received the **Great Emperor’s** decree. The **Attendant Secretary** was dispatched to open the jade casket with a jade key, revealing the **Dark Emperor’s** decree of ascension to be proclaimed.

This secret script is written in golden seal-script, a square *zhang* in size, called the **Celestial Talisman**. Whoever beholds it shall forever dwell among the **heavenly immortals**; whoever hears it shall not pass through **hell**. What, then, is this secret?

chunks.original_text: 显昊极三天门下金阙语命，重封奖其天符尊崇也。 按实录云：符篆诏制，乃天真皇人撰及书也。 字大方一丈者，则八角飞芒，各一尺篆迹也。 曰赤书玉字之体，以金错成形也。 得永处天仙，是斯会无极仙曹，咸获瞻见，当增其品秩矣。 次聆听者，因东汉之季，太上降蜀，授征士张真人道陵玄武之经，使流传于世，张君乃以金篆韶书文义，易作凡间书体，浃济学道之人，使夫诵念及聆之者，保毓肾官太玄之气，坚固耳宅门户之聪，使地司黑簿无得书执曾历八百功德之人也。 是等学人命终之际，死魂不当堕入地府狱中。 按《天师杜光庭集》：道无初布，混汉无形，炁凝於浩莽之间，文结於太空之内，曲折成字，八角飞芒。 元始命天真皇人，象形摹写，名曰天书玉篆，乃为文字之祖体也。 其韶文曰： 此经天符诏语，乃依降笔，实录本书。 金阙昊天三省门下牒奉 故学仙圣童净乐王子七岁神灵净乐国子十五志道辟国二亲 惟卿玄元之化太虚本炁玄元化生天一之尊太阴天一紫皇尊身 不言而教守中忘言授学元君莫知其神莫知帝象惟德至神 渺渺劫仞善释魔刃历结解纷绵绵若存镇护元气绵绵长存 虚心实腹清心寡欲抱一顺真和光同尘守昧同垢韬光晦明 凿开造化凿开虚己镕化至精朴散胚浑雕琢覆朴块然胚浑 六百万岁延康劫初纪至庚寅八十二身五灵老始玄武后形 曲全枉直诎己证道举众伸人洼盈币新若水下物度弊革新 生阴育阳阴生阳育女癸男壬起死成人恐人天横卫生留经 其功不恃兴益利施亡执恃名其德乃真不希上德真静长清 今宜再显昊天宜命太玄悖与永镇北旻秉斯公治专政愍民 上罚逆象妖精逆象辄现与擒下灭妖氛邪氛侵气妄逞收平 掌握图箓掌握宇宙极图誓盟摄制魔踪镇伏魔劳大刑摄摈 帝真灵会地真生理卫笔宏臣驱神驾龙驾龙驭骏统十号兵 甲庚之将纪纲骖辔特赐甲庚赞卫尔动克成赞术盖署元勋 周环六合十二分野按月日巡普福兆民分身下降普福乾坤 道参天地大道参校可诏飞升万真所推九清万真齐驾帝庭 可　特　拜　太　玄　元　帅　领 元和迁校府公事册 到　奉　行

The proclamation from the Golden Gates beneath the Three Heavens of the Radiant Celestial Pole reaffirms the exalted seal of this **Celestial Talisman**. According to the *Veritable Records*, the talismanic script and imperial decree were composed and inscribed by the **Perfected Sovereign of Heaven**. The characters, a square *zhang* in size, are eight-pointed with flying rays, each stroke a *chi* in length. This is the form of the **Crimson Writ of Jade Characters**, its shape wrought in inlaid gold. To dwell forever among the **heavenly immortals** is to ascend to the **Boundless Immortal Courts of this Assembly**, where all may behold it and thereby elevate their rank.

As for those who hear it: during the late Eastern Han, the **Most High** descended to Shu and transmitted the **Mysterious Warrior’s** scripture to the **Perfected Lord Zhang Daoling**, entrusting its dissemination to the world. Lord Zhang then rendered the golden seal-script’s profound meaning into a common written form, benefiting all who study the Dao. Those who recite or hear it preserve the **Great Mystery’s qi** within the **Kidney Palace**, fortifying the gates of the **Ear Residence** with keen hearing. Thus, the **Earth Bureau’s Black Register** cannot record those who have accrued eight hundred merits. When such practitioners reach life’s end, their souls shall not descend into the **earth-prison hells**.

According to the *Collected Works of Celestial Master Du Guangting*: the Dao first spread without beginning, formless amid the Han’s chaos. Qi congealed in the vast expanse, patterns coalesced within the Great Void, their sinuous strokes forming characters with eight-pointed flying rays. The **Primordial Beginning** commanded the **Perfected Sovereign of Heaven** to model and transcribe them, naming them the **Celestial Writ of Jade Seal-Script**—the primordial form of all writing.

Its **Vernal Writ** states:
This scripture’s celestial talisman and decree descend by inspired brush, as recorded in the *Veritable Book*. A missive from the Three Offices beneath the Golden Gates of the Radiant Celestial Pole is hereby issued:

Thus, the **Divine Child Jing Le**, Prince of the Pure Joy Kingdom, at seven years of age, and the **Dao-seeking Youth of the Avoided State**, at fifteen, with both parents—
You, whose transformation arises from the **Primordial Qi of the Great Origin**, whose birth is the **Celestial One’s** honor, the **Supreme Yin’s** singularity, the **Purple Sovereign’s** sacred form—
Though silent, you teach; by guarding the center, you forget words. The **Perfected Lord of Learning** cannot fathom your divinity; none know the **Emperor’s** likeness—only that your **virtue** attains the divine.
Through measureless kalpas, you dissolve the blades of demons, unraveling entanglements. Subtly present, you guard the **primordial qi**, ensuring its eternal endurance.
Empty the heart yet fill the belly; purify the heart and diminish desires. Embrace the One and follow the **Perfected**; harmonize with light and merge with dust. Conceal brilliance and obscure clarity; carve open creation, hollow the self, and refine the essence. Scatter the uncarved block, return to simplicity—lumpish, unhewn.
For six million years, since the **Yan Kang** kalpa’s inception in the *gengyin* year, eighty-two incarnations have passed. The **Five Spirits’** elder first took the **Mysterious Warrior’s** form.
Bending the whole to straighten the crooked, humbling the self to realize the Dao, raising the many to extend the few—like water, you descend to measure all things, renewing the old. You transform decay and innovate.
Nurturing yin to foster yang, yin births yang, the female *gui* and male *ren* revive the dead to become human. Fearing the heavens’ chaos, you safeguard life and preserve the scriptures.
Your merit does not rely on boasting; your beneficence spreads without attachment. Your **virtue** is true, not seeking lofty recognition. True stillness endures in eternal purity.
Now, it is fitting to once more manifest the decree of the **Radiant Celestial Pole**, commanding the **Great Mystery’s** might to eternally guard the **Northern Heavens**. Assume sole governance, pity the people, and punish rebellion. When portents of treachery appear, swiftly capture and annihilate them. Suppress demonic vapors and wayward qi; quell their reckless rampage.
Hold the **Chart and Registers**; grasp the **Cosmic Ultimate Diagram**. Swear oaths to subdue demonic traces; pacify demonic toil with the **Great Punishment’s** expulsion.
The **Imperial Perfected’s** numinous assembly and the **Earthly Perfected’s** governance—your brush is vast, your ministers drive spirits and mount dragons. Commanding dragons and steeds, you lead the **Ten Titled Armies**. The generals of *jia* and *geng* days uphold discipline; their reins are specially granted. By your movement, you achieve success; your arts are lauded, your merits recorded.
Encircling the Six Directions and Twelve Divisions, you patrol by month and day, universally bestowing fortune. Manifesting in myriad forms, you descend to bless heaven and earth.
The Dao parallels heaven and earth; the **Great Dao’s** comparison may be decreed. Ascend in flight—all **Perfected** acclaim it; the **Nine Purities’** myriad **Perfected** ride together to the **Imperial Court**.

**Hereby Appointed:**
**Grand Marshal of the Great Mystery**
**Director of the Bureau of Harmonious Transitions**

**Decree Received. To Be Executed.**

chunks.original_text: 紫微乃言告真人曰：此文者，玉皇秘敕，天帝徽宣，不可轻传，恐遭降责。 紫微大帝所宝三宣初敕曰：天书秘密，何可谈扬，恐泄天机也。 次曰：玉皇秘敕，不可轻传，恐遭降责也。 末曰：非乃至人，秘之宜也。 诫授受者，恐口敬心违也。 《因绿经》曰：凡人现世长命富贵者，往世曾敬信大道，妙义中来。 永劫家势不衰者，曾延奉正真，及成就功德中来。 处世为人才识明了深通妙理达性真者，曾持宝经不妄传人中来也。 真人稽首，又白帝言：臣闻玄武将军，神通至大，不居诸位，而镇北方。 妙用之因，神明之契，必有奥旨，愿释鄙怀。 妙行复问玄武洞妙，因何专政，位居北方。 大帝遗音告真人曰：天中北上，众曜拱之，以匪至神，孰能镇遏。 中天，北极之中建紫微帝庭也。 元和迁校府署，乃毗紫庭之北，且玄帝伟政，位天官四帅之右，导森罗万象之前，故经曰众曜拱之职事，准玄帝功业可当也。 每群真会朝昊天至尊，则四圣为都班之首。 实录云：元始升玉宸殿内，大会诸天上帝，校迁三界群真，登命九天，司马侍仙玉郎启太丹玉匣，出万天素威功过玉历，敕金阙侍中司马大神韩君丈人、金阙司命可韩真人、金阙司录定名玉历真人、金关司功九天探访真君、金阙司过九天储福真君，并开历考绩三官四圣之职，自太虚开化，神一挺生，有保天佑地化育之功，奏上三清，乃命玉帝亲行典仪，当亚帝真之号，遂诏玄武诣阙，登七宝琼台之上，遣金阙侍中素灵殿大学士三天门下直日储灵典奏事金真紫阳大夫含光上德仙君轩辕执本，斋莽昊极三天门下，玉册传命，官一赐玄武仪锡以通天十二谎冠，玄衮上施日月山龙物象，玄玉宝圭，红舄玄履，琼旌宝节，九龙玉笔，玄武拜受易服讫。 仙君谨言玉宸三省诰曰：皇皇大道，赫赫至真，太极开判，玄元化生，妙蕴枢机，万天尊仰，则为圣明主务，其休隆广，焉敢不崇。 钦惟太玄元师镇大玄武大将军三元都总管九天游奕使左天罡北极右垣三界大都督，依前领元和迁校府职判玄都右胜府公事。 太上紫皇天一真人册曰：灵通太妙，上开混化之玄。 道备郁明，下统虚危之秀。 宝育天元，抚成地纪。 持造化於四时，推纪纲於八节。 分身下降，普福乾坤。 功齐五千万劫，德并三十二天九霄。 上赖於真威十极，仰依於神化有大。 利施於下民，积圣德徧於玉历。 按遵简箓，当亚帝真，敢不徽崇。 何以明德，赐尊号特拜玉虚师相，玄天上帝领九天探访使。 金书册宝曰：夫道生一炁，感化三才，结真于九极之华，晨丽于六天之秀。 幽微炜烨，洞杳飞芒，功高难极，合示嘉尊想惟鉴观，幸勿谦辞。 余当上辅大道，劫劫长存，下佑兆民，绵绵永祉。 龙文昭降，永秘玄都。 谨言崇封，圣父日净乐天君明真大帝，圣母曰善胜太后琼真上仙。 下荫天关，曰太玄火精含阴将军赤灵尊神，地轴曰太玄水精育阳将军黑灵尊神，并居天一真庆宫。 仰观玄帝之勋业，在于今日之权，总司三界功过，事况真休，尚赖其威辅，而神通果至大欤。 真人乃启於紫微，若有天人，志心钦仰，其於福利，有所得乎。 妙行真人思正万汇，顺天人之心，仍问钦敬福利，将化人天归向耶。 大帝曰：此神将是岁每月六日、十六日、二十六日，诸天审察，

The Purple Tenuity thus spoke to the Perfected, saying: "This document is a secret decree of the Jade Emperor, a solemn proclamation of the Heavenly Thearch—it must not be lightly transmitted, lest one incur punitive censure."

The Three Proclamations treasured by the Great Emperor of Purple Tenuity state:
First: "The celestial writ is arcane; how may it be discussed or disseminated? One fears the leakage of Heaven’s mechanisms."
Second: "The Jade Emperor’s secret decree must not be lightly transmitted, lest one incur punitive censure."
Third: "Unless one is a Perfected of the highest order, secrecy is fitting."

The transmission of these admonitions warns that reverence in speech may yet conceal dissonance in the heart.

The *Scripture of the Green Cause* states: "Those who in this life enjoy longevity, wealth, and nobility have, in past lives, revered and trusted the Great Dao, deriving therefrom its wondrous principles. Those whose families endure unwaning prosperity across kalpas have, in past lives, extended devotion to the Orthodox and Perfected, achieving merit and virtue thereby. Those who in this life possess keen talent, profound insight, and deep comprehension of the subtle principles that illuminate the true nature have, in past lives, upheld sacred scriptures and refrained from reckless transmission."

The Perfected bowed deeply and addressed the Emperor again, saying: "I have heard that the General of the Dark Warrior possesses boundless divine efficacy, yet does not occupy the ranks of the myriad deities but instead guards the northern quadrant. The cause of his wondrous function and the covenant of his numinous brilliance must hold profound significance. I humbly beseech an explanation to dispel my ignorance."

The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct further inquired into the abstruse mysteries of the Dark Warrior, asking why he holds exclusive governance and is stationed in the north.

The Great Emperor’s voice responded to the Perfected, saying: "In the heavens above the north, the host of luminaries pay homage—without the most divine, who could restrain and govern? At the center of the heavens, within the northern pole, stands the imperial court of Purple Tenuity. The Bureau of Harmonious Transitions lies north of the Purple Court, and the Dark Emperor’s august governance ranks to the right of the Four Marshals of the Celestial Offices, guiding the myriad phenomena of the forest of existence. Thus, the scriptures say, 'The host of luminaries pay homage in their duties,' and the Dark Emperor’s achievements and merits are commensurate with this office.

Whenever the assembly of Perfected gathers to pay court to the August Celestial Honored One, the Four Saints serve as the vanguard of the ranks.

The *Veritable Record* states: When the Primordial Ascended within the Jade Clarity Palace and convened the assembly of the Celestial Thearchs of the Myriad Heavens, reviewing and promoting the host of Perfected across the Three Realms and appointing the Nine Heavens’ offices, the Jade Gentleman Attendant of the Celestial Marshal opened the Great Cinnabar Jade Casket and produced the *Jade Chronicle of Merit and Demerit of the Myriad Heavens*. The decree commanded the Golden Watchtower Attendant-in-Chief, the Celestial Marshal Divine Lord Han the Venerable; the Golden Watchtower Director of Destinies, the Perfected Han; the Golden Watchtower Recorder of Names, the Perfected of the Jade Chronicle of Destinies; the Golden Pass Director of Merit, the Nine Heavens’ Investigator Perfected Lord; and the Golden Watchtower Director of Demerit, the Nine Heavens’ Treasurer of Blessings Perfected Lord—all to open the chronicle and examine the merits of the Three Officials and the Four Saints. Since the opening of the Great Void and the emergence of the Divine Unity, he has borne the merit of protecting Heaven and aiding Earth in nurturing transformation. His achievements were memorialized to the Three Clarities, whereupon the Jade Emperor personally conducted the ritual, bestowing the title of 'Perfected Subordinate to the Emperor.' Thereupon, the Dark Warrior was summoned to the court, ascending the Seven-Treasured Jade Terrace. The Golden Watchtower Attendant-in-Chief, the Grand Academician of the Hall of Primordial Numinosity, the Direct Servitor of the Three Heavenly Gates, the Custodian of the Treasury of Numinosity, the Memorialist, the Golden Perfected, the Purple Yang Grand Master, the Radiant and Virtuous Transcendent Lord Xuanyuan, who holds the register, was dispatched to the Three Heavenly Gates of the August Ultimate. The jade tablet conveyed the mandate, and the office was granted: the Dark Warrior was invested with the Heaven-Connecting Twelve-Tiered Cap, the dark ceremonial robe adorned with the sun, moon, mountains, dragons, and cosmic imagery, the dark jade ritual tablet, the red-soled dark shoes, the jasper banner and precious staff, the Nine-Dragon Jade Brush. The Dark Warrior bowed to receive them and completed his change of attire.

Thereafter, the Transcendent Lord reverently recited the Threefold Edict of the Jade Clarity Palace, saying: "The august Great Dao, the majestic Supreme Perfected, at the division of the Great Ultimate, gave birth to the transformations of the Primordial Mystery. Its wondrous pivot encompasses the mechanisms of the myriad heavens, and all honor the Celestial Honored One as the sagely and luminous sovereign of their affairs. How vast and exalted are his blessings—how dare we not revere them?"

With reverence, we consider the Great Primordial Master, the Great General of the Dark Warrior of the Great Mystery, the Commander-in-Chief of the Three Origins, the Marshal of the Nine Heavens’ Patrols, the Right Celestial Pivot of the Northern Pole’s Right Wall, the Grand Commander of the Three Realms—continuing in his former office as Director of the Bureau of Harmonious Transitions and Adjudicator of the Right Victory Office of the Mysterious Capital.

The Register of the Supreme Purple Emperor and the Perfected of Heavenly Unity states: "His numinosity penetrates the supremely wondrous, opening the mysteries of primordial transformation. His Dao is replete and resplendent, governing the essence of the Void and Danger constellations. He nurtures the primordial of Heaven and completes the records of Earth. He upholds the transformations of the four seasons and extends the disciplines of the eight nodes. Manifesting in myriad forms, he universally blesses Heaven and Earth. His merit equals that of fifty million kalpas; his virtue parallels the thirty-two heavens and nine auroras. Above, he relies on the true majesty of the Ten Poles; below, he depends on the vast transformations of the divine. He bestows benefits upon the people and accumulates sagely virtue throughout the Jade Chronicle. In accordance with the registers and talismans, he is deemed a Perfected Subordinate to the Emperor—how dare we not honor him?"

To manifest his virtue, he was specially appointed as the Jade Void Preceptor and Minister, the Dark Celestial Thearch, and Marshal of the Nine Heavens’ Investigators.

The golden script of the register states: "The Dao gives birth to the One qi, which transforms the Three Powers. It crystallizes the true within the splendor of the Nine Poles and dawns radiantly in the excellence of the Six Heavens. Subtle and resplendent, profound and luminous, its merit is boundless—it is fitting to bestow honor. We hope you will not decline out of modesty. I shall henceforth assist the Great Dao, enduring across kalpas, and protect the myriad people, extending blessings eternally."

The dragon script descended in illumination, to be forever concealed in the Mysterious Capital.

With reverence, we proclaim the ennoblement: His Sagely Father is the Heavenly Lord of Pure Joy, the Radiant and Perfected Great Emperor; his Sagely Mother is the Queen Mother of Victorious Goodness, the Jasper Perfected Transcendent. Below, they shade the Celestial Pass: the General of the Fire Essence Containing Yin, the Venerable Dark Spirit of Vermilion Numinosity; and the General of the Water Essence Nurturing Yang, the Venerable Dark Spirit of Black Numinosity—both reside in the Palace of True Felicity of Heavenly Unity.

Gazing upon the Dark Emperor’s achievements and merits, we see that his authority today encompasses the governance of merit and demerit across the Three Realms. The circumstances of his true blessings still rely on his majestic assistance, for his divine efficacy is indeed boundless.

The Perfected then inquired of the Purple Tenuity: "If there are those among the celestial and human realms who, with sincere devotion, revere and honor him, will they obtain blessings and benefits?"

The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, contemplating the myriad phenomena and aligning with the hearts of Heaven and humanity, further inquired about the blessings of reverence and how they might transform the destinies of humans and gods.

The Great Emperor replied: "This divine general, on the sixth, sixteenth, and twenty-sixth days of every month, when the various heavens conduct their investigations..."

chunks.original_text: 此诸天者，乃是色欲一界天境公事。 玄帝之守，巡历审察二曜、三辰、五行、万象、星府事，弹镇不正妖彗也。 故本经曰：每月三度，统领神兵，躬往诸天，褊为巡察。 凡遇邪气及有妖星，速须剪戮，是斯职也。 色界天属上元三炁君，召诸天人春属事中外一十八天主尊，谨着睿号：中九天五炁天君主北方，元灵上极天始素天君主西南，妙灵宝华天九炁天君主东方，玉华无极天始丹天君主东南，大虚真极天一炁天君主上方，玉清虚皇天始玄天君主西北，素灵皓元天七黑天君主西方，玉灵素华天始青天君主东北，太灵真元天三炁天君主南方，南极玉文天外九天智德天尊主北方，双阙化身天威范天尊主西南，至妙变空天仁爱天尊主东方，元真宝曜天慈和天尊主东南，开灵传道天载德天尊主下方，中极总生天成化天尊主西北，元关溥济天义议天尊主西方，成德曜晶天智积天尊主东北，晖明流光天礼教天尊主南方。 太平运化天色界，乃无五行之所，其中天人春属衣饭天之厨箱也。 本因是从，凡修炼之士而及之。 灵宝经注云：人有百善，东华注名，以至三百善，去身业历，净行命终，蜕壳神随功着，飞乌此境也。 於中增修及千善者，福延七祖神魂，灵魄聚为春属也。 欲界天属中元三炁君，召诸天春也。 其六天十境，最居下位，接人间顶，题名于后。 诸天数号：善胜天王算北境，他化自在天妙化天王尊东境，乐变化天妙德天王尊中境，兜率陀天清净天王尊南境，须焰摩天灵和天王尊西境，切利天淳和天王尊护世四王天中央，东方境主持国天王，南方境主增长天王，西方境主广日天王，北方境主多闻天王。 灵宝经云：人有十善，司命储算，至五十善，五帝友别，三业渐除，形神少忘，得返五行之妙，天命终际，神魂径超此诸天境，受大快乐也。 况夫玄帝禀命，常保育天元矣。 十洞巡游。 十洞者，乃十大洞天也。 巡进警察，神仙公事也。 按朝天忏应洞天所各立仙官曹僚，分掌攒集万汇箓籍功过等事。 及正月七日，二月八日，三月九日，四月四日，五月五日，六月七日，七月七日，八月十三日，九月九日，十月二十一日，十一月七日，十二月二十七日，下降人间，剪灭邪魔，驱除瘟疟，保人庆寿，以全天命。 其有气正心纯，忠全孝尽，名书玉简，保举升仙。 更有玄科，莫可并述。 真人稽首再拜，白紫微大帝曰：显化之因，则闻命矣，天人钦仰。 玄武将军，作何归依、设何方便，而得福利，幸赐一言。 妙行请问归依之人，设何供礼。 大帝是时告真人曰：天地之内，能有至心奉杞玄武，一生之内，不食鯹音星膻，自毙毒伤厌秽之物，及於藠音小菜、大蒜、葫英； 耽淫嗜欲，扶尸接产，若能断得，方可志心。 凡临下降之辰，皆有桢祥之庆。 大帝语天地之内者，谓天下地上大千世界中人也。 能有志心奉祀玄武者，动修香火之家，诚谨信奉，遵依此经避忌之人，实於卫生利益。 按《应运经》曰：饮食随缘，不必劳神，不必着见。 饮则通其色身血肉，食则充其色身脏气。 按《灵宝大诫经》：身中元神，惟务清净，不可杂食臭腥，臭腥之物，壅滞经源，缠罗六腑。 又脂荤辛躁，昏塞神门，攻蒸五脏，生诸病恼。
