chunks.original_text: 。 应诸福地真人，各听玉帝轮排，差除职任也。 考续治政，行事得失，仍听升退者也。 无量飞天大神，无极长生大圣，金童玉女，九凤八鸾，侍卫於辉光，罗列於左右。 无者，不可也。 量者，度也。 极者，至也。 谓不可度，侍从中数矣。 且诸天阙庭下，陪驾侍御职事，曹僚局司，威仪济济矣。 飞天大神乃从笔策驾之官，掌仪銮法物等事。 按《大戒经》云：昔人能通戒行精进不退转者，即与证明作清信之士，果满命终，特补充天中勇猛飞天大神。 长生大圣者，乃三省总辖之臣，纪三界进修功籍。 按《玉晨藏筌》云：下元学人，轮回疾疫，若心离尘昧，种种坚固，神通慧极，法光神光慧光冲霄，而入真常之道，天仙拜迎，帝命入，补储天官之位，主理生籍。 金童者，安乡亭侯之职，如凡世给事中丞。 按《汉天师家传》云：子房、子渊，并佐太清宫童子，侍奉老君。 玉女者，应传命仪淑之品，如凡国嫔御命女之类也。 按《混元经》：又以玄炁，结成云阁，吹嘘感召，灵符化光，金童玉女，执节持幢。 凤鸾，乃灵禽也，出自南海丹穴女沐二山中。 九凤者，九只为一，成号九凤，祇应三清，合九九八十一只，动成九韶，应玉清上清太清之乐。 八鸾者，八只为一，列号八鸾，八八六十四只，列八修之舞，协洞真洞玄洞神之范。 二禽形高八九尺，身羽彩发，光辉曲终，舞罢环列诸天，侍卫左右。 八音自响，众圣咸欣， 八音者，谓八卦形器之韵。 自响者，因灵风鼓瑟骞林发声，唯三境九霄有无量自鸣天乐之妙，出于琳琅宝树枝叶之间，皆自宫商节奏，妙泛石磬轧玉之响，妙泛鼓坎革之音，妙泛笙黄艮匏之韵，妙泛箫笛震竹中声，妙柷敔巽木之击，妙泛琴瑟离丝之鸣，妙泛埙坤土之调，妙泛饶钹兑金锽铮。 《灵宝经》曰：琼府巍峨境，森扶蔼华骞，灵风泛洞响，可保无穷年。 盖此妙乐嘹喨自然之音，最能利益於聆者，使正性全真也。 是会莫不咸欣其美哉。 严听天尊说至真之妙法。 严听者，大众悚闻谈演也。 夫至真妙法，乃是洞玄中乘，开度天中九真之秘典也。 此教总一十二部秩目，曰：第一灵和部，第二灵宝部，第三通神部，第四无量部，第五集仙部，第六内秘部，第七至真部，第八进善部，第九炼精部，第十生户部，第十一官图部，第十二销魔部。 已上部目共计八万四千卷，元始并授玉晨大道君，永秘玄都玉京天台之内也，洎三十六天中其文具足矣。 於是名山洞府海岳仙官，虽有所修者，唯但闻篇目，岂获斯乘足备耶。 况下土士民探赜乎，今降流于世者，乃出第二秩灵宝开图之妙经也。 《应运经》载西域老曰：大底众妙不过一门。 若夫世人，内应阴之运度，外体阳之刚柔，推以五常，授之一炁，於此门中，知其渐处，乃得神炁降息。 神已降息，百魔潜倾，是为灵法，诸炁皆平。 炁平而息，四大一清，此为炼化，而为大宝也。 肃清道炁，绕无上之玄元， 肃清者，乃谓至道严净之炁也。 故澄清开光，结为神化之主，洞诀流贯，上通上清，下兼洞神，乃谓绕无上玄元也。 按《灵宝开图经》载：元始以灵宝祖炁，交始青之炁，主御天地鬼神，滋荣世间，生炁抱魂，结炼营护太和，浃下元生人耶。
chunks.translated_text:
The Perfected of all Blessed Lands shall each heed the Jade Emperor’s rotational assignments and accept their appointed duties. Their governance, merits, and faults shall be subject to review for promotion or demotion.

The boundless *Flying Heavenly Deities*, the *Infinite Long-Life Great Sages*, the *Golden Lads and Jade Maidens*, the *Nine Phoenixes and Eight Luan Birds*—all stand radiant in attendance, arrayed to left and right. "Boundless" signifies the immeasurable; "infinite," the unfathomable; "limitless," the ultimate. Such is the innumerable host of attendants.

Moreover, beneath the celestial palaces of all heavens, the ranks of courtiers, officials, and functionaries stand in solemn array. The *Flying Heavenly Deities* serve as the scribes and chariot-drivers of the celestial bureaucracy, overseeing ritual regalia and sacred implements. As the *Great Precepts Sutra* states: "Those of old who mastered the precepts, cultivated diligent practice, and never regressed were acknowledged as pure and faithful adepts. Upon the fulfillment of their destiny and the end of their lives, they were specially appointed as *Flying Heavenly Deities* of valor in the heavens."

The *Long-Life Great Sages* are ministers who oversee the Three Departments, recording the merits of cultivation across the Three Realms. According to the *Jade Dawn’s Hidden Basket*: "For disciples of the Lower Realm caught in the swift cycles of pestilence, if their hearts depart from worldly darkness and their resolve remains unshaken, their spiritual powers and wisdom reach their zenith, and the radiance of Dharma, spirit, and wisdom pierces the heavens—thus entering the Dao of true constancy—they shall be welcomed by celestial immortals. By imperial decree, they are appointed to the ranks of celestial officials, presiding over the registers of life."

The *Golden Lads* hold the office of *Marquis of Peaceful Village*, akin to the *Attendant Gentleman of the Palace* in the mortal realm. As the *House Biographies of the Han Celestial Masters* records: "Zifang and Ziyuan both served as lads in the *Supreme Clarity Palace*, attending the *Venerable Lord*."

The *Jade Maidens* fulfill roles as messengers of refined virtue, comparable to imperial consorts and court ladies. According to the *Primal Chaos Sutra*: "From the primordial *qi*, clouds coalesced into pavilions. Through breath and invocation, numinous talismans transformed into light, and *Golden Lads and Jade Maidens* bore standards and canopies."

The *Phoenixes and Luan Birds* are sacred fowl, originating from the *Cinnabar Cavern* and *Female Bathing* mountains in the Southern Sea. The *Nine Phoenixes*—nine forming a single flock—are styled as such, serving the *Three Clarities*. Together, they number eighty-one, and their movements compose the *Nine Shao* melodies, harmonizing with the music of the *Jade Clarity*, *Supreme Clarity*, and *Great Clarity* heavens. The *Eight Luan Birds*—eight forming a single flock—are styled as such, numbering sixty-four in total. Their dances align with the *Eight Refined Movements*, complementing the rites of the *Cavern of Perfection*, *Cavern of Mystery*, and *Cavern of Divinity*. These birds stand eight or nine *chi* tall, their plumage resplendent, their radiance undiminished until the dance’s end. Thereafter, they encircle the heavens, standing guard to left and right. The *Eight Sounds* resonate spontaneously, and all the sages rejoice.

The *Eight Sounds* refer to the harmonies of instruments shaped by the Eight Trigrams. "Spontaneous resonance" arises when the divine wind stirs the *qian* forest, producing tones. Only in the Three Realms and Nine Heavens does the wondrous *self-sounding celestial music* emerge—from the branches and leaves of *linlang* jewel-trees—each note a marvel of *gong* and *shang* cadence. There are the chimes of jade and stone, the rhythms of drums and *kan* leather, the melodies of *sheng* reeds and *gen* gourds, the flutes of *zhen* bamboo, the strikes of *xun* and *yu* wood, the strumming of *qin* and *se* strings, the tunes of *xun* and *fou* clay, and the clangs of *rao* cymbals and *dui* metal. As the *Numinous Treasure Sutra* declares:
*"The towering realm of the Jade Palace stands,
With forests of blossoms swaying in grace.
The divine wind stirs the cavern’s echo,
Ensuring boundless years in this place."*

This sublime music, resounding with natural clarity, most benefits those who hear it, preserving their true nature in its entirety. Thus, all in attendance rejoice in its beauty.

Now, hearken solemnly to the *Celestial Worthy* expound the wondrous Dharma of the *Utmost Perfection*. "Hearken solemnly" signifies the reverent attention of the assembly to the discourse. The *Dharma of the Utmost Perfection* is the esoteric scripture of the *Middle Vehicle of the Cavern of Mystery*, which initiates the Nine Perfected of the heavens.

This teaching comprises twelve divisions, each with its own hierarchy:
1. *Numinous Harmony Division*
2. *Numinous Treasure Division*
3. *Spirit Communication Division*
4. *Boundless Division*
5. *Immortal Assembly Division*
6. *Inner Esoteric Division*
7. *Utmost Perfection Division*
8. *Virtue Cultivation Division*
9. *Essence Refinement Division*
10. *Life Portal Division*
11. *Officials and Charts Division*
12. *Demon Subjugation Division*

Together, these divisions encompass eighty-four thousand scrolls. The *Primal Beginning* bestowed them upon the *Jade Dawn Great Dao Lord*, sealing them eternally within the *Jade Capital Heavenly Terrace* of the *Mystic Metropolis*. Their texts are complete across the Thirty-Six Heavens. Though the immortals of sacred mountains, grotto-heavens, seas, and peaks may engage in cultivation, they have only heard of these divisions’ titles—how could they fully attain this vehicle? Even less so for the scholars and common folk of the lower realms. The scriptures now disseminated in the world derive from the second division: the wondrous *Numinous Treasure Unfolding Charts Sutra*.

The *Sutra of Responding to the Era* records the words of an elder from the Western Regions: "Generally, all wonders converge in a single gateway. If mortals inwardly align with the cyclical movements of *yin* and outwardly embody the firmness and softness of *yang*, guiding them through the Five Constants and receiving them in a single *qi*—within this gateway, they may discern the gradual path. Thus, the spirit-*qi* descends and stills. Once the spirit is stilled, the hundred demons retreat in silence. This is the numinous Dharma, wherein all *qi* are harmonized. When *qi* is harmonized and still, the Four Great Elements become pure—this is the alchemical transformation, the Great Treasure."

The *Dao-qi* is purified, encircling the *Supreme Mystery*. "Purified" denotes the solemn and pristine *qi* of the Utmost Dao. Thus, clarity and radiance coalesce into the sovereign of spiritual transformation. The flowing secrets of the *Cavern Precepts* ascend to the *Supreme Clarity* and encompass the *Cavern of Divinity* below—this is the encircling of the *Supreme Mystery*. As the *Numinous Treasure Unfolding Charts Sutra* states: "The *Primal Beginning* employed the ancestral *qi* of the *Numinous Treasure*, merging it with the *Primordial Azure Qi* to govern the heavens, earth, ghosts, and spirits, nurturing the world. The *qi* of life embraces the soul, refining and safeguarding the Great Harmony, permeating the Lower Realm and its people."

chunks.original_text: 于时，元始乃命天真皇人，紫笔图记，将恢大教，慈惠流芳而接学人也。 按西域老曰：上玄下微，应运璇玑，华房都领炁，紫官集神威。 此乃谓归真之要道，透玄之户牖。 若太上士初登灵宝，始扣玄宗，须引而导之，此法应机，当求复舍。 方妙理之研精。 方者，谓灵宝妙理方法也。 元始天尊为众开扩微诠，万圣皆得研究精极。 左仙翁释灵宝诰法：灵宝本炁，始一混然。 太虚源流，升降诸天。 致灵洞渺，辅翼众仙。 飞祥郁秀，度品惠圆。 以神降集，乃法道先。 以炁停息，乃合自然。 俄天门之东北， 祖炁开化，九霄之境列三十六天也。 上极无上曰大罗，三境之天乃都天也。 都天东北门之间，乃号曰太霄八景，始青天中也。 元始常於此天中演说灵宝大法，此境乃覆下方东北变野鬼路之上也。 按说度人上品妙经时，万圣俱诣始青天中，受元始度人无量上品也。 七声大震，十目齐观，睹下界之冤魔，结冲天之秽气，众真默尔，大道寂然。 七声者，谓凡间喜怒哀乐忧怨思七情之声也。 无辜刑祝，号呼吁天，加以惨毒，悲切上惊天听。 谚曰：人问私语，天闻若雷，斯乃谓大震也。 时在会者十目，齐观于下界，四生历劫，交变身命，运气内外数穷焉。 《礼记》曰：十目所视，十手所指，其严乎谓情切也。 故十方众同心默而，哀尔群生矣。 仰惟大道，元始至尊，乃寂然不动，感而遂通也。 按《灵宝忏》曰：时元始上帝遂放神光下照，乃见是六天魔鬼克家等众，阵行凡间，勾连世人，亡过七祖死魂，结成阿党，恣横流行，凶衅杀伐，互相残害，昼夜不分，血尸狼藉，怨气哀声，化为炁毒，冲天光。 时妙行真人间所由於元始：既敷妙法，合集殊祥，是何异因，於此辄冒，可垂奥旨，以解众疑。 时者，乃妙行未知当．时祥异所由也，故发此间，惟思分别。 元始乃万天所尊，无上法王位也。 既敷演妙法，常能开度一切，和合殊祥也。 缘何却有此异因，辄冒干元始御前，妙行疑之，至请紫微大帝，可垂释过去奥旨，以解今会中大众之疑。 大帝曰：下元生人，皆禀至道，受氤氲之清气，以扶卫於赤身。 一切有形凡躯，皆属下元，三炁君主也。 各禀灵宝至道，自然氤氲之气流行，降浃扶卫造化，成男女赤身也。 按《诸品经》载：灵宝始青之炁，结元阳重三百八十四铢，立命落空歌之炁，贯经络脉，分应三百六十体骸。 大浮黎土之炁，结化回黄，转白青赤，构孕凝精。 元一黄演之炁，结胞。 洞冥紫户之炁，化胎，长灵明仙之炁，命魂。 砀尸冥演由之炁命魄。 五仙中灵之炁，化脏。 高真冲融之炁，化腑。 高仙洞笈之炁，化元。 真灵化凝之炁，结华。 自然玄照之炁，结岳。 玉清混洞之炁，化泥丸。 上清赤混之炁，化绛官。 太清玄通之炁，化丹田。 荧惑三炁，降真火，入心出舌，宰神炁温暖。 岁星九炁，降真木，入肝出目，宰皮肤毛发，镇星一炁，降真土，入脾胃口，宰肌肉四肢。 太白七炁，降真金，入肺出鼻，宰牙齿筋骨。 辰星五炁，降真水，入肾出耳，宰津液血髓。 东方七宿炁，主阳明经。 南方七宿炁，主太阳经。 西方七宿炁，主少阴经。 北方七宿炁，主太阴经。 东斗苍灵帝君，主算。 西斗白标帝君，籍名。 北斗七政，司其生聚。
chunks.translated_text:
At that time, the Primordial Beginning commanded the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign, inscribing with a purple brush to record and expand the Great Teaching, that its compassionate grace might flow forth and guide learners. According to the Western Venerable Elder: "The Supreme Mystery descends to the subtle, responding to the turning of the celestial pivot. The Flower Chamber governs the assembly of *qi*, while the Purple Palace gathers numinous might." This is the essential Dao of returning to truth, the gateway and window to penetrating the Mystery.

When a superior adept first ascends to the *Numinous Treasure*, beginning to knock at the gate of the Mysterious Principle, one must be led and guided—this method responds to the moment, seeking the return to the abode. Only then may the wondrous principles be studied with precision. "Only then" refers to the methods of the *Numinous Treasure*'s wondrous principles. The Primordial Heavenly Worthy, for the sake of all, expounded the subtle and profound, so that the myriad sages might delve deeply into its ultimate essence.

The Left Immortal Elder elucidated the *Numinous Treasure*'s precept-methods: The *Numinous Treasure*'s original *qi* was at first a singular undifferentiated whole. From the source-stream of the Great Void, it ascended and descended through the various heavens. Its numinous efficacy pervaded the distant and subtle, aiding and sheltering the host of immortals. Auspicious omens flourished in luxuriance, bestowing ranks and conferring perfect grace. By spirit descending and gathering, it became the forerunner of the Daoist method. By *qi* settling and stilling, it accorded with spontaneity.

In the northeast of the Heavenly Gate, the ancestral *qi* unfolded its transformations, and the ninefold heavens arrayed the thirty-six heavens. The utmost above is called the Great Loftiness; the three realms of heaven are the capital heavens. Between the capital heaven and the northeast gate lies what is named the *Supreme Clarity of the Eight Effulgences*, the *Primordial Azure Heaven*. The Primordial Beginning often expounded the great *Numinous Treasure* teachings within this heaven, which covers the northeast of the lower realm, above the ghostly paths of the wilds.

When the *Sublime Scripture of Salvation for Humanity, Supreme Grade* was proclaimed, the myriad sages all assembled in the *Primordial Azure Heaven* to receive the Primordial Beginning’s boundless, supreme salvation for humanity. Seven great sounds shook the heavens, and ten eyes gazed as one, beholding the karmic demons of the lower world and the foul *qi* surging toward the heavens. The host of perfected ones fell silent, and the Great Dao became still.

The "seven sounds" refer to the seven emotions of the mortal realm—joy, anger, sorrow, happiness, worry, resentment, and thought. The innocent suffer curses and punishments, crying out to heaven in anguish, their bitter suffering startling the celestial audience. As the saying goes: "Whispers among men are heard in heaven like thunder"—this is what is meant by the great shaking.

At that assembly, ten eyes gazed as one upon the lower realm, where the four kinds of birth endured kalpas, their forms and lives transformed, their inner and outer *qi* exhausted in cycles. As the *Record of Rites* states: "What ten eyes see and ten hands point to is most severe"—this expresses the depth of their concern. Thus, the multitudes of the ten directions fell silent in unison, mourning the sentient beings.

Reverently contemplating the Great Dao, the Primordial Beginning, the Most High, remained motionless and silent, yet responsive and all-pervading. According to the *Numinous Treasure Repentance*: At that time, the Primordial August Thearch emitted a divine radiance to illuminate below, revealing the demonic hosts of the Six Heavens—*Kejia* and their ilk—marching through the mortal world, entangling the living and the seven generations of deceased ancestors, forming cliques to act with wanton violence. Their conflicts and slaughters knew no day or night, leaving corpses and bloodshed strewn about. The *qi* of resentment and wails of sorrow transformed into toxic *qi*, surging against the celestial radiance.

Then the Wondrous Conduct Perfected One, hearing of this before the Primordial Beginning, asked: "Having expounded the wondrous Dharma and assembled auspicious signs, what is this strange cause that now intrudes? May you bestow profound guidance to resolve the doubts of the assembly." At that moment, the Wondrous Conduct Perfected One, unaware of the reason for these strange omens, posed this question, seeking clarification.

The Primordial Beginning is the Most Honored among the myriad heavens, the sovereign of the unsurpassed Dharma. Having expounded the wondrous Dharma, he constantly saves and delivers all, harmonizing extraordinary auspices. Why, then, did this strange cause intrude before the Primordial Beginning’s presence? The Wondrous Conduct Perfected One, perplexed, respectfully entreated the Purple Tenuity Great Emperor to reveal the profound meaning of the past, resolving the doubts of the great assembly.

The Great Emperor replied: "The people of the Lower Realm all receive the Ultimate Dao, endowed with the pure *qi* of primordial chaos to support and protect their mortal bodies. All embodied forms belong to the Lower Realm, governed by the Three *Qi* Lords. Each is imbued with the *Numinous Treasure*'s Ultimate Dao, the natural flow of primordial chaotic *qi* permeating and sustaining the creation of male and female bodies."

According to the *Various Scriptures*: The *Numinous Treasure*'s *Primordial Azure Qi* coalesces into the *Original Yang*, weighing three hundred eighty-four *zhu*, establishing the *qi* of life that falls into the void and sings through the channels. It courses through the meridians and vessels, corresponding to the three hundred sixty bones and limbs. The *qi* of the Great Floating Black Earth coalesces and transforms, cycling through yellow, white, azure, and red to conceive and congeal essence. The *Original One Yellow Evolved Qi* forms the placenta. The *Cavern Obscurity Purple Portal Qi* shapes the embryo. The *Numinous Brightness Immortal Qi* commands the hun-soul. The *Vast Corpse Obscure Evolved Qi* commands the po-soul. The *Five Immortals Central Numinous Qi* forms the viscera. The *Lofty Perfected Harmonious Qi* forms the bowels. The *Lofty Immortal Cavern Tome Qi* forms the origin. The *True Numinous Coalescing Qi* binds the flower. The *Spontaneous Mysterious Illumination Qi* binds the peaks. The *Jade Clarity Chaotic Obscurity Qi* transforms the mud-pill. The *Supreme Clarity Crimson Chaos Qi* transforms the Crimson Palace. The *Great Clarity Mysterious Pervasion Qi* transforms the Cinnabar Field.

The *Blazing Deluder*'s three *qi* descend as true fire, entering the heart and exiting the tongue, governing the warmth of the spirit-*qi*. The *Year Star*'s nine *qi* descend as true wood, entering the liver and exiting the eyes, governing the skin, hair, and body hair. The *Quelling Star*'s one *qi* descends as true earth, entering the spleen, stomach, and mouth, governing the flesh and four limbs. The *Great White*'s seven *qi* descend as true metal, entering the lungs and exiting the nose, governing the teeth and sinews. The *Chronos Star*'s five *qi* descend as true water, entering the kidneys and exiting the ears, governing the fluids, blood, and marrow.

The *qi* of the seven eastern asterisms governs the *Yang Brightness* meridian. The *qi* of the seven southern asterisms governs the *Greater Yang* meridian. The *qi* of the seven western asterisms governs the *Lesser Yin* meridian. The *qi* of the seven northern asterisms governs the *Greater Yin* meridian. The Azure Numinous Emperor Lord of the Eastern Dipper governs destiny. The White Standard Emperor Lord of the Western Dipper registers names. The Seven Governors of the Northern Dipper oversee the gathering of life.

chunks.original_text: 南斗六司，宰其动用。 中斗冲灵大帝，縻落万神。 庄子曰：人者，继天顺地，序炁成形，谓之物灵。 《北斗经》曰：凡夫在世迷者，多不知身属北斗，命由天府，有灾有患，不知解谢之门，延福延生，莫晓归真之路，致使魂神被系，祸息来锺。 灵应帝君降笔云：当职禀玉帝，大垂慈敕，较念苍生，合使天下黎民起自丁巳岁中元节后，各互劝化酿财，修设三界广法明昌太平清醮一座者，悉度末劫洪波荡秽之界，仪范恭请，吾教徒倡法事，宜宣太上延生之科，诵经登坛拜表，告地盟天。 灵应帝君督泰，山府三司具名，然后缴奏三天门下，特与度脱劫运之名，如此莫不真为乐也哉。 今以劫运将终，妖魔渐盛。 按《业报经》云：每劫之初，龙汉赤明也。 洞真下化，人怀道德，多至长生。 劫中之世，上皇延康也。 洞玄下化，人渐散朴，失道叛德。 末劫之时，开皇运终也。 洞神下化，人多浇浮，少奉正真，差天帝斜之，世遭开皇三劫也。 宋中上元甲子后，入开皇七劫。 鸣呼，末劫之时，凶灾弥天耶。 多见日月蚀昏，五星错度，六极答罚，四夷交兵，火焚水漂，旱蝗泼飨，陨霜雹冻，地陷山崩，蛇虎怪异，淫刑苛虐，人妖鬼魔，疫疠夭横，总名劫报。 西华帝君日：且夫天地劫运否泰，终绝谷应，大象所归，各随万化，所息运终复建，劫绝复始。 盖大象无极无穷，惟浊世众生应劫，受诸轮回，或遭运劫，或遭气劫，或遭外劫，或遭内劫，或遭身劫，或遭命劫。 若诸众生本始业深，所造亦昧，遇诸劫界，是若苦海流沙漂沉，浩荡终不得息。 劫至终时，乃成永绝，化为幽怨之气。 昨庆元丁巳岁上元节，天垂降玉书，下剑州梓潼神庙，庙祝捧申属缴文奏行在。 据英显武烈灵佐广济惠宁王充金阙昊天检校洞通真先生九天开化主宰梓潼灵应帝君张亚准，奉三天门下三宫使相关牒，备丙戌岁三界灵享朝会以元仪正下元事籍毕各辞讫。 时昊天玉皇上帝驾御，至上元太一宫，出三天门，观览下方六合八弦，无不周徧，惟见怨气盘蔚，冤声哀号，无辜吁天，上彻宸听。 玉帝大垂慈旨，谓侍臣金阙御史大夫三天门下平章事葛洪曰：下方生灵，上自权贵执政，下至郡县杗寮，严刑峻法，厚赋重敛，以至强家、巨室、富商、大贾，一举一措，动以货路为急，所行所向，惟务财利，是营酒食，声色是御，不顾道理，口是心非，行如狗竞。 父母师傅内外亲族，轻弃傲慢，富不恤贫，贵多志贱，婚娉先财货，交结趋世利，强夺困穷，刻剥寒苦，富者不贷，贫者多至绝灭。 玉帝命右常侍引词章通事舍人王乔、持节诏玉清官太师守紫微垣天枢院事尹喜、上清宫太师守紫微垣南极院事徐甲、太清宫太师守紫微垣北极院事张道陵、紫微上官天皇大帝、后土玄天皇地祇、天地水三官大帝、四帅圣帝君、天府修文郎兖国公颜回、地府修文郎河内公卜商、水府修文郎清烈公屈原、迦叶尊者、阿难尊者、宾头卢尊者，共一十八员，既至朝谒，奏对御座。 玉帝垂音命群臣曰：下土生灵将临末劫，三教互忽为僧道者，多不顾戒行，动辄非理； 为缙绅士庶者，不遵敬周孔之业； 为官爵显达者，多生淫滥脏污；
chunks.translated_text:
The Six Governors of the Southern Dipper oversee its movements and functions. The Central Dipper’s *Primordial Numinous Great Emperor* binds and subdues the myriad spirits.

Zhuangzi said: "Humans inherit heaven and follow earth, arranging *qi* to form shape—this is called the numinous essence of beings." The *Scripture of the Northern Dipper* states: "Ordinary mortals in the world, deluded and confused, often do not know their bodies belong to the Northern Dipper, their lives governed by the Celestial Treasury. When disasters and calamities strike, they know not the gate of expiation and gratitude. Seeking to prolong fortune and life, they remain ignorant of the path to return to truth, causing their souls to be bound and misfortunes to accumulate."

The *Divinely Responsive Emperor Lord*, descending with his brush, proclaimed: "By the mandate of the Jade Emperor, I issue this compassionate decree. Moved by the plight of the common people, it is ordained that from the *Ding-Si* year of the Middle Prime Festival onward, all under heaven shall exhort one another to pool resources and establish the *Grand Ritual of the Three Realms, Illuminating Prosperity and Pacifying Clarity*. Those who perform this rite shall be delivered from the turbid waves of the final kalpic conflagration. The ritual protocols shall reverently invite my teachings, and disciples shall propagate the liturgy of the *Supreme Prolongation of Life*. They shall recite scriptures, ascend the altar, and present memorials to heaven and earth."

The *Divinely Responsive Emperor Lord* supervised the *Tai* Mountain Prefecture, where the Three Bureaus inscribed their names. The memorial was then submitted to the Three Celestial Gates, granting deliverance from the kalpic doom. Truly, is there no greater joy than this?

Now, as the kalpic cycle nears its end, demonic forces grow rampant. The *Sutra of Karmic Retribution* states: "At the dawn of each kalpa, it is the *Dragon Han* and *Red Clarity* era. The *Cavern of Truth* descends, and people embrace virtue and power, many attaining longevity. In the mid-kalpa, it is the *Supreme August* and *Prolonged Prosperity* era. The *Cavern of Mystery* descends, and people gradually abandon simplicity, losing the Dao and rebelling against virtue. At the kalpa’s end, it is the *Kaihuang* era’s conclusion. The *Cavern of Spirit* descends, and people grow frivolous, few upholding true rectitude. Heaven’s ordinances falter, and the world endures the three kalpas of *Kaihuang*." After the *Jia-Zi* year of the Upper Prime of the Song dynasty, the seventh *Kaihuang* kalpa began. Alas! In this final kalpa, calamities fill the heavens.

We witness the sun and moon eclipsed and dimmed, the five planets erring in their courses, the six extremes meting out punishments, the four barbarians waging war, fires burning and floods sweeping, droughts and locusts ravaging, frost, hail, and freezing storms descending, lands collapsing and mountains crumbling, serpents and tigers manifesting as omens, excessive punishments and cruel tyranny, human demons and ghostly specters, epidemics and untimely deaths—all named *kalpic retribution*.

The *Western Florescence Emperor Lord* said: "The kalpic cycles of heaven and earth alternate between adversity and prosperity, ending and responding in turn. The great cosmic pattern follows myriad transformations, its cessation and renewal cyclical. Yet the kalpa’s end and beginning are without limit or exhaustion. Only the sentient beings of the turbid world, bound to the kalpa, endure the wheel of rebirth—some facing the kalpa’s doom, some the *qi*-kalpa, some external calamities, some internal afflictions, some bodily tribulations, some fate’s trials. If beings’ primordial karma runs deep and their deeds remain benighted, when they encounter the kalpic realm, they drift like sand in the苦海, adrift and endless. When the kalpa reaches its end, it becomes eternal severance, transforming into the *qi* of dark resentment."

In the *Ding-Si* year of the *Qingyuan* reign, during the Upper Prime Festival, heaven sent down a jade missive to the *Zitong* Divine Temple in Jianzhou. The temple’s warden respectfully submitted the document to the imperial court. According to the report, *Zhang Yazhun*, the *Illustrious Martial and Valiant Numinous Assistant, Vast Salvation and Benevolent Tranquility King*, *Supervisor of the Golden Watchtower of the August Heaven*, *Perfected Master of the Nine Heavens’ Transformative Governance*, and *Zitong Divinely Responsive Emperor Lord*, received a memorial from the Three Celestial Gates via the Three Palace Envoys. It detailed the *Bing-Xu* year’s *Three Realms’ Spiritual Offering Assembly*, concluding the registration of the Lower Prime’s affairs before all departed.

At that time, the *August Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven* ascended his throne to the *Upper Prime Supreme Unity Palace*. Emerging from the Three Celestial Gates, he surveyed the six directions and eight boundaries below, his gaze all-encompassing. Yet he saw only coils of grievance, wails of sorrow, and the innocent crying out to heaven—voices that pierced the celestial hearing.

The Jade Emperor issued a compassionate decree, addressing his attendant minister, the *Golden Watchtower Censor-in-Chief and Grand Preceptor of the Three Celestial Gates*, *Ge Hong*: "The living beings below—from high-ranking officials and rulers to local magistrates and clerks—enforce harsh laws and exorbitant taxes. Even the powerful families, great households, wealthy merchants, and major traders prioritize bribes in every action, pursuing only profit in all directions. They indulge in feasts, music, and sensual pleasures, disregarding reason, speaking falsely, and behaving like scavenging dogs. They treat parents, teachers, and kin with disdain and arrogance. The rich ignore the poor; the noble disdain the lowly. Marriages are contracted for wealth, alliances forged for worldly gain. They seize from the destitute, exploit the suffering, and refuse aid to the impoverished, driving many to ruin."

The Jade Emperor commanded the *Right Regular Attendant*, *Wang Qiao*, *Orator and Messenger Bearing the Jade Clarity Palace’s Edict*, *Yin Xi*, *Grand Preceptor of the Jade Clarity Palace and Guardian of the Purple Tenuity Enclosure’s Celestial Pivot Institute*, *Xu Jia*, *Grand Preceptor of the Supreme Clarity Palace and Guardian of the Purple Tenuity Enclosure’s Southern Culmen Institute*, *Zhang Daoling*, *Grand Preceptor of the Grand Clarity Palace and Guardian of the Purple Tenuity Enclosure’s Northern Culmen Institute*, the *Celestial August Emperor of the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace*, the *Mysterious Heavenly August Emperor of the Earth*, the *Three Officials Great Emperors of Heaven, Earth, and Water*, the *Four Marshal Sage Emperors*, *Yan Hui*, *Cultivator of Literature in the Celestial Treasury and Duke of Yan*, *Bu Shang*, *Cultivator of Literature in the Earthly Treasury and Duke of Henei*, *Qu Yuan*, *Cultivator of Literature in the Water Treasury and Duke of Qinglie*, the Venerable *Kasyapa*, the Venerable *Ananda*, and the Venerable *Pindola*—eighteen in total—to attend court and present their memorials before the throne.

The Jade Emperor spoke to the assembled ministers: "The living beings of the lower world now face the final kalpa. The Three Teachings are neglected: those who become monks or Daoists often disregard precepts and act without reason; scholars and commoners fail to honor the teachings of the revered Zhou and Confucius; and officials of high rank indulge in excess and corruption."

chunks.original_text: 及广土生灵，循习倒行，轻贱百谷，嗜财如饥虎，行毒若炎火，去正从邪，习以成俗，犯者不可原赦。 卿等众臣，自丁巳岁朔一月一会天庭，稽考善恶，仰灵应帝君同虚空界神，先行降笔，布告下方城隍社令，仍牒束岳泰山府，永为定制，委举意司、见报司、速报司，日加严察，递申天府。 如有不循、不恢、不加敬信之域，量犯与报，疾疫、旱蝗、雷电、暴风、卒雨、陨霜、雹冻，伤残百谷，耗乏地财，四夷交侵，刀兵战阵，地陷山崩，蛇虎纵横，及遣魔鬼托生其家，破伤基业，覆灭亲族； 如能改节励行，遵从《太上感应篇》言，不犯诸罪目者，别与转祸为福。 故兹降笔，各宜知悉，三天门下三宫使相，牒九曲凤凰山灵应帝君，故牒施行。 唯从邪道， 失仁义礼德之所修者类。
chunks.translated_text:
Moreover, the vast multitudes of living beings, following perverse customs, scorn the hundred grains, crave wealth like starving tigers, and spread poison like raging fire. They abandon the upright and follow the crooked, making such ways habitual and customary—those who transgress shall not be pardoned or absolved.

You, the assembled ministers, shall convene in the Celestial Court on the first day of the first month each year beginning in the *dingsi* year, to examine and record good and evil. Relying upon the numinous power of the Imperial Lords of the Void and the Boundless Realm, you shall first issue written decrees to announce these judgments to the earthly city gods and local deities, and likewise dispatch documents to the courts of the Five Marchmounts and Mount Tai, establishing this as an eternal statute. The Offices of Intent, Manifest Report, and Swift Report shall daily enforce strict scrutiny, transmitting reports in succession to the Celestial Prefecture.

In regions where the people do not follow the Way, do not uphold virtue, or fail to revere and trust in the teachings, retribution shall be measured by their transgressions: pestilence, drought, locusts, thunder and lightning, violent winds, sudden rains, killing frosts, hail, and freezing cold shall damage the hundred grains and deplete the earth’s bounty. The Four Barbarians shall invade, bringing the scourge of war and battle; the earth shall split and mountains collapse; serpents and tigers shall run rampant. Demonic spirits shall be sent to take birth in their households, destroying their foundations and annihilating their kin.

Yet if they reform their conduct, exert themselves in right action, and adhere to the words of the *Tai Shang Gan Ying Pian*, avoiding all enumerated transgressions, their misfortunes shall be transformed into blessings.

Thus is this decree issued. Let all take heed.

From the Three Celestial Gates, the Envoys of the Three Palaces hereby dispatch this document to the Imperial Lord of Numinous Response of Nine-Bend Phoenix Mountain for enforcement.

Those who stray into heterodox paths and neglect the cultivation of benevolence, righteousness, propriety, and virtue shall be of this kind.

chunks.original_text: 不省本源， 忌父母师友之训恩者类。 乐奉邪神， 乐淫祭乱神要副情恳者类。 谄求余福， 谄谈祷怪力祈妄福者类。 昏迷沉乱， 昏酒与迷色怛失纪者类。 贪欲刚强， 贪非财根欲气刚强者类。 不义， 损彼利己者之类。 不仁， 暴物凌人者类。 不忠， 奸能不尽心者类。 不孝。 罔亲害教者类是。 按《灵宝混元救苦经》元始天尊曰：吾观冥府罪魂，乃是积劫以来至于今日在世为人造罪种种，不省本源，贪饕疾坏，暗损他人，安乐自己，争财竞气，好恋酒色，损失神气，荡散元真，不孝尊长，不忠君主，欺凌卑小，举意慢人，造罪千种，天官摄问，斗君追魂，送下九幽，受其痛苦，罪轻者化生六道，罪重者永无出期，纵复人身，岂获福禄哉。 今为六天魔王，五府瘟曹，不以尊卑，枉致伤害，或老或少，或女或男，未尽天年，徒违人世，本非死限，故使魂孤，怨恨上冲，盘结不散，此之暴卒，皇可悲哀。 按《洞渊经》云：人间北方有酆都山，水府大洞之旁列六宫，号六天也。 六大鬼魔王所主，乃太阴天君外六曹也。 六曹小吏，合有三十六万，皆异状殊形凶恶丑怪，本暴逆之气凝结为体，周流太虚也。 若人一念正真，持诵此六宫名号常生敬畏者，乃感六天善开，魔王保举，削除罪名，生死受赖，获福无穷也。 若人一念邪欲，乃召六天恶开，随人所犯轻重，悉以六痉五瘟与报罚也。 第一天纣绝阴洞休明总阴洞阴宫，专管酆都刑名宛狱生前罪戾，令世人虚耗荡散资财。 二天泰杀谅事洞元司重正司灵宫，专收摄天下狂横凶暴游魂荡魄，今世人运命骞滞功名官爵退失。 三天明晨耐犯武城洞统仙升灵希宛宫，专掠世人福禄，贤圣凡人弃世魂魄，先经此洞受事。 四天恬昭罪炁洞正真邵灵宛司宫，专掌瘟疫死丧灾火鬼怪，销磨世人田宅，阴抽阳灭，口舌官患。 五天宗灵七非洞云楼玉纪明元官，主春属不睦、夫妇乖违、离背分张及鳏寡等事。 六天敢司连宛屡洞崇灵赤映云曲官，专灭世人己出男女及怀胎孕主子母俱段，为继嗣事。 夫所谓五府者，乃五岳山府也，各立瘟曹。 案按《正一传》云：五府瘟神，禀五行不正之气，动出亿万，周流人间，嘘毒啸祸，东行号魔王，西行名外道，南游称鬼帅，北征呼鬼王，中国号瘟神也。 泰山府东岳主者，天齐仁圣帝所主，管杂病事刘元达。 衡山府南岳主者，司天昭圣帝所主，管瘟疫事张元伯。 华山府西岳主者，金天顺圣帝所管，泻痢事赵公明。 怛山府北岳主者，安天元圣帝所主，管暴汗寒疟事史文业。 嵩山府中岳主者，中天崇圣帝，行病司四案，李公伸狂魅赤眼案，锺士季掌肿疡案，范仲卿掌酸瘠案，姚公伯颠狂五毒案。 各遣瘟卒，递岁四时变故。 春月，随百乌喧呜，司录人祷诅。 夏月，诈亡过家亲，假骨肉扇祸。 秋月，附五部土公，为伏龙宅禁。 冬月，隐五姓坟墓，邀故气攻食。 《正一传》云：诸部瘟曹，收留社庙阴鬼甲马，常万数褊行九州，回丧车部死尸，每伺隙人误罹之故，横流毒炁，杀人老少男女，寿不得尽其天年，徒赖死违，人世皆被三官右府籍之，不得更生，遂致魂荡无依，结聚孤愤，众多怨气，蔚翳不散。 元始同众圣常真一睹斯恶，岂不悲哀常生命遭劫运乎。 《北帝经》曰：劫末之时，三天正炁渐消，六洞故炁顿长，欢使人鬼不分，邪正无别，幽囚之炁於是而出，自一而生，从北而起，以一生二，惨怛之气相，仍二以至三，邪魅之气缠惑，而复化四，妖淫之气浸湮，妄流入人经络，攻心伐肾，损肺枯肝，脾胃黄云不凝，元阳黑白相背，是以六天邪魔乘势来侵，八部瘟曹恣横流毒，唯．修善之人形，同劫界命不堕於凶衅亡矣。
chunks.translated_text:
Those who fail to reflect upon their fundamental origins and resent the teachings and kindness of parents, teachers, and friends are of this kind. Those who delight in worshipping heterodox spirits and indulge in licentious sacrifices to disorderly gods, currying favor with earnest entreaties, are of this kind. Those who obsequiously seek residual blessings and flatter through prayers to uncanny forces, vainly beseeching illusory fortune, are of this kind. Those who sink into confusion and disorder, lost in drunkenness and infatuated with lust, losing all sense of propriety, are of this kind. Those who are avaricious and obstinate, their greed for ill-gotten wealth rooted in overbearing qi, are of this kind.

Those who act without righteousness, harming others for personal gain, are of this kind. Those who lack benevolence, oppressing beings and bullying others, are of this kind. Those who are disloyal, cunning and failing to devote themselves wholeheartedly, are of this kind. Those who are unfilial, deceiving their kin and undermining teachings, are of this kind.

According to the *Lingbao Hunyuan Jiuku Jing*, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning states: "I observe the sinful souls in the nether realms—those who, from kalpas past to the present, while living as humans, committed myriad transgressions. They failed to reflect upon their fundamental origins, were gluttonous and envious, secretly harmed others while seeking ease for themselves, contended over wealth and qi, indulged in wine and lust, depleted their spirit and dissipated their primordial truth. They were unfilial to their elders, disloyal to their lords, bullied the humble, and treated others with arrogance. Having committed a thousand kinds of sins, they are seized by the Heavenly Officials, their souls pursued by the Star Lords, and sent down to the Nine Dark Realms to endure suffering. Those with lighter offenses are reborn into the Six Paths; those with heavier sins remain imprisoned forever. Even if they regain human form, how can they attain blessings and fortune?

Now, the Six Heavenly Demon Kings and the Five Bureau Plague Offices, disregarding rank, unjustly inflict harm—whether old or young, female or male—cutting short lives before their allotted years, forcing them to depart the world prematurely. Though their deaths were not fated, their souls are left solitary, their resentment surging upward, coiled and unrelenting. Such violent and untimely deaths are truly pitiable."

According to the *Dongyuan Jing*: "In the northern lands of the human realm lies Mount Fengdu, beside the great cavern of the Water Palace, where six palaces stand in array, known as the Six Heavens. They are ruled by the Six Great Demon Kings, the outer Six Bureaus of the Supreme Yin Heavenly Lord. The minor officials of these Six Bureaus number three hundred and sixty thousand, each of grotesque and fearsome form, their bodies forged from the qi of violence and rebellion, roaming the vastness of the void. If a person’s thoughts remain upright and pure, reciting the names of these Six Palaces with reverence, the Six Heavens shall open benevolently, the Demon Kings shall protect and advocate for them, their sins erased, and they shall rely upon this for life and death, gaining boundless fortune. But if a person harbors a single impure desire, the Six Heavens shall open malevolently, and according to the severity of their transgressions, they shall be afflicted with the Six Pains and Five Plagues as retribution."

The First Heaven: *Zhoujue Yin Dong Xiuming Zongyin Dong Yin Gong*, which oversees the penal records and nether prisons of Fengdu, meting out the sins committed in past lives, causing people in this world to squander and dissipate their resources.

The Second Heaven: *Taisha Liangshi Dong Yuan Si Zhong Zheng Si Ling Gong*, which gathers the wandering, violent, and reckless souls of the world, causing people’s fortunes to stagnate and their official ranks and titles to decline.

The Third Heaven: *Mingchen Naifan Wucheng Dong Tong Xian Sheng Ling Xi Wan Gong*, which seizes the blessings and fortunes of the world, where the souls of both sages and commoners, upon departing this life, first pass through this cavern to be processed.

The Fourth Heaven: *Tianzhao Zuiqi Dong Zhengzhen Shaoling Wan Si Gong*, which governs plagues, deaths, disasters, fires, and malevolent spirits, eroding people’s fields and dwellings, draining their yin and extinguishing their yang, bringing forth disputes and official misfortunes.

The Fifth Heaven: *Zongling Qifei Dong Yunyu Yujiming Yuan Gong*, which presides over familial discord, marital strife, separation, and the affairs of widowers and widows.

The Sixth Heaven: *Gansi Lianwan Lü Dong Chongling Chiming Yunqu Gong*, which destroys the male and female offspring of the world, including those conceived in the womb, severing both mother and child, disrupting the succession of heirs.

As for the Five Bureaus, they are the mountain bureaus of the Five Peaks, each establishing plague offices. According to the *Zhengyi Zhuan*: "The plague gods of the Five Bureaus are endowed with the unbalanced qi of the Five Phases, manifesting in countless numbers to roam the human realm, exhaling poison and howling calamity. When they travel east, they are called Demon Kings; when west, Heterodox Ways; when south, Ghost Commanders; when north, Ghost Kings; and within the Central Realm, Plague Gods."

The Eastern Peak, Mount Tai, is governed by the Heavenly Equal Benevolent Sage Emperor, who oversees miscellaneous illnesses through Liu Yuanda. The Southern Peak, Mount Heng, is governed by the Celestial Bright Sage Emperor, who oversees plagues through Zhang Yuanbo. The Western Peak, Mount Hua, is governed by the Metal Heavenly Compliant Sage Emperor, who oversees dysentery through Zhao Gongming. The Northern Peak, Mount Heng, is governed by the Peaceful Heavenly Primordial Sage Emperor, who oversees violent sweats and malarial chills through Shi Wenye. The Central Peak, Mount Song, is governed by the Central Heavenly Revered Sage Emperor, who administers illnesses through four bureaus: Li Gongshen for madness and red-eyed specters; Zhong Shiji for swellings and sores; Fan Zhongqing for emaciation and atrophy; and Yao Gongbo for insanity and the Five Poisons.

Each dispatches plague soldiers, altering their forms with the four seasons. In spring, they follow the clamor of birds to record human curses. In summer, they feign death to visit families, stirring calamity among kin. In autumn, they attach themselves to the Five Earth Lords, becoming hidden dragons in dwellings. In winter, they lurk in the tombs of the Five Clans, intercepting ancestral qi to attack and consume.

The *Zhengyi Zhuan* states: "The various plague bureaus gather the yin ghosts and spirit horses from village shrines, numbering in the tens of thousands, roaming the Nine Provinces, commandeering funeral carts and corpses. They lie in wait for human errors, spreading poisonous qi to slay the old and young, male and female, cutting short lives before their allotted years, forcing them to die prematurely. All such cases are recorded by the Three Officials in the Right Bureau, preventing rebirth. Thus, their souls drift without refuge, their grievances accumulating, their resentment dense and unyielding."

The Primordial Beginning, together with the assembled sages and perfected beings, beholding this evil, how could they not grieve for the lives ensnared by kalpic fate?

The *Beidi Jing* states: "At the end of the kalpa, the true qi of the Three Heavens gradually wanes, while the perverse qi of the Six Caverns surges forth, causing humans and ghosts to become indistinguishable, right and wrong to blur. The qi of imprisoned darkness emerges, arising from the One and spreading from the north. From one, two are born—the qi of sorrow and anguish intertwines. From two, three arise—the qi of demonic delusion entangles. Then four are formed—the qi of licentiousness and depravity seeps in, wantonly flowing into human meridians, attacking the heart and assaulting the kidneys, damaging the lungs and withering the liver. The spleen and stomach become clouded with yellow, while primordial yang and the black and white aspects turn against each other. Thus, the Six Heavenly Demon Kings seize the opportunity to invade, and the Eight Bureau Plague Offices rampage, spreading poison without restraint. Only those who cultivate goodness shall, in form and fate, avoid falling into the calamities of the kalpic realm."

chunks.original_text: 太上说玄天大圣真武本传神咒妙经卷之五竟 太上说玄天大圣真武本传神咒妙经卷之六 廛人方田子佩升玄内教录陈伀集疏 妙行真人上白元始：众真矜彼众生，何缘度之？ 妙行白紫微，矜彼方事时，元始前众真以何神用释之？ 天尊乃叩齿一通，流光万里北方，命召太玄将军，剪戮众妖，救度群品。 大帝证答，以元始天尊垂悯万类，生死劫会未分之际，当拟剪戮众妖救度莘品者急，故叩齿一通也。 谓道发一炁，而生万物也。 流光万里者，谓天光敕发安镇威用也。 北方事北极紫微令，遵行保制，劫运之命也。 唯召太玄将军，上朝玉清，听元始告命而诛戮妖氛，故运一而果全其万汇也。 真人曰：不审此将，而以何缘，位镇北方，威降下鬼，扫荡妖氛？ 妙行未全审，此又问太玄将军果能威讨下方妖魔乎？ 大帝曰：此神未开造化，先察神灵，易号假名，度人济物，不伐其善，不矜其能，荷其玉帝，封为玄武。 大帝既闻妙行深请，故陈造道本因之答。 昔太朴未判时，天地混其体，日月否其辉，八卦隐其神，当斯为未开造化之际也。 玄帝本炁，果在其中矣。 故谓之先禀神灵也。 其详注，见在本经前八十二次变为玄武之句下矣。 知易号假名，应化下土，度人济物也。 故玄帝凡一出世，兴益教宗，普济物命，博施利生，行道人间而不自伐，积成圣功而不自矜，其惟道长也。 按《元洞玉历》西华帝君曰：昔壬癸分于太清，以立次元之象，运于水官而源之。 水为上善而非善己，故得与天地一同而长，且久利于万物而弗自利，流渡万物而弗自渡，万物昏塞染着无所不涤，名曰备众广法也。 若论於修持之道，而以初进学功譬之，其圆乃可速成也。 惟玄帝在幼时，神灵施用，妙于壬癸，功感三天，赐诏自飞升日，除太玄元帅事。 又能清宁天地，荷昊天玉皇上帝敕荐，封玄武大将军。 真人曰：焉得此将，而往下方，咸度群品，免遭横死，亡者解脱，存者康宁。 妙行历问，金阙叩齿流光便为命令焉。 得此经径临受祸之境，为讨罚及安镇乎。 天尊以飞符召之。 紫微大帝以上言为答也。 元始泊出制命，乃号飞扬隐语之敕也。 其文乃本经中镇天魔神咒，是其辞义也。 凡持此咒，诵声一出，期会玄帝大信，谓之速召法也。 此将玄武蒙诏，神兵从行，至不夜之丹墀， 丹墀乃殿陛也，玄帝奉诏赴太霄八景阙庭。 《混洞赤文章》云：九光之炁，结成九霄不夜之天也。 睹强名之大道。 老子曰：吾不知其名，字之曰道，强为之名曰大，故称元始号大道也。 作礼长跪，稽首进言，今日何缘，蒙符特诏，慈颜幸睹，妙旨何归，炼伏轩墀，俯膺令命。 是时玄武朝谒，俯倪拳拳，伏胸遵听用命也。 《降笔实录》云：元始说法於玉清圣境，天门震辟，下睹恶气冲突，弥塞天光，乃命玉皇上帝降诏，诏北极紫微令紫微大帝，遽辞八景御座，即准奉昊天敕旨，玉牒有命，备坐曰：阳则以周武伐纣，平治社稷； 阴则遣玄武收魔，间分人鬼。 天尊告曰：吾观下界怨气冲天，大众咸惊，高真兢愍，卿之往彼，吾则钦哉。 玄武於是奉命， 大帝仿元始玉音也。 按《元洞玉历纪》：至五帝末，乃上天龙汉二劫，下世洪水渐息，人民始耕，生灵方足衣食。 乃其殷纣主世，淫心失道，矫侮上天，日造罪愆，恶毒自横，遂感六天魔王，引诸鬼众，肆诸凶衅，伤害无辜，怨气盘结，上冲太霄。
chunks.translated_text:
The *Most High’s Exalted Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Primordial Transmission of the Great Sage True Warrior of the Mysterious Heaven, Scroll Five* concludes.
The *Most High’s Exalted Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Primordial Transmission of the Great Sage True Warrior of the Mysterious Heaven, Scroll Six* begins.
Compiled and annotated by Chen You of the *Record of the Inner Teachings of Ascending the Mysteries* by Fang Tianzi Pei of the Marketplace.

The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct addressed the Primordial Beginning on high: "The host of Perfected Ones pity the multitude of beings—by what means may they be delivered?"
The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct inquired of the Purple Tenuity: "Pitying the affairs of this time, by what divine power did the host of Perfected Ones before the Primordial Beginning resolve them?"
The Heavenly Worthy then struck his teeth once, and a radiance streamed ten thousand leagues to the north, summoning the Great Mysterious General to sever and slay the host of demons and deliver the multitudes.
The Great Emperor affirmed in response: "The Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy, taking pity on the ten thousand kinds in the kalpic convergence of life and death, deemed it urgent to sever and slay the host of demons and deliver the multitudes. Thus he struck his teeth once."
This is called the Dao emitting one qi to engender the ten thousand things.
"Radiance streaming ten thousand leagues" refers to the celestial light issuing forth to establish and secure its majestic power.
The affairs of the north pertain to the Purple Tenuity of the Northern Culmen, who upholds and executes the mandate of the kalpic destiny.
Only by summoning the Great Mysterious General to ascend and attend the Jade Clarity, heeding the Primordial Beginning’s decree to execute and purge the demonic miasma, could the one be set in motion to perfect the ten thousand assemblies.
The Perfected One said: "I do not yet understand—by what cause does this general hold dominion over the north, his might subduing the ghosts below and sweeping away the demonic miasma?"
The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct had not yet fully grasped this, and so again inquired whether the Great Mysterious General truly possessed the power to subdue the demonic hordes below.
The Great Emperor replied: "Before this spirit unfolded the workings of creation, he first discerned the numinous. Assuming names and titles, he delivered beings and succored creatures, neither boasting of his goodness nor vaunting his abilities. Bearing the mandate of the Jade Emperor, he was enfeoffed as the Dark Warrior."
The Great Emperor, having heard the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct’s earnest inquiry, thus recounted the fundamental origins of the Dao.
In the time before the Great Simplicity was divided, when heaven and earth were merged in form, the sun and moon obscured their brilliance, and the eight trigrams concealed their spirit—this was the era before creation unfolded.
The original qi of the Dark Emperor was already within it.
Thus it is said he first received the numinous.
For a detailed annotation, see the passage on the eighty-second transformation into the Dark Warrior in the preceding section of this scripture.
Knowing to assume names and titles, he responded to the transformations of the lower realm, delivering beings and succoring creatures.
Thus, whenever the Dark Emperor manifested in the world, he advanced the teachings and doctrines, universally aiding living beings, broadly bestowing benefits upon life, practicing the Dao among humankind without self-aggrandizement, accumulating sagely merits without self-conceit—such was the enduring nature of the Dao.
According to the *Jade Calendar of the Primordial Cavern*, the Western Florescence Emperor Lord said: "Of old, the ren and gui were apportioned within the Great Clarity, establishing the image of the secondary kalpa and circulating through the Water Bureau as its source.
Water is the highest good yet does not claim goodness for itself, thus it attains unity with heaven and earth and endures, benefiting the ten thousand things without seeking benefit for itself, flowing through the ten thousand things without seeking passage for itself. The ten thousand things, benighted and obstructed, stained and attached, are cleansed without exception—this is called possessing the vast dharma of the multitude."
If one discusses the Dao of cultivation and compares it to the initial progress of a learner, its perfection may swiftly be achieved.
Only the Dark Emperor, in his youth, wielded the numinous with efficacy in the ren and gui, his merits moving the Three Heavens. From the day of his ascension, he was commissioned as the Great Mysterious Marshal.
He was further able to pacify heaven and earth, and by the grace of the Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven, he was enfeoffed as the Great General Dark Warrior.
The Perfected One said: "How may this general be dispatched to the lower realm to universally deliver the multitudes, sparing them from untimely death, liberating the deceased, and ensuring the living enjoy peace and well-being?"
The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, having inquired in sequence, asked how the striking of teeth in the Golden Portal and the streaming radiance served as command.
Would this scripture, upon reaching the realm of calamity, serve to punish and pacify?
The Heavenly Worthy summoned him with a flying talisman.
The Purple Tenuity Great Emperor responded with the above words.
The Primordial Beginning issued the decree, which was called the "Flying and Soaring Esoteric Edict."
Its text is the "Divine Incantation to Subdue the Heavenly Demons" within this scripture, comprising its words and meaning.
Whenever one recites this incantation, the moment its sound is uttered, it summons the Dark Emperor with great fidelity—this is called the "Method of Swift Summoning."
Upon receiving the decree, the Dark Warrior, General Xuanwu, led his divine troops to the cinnabar steps of the Never-Night Palace.
The cinnabar steps refer to the palace terrace; the Dark Emperor, bearing the decree, proceeded to the Eight Radiant Gate of the Grand Empyrean.
The *Red Writ of the Chaotic Cavern* states: "The qi of the nine lights coalesced to form the Nine Empyreans of the Never-Night Heaven."
He beheld the Great Dao of the mighty name.
Laozi said: "I know not its name; I style it the Dao, and by force call it Great." Thus the Primordial Beginning is titled the Great Dao.
He bowed, knelt, and prostrated, then advanced to speak: "By what cause today do I receive this talisman and special decree? Fortunate to behold your compassionate countenance, what is the wondrous intent? I refine and subdue the terrace, humbly receiving the command."
At that time, the Dark Warrior, in audience, bowed his head and listened with reverence, obeying the decree.
The *Veritable Record of the Descended Brush* states: "The Primordial Beginning expounded the Dharma in the Jade Clarity’s sacred realm. The gates of heaven trembled open, and below, baleful qi surged and clashed, suffusing the celestial light. Thereupon, he commanded the Jade Emperor to issue a decree, instructing the Purple Tenuity of the Northern Culmen, the Purple Tenuity Great Emperor, to swiftly depart the Eight Radiant Throne and promptly obey the Vast Heaven’s edict. The Jade Tablet bore the command, and all were seated, saying: 'In yang, it was by encircling King Wu’s punitive expedition against Zhou that the altars of the state were pacified; in yin, it was by dispatching the Dark Warrior to subdue demons that humans and ghosts were separated.'
The Heavenly Worthy proclaimed: 'I observe the grievous qi of the lower realm surging to heaven; the great assembly is alarmed, and the lofty Perfected compete in pity. You shall go there—I esteem this.'
The Dark Warrior thereupon received the command."
The Great Emperor echoed the Jade Sound of the Primordial Beginning.
According to the *Jade Calendar of the Primordial Cavern*: "By the end of the Five Emperors’ era, in the two kalpas of Heavenly Dragon and Han above and the gradual subsiding of the great flood below, the people began to till the soil, and living beings first had sufficient clothing and food. It was then that King Zhou of Yin ruled the world, his licentious heart losing the Dao, deceiving and defying Heaven on high. Daily he committed transgressions, his malevolence and poison rampant. Thus the Six Heavenly Demon Kings were provoked, leading the host of ghosts to perpetrate every calamity, harming the innocent without restraint. Grievous qi coiled and congealed, surging upward to the Grand Empyrean."

chunks.original_text: 灵宝道前，众圣高真咸惊，兢愍思念济此业也。 众睹太玄玄武至，奉圣命。 元始上帝抚喻曰：大道宜有付托，吾钦之哉。 上遂赐金甲玄袍皂纛玄旗，准敕降下方收魔也。 辞天回光反照，披发跣足，降龟蹑蛇， 太玄元帅秉水帝之符，以清澄浊，以正伏邪矣。 按《应运经》曰：於后世值立魔成华崇绮，致使恶道日增月盛，是故众真哀愍，众生昏迷沉乱，不见元始，惟思邪流，以弃正教。 太玄奉命，解缠释缚，慧施万物，津梁一切，普使见道，名日回光反照上元。 按《降笔实录》上帝命玄武曰：卿可当披发跣足，蹑踏龟蛇。 仙仗雷奔，天丁翊卫。 俄於焂欻，徧彼乾坤，前酷毒之妖魔，捕恣横之瘟疫，幽魂生界，苦病离痾，人鬼分离，冤家解脱，黎民安泰，国土清平。 《启圣记》云：魔鬼行营，驻割于东北徧野噩仙山间，乃鬼道中也。 按《降笔实录》云：太玄元帅与六天魔王战於洞阴之野，是时魔王以坎离二炁，变．为苍龟巨蛇，化现方成，元帅以神力摄归于足下，锁鬼众於酆都大洞，人民始安，宇宙清肃。 按《太平经》载：真君受元始符命神光宝书，统领天丁收天关地轴二魔王，忽一见如鳌苍龟，其形五变，一现万丈巨蛇，其形三变。 真君腾空，步乾踏斗，化千丈大身，挥□□之剑，冲折二魔各形状，龟如拳五寸，蛇如鞭三尺，和合并，被真君蹑踏之。 谨显二魔变相：苍龟一变，色若金光，甲缝苍青； 二变色如碧玉，甲缝含金； 三变色若苍黄，甲纹光青； 四变色如碧绿，甲缝含银； 五变龙首鳌身，出紫金光，甲间碧玉。 巨蛇初变，状若金色，鳞如赤丹； 次变体现青碧色，鳞络金线妪； 末变首如璃龙，身色苍黄，鳞间金玉。 《元始天尊说真武经》曰：统领六丁、六甲、五雷、八威齐到下方，七日之中，天下妖魔一时收断，人鬼分离，克家解散。 《 尚书》 载：武王戊午日兵济孟津，甲子日大破朝歌，亦七日克商诛纣，平治社稷，散鹿台财，发巨桥粟，天下黎民方得安泰。 於是国土清宁，皆赖中天紫微令天官大帝，遵敕暗宰其替否耶。 玄武再睹天尊，具言道力，功成事遂，浊降清升。 玄帝以义战、仁讨事遂，再朝玉清具奏元始。 却返祥光，复还本位， 《降笔录》云：玄帝凯还清都，面朝金阙。 元始告曰：卿在太初先天之前，本北方五灵玄老太阴天一紫炁之化，乃万象之根，今经二千五百年，合还本方，归根复位。 於是，元始乃命玉皇上帝颁降玉册，拜北极右胜府事，至是岁中元节日，紫微殿宣示玉册诰宝也。 妙行因得闻紫元君授玄帝之法。 交乾布斗， 交乾布斗者，玄帝本事也。 乃紫微馆修经真官，当显扬正教交乾者，用日德之新也。 布斗者，行中极之道也。 故德之与道，则无思不伏。 按《杜天师总龟集》太上第二：次遣玄夷苍水使者，下授禹王，姒氏既受之，克勤于邦，而尽力乎天下沟洫之事。 扬雄《法言》曰：昔姒氏以治水土，而巫者效禹，今之道术始名曰禹步也。 是故往圣之法，非今之巫觋苟且诈践之事乎。 轻举尚招天罪，其详见经首奉祀仪范内。 激坤指罡，上佐天关， 激坤指罡者，一名蹑地纪飞天纲之法也。 会造化生杀之权，发天关转运之机，显道导之。 施德得之，是以大则廓清宇宙，小则保庇兆民。
chunks.translated_text:
The host of sacred perfected and lofty immortals before the Numinous Treasure Dao were all alarmed, moved to compassion and pondering how to deliver this karmic world.

As all beheld the arrival of the Great Mystery Dark Warrior, bearing the sacred command, the Primordial Beginning Most High soothed and instructed: "The Great Dao ought to have its entrusted agent—how I revere this!" Thereupon, the Celestial Court bestowed upon him golden armor, a dark robe, a black banner, and a dark standard, dispatching him by decree to the lower realm to subdue the demons.

Taking leave of Heaven, he turned his radiance back in reflection, unbound his hair and went barefoot, treading upon the tortoise and serpent. The Great Mystery Marshal, bearing the talisman of the Water Emperor, purified the turbid and subdued the perverse.

According to the *Scripture of Responding to the Kalpa*: "In later ages, when demonic influences flourished and extravagant cults arose, the paths of evil daily grew and monthly waxed. Thus the host of perfected ones grieved in pity, for living beings, sunk in delusion and chaos, no longer beheld the Primordial Beginning but turned their thoughts to heterodox currents, abandoning the true teaching." The Great Mystery, obeying the command, untangled bonds and loosed fetters, bestowing wisdom upon the myriad things and serving as a bridge for all, universally guiding them to perceive the Dao. This was called *Turning the Light Back in Reflection to the Upper Prime*.

As recorded in the *Veritable Record of Descended Brushstrokes*, the Most High commanded the Dark Warrior: "You shall go forth with unbound hair and bare feet, treading upon the tortoise and serpent. Your divine retinue shall surge forth like thunder, with heavenly soldiers as your escort." In an instant, he traversed the cosmos, suppressing the cruel and venomous demons, capturing the wanton and rampant pestilences. In the realm of hidden souls, sufferings and ailments were dispelled; humans and ghosts were parted, grievances dissolved. The common people lived in peace, and the land was purified.

The *Record of Divine Manifestations* states: "The demonic hosts encamped and spread across the northeastern wilderness near Mount E, within the ghostly realm." According to the *Veritable Record of Descended Brushstrokes*, the Great Mystery Marshal battled the Six Heavenly Demon Kings in the wilds of the Cavernous Yin. At that time, the Demon Kings transformed the *qi* of Kan and Li into a verdant tortoise and a colossal serpent, which had only just taken form when the Marshal, by divine power, subdued them beneath his feet. The ghostly multitudes were bound in the Great Cavern of Fengdu, and the people at last found peace as the universe was purified.

The *Scripture of Great Peace* records: "The Perfected Lord received the talismanic command, the divine radiance, and the precious scripture from the Primordial Beginning, leading the heavenly soldiers to capture the Demon Kings of the Celestial Pass and Earthly Axis. Suddenly, they appeared as a colossal green-black tortoise, its form shifting five times, and as a serpent of ten thousand *zhang*, its form shifting thrice. The Perfected Lord soared into the sky, pacing the *qian* and treading the Dipper, transforming into a body of a thousand *zhang*. Wielding his sword, he shattered the two demons’ forms: the tortoise shrank to the size of a fist, five *cun* in length, and the serpent to the length of a whip, three *chi*. United, they were trodden beneath the Perfected Lord’s feet."

The transformations of the two demons are here revealed:
The green-black tortoise first transformed, its color like golden light, its shell seams dark green;
Second, its color like jasper, its shell seams suffused with gold;
Third, its color like dark yellow, its shell patterns gleaming green;
Fourth, its color like deep green, its shell seams suffused with silver;
Fifth, its head became that of a dragon, its body that of a giant turtle, emitting purple-golden light, its shell inlaid with jasper.

The colossal serpent first transformed, its form like gold, its scales like cinnabar;
Next, its body appeared in azure-green, its scales woven with golden threads;
Finally, its head resembled a dragon of lapis lazuli, its body dark yellow, its scales interspersed with gold and jade.

The *Sutra of the Primordial Heavenly Venerable on the Perfected Warrior* states: "Leading the Six Ding, Six Jia, Five Thunders, and Eight Mighties, he descended to the lower realm. Within seven days, all the world’s demons were captured and severed, humans and ghosts parted, households dissolved of their bonds."

The *Book of Documents* records: "On the *wu-wu* day, King Wu crossed the Meng Ford; on the *jia-zi* day, he shattered the capital of Zhaoge. Within seven days, he overthrew the Shang, executed Zhou, pacified the altars of soil and grain, dispersed the wealth of Lutai, and distributed the grain of Juqiao. Only then did the common people of the world attain peace." Thus, the land was purified and at peace, all owing to the governance of the Central Heaven’s Purple Tenuity, the Celestial Official Great Emperor, who by decree secretly administered its rise and fall.

The Dark Warrior again beheld the Heavenly Venerable and recounted the power of the Dao, the completion of his task, and the descent of the turbid and ascent of the pure. Having accomplished his righteous war and benevolent punitive campaign, the Dark Emperor again ascended to the Jade Purity to report to the Primordial Beginning. Returning in auspicious radiance, he resumed his original position.

The *Record of Descended Brushstrokes* states: "The Dark Emperor triumphantly returned to the Pure Capital and faced the Golden Portal." The Primordial Beginning declared: "Before the Great Beginning of the Prior Heaven, you were originally the transformation of the Five Numinous Ones of the North, the Dark Elder of the Great Yin, the Celestial One of Purple *Qi*—the root of the ten thousand images. Having passed through two thousand five hundred years, you now return to your original direction, resuming your root and position." Thereupon, the Primordial Beginning commanded the Jade Emperor to issue a jade decree, appointing him to the office of the Right Victorious Mansion of the Northern Culmen. On the Zhongyuan Festival of that year, the decree and treasure were proclaimed in the Purple Tenuity Hall.

The Wondrous Practitioner thus learned of the Purple Prime Lord’s transmission of the Dark Emperor’s method: *Exchanging Qian and Spreading the Dipper*.

*Exchanging Qian and Spreading the Dipper* was the Dark Emperor’s original practice. As the Perfected Scribe of the Purple Tenuity Gallery, when propagating the true teaching, "exchanging *qian*" refers to renewing the virtue of the sun, while "spreading the Dipper" refers to practicing the Way of the Central Culmen. Thus, virtue and the Way subdue all without deliberation.

According to the *Comprehensive Tortoise Collection of Master Du*: "The Supreme Lord’s second dispatch sent the Dark Barbarian and Azure Water Envoy to bestow it upon King Yu of the Si clan. Having received it, Yu labored diligently for his state and exerted himself for the world in matters of irrigation." Yang Xiong’s *Model Sayings* states: "In ancient times, the Si clan governed the waters and soil, and the shamans emulated Yu. Today’s Daoist arts thus first bear the name *Yu’s Step*." Therefore, the methods of the former sages are not the reckless and deceitful practices of today’s shamans and spirit-mediums. Even slight transgressions invite heavenly punishment, as detailed in the ritual protocols at the beginning of the scriptures.

*Stimulating Kun and Pointing the Mainstay* aids the Celestial Pass above.
*Stimulating Kun and Pointing the Mainstay* is also called the method of *Treading the Earth’s Threads and Flying the Heavenly Net*. It unites the power of creation and destruction, activates the mechanism of the Celestial Pass’s revolutions, and manifests the guidance of the Dao. By applying virtue, one attains it. Thus, in great matters, it purifies the cosmos; in small matters, it protects and shelters the myriad people.

chunks.original_text: 昔自中古禹王，并受持遵教行之道，能摄伏天下狞蛟、猛兽、魑魅、妖魔及凶恶异类、茶蛊诸毒，驱斥出极外之地。 然后，开导江河，引之川流，纳归于四海，天下黎庶从此各安其居也。 激坤者，乃镊地纪之法也。 当履顺倒返三匝，共得九迹，乃结成元坛法席，像坤道厚载之容我也。 谨当持念建坛神咒，神之听之，罔不来格。 咒曰：乾尊耀灵，坤顺内营，二仪交泰，六合利贞，配天享地，永宁肃清，应感元皇，上衣下裳，震登艮兴，坎顺离明，巽主兑生，虚步龙骧，天门地户，人门鬼路，卫我者谁，昊天明主。 今日禹步，上应天罡，鬼神宾服，下辟不祥，所求如愿，应时灵光。 急急如太上律令敕。 指罡者，乃飞天纲之法也。 当立坛心，以左右手掌，循点指节，至五斗歪位，弹吹炁腾，像璇玑华盖之覆我也。 诀目以左手，俱藏五指甲，日都天大法主印。 右手平持剑锋，各方念咒，敕水喷之。 咀曰：吾以月洗身，以日炼真，日月佐形，二十八宿与吾合并，千灾万祸逐，吾水清。 急急如太上律令敕。 诵咒至敕字，挥剑锋指束南高处，以口收吸神霄玉清真炁，存。 呷取盂中净水噀之。 既成坛席，犹虑凶恶，港用秽污之蠹，或餍误法主衣物者，准天条合行，惩治标目。 洞天刀支，地心刀支，祛恶； 人刀支，金刀支，木刀支，水刀支，火刀支，土刀支，破寇贼。 刀支断瘟鬼，刀支斩蛟龙，刀支降七魔，诛二鬼，刀支破五苦八难九横、除百病。 刀支且如恶人来加害者，当搯左手小指第三节，主杀伏渠凶，本人颇觉受殃也。 再搯右手小指第三节，主其生，放纵其去也。 名曰祛恶刀支目也。 别有经旨，兹不尽载。 盖此实奥妙之阶梯，是元真之门阀，如有行持志士临坛，获到一切凶异妖怪不祥之类，如是哀盟，宜恕一次，不可妄意轻设此坛，慢易诛戮鬼神，恐堕法主阴德耳。 所注禹步，不敢施语当达者，因化于未悟，故举之应诸初学姓名，未曾拜师，保奏入天籍者，不可冒举之也。 而作咒曰： 此咒乃玄帝本事大神呢也。 作是咒日，在魔营上建九迹纲界，上佐天关，飞罩六合八纮，掌握次胜，乃持此呢一遍，威令大行。 即就七日之间，尽伏六天群魔。 太初太易， 太初溟涬，无有无名。 太易起初，有一未形。 无象无形， 道本无象，混合自然。 德本无形，造立元根。 莫知重浊，范围未化，莫知其矩，重浊凝甚，降积为止。 孰辩轻清。 弥纶未分，其规孰辩，轻清高澄，积阳成天。 吾於混沌， 玄帝介然，果先天地於混沌时，化象分瑞。 分其昏明， 虚危蔼秀，坎离真精，副除日月，分其昏明。 天得以健， 天得一炁，乾健昭回，晶明焕列，昼夜经纬。 地得以宁， 地得一炁，坤顺宁容，固中至静，乃载无穷。 民得以养， 人伦抱一，禀协冲和，少私寡欲，年劫乃多心 物得以萌， 万物不匮，因一发萌，生端莫竭，交应流行。 邪得以正， 邪阴众杂，其类异同，太玄之一正宗风。 神得以灵， 神明得一，变化自然，灵通廓达，洞照无边。 三才之内， 天地统一，元气无形，人达元识，通彻内明。 万类咸亨。 邦君得一，万姓咸亨，昆虫草木，各遂其生。 大道既散， 道先太极，天地之根，散为万物，皆赖生成。 仁义乃兴， 天德大德，阴阳柔刚，号今刑德，起置行藏。
chunks.translated_text:
In ancient times, from the Middle Antiquity onward, King Yu upheld and practiced the teachings, thereby subduing and taming the fierce flood-dragons, savage beasts, demons, specters, malevolent spirits, and all manner of venomous creatures—expelling them to the farthest reaches. Thereafter, he dredged the rivers and streams, guiding their currents to flow into the Four Seas, so that the people of the world might each dwell securely in their homes.

*Stimulating Kun* is the method of *Treading the Earth’s Threads*. One treads forward and backward in three revolutions, making nine steps in total, thus forming the primordial altar and ritual mat, embodying the capacity of the Kun’s virtue to bear all things. One must recite the altar-founding incantation with reverence, and the spirits will heed the call without fail. The incantation reads:

*"The Qian’s honored radiance shines,
The Kun’s compliance inwardly aligns.
The Two Modes harmonize in peace,
The Six Directions thrive in purity.
Heaven’s match, Earth’s embrace,
Eternal tranquility and clarity.
Resonating with the Primordial Sovereign,
Above the robe, below the skirt.
Zhen ascends, Gen arises,
Kan flows, Li illumines.
Xun governs, Dui brings forth life.
Vacuous steps, dragon’s majesty,
Heaven’s Gate, Earth’s Portal,
Man’s Door, Ghost’s Path—
Who guards me? The August Heaven’s Luminous Lord.
Today’s Yu’s Step,
Aligns with the Celestial Mainstay above.
Ghosts and spirits submit in reverence,
Banishing all inauspiciousness below.
Desires fulfilled as wished,
Manifesting timely numinous radiance.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Supreme Decree commands!"*

*Pointing the Mainstay* is the method of *Flying the Heavenly Net*. Standing at the center of the altar, one traces the joints of the fingers with the left and right hands, extending to the five Dipper’s deviant positions, then flicks and exhales qi to ascend, emulating the revolving jade mechanism and the flowering canopy that shelters all. The mudra is formed with the left hand, all five fingernails concealed—termed the *Seal of the Great Law Lord of All Heavens*. The right hand holds the sword level, reciting incantations toward each direction and consecrating water to spray. The incantation reads:

*"I bathe my body in the moon,
Refine my essence in the sun.
Sun and moon assist my form,
The twenty-eight constellations unite with me.
A thousand calamities, ten thousand misfortunes—dispelled,
My water is pure.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Supreme Decree commands!"*

Upon reciting the incantation to the word *"consecrate,"* one brandishes the sword toward the high ground in the southeast, orally drawing in the numinous qi of the Jade Clarity of Divine Empyrean, and visualizes it. Then, one sips the pure water from the vessel and sprays it forth.

Once the altar is established, one must still guard against malevolent forces, lest defilement or corruption taint the ritual master’s garments. According to celestial statutes, punitive measures are to be enacted as follows:

The *Grotto-Heaven Blade Branch* and *Earth-Core Blade Branch* dispel evil;
The *Human Blade Branch*, *Metal Blade Branch*, *Wood Blade Branch*, *Water Blade Branch*, *Fire Blade Branch*, and *Earth Blade Branch* vanquish bandits and raiders.
The *Blade Branch* severs plague demons,
The *Blade Branch* slays flood-dragons,
The *Blade Branch* subdues the Seven Demons,
Executes the Two Ghosts,
The *Blade Branch* shatters the Five Sufferings, Eight Adversities, and Nine Calamities,
Eradicates the hundred diseases.
If evil persons seek to harm, one presses the third joint of the left little finger to subdue and vanquish their malice, causing the perpetrator to suffer misfortune. Pressing the third joint of the right little finger grants them life and releases them. This is called the *Dispelling Evil Blade Branch Method*.

Further scriptural instructions exist but are not fully recorded here. This is indeed the ladder to profound mysteries and the gateway to primordial truth. Should a practitioner of steadfast intent officiate at the altar and encounter any malevolent, anomalous, or inauspicious entities, it is fitting to show mercy once. However, one must not rashly establish this altar or carelessly execute the slaughter of spirits, lest the ritual master’s hidden virtue be diminished.

The *Yu’s Step* here recorded must not be casually transmitted to the uninitiated. As they remain unenlightened, it is presented for the benefit of beginners whose names have not yet been registered in the celestial rolls through proper ordination. Those who have not received transmission from a master must not presume to practice it.

The incantation further states:

This incantation is the great divine mantra of the Dark Emperor’s original deeds. When recited, it establishes the nine-step net’s boundary within the demonic camp, aiding the Celestial Pass above, flying to enshroud the Six Directions and Eight Extremities, and seizing control of victory. Reciting this mantra once, its authority prevails mightily. Within seven days, the myriad demons of the Six Heavens are fully subdued.

In the *Great Beginning* and *Great Simplicity*,
The *Great Beginning* was a vast expanse, nameless and formless.
At the inception of the *Great Simplicity*, there was yet no shape.
No image, no form—
The Dao is originally imageless,
Merging with spontaneity.
Virtue is originally formless,
Establishing the primordial root.
None knew the heavy and turbid,
Its bounds untransformed,
Its measure unknown.
The heavy and turbid congealed and settled,
Who could discern the light and pure?
Encompassing yet undivided,
Its compass unknowable.
The light and pure ascended and clarified,
Accumulating yang to form Heaven.

I, within the primordial chaos—
The Dark Emperor, distinct and resolute,
Preceding Heaven and Earth in the chaos,
Transformed images and divided auspices.
Separating darkness and light—
The *Xu* and *Wei* constellations’ luster,
The true essence of *Kan* and *Li*,
Assisting the sun and moon,
Dividing darkness and light.
Heaven attained its vigor,
Heaven received the One qi,
Qian’s strength shone forth,
Crystalline and resplendent,
Weaving day and night.
Earth attained its tranquility,
Earth received the One qi,
Kun’s compliance bore all,
Firm and utterly still,
Sustaining the boundless.
The people attained sustenance,
Humanity embraced the One,
Endowed with harmonious balance,
Few desires, little selfishness,
Their years and kalpas multiplied.
All things attained sprouting,
The myriad things never exhausted,
Burgeoning from the One,
Their origins inexhaustible,
Interacting and flowing.
Evil attained rectification,
The yin and the myriad杂,
Their kinds diverse,
The Great Mystery’s One rectifies all.
Spirits attained numinosity,
Spiritual clarity received the One,
Transforming naturally,
Luminous and expansive,
Illuminating boundlessly.
Within the Three Powers,
Heaven and Earth unite as One,
The primordial qi is formless,
Humans attain primordial awareness,
Penetrating inner illumination.
The myriad kinds flourish,
The lord of the state receives the One,
All people prosper,
Insects and plants,
Each fulfills its life.
The Great Dao dispersed,
The Dao preceded the Supreme Ultimate,
The root of Heaven and Earth,
Scattering into the myriad things,
All relying on its generation.
Benevolence and righteousness arose,
Heaven’s virtue, great virtue,
Yin and yang, soft and hard,
Now termed *punishment* and *virtue*,
Initiating their application and concealment.

chunks.original_text: 礼乐既作， 三典五礼，节约人伦，乐制既作，九变示淳。 奸邪斯行， 外穷内衰，弃礼离乐，暴慢奸邪，斯行苟作。 六义或失， 君臣混杂，父子无序，夫妇乖违，六义失处。 四民有争。 四业尊士，次农工商，各不专艺，争妬夸强。 上不宽恕， 帝纣亢暴，道缺法圯，不为宽恕，危国忘畿。 下不忠贞， 媚主崇虎，嬖臣费伸，刑增炮烙，紊乱莫忠。 或魔或鬼， 罚有六疰，妄出疠鬼，凶从至处，横祸不已。 或妖或精， 天灾地害，现妖起氛，百谷不成，遗烈为瘟。 恣横荼毒， 人凶恣横，喂茶逞欲，埋蛊餍胜，使人寿促。 干扰生民。 左道妖术，移猖发祟，干扰生民，邀求非利。 全家染患， 阴谋切害，交报赴刑，身染恶稔，全家患仍。 累岁刑名， 累年积月，不遵仁义，忠孝全亏，阴谴阳治。 财物耗散， 无名财物，润屋岂久，一旦耗散，子孙莫守。 骨肉伶仃， 天伦骨肉，谁欲轻分，伶仃有似，禽鸟暂群。 性命枉逝， 轻逝性命，因自孽多，一死之后，堕落鬼魔。 灾祸相萦， 三灾六害，岂枉相萦，降罚临尔，罪恶贯盈。 秽杂之气， 互伤物命，肥。 充肠，岂知维秽，翳昧三光。 上达天庭。 劫运终际，众恶相刑，七声咒诅，吁达天庭。 天尊有命， 元始慈造，广方便门，乃命玄帝，普救群伦。 令吾安平， 玄帝准敕，普福含生，三元男女，咸会安平。 有妖皆剪， 若有精妖，非时发沴，违其号令，捕至当剪。 无鬼不烹， 无名鬼物，辄敢峥嵘，兴殃邀祭，猎至须烹。 瘟疫之吏， 八部五瘟，司禁凶人，无许纵毒，横害良民。 束手服膺， 敢不遵者，辄逞凶狞，捉缚束手，枷拷鞭膺。 鬼精减夷， 厅貌神鬼，辄肆猛烈，停藏妖精，一例剿灭。 邪魔摧倾。 魔守鬼职，党邪不应，太玄兼知，犯者摧倾。 吾有十亿烈士， 太玄元帅统摄英雄，雨师风伯，电母雷公，甲庚两将，八煞天罡，六甲大神，社令城隍。 五千万兵， 太玄秉职，都督诸营，总管兵马，五千万兵。 天上天下， 腾天倒地，保护黎民，典司内外，降魔制神。 从吾降升， 挥纛鼓从，升降不停，保天佑地，覃恩及人。 拒吾者灭， 有王衮，拒玄帝圣训，而立见灭也。
chunks.translated_text:
Rites and music having arisen,
The Three Canons and Five Rites
Ordered human relations with restraint.
Music’s systems established,
Nine transformations revealed purity.
Yet perversity and deceit spread,
Externally exhausted, internally decayed—
Abandoning rites, forsaking music,
Violence, insolence, and treachery
Arose in reckless profusion.
The Six Principles were lost,
Ruler and minister confounded,
Father and son disordered,
Husband and wife estranged—
The Six Principles wholly undone.
The Four Peoples contended.
The Four Occupations honored scholars,
Then farmers, artisans, merchants,
Each failing to master their craft,
Vying in envy and boastful strength.
Above, no magnanimity:
King Zhou’s tyranny and cruelty,
The Dao diminished, laws collapsed,
No lenience shown,
The state imperiled, its borders forgotten.
Below, no loyalty:
Flattering lords, exalting tigers,
Favorites and ministers expanded,
Punishments multiplied—roasting and branding—
Chaos reigned, no fidelity remained.
Some became demons, some ghosts:
Six afflictions brought punishment,
Deluded spirits and plague ghosts emerged,
Calamity struck everywhere,
Unrelenting misfortune endured.
Some became specters, some spirits:
Heaven’s disasters, earth’s harms,
Omens appeared, baleful vapors arose,
The hundred grains failed to ripen,
Legacy plagues became epidemics.
Indulging in cruelty and poison,
People grew vicious and overbearing,
Feeding on bitterness, gratifying desires,
Burying curses, glutting on victory,
Shortening human lifespans.
Disturbing the lives of the people:
Heretical ways and demonic arts,
Wandering malevolence, erupting curses,
Disrupting the people’s lives,
Extorting illicit gains.
Entire households afflicted:
Dark schemes and mutual harm,
Retribution met with execution,
Bodies tainted by accumulated evil,
Whole families stricken.
Years of penal suffering:
Years and months accumulated,
Renouncing benevolence and righteousness,
Loyalty and filial piety wholly abandoned,
Condemned by yin, judged by yang.
Wealth and possessions dissipated:
Nameless riches,
How long could they fill the house?
Suddenly scattered,
Descendants could not preserve them.
Kin left solitary:
Blood ties and flesh,
Who would willingly sever them?
Alone, like birds
Temporarily flocking.
Lives cut short in vain:
Lives lightly cast away,
Through self-inflicted transgressions,
After death,
Falling into demonic realms.
Disasters and misfortunes entwined:
Three disasters, six harms,
How could they wrongly entangle you?
Punishment descends upon you,
Sins filling to the brim.
Foul and impure qi:
Mutually harming living things,
Fattening the belly—
How could one know the essence of filth?
Obscuring the Three Luminaries,
Ascending to the Celestial Court.
The kalpa’s end neared,
All evils mutually punished,
Seven cries of curses,
Exhaled to reach the Celestial Court.
The Heavenly Honored One issued a decree:
The Primordial Beginning, in compassionate creation,
Opened the gate of vast expedience,
And commanded the Dark Emperor
To universally save all beings.
Let us attain peace:
The Dark Emperor, by edict,
Bestowed universal blessings upon living beings,
The Three Origins’ men and women
All gathered in tranquility.
All specters shall be eradicated:
If any spirits or demons
Erupt untimely in pestilence,
Defying his command,
They shall be seized and cut down.
No ghost shall escape boiling:
Nameless ghostly entities,
Daring to rise in ferocity,
Inciting calamity, demanding sacrifices,
Shall be hunted and cooked.
The officials of epidemics:
The Eight Divisions and Five Pestilences,
Who oversee the wicked,
Shall not permit the spread of poison
To harm the innocent.
Bound and submissive:
Those who dare disobey
Shall be allowed to display their ferocity,
Seized, bound, and shackled,
Beaten and flogged.
Ghosts and spirits annihilated:
Manifestations of gods and ghosts,
Daring to act with ferocity,
Harboring malevolent spirits,
Shall be uniformly exterminated.
Evil demons overthrown:
Demons guarding ghostly posts,
Consorting with perversity—unacceptable.
The Supreme Mystery shall know all,
Offenders shall be toppled.
I command ten billion valiant warriors:
The Supreme Mystery’s marshals lead heroic legions,
Rain Masters, Wind Lords,
Lightning Mothers, Thunder Lords,
Generals Jia and Geng,
The Eight Slayers, Celestial Stems,
The Six Jia Great Spirits,
Earth Rulers, City Gods.
Fifty million troops:
The Supreme Mystery holds office,
Overseeing all camps,
Commanding the armies,
Fifty million soldiers.
Heaven above, earth below:
Soaring through heaven, overturning earth,
Protecting the common people,
Governing within and without,
Subduing demons, controlling spirits.
Following my ascent and descent:
Waving banners, drumming in procession,
Rising and falling without cease,
Protecting heaven, aiding earth,
Extending grace to humanity.
Those who resist me shall perish:
There is King Gun,
Who defied the Dark Emperor’s sacred decree—
Instantly destroyed.

chunks.original_text: 衮登仕路，酪食鳖鳝，每任所次，责史从须，索此物充鳝。 衮妻子奉祀真武香火，常劝绝物，衮不听。 一日除驾部镇邢州，独赴任所，忽患苦心疼，昼夜呻吟，触目无奈耳。 闻声呼索命，众鳌缮并来啮身。 俄一披发神人至，仗剑叱退，衮苏无恙，知是真武救护，任满还乡，写道经一藏，舍入延福宫，答谢天曹。 遽蒙朝廷诏充国子司业，衮乘舟赴京，於汴岸遇一道士相曰：公赴阙必拜修撰也，恐加史阁，檄充庚辛方干，宜辞免可，不然则寿禄俱绝，饿死雪中，骸骨不收矣。 衮怒，叱，其相士忽失之。 衮至阙，果赐御史天章阁待制，奉命入西域，因出言讽蕃君李万全，反遭耻辱国，辞归却畏本国刑典，至界首诱从人奔羊山，值天雨雪连绵，压于岩穴之下，久乏火食。 间见真武垂空责曰：衮尔於汴岸拒吾言，今奈何欤。 衮方思之，追悔何及，渐幽囚饿死而灭。 奉吾者生， 如孙诚之信奉玄帝，临死地而复生。 诚之刑部员外借补翰林侍读，充奉使西域，道过凤翔路，遇一布衣士谒之，曰：公莫奉使西蕃乎，斯职非公命禄之权，去必遭惊，众又受罪，公欲度厄，急须奉念吾师真武名号，当获天年寿限矣。 吾昨亦承国恩，今除仙职见掌三罗山玉峰琼壶洞龙潭公事，锺进明也。 特来报公耳。 言讫忽不见。
chunks.translated_text:
King Gun embarked on his official career, indulging in delicacies of milk, turtle, and eel. At every post he held, he demanded his subordinates procure these creatures to sate his cravings. His wife and children, who revered the incense and flame of True Warrior, often urged him to abstain from such fare, but Gun paid no heed.

One day, appointed as Commissioner of the Imperial Carriage Bureau to govern Xingzhou, he journeyed alone to his post. Suddenly, he was stricken with agonizing heart pain, groaning day and night, helpless against the torment. He heard voices calling for his life, and a host of turtles and eels swarmed to gnaw at his flesh. Then, a disheveled divine figure arrived, wielding a sword to drive them away. Gun revived unharmed, realizing it was True Warrior who had saved him. Upon completing his term and returning home, he commissioned the transcription of a full canon of scriptures, which he donated to Yanfu Abbey in gratitude to the celestial court.

Soon after, he received an imperial summons to serve as Vice Chancellor of the Directorate of Education. Boarding a boat to the capital, he encountered a Daoist on the banks of the Bian River, who read his fortune and said: "You shall surely be appointed Compiler-in-Chief upon arrival, but I fear you will also be assigned to oversee the affairs of the *geng* and *xin* directions. You must decline this post, or else both your lifespan and fortune will be cut short—you will starve to death in the snow, your bones left unburied." Enraged, Gun rebuked the diviner, who vanished in an instant.

Upon reaching the capital, Gun was indeed granted the title of Imperial Censor and Academician of the Tianzhang Pavilion. He was then dispatched to the Western Regions, where his critical remarks toward the Tibetan ruler Li Wanquan brought humiliation upon the state. Fearing punishment under his own country’s laws, he fled at the border, enticing his attendants to join him in Yangshan. There, a relentless snowstorm trapped them beneath a rocky overhang, where they languished without fire or food.

Suddenly, True Warrior descended from the heavens, rebuking him: "Gun, you spurned my warning on the banks of the Bian. What now?" Gun, realizing his folly, could only repent too late. Gradually, he wasted away in darkness, starving to death.

Those who heed me shall live:
Take Sun Cheng, who faithfully served the Dark Emperor. Even at death’s door, he was restored to life.

Sun Cheng, a Vice Minister of Justice temporarily assigned as Hanlin Academician and Reader-in-Waiting, was appointed imperial envoy to the Western Regions. While passing through the road to Fengxiang, a commoner approached him and said: "Are you not bound as envoy to the Western Tibetans? This mission is not fated for your destiny. If you proceed, you will face peril, and many will suffer with you. To escape calamity, you must fervently invoke the name of my master, True Warrior, and you shall attain the full measure of your heavenly allotted lifespan."

"I, too, once served the state," the man continued, "but now I hold the immortal office of overseeing the affairs of the Three Luo Mountains, Jade Peak, the Jasper Flask Grotto, and the Dragon Pool. I am Zhong Jinming, and I came especially to warn you." With that, he vanished.

Upon reflection, Sun Chengzhi proceeded to the western frontier and attended a banquet hosted by the Tibetan ruler Li Xijing. By chance, a poetic prompt was presented: *"The sun and moon rise in the east and set in the west"*—a seven-character line. Chengzhi found himself unable to compose a matching verse, enraging the ruler, who ordered him bound and imprisoned. Overcome with terror and humiliation, fearing disgrace to the state, he returned to the court only to face execution.

In his moment of utmost dread, Chengzhi recited the sacred name of True Warrior several times. Soon after, a memorandum from the Chancellery and the Secretariat arrived in haste, stating: *"Sun Chengzhi merits execution. However, considering his prior encounter with the divine messenger Zhong Jinming, who foretold the outcome of his mission, it is evident that the state should not recklessly impose such a severe penalty. By imperial decree, his crime is pardoned."*

A separate edict was issued to Fengxiang Prefecture, commanding the construction of a shrine hall for Zhong Jinming, where his statue was to be enshrined in the likeness of a white-robed immortal. He was canonized as *Immortal Guide of Serene Virtue* (Shandao Anji Xianjun), his glory eternally celebrated for aiding the nation. Thus, Chengzhi, through his devotion, was delivered from death and granted new life.

*"Those who revile me bring only shame upon themselves."*
